translated: With the left index finger and thumb in the case of virtue, and with the right in the case of non-virtue, one should snap the fingers in all directions to set out the weapons.

original: de nas aom sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya si ra:shi kh'a ka ba tsa ne tra aa stra badzra sha dam ga sva bh'a ba a'a tma ko ham zhes pa ste yan lag drug dgod pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de nas aom sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya si ra:shi kh'a ka ba tsa ne tra aa stra badzra sha dam ga sva bh'a ba a'a tma ko ham zhes pa ste yan lag drug dgod pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Then, Oṃ, all tathāgatas, I will set out the six limbs, the heart, the eyes, the face, the mouth, the weapon, and the vajra, in my own nature.

original: sal sogs pa yan lag drug ni dgongs pa'i skad kyis tshul gzhan yang ste snying ga ni lte ba'o //
analyzed: sal sogs pa yan lag drug ni dgongs pa'i skad kyis tshul gzhan yang ste snying ga ni lte ba'o //
translated: The six limbs, beginning with the heart, are in another manner by the language of intention. The heart is the navel.

original: de bzhin du snying ga dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba dang gtsug tor la sogs pa ste mgo @110b po la sogs pas gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying ga dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba dang gtsug tor la sogs pa ste mgo @110b po la sogs pas gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the heart, throat, forehead, crown, and so on, should be taken with the head and so on.

original: de nas sngags 'dis sngar brjod pa'i bsrung ba'i 'khor lo bya ste aom a'a:hum ra:badzra tsandra s'urya r'a hu k'a la aa ga na ya:k'a ya b'aka tsitta dzny'a na badzra pr'a k'a r'a na ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ra ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: de nas sngags 'dis sngar brjod pa'i bsrung ba'i 'khor lo bya ste aom a'a:hum ra:badzra tsandra s'urya r'a hu k'a la aa ga na ya:k'a ya b'aka tsitta dzny'a na badzra pr'a k'a r'a na ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ra ba'i sngags so //
translated: Then, with this mantra, one should make the previously mentioned protection circle: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ raṃ vajra candra sūrya rāhu kāla aghaṇi kāya vāk citta jñāna vajra prakāraṇa kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom hum bi shva k'a ya badzra badzra k'u t'a g'a ram ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ni khang pa brtsegs pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: aom hum bi shva k'a ya badzra badzra k'u t'a g'a ram ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ni khang pa brtsegs pa'i sngags so //
translated: Oṃ hūṃ viśva kāya vajra vajra kūṭāgraṃ kuru kuru svāhā. This is the mantra of the palace.

original: aom h'm y'm r'am w'am l'm badzr'a k'a sha b'a yu te dza au da ka pri thv'i badzra sva bh'a ba pa nytsa ta bo badzra mandal'a ni ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ni 'og tu dkyil 'khor dgod pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: aom h'm y'm r'am w'am l'm badzr'a k'a sha b'a yu te dza au da ka pri thv'i badzra sva bh'a ba pa nytsa ta bo badzra mandal'a ni ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ni 'og tu dkyil 'khor dgod pa'i sngags so //
translated: Oṃ haṃ yaṃ raṃ vaṃ laṃ vajra kāśyapa utteja ujvala prathitā vajra svabhāva pūjā tathāgata padma maṇḍala ni kuru kuru svāhā. This is the mantra for laying out the maṇḍala below.

original: thabs kyi rgyud la 'di nyid kyis khang pa brtsegs pa la sogs pa bya ste 'dir lhun po'i steng du dkyil 'khor du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyud la 'di nyid kyis khang pa brtsegs pa la sogs pa bya ste 'dir lhun po'i steng du dkyil 'khor du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the method tantra, one should make the palace and so on with this [mantra]. Here, the maṇḍala is not on top of Mount Meru.

original: aom pam bi shva badzra padme ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ni padma'i sngags so //
analyzed: aom pam bi shva badzra padme ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ni padma'i sngags so //
translated: Oṃ, expand, expand, O vajra lotus, do, do! Svāhā! This is the lotus mantra.

original: aom ra:badzra s'u rya badzra s'u rya sa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ni nyi ma'i gdan gyi sngags so //
analyzed: aom ra:badzra s'u rya badzra s'u rya sa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ni nyi ma'i gdan gyi sngags so //
translated: Oṃ, Raḥ, O vajra sun, make the vajra sun seat do, do! Svāhā! This is the sun seat mantra.

original: de nas de'i steng du rgyud la lhag par mos pas bdag nyid khro bo'i dbang por bsgom par bya ste aom h'um kro dhi na dro ham kro dh'a n'am a'a dzny'a d'a ya ka sv'a h'a de nas rang rang gi sngags kyi tshig gi khro bo rnams la🔽bka' bsgo bar bya ste /🔽aom ham badzra kro dha r'a dza ma h'a au shn'i sha a'u ru dha di shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de nas de'i steng du rgyud la lhag par mos pas bdag nyid khro bo'i dbang por bsgom par bya ste aom h'um kro dhi na dro ham kro dh'a n'am a'a dzny'a d'a ya ka sv'a h'a de nas rang rang gi sngags kyi tshig gi khro bo rnams la bka' bsgo bar bya ste / aom ham badzra kro dha r'a dza ma h'a au shn'i sha a'u ru dha di shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Then, on top of that, with intense devotion to the tantra, one should visualize oneself as the Lord of Wrath, with Oṃ, hūṃ, I am the king of wrathful ones, arouse the wrathful ones, give me knowledge! Svāhā! Then, one should give commands to the individual wrathful ones with their mantra words.🔽Oṃ, haṃ, O vajra king of wrath, great Uṣṇīṣa, protect the northern direction, do, do! Svāhā!

original: aom yam badzra kro dha r'a dza aa ti ba la sarba bighna na ta ka p'u rba de shir ksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom yam badzra kro dha r'a dza aa ti ba la sarba bighna na ta ka p'u rba de shir ksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ, yaṃ, O vajra king of wrath, Atibala, destroy all obstructors, do, do! Svāhā!

original: aom ram badzra kro dha r'a dza dzam bha ka du sh'a pra dzny'anta ka dakshi na di sha ri ksh'i ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /🔽aom wam badzra kro dha r'a dza m'a na ka bi r'a ga padma nta ka a'u dta ra di shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ram badzra kro dha r'a dza dzam bha ka du sh'a pra dzny'anta ka dakshi na di sha ri ksh'i ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a / aom wam badzra kro dha r'a dza m'a na ka bi r'a ga padma nta ka a'u dta ra di shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vaṃ vajra-krodha-rāja,

original: aom lam badzra kro dha r'a dza stam bha ka ya m'a nta ka pa shtsi me di shi ra ksh'aam du ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom lam badzra kro dha r'a dza stam bha ka ya m'a nta ka pa shtsi me di shi ra ksh'aam du ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ laṃ vajra-krodha-rāja,

original: de nas bsam pa'i dbang gis phyogs bral rnams su yi ge ring po rnams sdud pa'i rim pas gzung bar bya ste /🔽aom l'a:badzra kro dha r'a dza mah'a ba la b'a ya by'am di shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de nas bsam pa'i dbang gis phyogs bral rnams su yi ge ring po rnams sdud pa'i rim pas gzung bar bya ste / aom l'a:badzra kro dha r'a dza mah'a ba la b'a ya by'am di shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Then, by the power of thought, the long syllables should be apprehended in the intermediate directions in the order of gathering:🔽Oṃ laḥ vajra-krodha-rāja,

original: aom w'a:badzra kro dha r'a dza aa ttsa la a'i sh'a na di shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom w'a:badzra kro dha r'a dza aa ttsa la a'i sh'a na di shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vaḥ vajra-krodha-rāja,

original: aom r'a:badzra krodha r'a dza ta kko nee rri ty'am de shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom r'a:badzra krodha r'a dza ta kko nee rri ty'am de shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ rāḥ, Vajra Wrathful King, Rāhu, protect the directions, do this, do this, svāhā.

original: aom y'a:badzra kro dha r'a dza n'i la danda a'a gne yy'am di shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom y'a:badzra kro dha r'a dza n'i la danda a'a gne yy'am di shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ yāḥ, Vajra Wrathful King, Nīladaṇḍa, protect the directions, do this, do this, svāhā.

original: aom h'a:badzra kro dha r'a dza sumbha aa dho de shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom h'a:badzra kro dha r'a dza sumbha aa dho de shi raksh'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hāḥ, Vajra Wrathful King, Sumbha, protect the lower directions, do this, do this, svāhā.

original: de ltar sngags kyi tshig rnams kyis khor bo'i rgyal po rnams sngags pas rgyud las gsungs pa'i sgrub thabs kyi tshogs bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sngags kyi tshig rnams kyis khor bo'i rgyal po rnams sngags pas rgyud las gsungs pa'i sgrub thabs kyi tshogs bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the mantra practitioner should meditate on the assembly of wrathful kings with the mantra words and the methods of accomplishment taught in the tantras.

original: de nas sarba ta tha' ga ta raksh'a tsikra sva bh'a wa a'a tma ko& ham zhes brjod do /
analyzed: de nas sarba ta tha' ga ta raksh'a tsikra sva bh'a wa a'a tma ko& ham zhes brjod do /
translated: Then, one should recite “Sarvatathāgata rakṣa cakra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ” and

original: nga rgyal gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gzung bar bya'o //
translated: grasp the pride.

original: @111a * // bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: @111a * // bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the section on the protection wheel.

original: de nas rang gi snying khar pam yig yongs su gyur pa las sna tshogs padma ste de'i lte ba'i steng du aom yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying khar pam yig yongs su gyur pa las sna tshogs padma ste de'i lte ba'i steng du aom yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Then, in one's heart, from the transformation of the syllable pam, a variegated lotus; on its center, from the transformation of the syllable aom, a moon-disk.

original: de'i steng du lha la lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis ye shes kyi sa bon no ;
analyzed: de'i steng du lha la lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis ye shes kyi sa bon no ;
translated: On that, the seed of gnosis, by the power of one's faith in the deity.

original: / de las rdo rje nyi ma bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rab tu sad par byed pa'i 'od zer rnams nam mkha'i khams su spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: / de las rdo rje nyi ma bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rab tu sad par byed pa'i 'od zer rnams nam mkha'i khams su spro bar bya'o //
translated: From that, like a sun-vajra, one should emit rays of light that awaken all the Tathagatas in the realm of space.

original: de nas de rnams phyir log ste rang gi snying kha'i ye shes kyi sa bon la zhugs nas nam mkha'i khams su dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par spros pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mchod pa'i don du dri ma dang phreng ba ma la sogs pa rnams rang rang gi ye🔽shes kyi sa bon las spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de rnams phyir log ste rang gi snying kha'i ye shes kyi sa bon la zhugs nas nam mkha'i khams su dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par spros pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mchod pa'i don du dri ma dang phreng ba ma la sogs pa rnams rang rang gi ye🔽shes kyi sa bon las spro bar bya'o //
translated: Then, those rays of light return, enter the seed of gnosis in one's heart, and, in the form of a mandala in the realm of space, one should emit from one's own seed of gnosis the offerings such as perfume, garlands, and so on, for the sake of worshipping the Buddhas.

original: aom tstshdzdzhnya badzra gandha aartstsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom tstshdzdzhnya badzra gandha aartstsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ ca ṭa ṭa ṭha ḍha ṇa vajra gandhārcitaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom tstshdzdzhny'a badzra m'a le m'a la aartstsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /🔽aom tthdhna badzra dhu pe dh'u pa aartstsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a ;
analyzed: aom tstshdzdzhny'a badzra m'a le m'a la aartstsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a / aom tthdhna badzra dhu pe dh'u pa aartstsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a ;
translated: Oṃ ca ṭa ṭa ṭha ḍha ṇa vajra mālā mālārcitaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.🔽Oṃ ta ṭha ḍa ḍha na vajra dhupe dhupaṃrcitaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom tthddhn'a badzra pra d'i pe pra d'i pa aartsytsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /🔽aom paphbhma badzra aa mri te nee bee rya aartstsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom tthddhn'a badzra pra d'i pe pra d'i pa aartsytsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a / aom paphbhma badzra aa mri te nee bee rya aartstsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ ta ṭha ḍa ḍha na vajra pradīpe pradīpaṃrcitaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.🔽Oṃ pa pha ba bha ma vajra amṛte naivedyaṃrcitaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom paphphpahm'a badzra aaksha te aaksha te aaksha ta pha la aartstsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /🔽aom tthddhna badzra l'a sye bastra a'a bha ra na p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom paphphpahm'a badzra aaksha te aaksha te aaksha ta pha la aartstsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a / aom tthddhna badzra l'a sye bastra a'a bha ra na p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ pa pha ba bha ma vajra akṣate akṣata phalārcitaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.🔽Oṃ ta ṭha ḍa ḍha na vajra lāsyai vastrābharaṇa pūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom tthddhna badzra h'am sye gha na t'a da rsha p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom tthddhna badzra h'am sye gha na t'a da rsha p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ ta ṭha ḍa ḍha na vajra hāsyai gīta ādāra pūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom kakhgghnga badzra b'a dye b'a dya p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom kakhgghnga badzra b'a dye b'a dya p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ ka kha ga gha ṅa vajra vādyai vādyapūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom khghr'a badzra nri tye nri tya p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom khghr'a badzra nri tye nri tya p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ khaṃ vajra nṛtye nṛtye pūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom spshshka badzra k'a me sarba phuddha bo dhi sa tv'a n'am kro dh'e d'i n'am badzra su ra ta p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom spshshka badzra k'a me sarba phuddha bo dhi sa tv'a n'am kro dh'e d'i n'am badzra su ra ta p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ śaṃ khaṃ vajra kāme sarva buddha bodhisattvāṇāṃ krodhe dīpte vajra sukhā pūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: zhes pa lha mo'i sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la yid kyi rang bzhin gyi mchod pa byas nas de bzhin du phyag 'tshal ba'i mchod pa'o //🔽de nas rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas sdig pa bshags pa dag bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang bdag nyid kyi dngos po dbul ba dang byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni rnam pa
analyzed: zhes pa lha mo'i sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la yid kyi rang bzhin gyi mchod pa byas nas de bzhin du phyag 'tshal ba'i mchod pa'o // de nas rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas sdig pa bshags pa dag bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang bdag nyid kyi dngos po dbul ba dang byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni rnam pa
translated: With these mantra words of the goddesses, having made mental offerings to the buddhas and so forth, in the same way, one should make the offering of prostration.

original: bdun gyis mchod pa'i cho ga'o /
analyzed: bdun gyis mchod pa'i cho ga'o /
translated: Then, according to the ritual taught in the tantras, one should confess misdeeds, rejoice in merit, go for refuge to the Three Jewels, offer oneself, and generate the awakening mind. This is the seven-branch offering.

original: la de nas stong pa nyid la dmigs pa dang dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang las rgyal mchog dang thig le'i rnal @111b 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnams sngags pas bya'o //
analyzed: la de nas stong pa nyid la dmigs pa dang dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang las rgyal mchog dang thig le'i rnal @111b 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnams sngags pas bya'o //
translated: Then the mantrin should perform the yoga of emptiness, the supreme royal mandala, the supreme royal rite, the yoga of the drop, and the subtle yoga.

original: de nas rgyud la lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa'i lha'i nga rgyal bya ste aom sarba ta th'a ga t'a dhi ba ti badzra sa tvo ham dur d'anta da ma ka hum h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa 'dis bdag nyid byin gyis brlab par bya ste
analyzed: de nas rgyud la lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa'i lha'i nga rgyal bya ste aom sarba ta th'a ga t'a dhi ba ti badzra sa tvo ham dur d'anta da ma ka hum h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa 'dis bdag nyid byin gyis brlab par bya ste
translated: Then, by the power of faith in the tantra, one should perform the pride of the desired deity with this: Oṃ, I am the vajra being of all the tathāgatas, the fierce one, the subduer, the crusher, huṃ huṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: lha'i nga rgyal gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i nga rgyal gyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the pride of the deity.

original: de ltar lha'i nga rgyal bskyed de rnams yongs su gzung ba dang slob ma bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha'i nga rgyal bskyed de rnams yongs su gzung ba dang slob ma bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, having generated the pride of the deity, one should accept disciples and gather them.

original: dang por yul dang grong gi bdag po'i gtor ma sngags kyi tshig 'di dag gis sbyangs nas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dang por yul dang grong gi bdag po'i gtor ma sngags kyi tshig 'di dag gis sbyangs nas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: First, having purified the bali offering to the lords of the country and town with these mantra words, one should give it.

original: aom aom badzra tsandra sarba dharmma su bi shuddha sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na bi sha dha ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aom badzra tsandra sarba dharmma su bi shuddha sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na bi sha dha ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ oṃ vajra candra, all dharmas are completely purified, the nature of all dharmas is purified, svāhā.

original: aom a'a: badzra s'u rya sarba dharmma pra bodha ka sarba dharm'a na pra bo dha ya sv'a h'a /🔽aom hum: badzr'a na la sarba dharmma pra d'i ba ka sarba dharm'a na pra d'i pa ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: badzra s'u rya sarba dharmma pra bodha ka sarba dharm'a na pra bo dha ya sv'a h'a / aom hum: badzr'a na la sarba dharmma pra d'i ba ka sarba dharm'a na pra d'i pa ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ vajra sūrya, all dharmas are awakened, the nature of all dharmas is awakened, svāhā.🔽Oṃ huṃ vajra anala, all dharmas are inflamed, the nature of all dharmas is inflamed, svāhā.

original: aom ho sarba dharmma badzr'a mri ta ka ra sarba dharm'a na badzr'a mri tam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ho sarba dharmma badzr'a mri ta ka ra sarba dharm'a na badzr'a mri tam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hoḥ vajra amṛta kara, all dharmas are made into vajra amṛta, make all dharmas into vajra amṛta, svāhā.

original: sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis go rims bzhin du lag pa g-yon pas sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis go rims bzhin du lag pa g-yon pas sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: With these mantra words, one should cleanse with the left hand,

original: lag pa g-yas pas rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pas rgyas par bya'o //
translated: and with the right hand, one should spread.

original: yang dag par reg ste snyim pas bkab nas rab tu 'bar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par reg ste snyim pas bkab nas rab tu 'bar bar bya'o //
translated: Having touched properly, covering with the cupped hands, one should inflame.

original: rdo rje mkha' lding gi phyag rgyas rdo rje bdud rtsir byas nas 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgyas yul gyi bdag po spyan drang bar bya zhing khyi'i phyag rgyas grong na gnas pa'i bdag po rnams dang rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgyas khro bo'i rgyal🔽po rnams dang gri gug gi phyag rgyas zad par rnams dang ral gri'i phyag rgyas lha rnams dang rin po che'i phyag rgyas gza' rnams dang padma'i phyag rgyas klu rnams dang 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas yi dags rnams spyan drang bar bya ste de nas aom a'a:hum che ge
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' lding gi phyag rgyas rdo rje bdud rtsir byas nas 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgyas yul gyi bdag po spyan drang bar bya zhing khyi'i phyag rgyas grong na gnas pa'i bdag po rnams dang rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgyas khro bo'i rgyal po rnams dang gri gug gi phyag rgyas zad par rnams dang ral gri'i phyag rgyas lha rnams dang rin po che'i phyag rgyas gza' rnams dang padma'i phyag rgyas klu rnams dang 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas yi dags rnams spyan drang bar bya ste de nas aom a'a:hum che ge
translated: Having made the vajra nectar with the mudra of the vajra garuḍa, one should invite the lords of the directions with the mudra of total victory over the three worlds. With the mudra of the dog, one should invite the lords dwelling in the village; with the mudra of the five-pointed vajra, the wrathful kings;🔽with the mudra of the flaying knife, the all-pervading ones; with the mudra of the sword, the gods; with the mudra of the jewel, the planets; with the mudra of the lotus, the nāgas; and with the mudra of the wheel, the pretas.

original: mo a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha sh'i ghram ai dam ba lim grihna grihna bhu ga tv'ap'i tv'a hri pa tim kri tv'a sarba satv'a n'am /
analyzed: mo a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha sh'i ghram ai dam ba lim grihna grihna bhu ga tv'ap'i tv'a hri pa tim kri tv'a sarba satv'a n'am /
translated: Then, with oṃ āḥ hūṃ, invite the particular deity with “Oṃ, such and such, come! Come! I offer food, drink, and so forth.🔽Accept this bali and satisfy all sentient beings.”

original: sh'anti tsttam kri tv'a aa pa ra sth'a nam gatstsha gatstsha sv'a h'a sa yongs su gzung ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: sh'anti tsttam kri tv'a aa pa ra sth'a nam gatstsha gatstsha sv'a h'a sa yongs su gzung ba'i dus su'o //
translated: Santi cattāro kṛtāparastānam gacchati gacchati svāhā.

original: gzhan gyi dus su ni sv'a sth'a na gatstsha zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dus su ni sv'a sth'a na gatstsha zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: At the time of the other, one should say, Svasti sthānam gacchati gacchati svāhā.

original: de ltar thams cad kyi gtor ma so so'i phyogs kyi char sngar brjod pa'i cho gas gshegs su gsol bar bya ste gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad kyi gtor ma so so'i phyogs kyi char sngar brjod pa'i cho gas gshegs su gsol bar bya ste gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
translated: Thus, the bali offering of all should be requested to depart in the respective directions, according to the previously described procedure. This is the bali offering ritual.

original: de nas rang gi snying khar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la l'om yig yongs su gyur pa @112a * //
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying khar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la l'om yig yongs su gyur pa @112a * //
translated: Then, in one's heart, on a moon disc, one should meditate on the syllable ḍoṃ,

original: las 'khor lo ser po bsgom par bya ste de yongs su gyur pa las sa'i lha mo zhal gsum phyag drug ma g-yas pa na 'khor lo dang dbyug pa dang rdo rje 'dzin cing g-yon pa na dung dang lcags sgrog dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin ma kha
analyzed: las 'khor lo ser po bsgom par bya ste de yongs su gyur pa las sa'i lha mo zhal gsum phyag drug ma g-yas pa na 'khor lo dang dbyug pa dang rdo rje 'dzin cing g-yon pa na dung dang lcags sgrog dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin ma kha
translated: which transforms into a yellow wheel. From that, one should meditate on Pṛthivīdevī, with three faces and six arms, holding a wheel, club, and vajra with the right hands, and a conch, iron chain, and vajra bell with the left hands,

original: dog ser mo gos ser po dang rin po che'i rgyan ser po dang ldan pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dog ser mo gos ser po dang rin po che'i rgyan ser po dang ldan pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: yellow in color, wearing yellow garments and yellow jeweled ornaments.

original: de nas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas dam tshig sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa' gcig tu byas te de nas phyi rol du sa'i lha mo sngags kyi tshig 'dis spyan drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas dam tshig sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa' gcig tu byas te de nas phyi rol du sa'i lha mo sngags kyi tshig 'dis spyan drang bar bya ste /
translated: Then, by the process to be explained, the pledge-being and the awareness-being are made one. Then, outside, the earth goddess is invited with this mantra:

original: aom l'om a'a: hum ba su na dha ri sarba buddha dza na ni sarba satv'a ba k'a ri ni /
analyzed: aom l'om a'a: hum ba su na dha ri sarba buddha dza na ni sarba satv'a ba k'a ri ni /
translated: Oṃ loma āḥ hūṃ. Vasundharā, you who are the mother of all buddhas, you who are the benefactor of all beings,

original: badzra sv'a a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sh'i gh'am a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha /
analyzed: badzra sv'a a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sh'i gh'am a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha /
translated: you who are the vajra speech, you who are the vajra knowledge, you who are the vajra wisdom, come! Come!

original: ai dam ga na dham pushpam dh'u pam d'i pam nee bee tyam pha l'a ksha ham da d'a mi ta ba hva me ba grihna grihna mandal'a rbam /
analyzed: ai dam ga na dham pushpam dh'u pam d'i pam nee bee tyam pha l'a ksha ham da d'a mi ta ba hva me ba grihna grihna mandal'a rbam /
translated: Please accept this incense, this flower, this lamp, this perfume, this food, this drink, this offering, this bali, this mandala.

original: ma ma sth'a nam dang / sarba satv'a n'am sh'antim /
analyzed: ma ma sth'a nam dang / sarba satv'a n'am sh'antim /
translated: Please grant me the stability of the mind, and the pacification and increase of all beings.

original: pushtim kri tv'a shu bha tsi ta te na ai dam sth'a nam hya ka tp'a aa pa ra sth'a nam gatstsha gatstsha sv'a h'a zhes pa ni sa'i lha mo gshegs su gsol ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: pushtim kri tv'a shu bha tsi ta te na ai dam sth'a nam hya ka tp'a aa pa ra sth'a nam gatstsha gatstsha sv'a h'a zhes pa ni sa'i lha mo gshegs su gsol ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: With your virtuous mind, please grant me stability, and please grant me the supreme stability. Come! Come! Svāhā. This is the ritual of inviting the earth goddess.

original: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis bdud gzhom par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis bdud gzhom par bya ste /
translated: Then, with these previously mentioned mantra words of meditative concentration, one should conquer the demons.

original: aom a'a: hum ham: ham ksha: hr'a: hr'a: hr'a: ra ra ra ra badzr'a na la sarba ba ra ne bha rm'a pra la ya sva bh'a ba sarba m'a ra k'a yi ke bishn'a bi n'a ya k'a di n'am da sha dig ga t'a ni k'a ya b'a katstt'a
analyzed: aom a'a: hum ham: ham ksha: hr'a: hr'a: hr'a: ra ra ra ra badzr'a na la sarba ba ra ne bha rm'a pra la ya sva bh'a ba sarba m'a ra k'a yi ke bishn'a bi n'a ya k'a di n'am da sha dig ga t'a ni k'a ya b'a katstt'a
translated: Om a: hum ham: ham ksh: har: har: har: ra ra ra ra vajra-nala sarva-varane bharana pra-laya svabhava sarva-mara-kayika-visha-vinayaka-dinam dasha-dig-gatam nika-kaya-vaka-tatta

original: ni da ha da ha pa tsa pa tsa bha sm'i ku ru ku ru hum h'um phat phat ces pa ni bdud gzhom pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: ni da ha da ha pa tsa pa tsa bha sm'i ku ru ku ru hum h'um phat phat ces pa ni bdud gzhom pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: ni daha daha pacha pacha bhasmi kuru kuru hum hum phat phat. This is the rite of conquering the demons.

original: de nas bgegs dang log 'dren la sogs pa gzhan rnams rdo rje lcags kyus bkug cing rdo rje zhags pas bcings nas rdo rje phur pa khro bo'i rgyal po lte ba'i 'og rtse mo'i rnam pa ni gnas bcu po rnams su gdug pa'i steng du bying bar yi
analyzed: de nas bgegs dang log 'dren la sogs pa gzhan rnams rdo rje lcags kyus bkug cing rdo rje zhags pas bcings nas rdo rje phur pa khro bo'i rgyal po lte ba'i 'og rtse mo'i rnam pa ni gnas bcu po rnams su gdug pa'i steng du bying bar yi
translated: Then, having summoned the others, such as the obstructors and the misleaders, with the vajra hook, and having bound them with the vajra noose, one should imagine that the vajra dagger, in the form of the peak below the navel of the wrathful king, is plunged into the ten places on top of the wicked ones.

original: ge lnga las bsgom par bya ste sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ge lnga las bsgom par bya ste sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis so //
translated: One should meditate on the five seed syllables, with these mantra words.

original: aom a'a: hum ho: ham ksha:h'um h'um phat phat phat badzra k'i la k'a ya b'a ka tsitta dzny'a n'a dh'i pa te sha ta mu kha sha ta gha dza sha ta tsa ra na sarba bighna bi n'a ya k'a de dusht'a n'am k'a ya b'a ka tsitta dzny'a🔽n'a nam k'i la ya k'i la ya hum h'um phat phat /
analyzed: aom a'a: hum ho: ham ksha:h'um h'um phat phat phat badzra k'i la k'a ya b'a ka tsitta dzny'a n'a dh'i pa te sha ta mu kha sha ta gha dza sha ta tsa ra na sarba bighna bi n'a ya k'a de dusht'a n'am k'a ya b'a ka tsitta dzny'a n'a nam k'i la ya k'i la ya hum h'um phat phat /
translated: Om aḥ huṃ hoḥ haṃ kṣaḥ huṃ huṃ phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ vajra-kīla kāya-vāk-citta-jñāna-ādhipate śata-mukha śata-ghāta śata-caraṇa sarva-vigha-vināyaka-duṣṭānāṃ kāya-vāk-citta-jñāna-nāśana kīlaya kīlaya huṃ huṃ phaṭ phaṭ.

original: de nas rdo rje tho ba'i sngags ni aom ll'i badzra mud ga ra m'a r'a dh'i n'am si ra si kanthe hri da ye n'a bho gu hye aa na te badzra k'i la k'a n'a ko ta y'a ko ta ya ksham ksh'am kshim kshrim kshr'im kshr'a kshum ksh'um
analyzed: de nas rdo rje tho ba'i sngags ni aom ll'i badzra mud ga ra m'a r'a dh'i n'am si ra si kanthe hri da ye n'a bho gu hye aa na te badzra k'i la k'a n'a ko ta y'a ko ta ya ksham ksh'am kshim kshrim kshr'im kshr'a kshum ksh'um
translated: Then the mantra of the vajra hammer is: Om la li vajra mudgara māra-dhīnaṃ sira-skaṃdhe hṛdaya-nayana-avadhūya anate vajra-kīla kāya-koṭaya koṭaya kṣaṃ kṣaṃ kṣiṃ kṣrīṃ kṣruṃ kṣṣuṃ

original: kshlim kshl'im h'um h'um h'um phat @112b phat phat ces pa ni phur bus gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: kshlim kshl'im h'um h'um h'um phat @112b phat phat ces pa ni phur bus gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: kṣliṃ kṣliṃ huṃ huṃ huṃ phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ. This is the rite of striking with the dagger.

original: de nas phur bu rnams bsrung ba'i don du khro bo'i rgyal po bcu po rnams sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phur bu rnams bsrung ba'i don du khro bo'i rgyal po bcu po rnams sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas dgod par bya'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of protection of the kīlas, one should arrange the ten kings of wrathful ones by the previously mentioned rite.

original: de nas g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i rkang ba'i mthil la hum h'um rnam par bkod de rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgyas rkang ba'i mthil du reg nas rdo rje'i stabs kyis dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyis la bcag par bya ste dus kyi 'khor lo'i sku'i g-yas brkyang
analyzed: de nas g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i rkang ba'i mthil la hum h'um rnam par bkod de rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgyas rkang ba'i mthil du reg nas rdo rje'i stabs kyis dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyis la bcag par bya ste dus kyi 'khor lo'i sku'i g-yas brkyang
translated: Then, having arranged hūṃ hūṃ on the soles of the left and right feet, and having touched the soles of the feet with the five-tined vajra gesture, one should break into the center of the maṇḍala with the vajra step.

original: dang g-yon brkyang gi stabs dang mnyam pa'i stabs kyis kyang ngo //🔽shar du yam y'a: rkang pa'i mthil la bkod cing ral gri'i phyag rgyas reg nas zlum po'i stabs kyis bcag par bya'o //
analyzed: dang g-yon brkyang gi stabs dang mnyam pa'i stabs kyis kyang ngo // shar du yam y'a: rkang pa'i mthil la bkod cing ral gri'i phyag rgyas reg nas zlum po'i stabs kyis bcag par bya'o //
translated: One should also do so with the right and left extended steps and the equalized step of Kālacakra’s body.🔽In the east, having arranged yaṃ yaḥ on the soles of the feet and having touched them with the sword gesture, one should break into the center of the maṇḍala with the circular step.

original: lhor ram r'a: bkod cing rin po che'i phyag rgyas reg nas rol pa'i stabs kyis bcag par bya'o //
analyzed: lhor ram r'a: bkod cing rin po che'i phyag rgyas reg nas rol pa'i stabs kyis bcag par bya'o //
translated: In the south, having arranged raṃ rāḥ and having touched them with the jewel gesture, one should break into the center of the maṇḍala with the dancing step.

original: nub tu lam l'a: bkod cing 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas reg nas rdo rje'i 'dug stangs kyis byin gyis brlab pa'am sa ga'i stabs kyis bcag par bya'o ;
analyzed: nub tu lam l'a: bkod cing 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas reg nas rdo rje'i 'dug stangs kyis byin gyis brlab pa'am sa ga'i stabs kyis bcag par bya'o ;
translated: In the west, having arranged the syllable LAM, and having touched with the wheel gesture, one should consecrate with the vajra posture, or one should break with the posture of the elephant.

original: / byang du wam w'a:bkod cing padma'i phyag rgyas reg nas padma'i 'dug stangs kyis byin gyis brlab pa'am t'a na da ba'i stabs kyis bcag par bya'o //
analyzed: / byang du wam w'a:bkod cing padma'i phyag rgyas reg nas padma'i 'dug stangs kyis byin gyis brlab pa'am t'a na da ba'i stabs kyis bcag par bya'o //
translated: In the north, having arranged the syllable VAM, and having touched with the lotus gesture, one should consecrate with the lotus posture, or one should break with the posture of the peacock.

original: de nas badzra ga na dha la sogs pa'i sngags kyi tshig rnams kyis dri la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi sa la mchod pa byas nas sngar brjod pa'i cho gas rdo rje'i sa spyan drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas badzra ga na dha la sogs pa'i sngags kyi tshig rnams kyis dri la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi sa la mchod pa byas nas sngar brjod pa'i cho gas rdo rje'i sa spyan drang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having made offerings on the ground of the maṇḍala with the substances of scent and so forth with the mantra words beginning with “vajra scent,” one should invite the vajra ground with the previously explained rite.

original: de la sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom a'a: l'am h'um badzra bh'u mi tishtha ma tsa la hum h'um phat badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de la sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom a'a: l'am h'um badzra bh'u mi tishtha ma tsa la hum h'um phat badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /
translated: The mantra words are: Oṃ āḥ laṃ hūṃ. “Vajra ground, be firm, do not shake, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ. The vajra earth is known.”

original: de nas slar yang sngags pas mchod yon la sogs pa bya ste sa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de nas slar yang sngags pas mchod yon la sogs pa bya ste sa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Then again the mantrin should make the offerings, etc., and the rite of the consecration of the ground.

original: de nas rdo rje bum pa rnams lhag par gnas pa bya ste 'dir sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom ham h'am him hrim hr'im hum h'um hlim hl'im badzra padma mri ta ga ta su bi shuddha dharmma dh'a tu sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na su bi shuddha dharmma🔽dh'a tu sva bh'a b'a na ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje bum pa rnams lhag par gnas pa bya ste 'dir sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom ham h'am him hrim hr'im hum h'um hlim hl'im badzra padma mri ta ga ta su bi shuddha dharmma dh'a tu sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na su bi shuddha dharmma dh'a tu sva bh'a b'a na ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Then the consecration of the vajra and the vases should be performed. Here the mantra words are: Oṃ haṃ hāṃ him hriṃ hriṃ hūṃ hūṃ hlim hlim vajra padma mṛta gāta suviśuddha dharmadhātu svabhāva sarva dharmeṣu suviśuddha dharmadhātu svabhāvān kuru kuru svāhā.

original: dri la sogs pa phul nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa gzhag par bya ste bum pa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa phul nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa gzhag par bya ste bum pa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Having offered the scents, etc., the Victorious Vase should be placed in the center of the maṇḍala. This is the rite of the consecration of the vase.

original: de nas rdo rje'i thig skud lhag par gnas pa bya ste de la sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom a'am a'im r'i a'um l'iom badzra s'u tra sarba dharmee ke sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na ae ka a'a k'a ra sv'a bh'a @113a * //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i thig skud lhag par gnas pa bya ste de la sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom a'am a'im r'i a'um l'iom badzra s'u tra sarba dharmee ke sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na ae ka a'a k'a ra sv'a bh'a @113a * //
translated: Then perform the special consecration of the vajra string. The mantra words are oṃ aṃ āṃ iṃ īṃ riṃ ṝṃ liṃ ḷīṃ aiṃ auṃ aṃ aḥ.🔽

original: b'a na ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: b'a na ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Then, one should perform the consecration of the vajra chalk line. The mantra syllables are Oṃ āṃ āiṃ ṛṃ āuṃ luṃ. Oṃ vajra-sūtra sarva-dharmā eka-sva-bhāva sarva-dharmāṇāṃ eka-ākāra-sva-bhāva-vān kuru kuru svāhā.

original: dril sogs pa phul nas shar gyi sar bzhag par bya ste thig skud lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: dril sogs pa phul nas shar gyi sar bzhag par bya ste thig skud lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Having offered perfume, etc., one should place it in the east. This is the rite of consecrating the chalk line.

original: de nas rdo rje'i rdul tshon lhag par gnas pa bya ste de la sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom aom aom riom auom liom su bi shuddha panytsa ska na dha sva bh'a ba panytsa skan dh'a na su bi shuddha dharm'a na ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i rdul tshon lhag par gnas pa bya ste de la sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom aom aom riom auom liom su bi shuddha panytsa ska na dha sva bh'a ba panytsa skan dh'a na su bi shuddha dharm'a na ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Then, one should perform the consecration of the vajra-colored sand. The mantra syllables are Oṃ aṃ oṃ riṃ oṃ luṃ su-viśuddha pañca-skandha-svabhāva pañca-skandha-su-viśuddha-dharmāṇāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: dri la sogs pa phul nas rdul tshon gyi snod rnams nub kyi sar gzhag par bya ste rdul tshon lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa phul nas rdul tshon gyi snod rnams nub kyi sar gzhag par bya ste rdul tshon lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Having offered perfume, etc., one should place the containers of colored sand in the west. This is the rite of consecrating the colored sand.

original: de nas rdo rje lhag par gnas pa bya ste de la sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom hum kro dha badzra sarba satva ka ru n'a da ma ka sarba dharmee ka su kha sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na badzra su kha sva bh'a b'a na ku ru ku🔽ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje lhag par gnas pa bya ste de la sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom hum kro dha badzra sarba satva ka ru n'a da ma ka sarba dharmee ka su kha sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na badzra su kha sva bh'a b'a na ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Then one should perform the consecration of the vajra. The mantra syllables are: Oṃ hūṃ krodhavajra sarva-sattva-kārūṇā-damāka sarva-dharmā eka-sukha-svabhāva sarva-dharmāṇāṃ vajra-sukha-svabhāvān kuru kuru svāhā.

original: dri la sogs pa phul nas lhor gzhag par bya ste rdo rje lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa phul nas lhor gzhag par bya ste rdo rje lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Having offered scent, etc., one should place it in the south. This is the rite of the consecration of the vajra.

original: de nas rdo rje dril bu lhag par gnas pa bya ste de la sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom ho: badzra na te sarba dharmee ka pradzny'a ttva ni sva bh'a be sarb'a k'a re sarba dharma bra bo dha ni sarba dharm'a na ni: sva bh'a ba na pra
analyzed: de nas rdo rje dril bu lhag par gnas pa bya ste de la sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom ho: badzra na te sarba dharmee ka pradzny'a ttva ni sva bh'a be sarb'a k'a re sarba dharma bra bo dha ni sarba dharm'a na ni: sva bh'a ba na pra
translated: Then one should perform the consecration of the vajra bell. The mantra syllables are: Oṃ hoḥ vajra-nata sarva-dharmā eka-prajñā-tattva-niḥsvabhāve sarva-kāre sarva-dharmā-bravodha-niḥsvabhāve sarva-dharmāṇāṃ pra

original: bo dha ya pra bo dha ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: bo dha ya pra bo dha ya sv'a h'a /
translated: bodhaya prabodhaya svāhā.

original: dri la sogs pa phul nas byang gi sa la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa phul nas byang gi sa la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having offered scent, etc., one should place it on the northern ground.

original: rdo rje dril bu lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga ste sa la sogs pa yang dag par gzung ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga ste sa la sogs pa yang dag par gzung ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of consecrating the vajra and bell, and the rite of taking possession of the ground, etc.

original: de nas slob ma lhag par gnas pa bya ste dang por dkyil 'khor gsol ba gdab pa'i dus dang bar du sa la sogs pa gzung ba dang / mthar dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i dus thams cad du mandala byas nas so shing byin te de nas bsrung ba bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slob ma lhag par gnas pa bya ste dang por dkyil 'khor gsol ba gdab pa'i dus dang bar du sa la sogs pa gzung ba dang / mthar dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i dus thams cad du mandala byas nas so shing byin te de nas bsrung ba bya'o //
translated: Then one should perform the disciples' preparatory rite. First, at the time of requesting the mandala, in the middle, at the time of taking possession of the ground, etc., and finally, at the time of entering the mandala, having made a maṇḍala and given tooth sticks, one should then perform protection.

original: de la 'di ni cho ga ste khrus byas shing gos gtsang ma bgos te zhi ba la sogs pa'i las dang rjes su mthun pas sa de nyid la mandala byas nas shar du mngon par phyogs pa la au dum b'a ra'i so shing ngam 'o ma can gyi
analyzed: de la 'di ni cho ga ste khrus byas shing gos gtsang ma bgos te zhi ba la sogs pa'i las dang rjes su mthun pas sa de nyid la mandala byas nas shar du mngon par phyogs pa la au dum b'a ra'i so shing ngam 'o ma can gyi
translated: The procedure is as follows: Having bathed and put on clean clothes, having made a maṇḍala on that very ground in accordance with the rite of pacification, etc., facing east, one should give an udumbara tooth stick or one grown from a milk tree,

original: shing gzhan las skyes pa sor bcu gnyis pa mgo bor me tog gi phreng ba bcings pa dri la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod nas sngags 'dis sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: shing gzhan las skyes pa sor bcu gnyis pa mgo bor me tog gi phreng ba bcings pa dri la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod nas sngags 'dis sbyin par bya'o //
translated: twelve fingerbreadths long, with a garland of flowers tied to the top, having made offerings of perfume, etc., with this mantra.

original: aom a'a: hum ho: hom ksha: badzra danta k'ashtha tsa tur bi mo ksha mu kha bisshuddhi sva bh'a ba k'a ya b'a ka tsitta dzny'a na mu kha dan t'a di ma lom bi sho dha ya bi sho dha ya sv'a h'a zhes pas so shing byin nas lhag
analyzed: aom a'a: hum ho: hom ksha: badzra danta k'ashtha tsa tur bi mo ksha mu kha bisshuddhi sva bh'a ba k'a ya b'a ka tsitta dzny'a na mu kha dan t'a di ma lom bi sho dha ya bi sho dha ya sv'a h'a zhes pas so shing byin nas lhag
translated: With Om a: hum ho: ham ksha: vajra-tooth-brush, four-faced, pure, with the nature of the body, speech, mind, and wisdom faces, tooth-brush, illuminate, illuminate, svāhā, give the tooth-stick.

original: par gnas pa'i mthar steng nas rab tu dor zhing mandala du lhung ba'i so @113b shing gis mtshon bar bya ste gang du mgo bo gang yin pa ltung ba der gnas pa'i las rab 'byam la sogs pa der 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni so shing gi
analyzed: par gnas pa'i mthar steng nas rab tu dor zhing mandala du lhung ba'i so @113b shing gis mtshon bar bya ste gang du mgo bo gang yin pa ltung ba der gnas pa'i las rab 'byam la sogs pa der 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni so shing gi
translated: At the end of the consecration, throw it up and fall on the maṇḍala. The tooth-stick will indicate where the head is. Whatever direction it falls, the disciple's activities will be accomplished there. This is the ritual of the tooth-stick.🔽Then, having placed the disciple on the maṇḍala ground, one should place the six families on the head, throat, heart, navel, crown, and secret place with “Om a: hum ho: ham ksha:.”

original: cho ga'o // de nas slob ma dkyil 'khor gyi sa la bcug ste spyi bo dang mgrin pa dang snying kha dang lte ba dang gtsug tor dang gsang ba la aom a'a: hum ho: ham ksha: rigs drug po rnams dgod pa byas nas sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis rdo rje
analyzed: cho ga'o // de nas slob ma dkyil 'khor gyi sa la bcug ste spyi bo dang mgrin pa dang snying kha dang lte ba dang gtsug tor dang gsang ba la aom a'a: hum ho: ham ksha: rigs drug po rnams dgod pa byas nas sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis rdo rje
translated: Having done that, with these mantra words, one should visualize the six families of the vajra master.

original: sems dpa' bskul bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' bskul bar bya ste /
translated: One should urge the hero.

original: aom aa a'a aom aa: badzra satva ma h'a su kha badzra k'a la tsakra shi shya sya aa bhe mu kho bha ba sa na tushto bha ba bar do bha ba k'a ya b'a ka tsott'a dhi shtha nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aa a'a aom aa: badzra satva ma h'a su kha badzra k'a la tsakra shi shya sya aa bhe mu kho bha ba sa na tushto bha ba bar do bha ba k'a ya b'a ka tsott'a dhi shtha nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ a ā aḥ oṃ aḥ, Vajrasattva, great hero, Vajra Time, be gracious to the disciple, be present at the door, be pleased, be present in the body, speech, and mind, grant the consecration, do, do, svāhā.

original: slob ma lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: slob ma lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The ritual for the consecration of the disciple.

original: de nas slob ma gshegs su bcug nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa dang shar du rdo rje'i thig skud dang nub tu rdo rje rdul tshon gyi snod dang lhor rdo rje dang byang du dril bu rnams slob dpon gyis sgo'i cha shas🔽nas dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slob ma gshegs su bcug nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa dang shar du rdo rje'i thig skud dang nub tu rdo rje rdul tshon gyi snod dang lhor rdo rje dang byang du dril bu rnams slob dpon gyis sgo'i cha shas nas dgod par bya'o //
translated: Then, having sent away the disciple, the master should arrange in the middle of the maṇḍala the victorious vase, in the east the vajra thread, in the west the vessel of the vajra dust, in the south the vajra, and in the north the bell, from the section of the door.

original: de rnams gnas lngar bkod de de nas lhor dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan ma'i don du sngags 'dis ma la stan lhag par gnas pa bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams gnas lngar bkod de de nas lhor dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan ma'i don du sngags 'dis ma la stan lhag par gnas pa bya'o //
translated: Having placed those in the five places, then in the south, for the sake of the signs of virtue and non-virtue, the consecration of the seat should be done with this mantra.

original: aom ho:badzra ka ma la da la garbhe shaye badzra su kha ma h'a ni dr'am ka roma ya th'a ta th'a ga te na kri t'a ha: ha: sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ho:badzra ka ma la da la garbhe shaye badzra su kha ma h'a ni dr'am ka roma ya th'a ta th'a ga te na kri t'a ha: ha: sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hoḥ vajra-kamala-dalagrabhe vajra-sukha-mahānidarśa-karomya-thāta-tathāgatena kṛtā haḥ haḥ svāhā.

original: mal stan lhag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mal stan lhag par gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the special consecration of the bed.

original: de nas slob dpon nub tu mgo dang shar du rkang pa phyogs pas nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon nub tu mgo dang shar du rkang pa phyogs pas nyal bar bya'o //
translated: Then the master should lie down on the bed, with his head to the west and his feet to the east.

original: de la bsgoms pa'i stobs sam rmi lam gyis mtshan ma blta bar bya ste gal te sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag lha mo'i tshogs rgyud mangs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i phyag dang ldan pa mthong na de'i tshe dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la bsgoms pa'i stobs sam rmi lam gyis mtshan ma blta bar bya ste gal te sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag lha mo'i tshogs rgyud mangs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i phyag dang ldan pa mthong na de'i tshe dge ba'o //
translated: There, he should look for signs by the power of meditation or in dreams. If he sees buddhas and bodhisattvas, with hosts of goddesses holding signs such as lutes, then that is virtuous.

original: ci ste rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma phyag na gri gug dang thod pa can nam khro bo'i dbang po bdud dang bgegs dang log 'dren la sogs pa rnams srung ba'i 'khor lo'i mtha' phan chad du nyams par byed pa mthong na yang de bzhin du dge ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma phyag na gri gug dang thod pa can nam khro bo'i dbang po bdud dang bgegs dang log 'dren la sogs pa rnams srung ba'i 'khor lo'i mtha' phan chad du nyams par byed pa mthong na yang de bzhin du dge ba'o //
translated: If he sees Vajraḍāka with a knife and skull-cup in his hands, or the Lord of Wrath, or demons, obstructors, and misleaders, etc., being destroyed beyond the rim of the protection circle, then that is also virtuous.

original: ci ste cung zad kyang ma mthong na de'i tshe 'bring bo'o //🔽ci ste bdud kyi ris bkres pa dang skom pas gzir ba ring cing skam pa'i lus can lag na gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa skye bo legs pa la gnod pa byed @114a * //
analyzed: ci ste cung zad kyang ma mthong na de'i tshe 'bring bo'o // ci ste bdud kyi ris bkres pa dang skom pas gzir ba ring cing skam pa'i lus can lag na gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa skye bo legs pa la gnod pa byed @114a * //
translated: If he sees nothing at all, then it is middling.

original: pa la dga' ba rnams slob dpon nam slob mas mthong na de'i tshe mtshan ma ngan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa la dga' ba rnams slob dpon nam slob mas mthong na de'i tshe mtshan ma ngan par 'gyur te /
translated: If he sees the classes of demons, emaciated and dry, with knives and skulls in their hands, who delight in harming good people, then it is an inauspicious sign.

original: de mthong nas rdo rje slob dpon gyis mal stan spangs te dkyil 'khor gyi shar gyi sar sngar brjod pa'i srung pa'i 'khor lo bsgoms nas slar yang de rnams la sngar brjod pa'i cho gas gtor ma rgya chen po sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de mthong nas rdo rje slob dpon gyis mal stan spangs te dkyil 'khor gyi shar gyi sar sngar brjod pa'i srung pa'i 'khor lo bsgoms nas slar yang de rnams la sngar brjod pa'i cho gas gtor ma rgya chen po sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having seen that, the vajra master should abandon the bed and seat, and having meditated on the previously described protection wheel in the eastern part of the maṇḍala, he should again offer the previously described extensive bali offering to them.

original: slar yang sbyang ba'i sngags gzhan ni aom phrem badzra t'a ki n'i badzra dh'a tv'i shva rig ga na sva bh'a ba sarba dra bya bi sho dha ni sarba dra by'a ni bi sho dha ya hum phrem phat ces pa ni bgegs nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i
analyzed: slar yang sbyang ba'i sngags gzhan ni aom phrem badzra t'a ki n'i badzra dh'a tv'i shva rig ga na sva bh'a ba sarba dra bya bi sho dha ni sarba dra by'a ni bi sho dha ya hum phrem phat ces pa ni bgegs nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i
translated: Another mantra for purification is: Oṃ phaṭ vajra-ḍākinī vajra-dhātu-svabhāva śuddha sarva-dharmāṇi sarva-dravya-viśodhani sarva-kleśa-viśodhaya huṃ phaṭ.

original: gtor ma sbyang ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: gtor ma sbyang ba'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra for purifying the sacrificial cake.

original: de nas sangs rgyas rnams spyan drang bar bya ste sangs rgyas yab yum bcas pa sras bcas g-yog 'khor dang // grogs bcas gnyen rnams dag gis bskor ba'i tshogs pa ni //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas rnams spyan drang bar bya ste sangs rgyas yab yum bcas pa sras bcas g-yog 'khor dang // grogs bcas gnyen rnams dag gis bskor ba'i tshogs pa ni //
translated: Then one should invite the Buddhas with this verse: “The Buddhas with their consorts, sons, retinues, friends, and relatives,🔽together with the hosts of gods and goddesses who delight them, and the supreme Vajrasattvas—please come!”

original: lha dang lha mo dag gis mnyes par byed rnams dang // mchog gi rdo rje sems dpa' dag ni gshegs su gsol zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rang gi lus kyi rang rang gi khams la dgod par bya'o //

original: sangs rgyas rnams spyan drang ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams spyan drang ba'i cho ga'o //

original: de nas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams dgug par bya ste de la sngags kyi tshig rnams ni aom ha h'a hi h'i badzra bhee ra ba a'a karsha ya a'a karsha ya /

translated: Then, in order to pacify the harm of demons and obstructors, one should visualize the yoga of Vajrabhairava preceded by the protection wheel, and having arranged the mantras of the six limbs and so on according to the ritual of the sadhana,

translated: the ability to be a compassionate and loving hero, to be a hero who looks upon all with compassion, and to be a hero who is the nature of all sameness. Svāhā.🔽Oṃ evaṃ padma vajra cīṃnho prajñopāya mandala adhipati vajra sukha jñānaṃ gaṃ maṃ daṃ taṃ haṃ haḥ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom ae wampadma badzra tsi hnoo pradznyo p'a yoo mandal'a dhi pa ti badzra su kha dzny'a n'am gam ma ma da da t'am ham ha: h'um phat ces pas gsol ba gdab pa byas te de nas dbang bdun gyis bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bsgom par bya'o //

original: de nas dbang bdun thob pa'i nga rgyal gzung bar bya ste aom sarba ta th'a ga ta sapt'a bhi she ka sa pta bh'u mi pra'a gho ham zhes pa ste dbang bdun rjes su gnang ba'i cho ga'o //

original: aom a'a: pradznyo p'a yoo gu hy'e bhi she kamme da da t'am hum h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a: pradznyo p'a yoo gu hy'e bhi she kamme da da t'am hum h'um phat /

analyzed: bskur bar bsgom par bya'o //

original: aom hum badzra satve na pradzny'a dzny'a ne n'a bhi she ka to dvi tvi ya badzra dha ro ham dharmma me gh'a bh'u mi la ba dho ham zhes pas nga rgyal bya ste dbang gong ma'i cho ga'o //

original: de nas gong ma las gong ma dbang bzhi pa ni man ngag las te sngags 'dis gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gong ma las gong ma dbang bzhi pa ni man ngag las te sngags 'dis gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then the fourth consecration, which is higher than the higher, is from the esoteric instructions. One should request it with this mantra:

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpa'i nga rgyal gzung bar bya ste aom ho dharmma dh'a tva ksha ra tsa tu n'a bhi szhe ke n'a bhi she ka to badzra satve n'atma n'a ham dvi n'i yo dv'a da sha bh'u mi la ba dho badzra satvo ma h'artha: pa

translated: Then one should take up the pride of Vajrasattva with Oṃ, I am Vajrasattva, the essence of the syllable of the dharmadhātu, consecrated by the four consecrations, consecrated as Vajrasattva, the great meaning,

analyzed: sgo thams cad yang dag par sbyangs te slar yang dri dang me tog la sogs pa dang gtor ma byin nas sngar brjod pa'i cho gas sngags bzlas par bya'o // bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi dbang gi le'u las srung ba'i 'khor lo sngon du 'gro ba can sa la sogs pa gzung ba'i mdor
translated: Having thoroughly cleaned all the doors, one should again offer perfumes, flowers, and so forth, and bali offerings, and recite the mantra according to the previously described ritual.

original: bsdus chen po ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus chen po ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: In the Stainless Light, a commentary on the Concise King of Tantras, the Kālacakratantra, which is a commentary on the root tantra in twelve thousand [chapters], the chapter on empowerment is summarized in the brief summary of the chapter on taking earth and so forth, which is the second [chapter].

original: dus kyi 'khor lo bde chen po //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo bde chen po //
translated: The great bliss Kālacakratantra

original: dkyil 'khor pa rnams dag gi gtso //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa rnams dag gi gtso //
translated: is the principal one of the maṇḍala deities.

original: rdo rje gsum mchog la btud de //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mchog la btud de //
translated: Having bowed to the three supreme vajras,

original: zla ba khu ba'i cha dbye bas //
analyzed: zla ba khu ba'i cha dbye bas //
translated: the part of the moon's semen is divided.

original: dkyil 'khor cha ni bcu drug pa //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor cha ni bcu drug pa //
translated: The mandala has sixteen parts.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la //
translated: In the mandala of body, speech, and mind,

original: yang yang char ni phye ba yis //
analyzed: yang yang char ni phye ba yis //
translated: By dividing again and again,

original: rdo rje'i thig ni gdab pa la //
analyzed: rdo rje'i thig ni gdab pa la //
translated: The vajra lines are drawn.

original: 'jam pa'i rdo rjes bsdus rgyud las //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i rdo rjes bsdus rgyud las //
translated: In the Condensed Tantra of Manjushri Vajra,

original: drang srong rigs ni smra ba bo //
analyzed: drang srong rigs ni smra ba bo //
translated: The sage's caste is said to be

original: rnams kyi nga rgyal gzhil don du //
analyzed: rnams kyi nga rgyal gzhil don du //
translated: For the purpose of subduing the pride of

original: khru bzhi dpal ldan dkyil 'khor ni //
analyzed: khru bzhi dpal ldan dkyil 'khor ni //
translated: The four-cubit glorious mandala,

original: gsum la sor phyed thig rnams kyi //
analyzed: gsum la sor phyed thig rnams kyi //
translated: With half-finger lines for the three,

original: spros pa gang zhig gsungs pa de //
analyzed: spros pa gang zhig gsungs pa de //
translated: The elaboration that is taught,

original: @118b rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
analyzed: @118b rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
translated: Following the Root Tantra,

original: mtshan nyid bdag gis rgyas par bya //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bdag gis rgyas par bya //
translated: I will explain in detail.

original: 'dir mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las tshigs su bcad pa sum cu rtsa drug pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid bsdus te 'jam dpal gyis thig ces pa la sogs pas yang dag par brjod pa gang yin pa de rnams da ni rtsa ba'i rgyud🔽kyi rjes su 'brangs nas dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las tshigs su bcad pa sum cu rtsa drug pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid bsdus te 'jam dpal gyis thig ces pa la sogs pas yang dag par brjod pa gang yin pa de rnams da ni rtsa ba'i rgyud🔽kyi rjes su 'brangs nas dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Here, in the Supreme Original Buddha, the characteristics of the mandala are summarized by thirty-six verses, and what is stated by Manjushri with lines and so forth, those will now be explained following the Root Tantra.

original: 'dir sngar gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sa la nub tu rdo rje slob dpon shar du mngon par phyogs pa dang shar du slob ma las kyi rdo rje can nub tu mngon par phyogs pas dkyil 'khor gyis gru bzhir gzhal nas dbus su tshangs pa'i thig gdab par bya'o
analyzed: 'dir sngar gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sa la nub tu rdo rje slob dpon shar du mngon par phyogs pa dang shar du slob ma las kyi rdo rje can nub tu mngon par phyogs pas dkyil 'khor gyis gru bzhir gzhal nas dbus su tshangs pa'i thig gdab par bya'o
translated: Here, on the ground of the previous mandala, the vajra master faces west, and the disciple, the vajra worker, faces east. Having measured the mandala with four sides, one should lay down the brahma line in the middle.

original: // de nas lhor slob don byang du mngon par phyogs pa dang byang du slob ma lhor mngon par phyogs pas tshangs pa'i thig gnyis pa gdab par bya ste tshangs pa'i thig gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: // de nas lhor slob don byang du mngon par phyogs pa dang byang du slob ma lhor mngon par phyogs pas tshangs pa'i thig gnyis pa gdab par bya ste tshangs pa'i thig gi nges pa'o //
translated: Then, the master of the disciples faces south, and the disciple faces north. One should lay down the second brahma line. This is the rule of the brahma line.

original: de nas zur sbyang ba'i don du zur gyi thig kyang gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zur sbyang ba'i don du zur gyi thig kyang gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of the corner measurements, one should also lay down the corner lines.

original: de nas thig ni ro dang dgu bcu 'di rnams tshangs pa'i thig las phyogs kyi cha rnams dag tu rab sbyin bya zhes pa ni 'dir dbus kyi tshangs pa'i thig las lho'i phyogs kyi char dgu bcu rtsa drug dang byang du dgu bcu rtsa drug dang shar du
analyzed: de nas thig ni ro dang dgu bcu 'di rnams tshangs pa'i thig las phyogs kyi cha rnams dag tu rab sbyin bya zhes pa ni 'dir dbus kyi tshangs pa'i thig las lho'i phyogs kyi char dgu bcu rtsa drug dang byang du dgu bcu rtsa drug dang shar du
translated: Then, the lines are the forty-eight lines from the line of Brahmā.🔽Here, having drawn the lines of sixty-nine in the south from the central line of Brahmā, sixty-nine in the north,🔽sixty-nine in the east, and sixty-nine in the west, the lines are drawn.🔽The half-finger space is said to be the lines of wealth and time.

original: dgu bcu rtsa drug dang nub tu dgu bcu rtsa drug gi thig rnams rab tu btab nas sor phyed brjod pa nor dang dus kyi thig rnams dag gis zhes pa ste thig de rnams las thig bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyis dbus su snying po'i dkyil 'khor dag tu
analyzed: dgu bcu rtsa drug dang nub tu dgu bcu rtsa drug gi thig rnams rab tu btab nas sor phyed brjod pa nor dang dus kyi thig rnams dag gis zhes pa ste thig de rnams las thig bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyis dbus su snying po'i dkyil 'khor dag tu
translated: From those lines, the forty-eight lines in the center become the maṇḍala of the heart.

original: 'gyur te thugs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'gyur te thugs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it becomes the maṇḍala of the mind.

original: snying po las ni phyi rol mtha' dag rnams kyis zhes pa dgu bcu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i brgyas bkod pa dag kyang dkyil 'khor chen po'i sgo yi mtshams zhes pa ste snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi thig las nyis 'gyur gyi thig gis gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i🔽mtshams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying po las ni phyi rol mtha' dag rnams kyis zhes pa dgu bcu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i brgyas bkod pa dag kyang dkyil 'khor chen po'i sgo yi mtshams zhes pa ste snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi thig las nyis 'gyur gyi thig gis gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i mtshams su 'gyur ro //
translated: And from the center to the outer limits means that the one hundred and ninety-two squares are the sides of the doors of the great mandala, that is, the sides of the doors of the mandala of speech, which are two squares beyond the center of the mandala of the body.

original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi thig las nyis 'gyur gyis sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi thig las nyis 'gyur gyis sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sides of the doors of the mandala of body are two squares beyond the center of the mandala of speech.

original: de nas sku'i dkyil 'khor la rab lnga dang rta babs dang sa la sogs pa'i 'khor yug bzhi dang rdo rje'i phreng pa blta bar bya @119a * //
analyzed: de nas sku'i dkyil 'khor la rab lnga dang rta babs dang sa la sogs pa'i 'khor yug bzhi dang rdo rje'i phreng pa blta bar bya @119a * //
translated: Then one should see the five crests, the archways, the four circular bands of earth and so forth, and the vajra fence on the mandala of body.

original: ste phyi rol sa la zhes pa nam mkha'i sa la zhes pa'i don to zhes pa thig gdab ba'i nges pa gang yin pa de ni spros pa'i don gyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ste phyi rol sa la zhes pa nam mkha'i sa la zhes pa'i don to zhes pa thig gdab ba'i nges pa gang yin pa de ni spros pa'i don gyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the outer earth is the meaning of the earth of space, and so on. This is the ascertainment of the layout, which is stated with an elaborate meaning.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni slar yang tshigs su bcad pa lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa la sogs pa gnyis kyis gnyis dang chu gter gcig dang chu gter gcig dang nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pa'i cha shas kyis nges pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni slar yang tshigs su bcad pa lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa la sogs pa gnyis kyis gnyis dang chu gter gcig dang chu gter gcig dang nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pa'i cha shas kyis nges pa gsungs so //
translated: By its own nature, he again teaches the ascertainment with two [verses], beginning with the fifty-fourth, and with parts such as two, one ocean, one ocean, sun, etc.

original: de'i phyir sor phyed brjod pa'i re mig 'di rnams kyis tshad gang yin pa de ni slob dpon gyis spros pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sor phyed brjod pa'i re mig 'di rnams kyis tshad gang yin pa de ni slob dpon gyis spros pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the measure of these squares spoken of as half-squares is the meaning elaborated by the master.

original: gzhan gnyis dang chu gter la sogs pa'i cha shas kyis gang yin pa de ni byis pa'i slob ma rnams kyis rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gnyis dang chu gter la sogs pa'i cha shas kyis gang yin pa de ni byis pa'i slob ma rnams kyis rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The other two, with parts such as ocean, etc., are taught for the sake of being fully understood by the student beginners.

original: de'i phyir thig gang zhig dbyi bar bya ba de dag ni gdab par bya ba ma yin no zhes pa cho ga gzhan gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thig gang zhig dbyi bar bya ba de dag ni gdab par bya ba ma yin no zhes pa cho ga gzhan gyi nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the determination of another rite is that any lines to be erased are not to be drawn.

original: des na rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas spros pa med pa zla ba'i cha dag pas thig gdab pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: des na rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas spros pa med pa zla ba'i cha dag pas thig gdab pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Thus, following the root tantra, the unelaborated [rite] should be stated, with the pure part of the moon.

original: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavān has said this:

original: gru bzhi mnyam pa'i sa gzhi la //
analyzed: gru bzhi mnyam pa'i sa gzhi la //
translated: On a square and even ground,

original: bcu drug cha ru byas nas ni //
analyzed: bcu drug cha ru byas nas ni //
translated: having divided it into sixteen parts,

original: sku yi dkyil 'khor dor bya ste //🔽slar yang cha ni bcu drug pa'i //
analyzed: sku yi dkyil 'khor dor bya ste // slar yang cha ni bcu drug pa'i //
translated: the maṇḍala of the body should be abandoned.🔽Again, the maṇḍala of speech

original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor dang por bya //
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor dang por bya //
translated: should be made first, with sixteen parts.

original: de nas gsung gi dkyil 'khor yang //🔽dor nas cha ni bcu drug pa'i //
analyzed: de nas gsung gi dkyil 'khor yang // dor nas cha ni bcu drug pa'i //
translated: Then, having abandoned the maṇḍala of speech,

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor slar yang bya //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor slar yang bya //
translated: the maṇḍala of mind should again be made,🔽with sixteen parts.

original: de ltar phyogs su gsum yang dag dag / dkyil 'khor yon tan gsum bdag nyid //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs su gsum yang dag dag / dkyil 'khor yon tan gsum bdag nyid //
translated: Thus, the three directions are perfectly pure, the maṇḍala is the nature of the three qualities.

original: de nas gnyis dang chu sogs cha'i //
analyzed: de nas gnyis dang chu sogs cha'i //
translated: Then, with two and the parts of water and so forth,🔽that line is cast into the three maṇḍalas.

original: thig de dkyil 'khor gsum la gdab pa ces pa la sogs pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la thig gdab pa'i nges pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga des dbyi ba'i thig rnams spangs nas rdo rje slob
analyzed: thig de dkyil 'khor gsum la gdab pa ces pa la sogs pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la thig gdab pa'i nges pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga des dbyi ba'i thig rnams spangs nas rdo rje slob
translated: The Bhagavān has taught the certainty of casting the lines into the maṇḍalas of body, speech, and mind. Having abandoned the lines of the foundation with that rite taught in the Root Tantra, the vajra master

original: dpon gyis thig gdab par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o ;
analyzed: dpon gyis thig gdab par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o ;
translated: The master should lay out the lines.

original: /'dir yang khru bzhi pa'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gsum la sor phyed pa'i cha dgu bcu rtsa dru gnyis 'gyur du gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'dir yang khru bzhi pa'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gsum la sor phyed pa'i cha dgu bcu rtsa dru gnyis 'gyur du gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, for the three maṇḍalas of the measure of four cubits, it is said that there are one hundred and ninety-two half-inches.

original: de la cha bcu drug po rnams kyi cha so so la sor phyed pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur te de ltar na cha bcu drug po rnams la sor @119b phyed pa dgu bcu rtsa drug nyis 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la cha bcu drug po rnams kyi cha so so la sor phyed pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur te de ltar na cha bcu drug po rnams la sor @119b phyed pa dgu bcu rtsa drug nyis 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
translated: There, each of the sixteen parts is twelve half-inches, and thus the sixteen parts are ninety-six half-inches.

original: de'i phyir dang por dkyil 'khor gyi don dus gzhi cha bcu drug tu bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por dkyil 'khor gyi don dus gzhi cha bcu drug tu bya'o //
translated: Therefore, first, for the maṇḍala, the ground is divided into sixteen parts.

original: de nas phyi rol gyi phyogs bzhi rnams su cha bzhi don te ngos gnyig la cha brgyad dor nas gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi phyogs bzhi rnams su cha bzhi don te ngos gnyig la cha brgyad dor nas gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi don du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having discarded four parts in the four directions outside and eight parts in the two corners, it becomes the maṇḍala of speech.

original: de nas gsung gi dkyil 'khor la cha so so'i dbus su thig btab nas cha brgyad bo gang yin pa de nyid cha bcu drug tu bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gsung gi dkyil 'khor la cha so so'i dbus su thig btab nas cha brgyad bo gang yin pa de nyid cha bcu drug tu bya'o //
translated: Then, having placed a line in the center of each part of the maṇḍala of speech, those eight parts are made into sixteen parts.

original: de la cha bcu drug po rnams ni sor phyed ba drug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la cha bcu drug po rnams ni sor phyed ba drug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Of those, the sixteen parts are one-sixth of a finger.🔽From those, four parts are in the east for the purpose of the mind mandala.

original: de rnams las kyang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don du shar du cha bzhi dang // de bzhin du nub dang / byang dang lho ru yang dor nas gzhan snying po'i cha brgyad po cha so so'i dbus su thig btab ste cha bcu drug tu bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams las kyang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don du shar du cha bzhi dang // de bzhin du nub dang / byang dang lho ru yang dor nas gzhan snying po'i cha brgyad po cha so so'i dbus su thig btab ste cha bcu drug tu bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the west, north, and south, having skipped one, the other eight parts of the center are marked with lines in the center of each part, making sixteen parts.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor de la cha bcu drug po rnams ni sor phyed pa gsum par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor de la cha bcu drug po rnams ni sor phyed pa gsum par 'gyur ro //
translated: Of those, the sixteen parts of the mind mandala are three-sixths of a finger.

original: de ltar na nor dang dus kyis 'gyur zhes pa sor phyed pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyis te sor phyed pa gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi cha bcu drug gis so //
analyzed: de ltar na nor dang dus kyis 'gyur zhes pa sor phyed pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyis te sor phyed pa gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi cha bcu drug gis so //
translated: Thus, by the value of the finger and the time, it is said to be forty-eight one-sixths, that is, sixteen parts with the nature of three one-sixths.

original: de rnams la changs pa'i thig las byang dang lho dang shar dang nub kyi cha gnyis gnyis ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo bzhi'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de rnams la changs pa'i thig las byang dang lho dang shar dang nub kyi cha gnyis gnyis ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo bzhi'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Of those, the Blessed One taught that two parts each in the north, south, east, and west are for the four gates of the mind mandala.

original: de bzhin du sor phyed pa gsum gyi cha bzhi ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i don du gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sor phyed pa gsum gyi cha bzhi ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i don du gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, three and a half finger lengths are taught for the purpose of the door of the speech mandala.

original: de bzhin du sor phyed pa gsum gyi cha brgyad ni sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i don du gsungs te de ltar thugs dang gsung dang sku'i dkyil 'khor la rang rang gi 'khor lo'i tshad kyis sgo ni 'khor lo'i brgyad char 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sor phyed pa gsum gyi cha brgyad ni sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i don du gsungs te de ltar thugs dang gsung dang sku'i dkyil 'khor la rang rang gi 'khor lo'i tshad kyis sgo ni 'khor lo'i brgyad char 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, eight finger lengths are taught for the purpose of the door of the body mandala. Thus, the door of the mind, speech, and body mandalas is one-eighth of the size of their respective wheels.

original: 'khor lo yang ra ba'i dad po'i mtshams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo yang ra ba'i dad po'i mtshams su rig par bya'o //
translated: The wheels should be understood to be at the corners of the enclosure.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum g-yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum g-yang de bzhin no //
translated: The three mandalas are the same.

original: tshangs pa'i thig las byang dang lho dang shar dang nub tu sor phyed pa gnyis gnyis spangs nas snying po'i padma'i lte ba'i gtso bo'i gdan gyi don dang phyogs dang sgo bzhi rnams su lha'i padma'i gdan gyi don du thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i thig las byang dang lho dang shar dang nub tu sor phyed pa gnyis gnyis spangs nas snying po'i padma'i lte ba'i gtso bo'i gdan gyi don dang phyogs dang sgo bzhi rnams su lha'i padma'i gdan gyi don du thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: From the Brahmā line, two and a half finger lengths should be left in the north, south, east, and west for the purpose of the central lotus hub and the main seat of the principal, and for the purpose of the four directional and gate seats of the deities, lines should be drawn.

original: de nas byang dang lho dang shar dang nub kyi phyogs rnams su chu gter zhes pa sor phyed pa bzhi ni padma'i 'dab ma rnams su 'gyur te gtso bo'i padma ni lha dang lha mo lhag ma @120a * //🔽rnams kyi gdan las sum 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas byang dang lho dang shar dang nub kyi phyogs rnams su chu gter zhes pa sor phyed pa bzhi ni padma'i 'dab ma rnams su 'gyur te gtso bo'i padma ni lha dang lha mo lhag ma @120a * // rnams kyi gdan las sum 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, in the north, south, east, and west, four finger-breadths, called “oceans,” are the lotus petals. The principal lotus is three times the size of the seats of the remaining gods and goddesses.

original: de ltar tshangs pa'i gnas su ni nyi ma'i re mi ga dag gis zhes pa sor phyed pa bcu gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi padma'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshangs pa'i gnas su ni nyi ma'i re mi ga dag gis zhes pa sor phyed pa bcu gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi padma'o //
translated: Thus, in the abode of Brahmā, the lotus of the Blessed One is twelve finger-breadths, with one-half finger-breadth for each sun.

original: padma'i sum cha ni lte ba sta sor phyed ba bzhir 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i sum cha ni lte ba sta sor phyed ba bzhir 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: One-third of the lotus is the pericarp, which is four finger-breadths. This is the rule.

original: phyogs rnams su 'dab ma'i nang du thig btab nas /
analyzed: phyogs rnams su 'dab ma'i nang du thig btab nas /
translated: Having marked the petals in the directions,

original: lhag ma sor phyed pa gsum rnam pa gnyis su byas te /
analyzed: lhag ma sor phyed pa gsum rnam pa gnyis su byas te /
translated: the remaining three and one-half finger-breadths are divided in two.

original: rkang pa dang bcas pa'i sor phyed pa'i chas snying po'i dkyil 'khor la re kh'a gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkang pa dang bcas pa'i sor phyed pa'i chas snying po'i dkyil 'khor la re kh'a gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: With one-half finger-breadth and one-fourth, there are three lines in the pericarp maṇḍala.

original: phyogs gzhan du'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan du'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the same in the other directions.

original: de nas padma'i 'dab ma'i phyi rol du sor phyed pa'i gcig gis rdo rje phreng ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: de nas padma'i 'dab ma'i phyi rol du sor phyed pa'i gcig gis rdo rje phreng ba'i gnas so //
translated: Then, outside the lotus petals, with one half-part, is the location of the vajra garland.

original: de nas sor phyed pa bzhis lha'i padma rnams so //
analyzed: de nas sor phyed pa bzhis lha'i padma rnams so //
translated: Then, with four half-parts, are the deities' lotuses.

original: padma'i dbus su thig btab nas snga ma ma yin pa'i rdo rje'i phreng ba'i cha dang / lhan cig sor phyed pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: padma'i dbus su thig btab nas snga ma ma yin pa'i rdo rje'i phreng ba'i cha dang / lhan cig sor phyed pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Having made a line in the center of the lotus, together with the part of the vajra garland that is not the previous one, there are three half-parts.

original: de rnams kyi dbus su thig btab nas phyed dang bcas pa phyed dang bcas pa'i chas 'gram gyi gnas su ra ba'i sa dang / rtab bas kyi ka bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbus su thig btab nas phyed dang bcas pa phyed dang bcas pa'i chas 'gram gyi gnas su ra ba'i sa dang / rtab bas kyi ka bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having made a line in their center, with half-parts and half-parts, the locations of the sides become the ground of the fence and the pillars of the fence.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi gdan las phyi rol du sor phyed kyis phyi'i rdo rje phreng bar 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas dang lha mo rnams kyi bar gyi le tshe rnams la bum pa'am /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi gdan las phyi rol du sor phyed kyis phyi'i rdo rje phreng bar 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas dang lha mo rnams kyi bar gyi le tshe rnams la bum pa'am /
translated: Then, outside the Buddha's seat, with one half-part, is the outer vajra garland.🔽In the squares between the Buddhas and goddesses, there are eight seats of vases

original: thod pa rnams kyi gdan brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: thod pa rnams kyi gdan brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: or skulls.

original: g-yon dang g-yas su ka ba bcu drug gi bar du sor phyed pa'i cha gsum gyis so //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas su ka ba bcu drug gi bar du sor phyed pa'i cha gsum gyis so //
translated: Up to the sixteen pillars on the left and right, with three half-parts,

original: lhag ma ni sangs rgyas kyi gdan gyi tshad kyis so //
