analyzed: lhag ma ni sangs rgyas kyi gdan gyi tshad kyis so //
translated: The remaining [space] is the measure of the seat of the Buddha.

original: de nas rdo rje phreng ba las sor phyed pa gsum pa'i cha gnyis dang sor phyed dor nas thig btab ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje phreng ba las sor phyed pa gsum pa'i cha gnyis dang sor phyed dor nas thig btab ste /
translated: Then, from the vajra garland, having omitted three fingerbreadths and two and a half, make a line.

original: de nas bzhis dri la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams dang / sna la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi gdan gyi don du thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bzhis dri la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams dang / sna la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi gdan gyi don du thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then, with four [fingerbreadths], make a line for the seats of the goddesses of smell and so forth and the gods of the nose and so forth.

original: de nas sor phyed dor nas phyed dang bcas pa'i sor mo phyed kyis rab gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sor phyed dor nas phyed dang bcas pa'i sor mo phyed kyis rab gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having omitted one and a half fingerbreadths, with half a fingerbreadth, there will be three ledges.

original: de bzhin du ra ba'i sa las nyis 'gyur ni stegs bu'i sa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ra ba'i sa las nyis 'gyur ni stegs bu'i sa'o //
translated: In the same way, the ground of the wall is twice that.

original: stegs bu'i phyed kyis rin chen snam bu'o //
analyzed: stegs bu'i phyed kyis rin chen snam bu'o //
translated: With half of the wall, there is the jeweled ledge.

original: rin chen snam bu'i nyis 'gyur gyis do shal dang do shal phyed pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: rin chen snam bu'i nyis 'gyur gyis do shal dang do shal phyed pa'i sa'o //
translated: With twice the jeweled ledge, there is the ground of the garland and half-garland.

original: do shal gyis phyed ni ba ku l'i dang krama sh'i rsha'o //
analyzed: do shal gyis phyed ni ba ku l'i dang krama sh'i rsha'o //
translated: With half of the garland, there is the ground of the bakula and kramasha.

original: de ltar na sgo dang mnyam pa ni sgo khyud @120b do ;
analyzed: de ltar na sgo dang mnyam pa ni sgo khyud @120b do ;
translated: Thus, equal to the door is the door frame.

original: / sgo khyud dang mnyam pa ni logs te 'gram yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: / sgo khyud dang mnyam pa ni logs te 'gram yang de bzhin no //
translated: The sides are equal to the door-jambs, and the same for the wings.

original: ka ba'i steng du rta babs ni sgo'i tshad las sum 'gyur te /🔽de ltar na snying po'i dkyil 'khor la thig gdab ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: ka ba'i steng du rta babs ni sgo'i tshad las sum 'gyur te / de ltar na snying po'i dkyil 'khor la thig gdab ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: The pediment above the pillars is three times the size of the door.

original: de ltar thig ni ro dang zhes pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar thig ni ro dang zhes pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, this is the rule for laying out the lines of the essence maṇḍala.🔽Having begun with “the line of the corpse,” up to🔽“the end of the half-garland,” the line is laid out.

original: do shal phyed pa dag gi mthar ni ba ku l'i ra yang rab tu 'gyur zhes pa'i mthar thug pa sngar thig gdab pa dang / slar yang dkyil 'khor gyi don du gzhan gnyis dang chu gter gcig dang chug gter gcig dang zhes pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: do shal phyed pa dag gi mthar ni ba ku l'i ra yang rab tu 'gyur zhes pa'i mthar thug pa sngar thig gdab pa dang / slar yang dkyil 'khor gyi don du gzhan gnyis dang chu gter gcig dang chug gter gcig dang zhes pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Again, for the sake of the maṇḍala, the other two, one ocean, and one continent,

original: rta babs rab tu gsungs pa'i cha rnams kyis zhes ba'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: rta babs rab tu gsungs pa'i cha rnams kyis zhes ba'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: up to “the parts of the excellent pediment,”🔽the two lines of the mind maṇḍala are said to be excellent.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la thig gdab pa gnyis rab tu gsungs so zhes pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la thig gdab pa gnyis rab tu gsungs so zhes pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the mind maṇḍala.

original: da ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rta babs kyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rta babs kyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now I will describe the characteristics of the gateways as they are taught in the Root Tantra.

original: 'dir rta babs ni thams cad du sgo'i tshad las sum 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir rta babs ni thams cad du sgo'i tshad las sum 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the gateways are three times the size of the door in all cases.

original: de la thugs kyi dkyil 'khor sor phyed pa drug gis sgo ste /
analyzed: de la thugs kyi dkyil 'khor sor phyed pa drug gis sgo ste /
translated: The mind mandala is six fingerbreadths wide.

original: de las sum 'gyur sor phyed pa bco brgyad kyis rta babs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las sum 'gyur sor phyed pa bco brgyad kyis rta babs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Three times that is eighteen fingerbreadths, which is the size of the gateway.

original: de nyid ni rtseg ma gsum du bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rtseg ma gsum du bya ste /
translated: That is made into three stories.

original: rtseg ma dang po ni sor phyed pa drug gis so //
analyzed: rtseg ma dang po ni sor phyed pa drug gis so //
translated: The first story is six fingerbreadths.

original: gnyis pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bzhi yis so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bzhi yis so //
translated: The second is four and a half fingerbreadths.

original: gsum pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i gsum gyis so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i gsum gyis so //
translated: The third is three and a half fingerbreadths.

original: de nas gnyis kyis ha ra mi dang / gnyis kyis bum pa ste de ltar cha bco brgyad kyis rta babs sum rtseg go //
analyzed: de nas gnyis kyis ha ra mi dang / gnyis kyis bum pa ste de ltar cha bco brgyad kyis rta babs sum rtseg go //
translated: Then two fingerbreadths is a harimika, and two fingerbreadths is a vase. Thus the three-storied gateway is eighteen fingerbreadths.

original: de la rtseg ma dang po la ka ba'i steng du sor phyed kyi chas snam bu ste ring ba nyid du sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la rtseg ma dang po la ka ba'i steng du sor phyed kyi chas snam bu ste ring ba nyid du sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: On the first story, above the pillars, there is a ledge one fingerbreadth wide, twenty-four fingerbreadths long.

original: de'i steng du sor phyed kyi chas myos pa srung ba ste ring ba nyid du sor phyed pa bcu drug go //
analyzed: de'i steng du sor phyed kyi chas myos pa srung ba ste ring ba nyid du sor phyed pa bcu drug go //
translated: On top of that, with a half-finger, is the protection of the intoxicated, which is sixteen half-fingers long.

original: de'i steng du snying po'i lte ba'i tshad kyis dbus su mchod pa'i lha mo'i gnas gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du snying po'i lte ba'i tshad kyis dbus su mchod pa'i lha mo'i gnas gru bzhi'o //
translated: On top of that, with the measure of the navel of the center of the essence, there is a square place for the offering goddesses.

original: de'i g-yas dang g-yon du sor phyed kyis ka ba'o //
analyzed: de'i g-yas dang g-yon du sor phyed kyis ka ba'o //
translated: On the right and left of that, with a half-finger, are pillars.

original: de dag gi g-yas dang g-yon du slar yang lha mo'i gnas so //
analyzed: de dag gi g-yas dang g-yon du slar yang lha mo'i gnas so //
translated: On the right and left of those, again, are places for goddesses.

original: de nas slar yang g-yas dang g-yon du ka ba'o //
analyzed: de nas slar yang g-yas dang g-yon du ka ba'o //
translated: Then again, on the right and left, are pillars.

original: de dag gi g-yas dang g-yon du rta babs kyi ka ba'i steng du glang bo che mnan pa'i seng ge zung zhig mgo bo steng du bltas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi g-yas dang g-yon du rta babs kyi ka ba'i steng du glang bo che mnan pa'i seng ge zung zhig mgo bo steng du bltas pa'o //
translated: On the right and left of those, on top of the pillars of the archway, are pairs of lions trampling elephants, their heads looking up.

original: de dag gi mgo bo'i @121a * //
analyzed: de dag gi mgo bo'i @121a * //
translated: On top of their heads

original: steng dang ka ba bzhi'i steng du 'og gi snam bu'i phyed kyi chas snam bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: steng dang ka ba bzhi'i steng du 'og gi snam bu'i phyed kyi chas snam bur 'gyur te /
translated: and on top of the four pillars, with a half of the lower platform, there is a platform,

original: ring ba nyid du sor phyed ba bcva brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: ring ba nyid du sor phyed ba bcva brgyad pa'o //
translated: which is eighteen half-fingers long.

original: de'i steng du rtsa ba'i myos pa srung ba bzhin du myos pa srung ba ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du rtsa ba'i myos pa srung ba bzhin du myos pa srung ba ste /
translated: On top of that, like the protection wheel, there is the protection wheel.

original: ring ba nyid du sor phyed ba bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: ring ba nyid du sor phyed ba bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: It is twelve fingerbreadths long.

original: de'i steng du rkang pas dman pa'i sor phyed kyi chas ka ba so so ste /🔽ka ba'i bar du sor phyed ba gsum gsum gyis lha'i gnas sam /
analyzed: de'i steng du rkang pas dman pa'i sor phyed kyi chas ka ba so so ste / ka ba'i bar du sor phyed ba gsum gsum gyis lha'i gnas sam /
translated: On top of that, each pillar is reduced by a half-fingerbreadth.🔽The distance between the pillars is three half-fingerbreadths each.

original: mtshan ma'i gnas gsum mo //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i gnas gsum mo //
translated: This is the location of the deities or the location of the symbols.

original: phyi rol gyi ka bdag gi g-yas dang g-yon du sh'a la bha nydzi k'a bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ka bdag gi g-yas dang g-yon du sh'a la bha nydzi k'a bya'o //
translated: The outer pillars are to be placed to the right and left of oneself.

original: de dag gi mgo bo'i steng dang / ka ba bzhi'i steng du slar yang sor phyed pa phyed kyis chas snam bu ste /
analyzed: de dag gi mgo bo'i steng dang / ka ba bzhi'i steng du slar yang sor phyed pa phyed kyis chas snam bu ste /
translated: Above the tops of those and above the four pillars, again, there is a half-half-fingerbreadth strip.

original: ring ba nyid du sor phyed ba bcva lnga'o //
analyzed: ring ba nyid du sor phyed ba bcva lnga'o //
translated: It is fifteen fingerbreadths long.

original: de'i steng du snga ma bzhin du sor phyed kyis myos pa srung ba ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du snga ma bzhin du sor phyed kyis myos pa srung ba ste /
translated: On top of that, like before, there is the protection wheel, reduced by a half-fingerbreadth.

original: ring ba nyid du sor phyed brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: ring ba nyid du sor phyed brgyad pa'o //
translated: It is eight fingerbreadths long.

original: de'i steng du sor phyed phyed kyi chas ka ba so so bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du sor phyed phyed kyi chas ka ba so so bya'o //
translated: On top of that, each pillar is reduced by a half-fingerbreadth.

original: ka ba'i bar bar du rtsa ba'i rtseg ma'i lha'i gnas kyi phyed kyi chas gnas gsum mo //
analyzed: ka ba'i bar bar du rtsa ba'i rtseg ma'i lha'i gnas kyi phyed kyi chas gnas gsum mo //
translated: In the spaces between the pillars, the three places are by a quarter of the height of the divine abode of the base.

original: de la phyi rol gyi ka bdag gi g-yas dang g-yon du slar yang sh'a la bha nydzi k'a bya'o //
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi ka bdag gi g-yas dang g-yon du slar yang sh'a la bha nydzi k'a bya'o //
translated: On the outside of those pillars, on the right and left, one should make śāla trees.

original: de'i steng du cha phyed kyis snam bu sor phyed bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du cha phyed kyis snam bu sor phyed bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: Above that, a frieze is half a cubit high.

original: de'i steng du har mi ring ba nyid du sor phyed brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du har mi ring ba nyid du sor phyed brgyad pa'o //
translated: Above that, a harmikā is four cubits high.

original: de'i steng du gnyis kyis bum pa ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du gnyis kyis bum pa ste /
translated: Above that, a vase is two cubits high.

original: g-yas dang g-yon du rgyal mtshan gyi yu ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon du rgyal mtshan gyi yu ba'i gnas so //
translated: On the right and left, there are the bases of the flagpole.

original: de bzhin du snam bu so so'i rtse mor rnga yab dang / me long 'phyang ba dang / rgyal mtshan te rta babs kyi tshad dang mtshan nyid rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snam bu so so'i rtse mor rnga yab dang / me long 'phyang ba dang / rgyal mtshan te rta babs kyi tshad dang mtshan nyid rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, on the top of each frieze, there is a yak-tail fan, a mirror hanging, and a victory banner. The measurements and characteristics of the gateways are taught in the Root Tantra.

original: da ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor gsungs pa re mig drug gis rta babs 'og tu nor gyi padma dang ldan rnal 'byor ma rnams snam bu'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: da ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor gsungs pa re mig drug gis rta babs 'og tu nor gyi padma dang ldan rnal 'byor ma rnams snam bu'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Now, the speech maṇḍala is taught: “Below the gateways, the maṇḍala of wealth is endowed with six squares, and the yoginīs are friezes.”

original: 'dir gsung gi dkyil 'khor la phyogs bzhi rnams su sor phyed pa drug gi bdag nyid kyi cha bzhi po gang yin pa de dag las /
analyzed: 'dir gsung gi dkyil 'khor la phyogs bzhi rnams su sor phyed pa drug gi bdag nyid kyi cha bzhi po gang yin pa de dag las /
translated: Here, in the maṇḍala of speech, in the four directions, there are four parts with a measure of six fingerbreadths.

original: cha gnyis la snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi ra ba dang / stegs bu dang / rin chen snam bu dang / do shal dang / do shal phyed pa dang / ba ku l'i dang / kra ma sh'irsha rnams bkod de lhag ma cha gnyis gnas so //
analyzed: cha gnyis la snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi ra ba dang / stegs bu dang / rin chen snam bu dang / do shal dang / do shal phyed pa dang / ba ku l'i dang / kra ma sh'irsha rnams bkod de lhag ma cha gnyis gnas so //
translated: From those, in two parts, the enclosure of the maṇḍala of the essence, the dais, the jeweled wall, the garland, the half-garland, the bakula, and the kramaśīrsa are arranged. The remaining two parts remain.

original: de dag las @121b cha gcig dor nas /
analyzed: de dag las @121b cha gcig dor nas /
translated: Having discarded one of those,

original: cha gzhan gyi re mig drug po rnams las steng dang 'og tu re mig re re dor la /
analyzed: cha gzhan gyi re mig drug po rnams las steng dang 'og tu re mig re re dor la /
translated: from the other six parts, discard one part above and below.

original: dbus su cha bzhis rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi padma brgyad kyi snam bu ste /
analyzed: dbus su cha bzhis rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi padma brgyad kyi snam bu ste /
translated: In the center, with four parts, there is the dais of the eight lotuses of the yoginīs.

original: phyogs dang mtshams rnams thams cad du padma'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang mtshams rnams thams cad du padma'o //
translated: In all the directions and corners, there are lotuses.

original: phyogs rnams su rta babs kyi 'og tu ste ;
analyzed: phyogs rnams su rta babs kyi 'og tu ste ;
translated: In the directions, below the archways,

original: rtseg ma gnyis pa'i myos pa srung ba dang / ka ba zung dag la sor mo phyed pa phyed tsam bkyed nas sor phyed bzhi bzhag pa la rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi padma bya'o //
analyzed: rtseg ma gnyis pa'i myos pa srung ba dang / ka ba zung dag la sor mo phyed pa phyed tsam bkyed nas sor phyed bzhi bzhag pa la rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi padma bya'o //
translated: On the second tier, the protectors of intoxication, with a finger-width space between each pair of pillars, are placed four finger-breadths apart.

original: lha mo rnams med na slar yang sngar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lha mo rnams med na slar yang sngar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: If the goddesses are not present, then again the previously described characteristics [apply].

original: mtshan nyid de nyid kyis phyi rol du gsung gi dkyil 'khor la sgo nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de nyid kyis phyi rol du gsung gi dkyil 'khor la sgo nas brtsams te /
translated: By that very characteristic, externally, in the speech mandala, beginning from the door

original: rta babs kyi mthar thug pa thams cad nyis 'gyur du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: rta babs kyi mthar thug pa thams cad nyis 'gyur du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: up to the archways, everything is doubled. This is the rule.

original: de ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pas sku'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa 'dir sku'i dkyil 'khor la phyogs bzhi rnams su sor phyed pa bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi cha bzhi po gang yin pa de rnams las cha gnyis la gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi ra ba
analyzed: de ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pas sku'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa 'dir sku'i dkyil 'khor la phyogs bzhi rnams su sor phyed pa bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi cha bzhi po gang yin pa de rnams las cha gnyis la gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi ra ba
translated: Now, from “Then, ” etc., the body mandala is taught. Here, in the body mandala, in the four directions, the four parts that have the nature of twelve finger-breadths are divided in two.

original: dang / stegs bu dang / rin chen snam bu dang / do shal dang / do shal phyed pa dang / ba dku l'i dang / kra ma sh'irsha rnams bkod de lhag ma cha gnyis gnas so //
analyzed: dang / stegs bu dang / rin chen snam bu dang / do shal dang / do shal phyed pa dang / ba dku l'i dang / kra ma sh'irsha rnams bkod de lhag ma cha gnyis gnas so //
translated: and the platforms, and the jeweled cloth, and the necklaces, and the half-necklaces, and the armlets, and the bracelets, are arranged. The remaining two parts remain.

original: de nas te gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha' nas ro yis bsgyur pa'i dus kyis zhes pa sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis dpal ldan tshon gyi sar 'gyur zhing re kh'a lnga'i bar du'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nas te gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha' nas ro yis bsgyur pa'i dus kyis zhes pa sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis dpal ldan tshon gyi sar 'gyur zhing re kh'a lnga'i bar du'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Then, from the end of the maṇḍala of speech, the time of the transformation by the taste, is the glorious color part by twenty-four finger lengths, and it is ascertained that there are five lines.

original: dkyil 'khor de la phyogs zur rnams su nyi ma'i padma zhes pa ni padma bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de la phyogs zur rnams su nyi ma'i padma zhes pa ni padma bcu gnyis te /
translated: In that maṇḍala, in the corners, there are twelve lotuses of the sun.

original: nyis 'gyur ma nu'i 'dab ldan zhes pa 'dab ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: nyis 'gyur ma nu'i 'dab ldan zhes pa 'dab ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The one with double the petals is the one with twenty-eight petals.

original: nyi ma'i re mig dag gis zhes pa ni sor phyed pa'i cha bcu gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i re mig dag gis zhes pa ni sor phyed pa'i cha bcu gnyis kyis te /
translated: By the squares of the sun, there are twelve finger lengths.

original: sor phyed pa bcu gnyis po de rnams cha bdun du byas nas /
analyzed: sor phyed pa bcu gnyis po de rnams cha bdun du byas nas /
translated: Those twelve finger lengths are divided into seven parts.

original: dbus kyi chas lte ba'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi chas lte ba'o //
translated: The central part is the center.

original: g-yas dang g-yon gyi cha gnyis pas 'dab ma bzhi dang / g-yas dang g-yon gyi gsum pas 'dab ma brgyad dang / g-yas dang g-yon gyi bzhi pas 'dab ma bcu drug ste /
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon gyi cha gnyis pas 'dab ma bzhi dang / g-yas dang g-yon gyi gsum pas 'dab ma brgyad dang / g-yas dang g-yon gyi bzhi pas 'dab ma bcu drug ste /
translated: The fourth parts of the right and left sides make sixteen petals.

original: de ltar na 'dab ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dab ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad bya'o //
translated: Thus there are twenty-eight petals.

original: de bzhin du snying po'i sgo ni @122a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying po'i sgo ni @122a * //
translated: The door of the center is

original: mun pa'i yon tan gyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: mun pa'i yon tan gyi dbang gis te /
translated: by the power of the quality of darkness.

original: de las bar ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo rdul gyi yon tan gyi dbang gis nyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las bar ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo rdul gyi yon tan gyi dbang gis nyis 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, the door of the intermediate mandala is twice that by the power of the quality of dust.

original: de las snying stobs kyi yon tan gyi dbang gis sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo bzhi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las snying stobs kyi yon tan gyi dbang gis sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo bzhi 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, the door of the body mandala is four times that by the power of the quality of sattva.

original: ra ba la sogs pa dang rta babs la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ra ba la sogs pa dang rta babs la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The walls and so on and the archways and so on are also like that.🔽The three surrounding circles are arranged with twenty-four,

original: khor yug gsum bkod rnams te chu dang me dang rlung gi khor yug bkod pa rnams ni brgyad pa gsum gyis zhes pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis rab tu bya'o //
analyzed: khor yug gsum bkod rnams te chu dang me dang rlung gi khor yug bkod pa rnams ni brgyad pa gsum gyis zhes pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis rab tu bya'o //
translated: which are the three eights.

original: khor yug gsum po de dag rnams kyi thog ma'i cha la nyi zla 'char ba'i 'khor yug de phyed re mig rnams kyis te bcu gnyis kyis bya'o //
analyzed: khor yug gsum po de dag rnams kyi thog ma'i cha la nyi zla 'char ba'i 'khor yug de phyed re mig rnams kyis te bcu gnyis kyis bya'o //
translated: Of those three circumferences, the circumference of the rising of the sun and moon is to be made with twelve half-squares.

original: de rnams kyi mtha' la rdo rje phreng ba bcu gnyis kyis bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtha' la rdo rje phreng ba bcu gnyis kyis bya ste /
translated: At the end of those, the vajra garland is to be made with twelve [squares].

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis rdo rje'i me lce'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis rdo rje'i me lce'o //
translated: With twenty-four [squares], the vajra flame.

original: de la sgo'i mtha'i 'khor lo gang yin pa de ni so sor rtsibs brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: de la sgo'i mtha'i 'khor lo gang yin pa de ni so sor rtsibs brgyad pa ste /
translated: There, the wheel at the end of the door is to be made with eight spokes each.

original: rlung dang me'i khor yug gi dbus su cha bcu gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: rlung dang me'i khor yug gi dbus su cha bcu gnyis kyis so //
translated: In the middle of the circumferences of wind and fire, with twelve [squares].

original: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi ka ba'i 'og tu stegs bu la bcu gnyis kyis gdengs can rnams kyi gdan rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi ka ba'i 'og tu stegs bu la bcu gnyis kyis gdengs can rnams kyi gdan rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Outside, under the pillars of the mandala, on the terrace, with twelve [squares], the seats of the nāgas, the mandalas of wind, and so forth.

original: shing rta ni bcu gnyis kyis sgo'i dbus su ste /
analyzed: shing rta ni bcu gnyis kyis sgo'i dbus su ste /
translated: The chariot is with twelve [squares], in the middle of the door.

original: de nyid la gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rta babs sor phyed pa bcu gnyis spangs nas sgo'i phyed gnyis pa la dbang po la sogs pa'i lha'i snam bu dang mtshungs pa'i shing rta bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rta babs sor phyed pa bcu gnyis spangs nas sgo'i phyed gnyis pa la dbang po la sogs pa'i lha'i snam bu dang mtshungs pa'i shing rta bya'o //
translated: In that very [mandala], having abandoned twelve finger-breadths of the arch of the Speech Mandala, one should make a chariot equal to the platform of the gods such as Indra, two finger-breadths wide.

original: shar dang nub tu sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi rta babs kyi bum pa spangs nas nam mkha' dang sa 'og gi shing rta blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: shar dang nub tu sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi rta babs kyi bum pa spangs nas nam mkha' dang sa 'og gi shing rta blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the east and west, having abandoned the vase of the arch of the Body Mandala, one should see the chariot of space and the underworld.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for laying out the mandala lines.

original: de ni rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pas rdul tshon gdab pa'i cho ga gsungs pa 'dir thig btab cing lha'i gnas thams cad sbyangs par gyur pa ni de nas dri dang me tog la sogs pa dang gtor ma byin te phyi nas rdul tshon dgye ba brtsam
analyzed: de ni rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pas rdul tshon gdab pa'i cho ga gsungs pa 'dir thig btab cing lha'i gnas thams cad sbyangs par gyur pa ni de nas dri dang me tog la sogs pa dang gtor ma byin te phyi nas rdul tshon dgye ba brtsam
translated: Now, beginning with vajra, he explains the rite of laying out the colored powders. Here, having laid out the lines and purified all the places of the deities, then having given perfumes, flowers, etc. and the sacrificial cake, one should commence the laying out of the colored powders.

original: par bya'o // de la 'byor pa dang rjes su mthun pas tshon lnga bya ste 'khor los sgyur pa'i 'byor pa la rdo rje la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: par bya'o // de la 'byor pa dang rjes su mthun pas tshon lnga bya ste 'khor los sgyur pa'i 'byor pa la rdo rje la sogs pa'am /
translated: There, one should make the five colors according to one's wealth, or with the wealth of a universal monarch, with diamonds, etc.

original: rin po che lngas phye ma bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che lngas phye ma bya'o //
translated: One should grind the powders with the five precious substances.

original: de la ma ra ka ta'i phye mas ljang gu dang / aindra n'i las nag po dang / padma r'a gas dmar po dang / zla ba chu shel gyis dkar po dang / karke ta @122b nas ser po dang / mthon ka chen pos sngon po'o //
analyzed: de la ma ra ka ta'i phye mas ljang gu dang / aindra n'i las nag po dang / padma r'a gas dmar po dang / zla ba chu shel gyis dkar po dang / karke ta @122b nas ser po dang / mthon ka chen pos sngon po'o //
translated: Therein, with the powder of ruby, one should make green, with sapphire, black, with padmaraga, red, with moon crystal, white, with karkeeta, yellow, and with great lapis lazuli, blue.

original: de bzhin du thun mong ba'i 'khor los sgyur pa rnams kyi gser gyi phye mas ni ser po dang mu tig gi phye mas dkar po dang byi ru'i phye mas dmar po dang mu men gyi phye mas nag po dang tshon bzhi bsres pas ni ljang gu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thun mong ba'i 'khor los sgyur pa rnams kyi gser gyi phye mas ni ser po dang mu tig gi phye mas dkar po dang byi ru'i phye mas dmar po dang mu men gyi phye mas nag po dang tshon bzhi bsres pas ni ljang gu'o //
translated: Similarly, with the powder of gold, the universal monarchs of the common type make yellow, with the powder of pearl, white, with the powder of coral, red, with the powder of lapis lazuli, black, and with a mixture of the four colors, green.

original: dbye ba lnga yi 'bru'am zhes pa ni mungga la sogs pa'am 'bras ma nyams pa rnams sam rnams mang nor bu'i phye ma'i tshon rnams sam btags pa'i tshon thun mong ba rnams kyis ni sems can thams cad kyi ste rdo rje rnams kyis ji ltar ba de bzhin
analyzed: dbye ba lnga yi 'bru'am zhes pa ni mungga la sogs pa'am 'bras ma nyams pa rnams sam rnams mang nor bu'i phye ma'i tshon rnams sam btags pa'i tshon thun mong ba rnams kyis ni sems can thams cad kyi ste rdo rje rnams kyis ji ltar ba de bzhin
translated: With the grains of the five divisions means with sesame seeds, etc., or with undamaged rice, or with the powders of the precious substances, or with the common dyed powders.

original: du ma nyams pa'i 'bru rnams kyis so //
analyzed: du ma nyams pa'i 'bru rnams kyis so //
translated: with grains that have not been damaged by insects.

original: mar ka ta la sogs pa'i phye ma rnams kyis ji lta ba de bzhin du btags pa'i tshon rnams kyis te /
analyzed: mar ka ta la sogs pa'i phye ma rnams kyis ji lta ba de bzhin du btags pa'i tshon rnams kyis te /
translated: Just as with the powders of marble, etc., so with the colors of the cloth.

original: ji ltar 'byor ba las 'di rnams kyis phyogs kyi char sa la rdul tshon gdab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byor ba las 'di rnams kyis phyogs kyi char sa la rdul tshon gdab par 'gyur ro //
translated: In whatever way is available, one should scatter the colored powders on the ground in the directions.

original: kye mi yi bdag po de nyid ni sangs rgyas dbye ba 'chad par 'gyur pa rnams kyis te dkyil 'khor la'o //
analyzed: kye mi yi bdag po de nyid ni sangs rgyas dbye ba 'chad par 'gyur pa rnams kyis te dkyil 'khor la'o //
translated: Oh Lord of Men, that is the mandala of the Buddhas, which will be explained.

original: phyi rol du yang sa'i khor yug la ser po dang chu la dkar po dang me la dmar po dang rlung gi khor yug la nag pos te rim pas so //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang sa'i khor yug la ser po dang chu la dkar po dang me la dmar po dang rlung gi khor yug la nag pos te rim pas so //
translated: Also externally, on the periphery of the earth, with yellow; on the periphery of water, with white; on the periphery of fire, with red; and on the periphery of wind, with black.

original: de ni shar du zhes pa la sogs pas tshon gyi sa'i kha dog gsungs pa 'dir bdag po'i mtshan ma dang zhal gyi dbang gis dkyil 'khor gyi sa la phyogs kyi char 'gyur te zhal nag po la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de ni shar du zhes pa la sogs pas tshon gyi sa'i kha dog gsungs pa 'dir bdag po'i mtshan ma dang zhal gyi dbang gis dkyil 'khor gyi sa la phyogs kyi char 'gyur te zhal nag po la sogs pas so //
translated: That is the color of the ground of the mandala, beginning with the east, etc. Here, the directions in the ground of the mandala are by the signs of the Lords and by the faces, with black faces, etc.

original: des na thugs rnam par dag pas shar du dpal ldan nag po'i sar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thugs rnam par dag pas shar du dpal ldan nag po'i sar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by the purity of mind, in the east, there is Śrīkṛṣṇa.

original: gsung rnams par dag pas lho ru nyi ma dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung rnams par dag pas lho ru nyi ma dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: By the purity of speech, in the south, there is Sūrya.

original: ye shes kyi zhal rnam par dag pas nub tu gser mdog ste ser po'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi zhal rnam par dag pas nub tu gser mdog ste ser po'o //
translated: By the purity of the face of gnosis, in the west, there is Kanakavarna, that is, yellow.

original: sku'i zhal rnams par dag pas byang du yang gzhan te dkar po'o //
analyzed: sku'i zhal rnams par dag pas byang du yang gzhan te dkar po'o //
translated: By the purity of the face of the body, in the north, there is also another, that is, white.

original: de ltar rdo rje can gyi zhal gyi dbye bas phyogs rnams su rdul tshon dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje can gyi zhal gyi dbye bas phyogs rnams su rdul tshon dbye bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, by the division of the faces of the Vajra Holder, the colors should be divided in the directions.

original: de yang dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams nas tshon dkar po la sogs pa las kyi rjes su 'brangs pas phyogs rnams su btab ste de nas zhal gyi dbye bas dgye bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams nas tshon dkar po la sogs pa las kyi rjes su 'brangs pas phyogs rnams su btab ste de nas zhal gyi dbye bas dgye bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Moreover, beginning from the northeast, the colors white and so forth should be applied in the directions according to the sequence of the actions, and then they should be divided by the division of the faces. This is the rule.

original: da ni dkar dang zhes pa la sogs pas stegs bu la sogs pa rnams kyi rdul tshon gyi kha dog gsungs pa 'dir stegs bu ni dkar po ste de yang gzugs kyi snam bu'o //
analyzed: da ni dkar dang zhes pa la sogs pas stegs bu la sogs pa rnams kyi rdul tshon gyi kha dog gsungs pa 'dir stegs bu ni dkar po ste de yang gzugs kyi snam bu'o //
translated: Now, the colors of the platforms and so forth are stated beginning with white and so forth. Here, the platform is white, and that is the form cloth.

original: de'i steng du @123a * //
analyzed: de'i steng du @123a * //
translated: On top of that,

original: rin chen snam bu'i sa dmar po ste /
analyzed: rin chen snam bu'i sa dmar po ste /
translated: the level of the jeweled cloth is red.

original: de la rin po che'i 'ching ba rnam par bkra zhing sgo khyud dang ka ba'i mtshams su rin po ches spras pa'o //
analyzed: de la rin po che'i 'ching ba rnam par bkra zhing sgo khyud dang ka ba'i mtshams su rin po ches spras pa'o //
translated: On that, the jeweled bindings are colorful, and the door frames and the spaces between the pillars are adorned with jewels.

original: de bzhin du do shal gyi sa nag po ste de la do shal dang do shal phyed pa dang me long dang rnga yab rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du do shal gyi sa nag po ste de la do shal dang do shal phyed pa dang me long dang rnga yab rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the level of the garland is black, and on that are garlands, half-garlands, mirrors, and yak-tail whisks.

original: ba ku l'i dkar po dang / ka ba ser po dang / kra ma sh'irsha dkar po dang / lha'i padma rnams ni zla ba'i kha dog dang nyi ma'i kha dog go //
analyzed: ba ku l'i dkar po dang / ka ba ser po dang / kra ma sh'irsha dkar po dang / lha'i padma rnams ni zla ba'i kha dog dang nyi ma'i kha dog go //
translated: The white bakula, the yellow pillars, the white kramaśiras, and the divine lotuses are the color of the moon and the color of the sun.

original: de bzhin du snying po'i dkyil 'khor la thams cad du sku dang / gsung dang / thugs dag pas ra ba rnams ni dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po'i re kh'ar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying po'i dkyil 'khor la thams cad du sku dang / gsung dang / thugs dag pas ra ba rnams ni dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po'i re kh'ar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, in the center of the mandala, everywhere, the walls become white, red, and black lines due to the purity of body, speech, and mind.

original: dbus su zhes pa la sogs pas snying po'i padma la sogs pa'i kha dog gsungs te 'dir thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gtso bo'i padma 'dab brgyad ljang gu'o //
analyzed: dbus su zhes pa la sogs pas snying po'i padma la sogs pa'i kha dog gsungs te 'dir thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gtso bo'i padma 'dab brgyad ljang gu'o //
translated: The center and so forth indicates the colors of the heart lotus and so forth. Here, in the center of the mind mandala, the eight-petaled lotus of the principal is green.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa rnams la dkar po la sogs par 'gyur te thun mong gis ljang gu'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa rnams la dkar po la sogs par 'gyur te thun mong gis ljang gu'o //
translated: In the case of the peaceful and so forth, it becomes white and so forth, but in general it is green.

original: bud ba dang mtshungs ka ba rdo rje phreng bar 'gyur zhes pa padma'i phyi rol du ka ba bcu drug ni shar la sogs pa rnams su ste ral gri dang rin po che dang 'khor lo dang padma'i phreng ba dang ldan ba bzhi bzhi nyid do //
analyzed: bud ba dang mtshungs ka ba rdo rje phreng bar 'gyur zhes pa padma'i phyi rol du ka ba bcu drug ni shar la sogs pa rnams su ste ral gri dang rin po che dang 'khor lo dang padma'i phreng ba dang ldan ba bzhi bzhi nyid do //
translated: The pillar is like a bud, and the vajra garland is the sixteen pillars outside the lotus. In the east and so forth, there are four each endowed with a sword, jewel, wheel, and lotus garland.

original: 'dir snying po'i padma'i zur bzhi rnams su grangs bzhin du dbang ldan du dung zla ba'i kha dog can dang / bden bral du chos kyi gand'i nyi ma'i kha dog can dang / me'i zur du yid bzhin gyi nor bu kha dog nag po dang /
analyzed: 'dir snying po'i padma'i zur bzhi rnams su grangs bzhin du dbang ldan du dung zla ba'i kha dog can dang / bden bral du chos kyi gand'i nyi ma'i kha dog can dang / me'i zur du yid bzhin gyi nor bu kha dog nag po dang /
translated: Here, in the four corners of the heart lotus, in the northeast is a conch the color of the moon, in the southwest is a dharma conch the color of the sun, in the southeast is a wish-fulfilling jewel the color of black,🔽and in the northwest is a vase the color of gold.

original: rlung gi zur du dpag bsam gyi shing ser bo'o //
analyzed: rlung gi zur du dpag bsam gyi shing ser bo'o //
translated: In the corners are yellow wish-fulfilling trees.

original: de bzhin du phyogs bzhi'i ka ba bcu drug gi bar sangs rgyas dang lha mo rnams dang bum pa dkar po rnams te phyogs brgyad du padma'i steng na gnas shing padma'i kha dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bzhi'i ka ba bcu drug gi bar sangs rgyas dang lha mo rnams dang bum pa dkar po rnams te phyogs brgyad du padma'i steng na gnas shing padma'i kha dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Similarly, up to the sixteen pillars in the four directions are the buddhas, goddesses, and white vases. In the eight directions, they stand on lotus flowers with lotus mouths.

original: 'dir padma dmar po'i steng du lha mo rnams kyi zla ba'i gdan du 'gyur zhing padma dkar po'i steng du lha rnams kyi nyi ma'i gdan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir padma dmar po'i steng du lha mo rnams kyi zla ba'i gdan du 'gyur zhing padma dkar po'i steng du lha rnams kyi nyi ma'i gdan du 'gyur te /
translated: Here, on top of the red lotus, the goddesses' moon seats will be formed, and on top of the white lotus, the gods' sun seats will be formed.

original: 'dab ma brgyad po rnams spangs nas padma'i sum cha'i lte ba la'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad po rnams spangs nas padma'i sum cha'i lte ba la'o //
translated: Abandoning the eight petals, the third part of the lotus is the center.

original: lha mo rnams kyi zla ba'i gdan yang zur rnams su ste lha rnams kyi ni phyogs su'o //
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyi zla ba'i gdan yang zur rnams su ste lha rnams kyi ni phyogs su'o //
translated: The goddesses' moon seats are in the corners, and the gods' are in the directions.

original: thams cad kyi phyi rol du ni rdo rje phreng bar 'gyur te gtso bo'i padma'i kha dog gi dbang gis bya zhing /
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyi rol du ni rdo rje phreng bar 'gyur te gtso bo'i padma'i kha dog gi dbang gis bya zhing /
translated: Outside of everything is the vajra fence, which should be done according to the color of the principal's lotus.

original: rta babs ni kha dog sna tshogs su @123b bya'o ;
analyzed: rta babs ni kha dog sna tshogs su @123b bya'o ;
translated: The archways should be made multicolored.

original: / rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdul tshon dgye ba dang kha dog gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: / rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdul tshon dgye ba dang kha dog gi nges pa'o //
translated: The distribution of the colored powders in the basic maṇḍala and the rule of the colors.

original: da ni gsung dang sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i snam bu'i kha dog gsungs pa dkar po'i mdog ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gsung gi dkyil 'khor la rnal 'byor ma rnams dang / 'dod ma rnams dang ; sku'i dkyil 'khor la phyir 'dod ma la sogs pa rnams kyi snam bu ni dkar po'i mdog tu 'gyur zhing nor gyi padma ste padma brgyad kyi gzhi'i snam bu dag kyang phyogs dang phyogs bral kun du'o //
analyzed: da ni gsung dang sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i snam bu'i kha dog gsungs pa dkar po'i mdog ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gsung gi dkyil 'khor la rnal 'byor ma rnams dang / 'dod ma rnams dang ; sku'i dkyil 'khor la phyir 'dod ma la sogs pa rnams kyi snam bu ni dkar po'i mdog tu 'gyur zhing nor gyi padma ste padma brgyad kyi gzhi'i snam bu dag kyang phyogs dang phyogs bral kun du'o //
translated: The colors of the deities' platforms in the maṇḍalas of speech and body are stated: white, etc. Here, the platforms of the yoginīs and the kṣetrapālas in the maṇḍala of speech, and the platforms of the kṣetrapālas, etc. in the maṇḍala of body, are of a white color. The platforms of the eight lotuses, the bases of the lotuses, are in all the directions and intermediate directions.

original: de la phyogs kyi char ni padma rnams kha dog dmar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la phyogs kyi char ni padma rnams kha dog dmar por 'gyur ro //
translated: There, in the cardinal directions, the lotuses are red.

original: rgyal ba'i dbang gis te sangs rgyas kyi dbang gis padma dkar po zur du'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dbang gis te sangs rgyas kyi dbang gis padma dkar po zur du'o //
translated: By the power of the Victor, the white lotuses are in the corners.

original: padma de rnams ni nyi ma dang zla ba'i gdan gyis rnam par dman pa 'dab ma brgyad pa dang // de bzhin nyid du 'chi med rnams kyi nyis 'gyur ma nu'i 'dab ldan te 'dab ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa ni zla ba dang nyi mas rnam par dman pa'o //
analyzed: padma de rnams ni nyi ma dang zla ba'i gdan gyis rnam par dman pa 'dab ma brgyad pa dang // de bzhin nyid du 'chi med rnams kyi nyis 'gyur ma nu'i 'dab ldan te 'dab ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa ni zla ba dang nyi mas rnam par dman pa'o //
translated: Similarly, for the immortals, there are twenty-eight petals, inferior to the moon and sun.

original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor la mkha' sogs re kh'a lnga po gang yin de rnams rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis sum cha bar du gnas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor la mkha' sogs re kh'a lnga po gang yin de rnams rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis sum cha bar du gnas zhes pa ni /
translated: The five lines of space and so on, which are on the maṇḍala of speech, are the three parts of the qualities of the nature.

original: 'dir gsung gi dkyil 'khor la rang bzhin ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pa ste des na zhi ba la sogs pa dang dbang la sogs pa'i las la g-yon pa'i rgyu ba'i dbang gis spro ba'i sbyor bas nam mkha' dang /
analyzed: 'dir gsung gi dkyil 'khor la rang bzhin ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pa ste des na zhi ba la sogs pa dang dbang la sogs pa'i las la g-yon pa'i rgyu ba'i dbang gis spro ba'i sbyor bas nam mkha' dang /
translated: Here, the nature of the maṇḍala of speech is the descent of the maṇḍala of space and so on. Therefore, through the yoga of emanating with the movement of the left, the function of space and so on is the function of pacifying and so on and the function of controlling and so on.

original: rlung dang / me dang / chu dang / sa rnams ljang gu dang / nag po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ser po'i kha dog ste /
analyzed: rlung dang / me dang / chu dang / sa rnams ljang gu dang / nag po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ser po'i kha dog ste /
translated: The colors of wind, fire, water, and earth are green, black, red, white, and yellow,

original: rim pa bzhin du snying po nas brtsams nas stegs bu'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du snying po nas brtsams nas stegs bu'i bar du'o //
translated: respectively, beginning from the center up to the platform.

original: de bzhin du gsad pa la sogs pa dang rengs pa la sogs pa rnams las la sogs pa rnams kyis bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsad pa la sogs pa dang rengs pa la sogs pa rnams las la sogs pa rnams kyis bya'o //
translated: Likewise, killing and so forth and paralyzing and so forth are done with the fire and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis 'gyur pa'o //
translated: This is the change due to the power of the nature and qualities.

original: cha gcig dor nas cha gnyis kyis re kh'a so sor 'gyur pa gang yin pa de'i phyir ra ba'i sa ni cha bcva lnga par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: cha gcig dor nas cha gnyis kyis re kh'a so sor 'gyur pa gang yin pa de'i phyir ra ba'i sa ni cha bcva lnga par shes par bya'o //
translated: The area of the enclosure is to be known as one-fifteenth of the area of the mandala, because the individual lines are two-thirds of the area of one part.

original: de bzhin du snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi ra ba'i sa ni cha dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi ra ba'i sa ni cha dgu pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the area of the enclosure of the center mandala is one-ninth.

original: de bzhin du sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin brjod par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, the nature of the body mandala should be described.

original: 'dir sku la mthe chung la sogs pa'i sor mo lnga po @124a * //
analyzed: 'dir sku la mthe chung la sogs pa'i sor mo lnga po @124a * //
translated: Here, the body has five fingers, such as the little finger, and so forth.

original: rnams ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnams ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The colors are the nature of space and so forth.

original: des na zhi ba la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la spro ba'i dbye bas kha dog ljang gu la sogs pa'i re kh'a'o //
analyzed: des na zhi ba la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la spro ba'i dbye bas kha dog ljang gu la sogs pa'i re kh'a'o //
translated: Therefore, the colors are green and so forth, by the division of emanation in the mandala of pacification and so forth.

original: gsad pa la sogs pa la sdud pa'i rim pas sa la sogs pa'i dbye bas so zhes pa ni ra ba'i re kh'a nges pa'o //
analyzed: gsad pa la sogs pa la sdud pa'i rim pas sa la sogs pa'i dbye bas so zhes pa ni ra ba'i re kh'a nges pa'o //
translated: In the case of killing and so forth, the colors are the colors of earth and so forth, by the process of gathering. This is the determination of the colors of the enclosure.

original: da ni ka ba'i 'og ces pa la sogs pas klu'i rgyal po rnams kyi gdan gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni ka ba'i 'og ces pa la sogs pas klu'i rgyal po rnams kyi gdan gsungs pa /
translated: Now, beginning with “the lower part of the pillars,” he speaks of the seats of the naga kings.

original: 'dir phyi rol sku'i dkyil 'khor la rta babs kyi ka ba rnams kyi 'og gi stegs bu'i gnas la /
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol sku'i dkyil 'khor la rta babs kyi ka ba rnams kyi 'og gi stegs bu'i gnas la /
translated: Here, in the outer mandala of body, in the place of the platform below the pillars of the archways,🔽the seats of the hooded ones are in the corners of the gates. The seats of the nagas are in the east and so forth.

original: sgo'i mtshams su gdengs can rnams kyi gdan rlung la sogs par rab tu 'gyur pa ni shar gyi sgo'i g-yas dang g-yon du rlung gi dkyil 'khor zlum por 'gyur te /🔽snying po'i padma'i tshad kyis so //
analyzed: sgo'i mtshams su gdengs can rnams kyi gdan rlung la sogs par rab tu 'gyur pa ni shar gyi sgo'i g-yas dang g-yon du rlung gi dkyil 'khor zlum por 'gyur te /🔽snying po'i padma'i tshad kyis so //
translated: The wind mandala is round, by the measure of the central lotus.

original: sogs pa'i sgras lho ru me'i dkyil 'khor zur gsum dang / nub tu sa'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi dang / byang du chu'i dkyil 'khor zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa ni nag po dang / dmar po dang / ser po dang / dkar po ste rim pa bzhin du thig le dang /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras lho ru me'i dkyil 'khor zur gsum dang / nub tu sa'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi dang / byang du chu'i dkyil 'khor zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa ni nag po dang / dmar po dang / ser po dang / dkar po ste rim pa bzhin du thig le dang /
translated: The syllable “etc.” refers to the triangular fire maṇḍala in the south, the square earth maṇḍala in the west, and the crescent-shaped water maṇḍala in the north, which are black, red, yellow, and white, respectively, and are marked with a drop,

original: bkra shis dang / rdo rje dang / padmas mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: bkra shis dang / rdo rje dang / padmas mtshan pa'o //
translated: a svastika, a vajra, and a lotus.

original: de bzhin du nag po dang / dmar po dang / ser po dang / dkar po dang / ljang gu dang / sngon po ni sgo la sogs pa'i shing rta rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nag po dang / dmar po dang / ser po dang / dkar po dang / ljang gu dang / sngon po ni sgo la sogs pa'i shing rta rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the colors of the gates, etc., are black, red, yellow, white, green, and blue.

original: dur khrod kyi 'khor lo rnams ni zla ba dang / nyi ma'i kha dog ste gang zhig 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'khor lo dkar dang dmar po zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi 'khor lo rnams ni zla ba dang / nyi ma'i kha dog ste gang zhig 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'khor lo dkar dang dmar po zhes pa'o //
translated: The maṇḍalas of the charnel grounds are the colors of the moon and sun, as will be explained: “the white and red maṇḍala.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i kha dog gi dbye ba thams cad du rdul tshon gyi sa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i kha dog gi dbye ba thams cad du rdul tshon gyi sa'o //
translated: The colors of the tathāgatas are in all the maṇḍalas of the sand.

original: da ni nyi ma dang zla ba 'char ba'i gnas gsungs te 'dir sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi rta babs kyi gnas la sa'i khor yug kha dog ser po sor phyed pa bcu gnyis kyis bkod pa gang yin pa de la dbang ldan du mtshan mo'i dbang gis zla ba
analyzed: da ni nyi ma dang zla ba 'char ba'i gnas gsungs te 'dir sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi rta babs kyi gnas la sa'i khor yug kha dog ser po sor phyed pa bcu gnyis kyis bkod pa gang yin pa de la dbang ldan du mtshan mo'i dbang gis zla ba
translated: Now, the location of the rising of the sun and moon is stated. Here, in the location of the pediment of the body maṇḍala, the yellow outer ring of the earth is arranged with twelve finger lengths.

original: nya ba 'char ba blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nya ba 'char ba blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the northeast, one should view the full moon rising by the power of the night.

original: de bzhin du lha min zur zhes pa bden bral du nyi ma nub pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha min zur zhes pa bden bral du nyi ma nub pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the southwest, one should view the setting sun in the “corner of the asuras.”

original: de ltar nas yi dkyil 'khor la gnas zla nyi dag go kye mi'i dbang po zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nas yi dkyil 'khor la gnas zla nyi dag go kye mi'i dbang po zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the moon and sun are located in the maṇḍala of the earth.

original: de nas sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol la sgo yi steng gi char rta babs kyi rtseg ma dang po'i dbus ma'i gnas sor phyed bcu drug gi @124b bdag nyid la thugs kyi zhal rnam par dag pas ri dags dang bcas chos kyi 'khor lo sprin gyi mdog
analyzed: de nas sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol la sgo yi steng gi char rta babs kyi rtseg ma dang po'i dbus ma'i gnas sor phyed bcu drug gi @124b bdag nyid la thugs kyi zhal rnam par dag pas ri dags dang bcas chos kyi 'khor lo sprin gyi mdog
translated: Next, on the body maṇḍala, on the top of the door, in the center of the first tier of the pediment, in the location of sixteen finger lengths, the face of the mind is pure, with a deer and Dharma wheel, the color of a cloud.

original: tu 'gyur te 'khor lo'i g-yas dang g-yon du ri dags dang ri dags mo'o //
analyzed: tu 'gyur te 'khor lo'i g-yas dang g-yon du ri dags dang ri dags mo'o //
translated: The deer and doe are to the right and left of the wheel.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gnas su mchod pa'i lha mo ste ji ltar brjod pa las so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gnas su mchod pa'i lha mo ste ji ltar brjod pa las so //
translated: The offering goddesses are in the other directions, as stated.

original: de bzhin du g-yas su zhes pa lho'i rta babs la gsung rnam par dag pas bum pa bzang po kha dog dmar po ste de'i g-yas dang g-yon du dung dang padma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas su zhes pa lho'i rta babs la gsung rnam par dag pas bum pa bzang po kha dog dmar po ste de'i g-yas dang g-yon du dung dang padma'o //
translated: Similarly, to the right, on the southern archway, is the excellent vase of speech, red in color. The conch and lotus are to its right and left.

original: nor sbyin dang bcas chur ni zhes pa nor sbyin du rnga bo che dkar po ste g-yas dang g-yon du dbyug pa dang tho ba'o //
analyzed: nor sbyin dang bcas chur ni zhes pa nor sbyin du rnga bo che dkar po ste g-yas dang g-yon du dbyug pa dang tho ba'o //
translated: In the south, the white kettledrum is with Kubera. The club and hammer are to its right and left.

original: nub tu byang chub kyi shing ser po ste g-yas dang g-yon du mi 'am ci dang mi 'am ci mo'i zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: nub tu byang chub kyi shing ser po ste g-yas dang g-yon du mi 'am ci dang mi 'am ci mo'i zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: In the west is the yellow tree of enlightenment. The kinnara and kinnari are to its right and left.

original: de bzhin du dril bu me long ba dan ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar rta babs rnams las 'phyang bar gyur pa dang // do shal phyed pa kha dog dkar por 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis shing rta sgo'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dril bu me long ba dan ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar rta babs rnams las 'phyang bar gyur pa dang // do shal phyed pa kha dog dkar por 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis shing rta sgo'i dbus su'o //
translated: The half-garlands are white in color, and by the power of the family, in the middle of the door of the chariot.

original: 'khor lo dkar dang dmar po rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis rlung la sgo'i phyi rol du //
analyzed: 'khor lo dkar dang dmar po rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis rlung la sgo'i phyi rol du //
translated: The white and red wheels are by the power of one's own victorious family, in the wind direction outside the door.🔽The blazing vajras are by the lord of men outside the vajra garlands as well.

original: rdo rje 'bar ba 'phro ba dag gis mi'i bdag po phyi rol rdo rje phreng ba rnams su'ang 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir rdo rje phreng ba'i dang po dang tha mar zlum skor bkod nas /
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba 'phro ba dag gis mi'i bdag po phyi rol rdo rje phreng ba rnams su'ang 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir rdo rje phreng ba'i dang po dang tha mar zlum skor bkod nas /
translated: Here, the vajra garland is arranged in a circle at the beginning and end,

original: de'i phyi rol du 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin 'bar ba blta bar bya ste des dkyil 'khor grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin 'bar ba blta bar bya ste des dkyil 'khor grub po //
translated: and outside of that, the blazing nature of five lights should be seen. By that, the mandala is accomplished.

original: sa'i 'khor yug dang kra ma sh'irsha dag gi bar du mchod pa'i rdzas rnams ji ltar mdzes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i 'khor yug dang kra ma sh'irsha dag gi bar du mchod pa'i rdzas rnams ji ltar mdzes par bya'o //
translated: Between the earth-cakra and the kramaśīrṣa, the offering substances should be arranged as beautiful as possible.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi rdul tshon gyi kha dog nges pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi rdul tshon gyi kha dog nges pa'o //
translated: The colors of the colored powders of the maṇḍala are definite.

original: da ni ra ba'i re kh'a rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skyon gsungs pa sboms pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir zhi ba dang rgyas pa la gang gi tshe re kh'a'i mtshan nyid dang bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe las phyin ci log tu 'gyur
analyzed: da ni ra ba'i re kh'a rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skyon gsungs pa sboms pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir zhi ba dang rgyas pa la gang gi tshe re kh'a'i mtshan nyid dang bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe las phyin ci log tu 'gyur
translated: Now, the faults of the lines of the enclosure being without the characteristics are stated by “by being too thick,” and so on. Here, in the case of pacifying and increasing, when the lines are without the characteristics, then the rite is reversed.

original: ro // de la sboms pas ni sbyin bdag gam slob dpon la nad dag byed cing phra dang re kh'a ngan pas rdzas ni nyams pa rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: ro // de la sboms pas ni sbyin bdag gam slob dpon la nad dag byed cing phra dang re kh'a ngan pas rdzas ni nyams pa rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: There, by being too thick, it makes the patron or the master sick; by being thin, it makes the substances deteriorate.

original: chad pas 'chi ba yang rab tu gsal bar byed de 'khyog pos mi'i bdag po dang bcas grong rdal de bzhin nyid du skyod par byed do //🔽mtshan ma 'am nyi ma dang zla ba'i gdan chad par gyur na sngags pa rnams la srid pa'i @125a * //
analyzed: chad pas 'chi ba yang rab tu gsal bar byed de 'khyog pos mi'i bdag po dang bcas grong rdal de bzhin nyid du skyod par byed do // mtshan ma 'am nyi ma dang zla ba'i gdan chad par gyur na sngags pa rnams la srid pa'i @125a * //
translated: By being broken, it makes death manifest; by being crooked, it makes the lord of men and the city move just as it is.

original: 'jigs pa 'joms pa'i dngos grub gang yin ba de med do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa 'joms pa'i dngos grub gang yin ba de med do //
translated: If the sign or the seat of the sun and moon is broken, then the siddhi of the mantra practitioners, which is the destruction of the fear of existence, is not present.

original: phan tshun rdul tshon rnams par 'dres pas sbyin bdag gi rgyud dang slob dpon gyi rgyud kyi rigs rgyud 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun rdul tshon rnams par 'dres pas sbyin bdag gi rgyud dang slob dpon gyi rgyud kyi rigs rgyud 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The lineages of the patron and the master will be broken, because the colored powders are mixed together.

original: des na rgyal ba'i rigs kyis dkyil 'khor dag la rigs par bya ste rab tu 'bad pas rdul tshon thams cad bsgrub po zhes pa ni nges pa'o /
analyzed: des na rgyal ba'i rigs kyis dkyil 'khor dag la rigs par bya ste rab tu 'bad pas rdul tshon thams cad bsgrub po zhes pa ni nges pa'o /
translated: Therefore, one should do the maṇḍala with the lineage of the Victorious Ones, and one should accomplish all the colored powders with effort. This is the definitive meaning.

original: da ni mtshan ma mtshan nyid dang bral ba gsungs pa 'dir 'khor lo ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: da ni mtshan ma mtshan nyid dang bral ba gsungs pa 'dir 'khor lo ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Now, the characteristic of the signless is stated here. The wheel is twofold:

original: gcig ni lha mo rnams kyi tshogs pa dang / gzhan ni rtsibs brgyad pa ste rten gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig ni lha mo rnams kyi tshogs pa dang / gzhan ni rtsibs brgyad pa ste rten gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: one is the assembly of the goddesses, and the other is the eight-spoked wheel, which is the nature of the support.

original: de la rtsibs brgyad pa ni zur du dkar po dang phyogs rnams su dmar po'o //
analyzed: de la rtsibs brgyad pa ni zur du dkar po dang phyogs rnams su dmar po'o //
translated: There, the eight-spoked wheel is white in the corners and red in the directions.

original: tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yang rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yang rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis te /
translated: The nature of the assembly is also by the power of one’s own lineage of the Victorious Ones.

original: rang gi rgyal ba'i kha dog gis lha mo rnams kyi kha dog go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi rgyal ba'i kha dog gis lha mo rnams kyi kha dog go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the color of the goddesses is the color of one’s own Victorious One.

original: gang zhig ces pa ni 'dir sngags kyi tshul la gang du rgyud las rgyal bas te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces pa ni 'dir sngags kyi tshul la gang du rgyud las rgyal bas te /
translated: The word whatever here refers to the mantra method, where the Tathāgata, the Victor, has not clearly taught the signs.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan ma gsal bar ma gsungs pa'i mtshan ma de ni mdzes pa'i don du dkyil 'khor la dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan ma gsal bar ma gsungs pa'i mtshan ma de ni mdzes pa'i don du dkyil 'khor la dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: That sign should not be placed in the maṇḍala for the sake of beauty.

original: ci'i phyir zhes na gang gi phyir mtshan ma de ni bdud kyi mtshan mar 'gyur te phyin ci log lhag pa'i phyir ro //🔽rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la ste rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs la rdo rje slob dpon gyis so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes na gang gi phyir mtshan ma de ni bdud kyi mtshan mar 'gyur te phyin ci log lhag pa'i phyir ro // rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la ste rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs la rdo rje slob dpon gyis so //
translated: Why? Because that sign would be a sign of Māra, due to the predominance of error.

original: de phyir rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga'i mtshan mar 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis sgo'i mtshams nas dkyil 'khor la'o //
analyzed: de phyir rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga'i mtshan mar 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis sgo'i mtshams nas dkyil 'khor la'o //
translated: The vajra master in the family that generates the Victor, in the family of Vajrasattva, should make the sign taught in the tantra, due to the power of the family, in the maṇḍala from the door threshold.

original: do shal phyed pa'i mthar ni rab tu bya zhes pa ni do shal phyed pas nye bar mtshon nas ba ku l'i dang kra ma sh'irsha'i mthar ro //
analyzed: do shal phyed pa'i mthar ni rab tu bya zhes pa ni do shal phyed pas nye bar mtshon nas ba ku l'i dang kra ma sh'irsha'i mthar ro //
translated: At the end of the half-garland, it should be done, indicated by the half-garland, at the end of the bakula and kramaśīrṣa.

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar sa yi dkyil 'khor gyi gzhi la padma bum sogs mdzes pa bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar sa yi dkyil 'khor gyi gzhi la padma bum sogs mdzes pa bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: At the end of the maṇḍala of the body, one should make a beautiful lotus, vase, and so on on the foundation of the maṇḍala of earth.

original: da ni nag po la sogs zhes pa la sogs pas rdul tshon gyi dpangs gsungs pa 'dir snying po'i dkyil 'khor la rlung la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi dbye bas rkang pa la sogs pa 'phel bas rdul tshon dgye bar 'gyur te shar du reg bya'i yon tan
analyzed: da ni nag po la sogs zhes pa la sogs pas rdul tshon gyi dpangs gsungs pa 'dir snying po'i dkyil 'khor la rlung la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi dbye bas rkang pa la sogs pa 'phel bas rdul tshon dgye bar 'gyur te shar du reg bya'i yon tan
translated: Now, in order to explain the height of the colored powder, “black and so on” is stated. Here, since the qualities of wind and so on increase the height of the colored powder in the maṇḍala of the essence and so on, the colored powder is applied.

original: rnams par dag pas rdul tshon nag po ni nas kyi rkang pa gcig gi dpangs so //
analyzed: rnams par dag pas rdul tshon nag po ni nas kyi rkang pa gcig gi dpangs so //
translated: Since the quality of touch is pure in the east, the colored powder is one cubit high.

original: lhor reg bya dang ro'i @125b yon tan gnyis rnams par dag pas dmar po ni rkang ba gnyis so //
analyzed: lhor reg bya dang ro'i @125b yon tan gnyis rnams par dag pas dmar po ni rkang ba gnyis so //
translated: Since the two qualities of touch and taste are pure in the south, [the colored powder] is two cubits.

original: byang du reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs kyi yon tan rnam par dag pas dkar po ni rkang ba gsum mo //
analyzed: byang du reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs kyi yon tan rnam par dag pas dkar po ni rkang ba gsum mo //
translated: Since the qualities of touch, taste, and form are pure in the north, [the colored powder] is three cubits.

original: nub tu reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri'i yon tan bzhi rnam par dag pas ser po ni rkang ba bzhi'i dpangs so //
analyzed: nub tu reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri'i yon tan bzhi rnam par dag pas ser po ni rkang ba bzhi'i dpangs so //
translated: In the west, the four qualities of texture, taste, form, and smell are purified as yellow, which is four cubits high.

original: de bzhin du gsung gi dkyil 'khor la nyis 'gyur dang / sku'i dkyil 'khor la bzhi 'gyur gyi dpangs so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung gi dkyil 'khor la nyis 'gyur dang / sku'i dkyil 'khor la bzhi 'gyur gyi dpangs so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the speech mandala is twice that height, and the body mandala is four times that height.

original: nas kyang rang rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi drug cu rtsa brgyad lhag pa'i bdun brgya'i cha shas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nas kyang rang rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi drug cu rtsa brgyad lhag pa'i bdun brgya'i cha shas su rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, each of their mandalas should be known as three hundred and seventy-five parts.

original: de bzhin du ra ba rnams kyi dpangs ni rdul tshon ser po'i dpangs sum 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ra ba rnams kyi dpangs ni rdul tshon ser po'i dpangs sum 'gyur te /
translated: The height of the fences is three times the height of the yellow sand.

original: gzhan re kh'a thun mong ba ni rdul tshon ser po'i nyis 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan re kh'a thun mong ba ni rdul tshon ser po'i nyis 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
translated: The common lines are twice the height of the yellow sand.

original: padma rnams kyi 'dab ma'i phyi rol du padma'i gdan gyi snam bu dang / nyin mor byed pa ri bong can dang / chu skyes re kh'a nyis 'gyur ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: padma rnams kyi 'dab ma'i phyi rol du padma'i gdan gyi snam bu dang / nyin mor byed pa ri bong can dang / chu skyes re kh'a nyis 'gyur ni nges pa'o //
translated: Outside the petals of the lotuses, the platform of the lotus seats, the sun, moon, and water lilies are twice the height of the lines.

original: snying po dag las phyi rol bar ma'i dkyil 'khor la nyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: snying po dag las phyi rol bar ma'i dkyil 'khor la nyis 'gyur te /
translated: The outer middle maṇḍala is twice that.

original: de nyis 'gyur ni sku'i dkyil 'khor 'di la'o //
analyzed: de nyis 'gyur ni sku'i dkyil 'khor 'di la'o //
translated: That is twice the size of this body maṇḍala.

original: do shal phyed pa'i mthar ni nas gcig ste /
analyzed: do shal phyed pa'i mthar ni nas gcig ste /
translated: At the end of the half-garland, there is one finger.

original: kra ma sh'irsha'i mthar phyi rol gyi mchod pa'i sa la'o //
analyzed: kra ma sh'irsha'i mthar phyi rol gyi mchod pa'i sa la'o //
translated: At the end of the kramaśīrṣa, there is the outer place of worship.

original: de bzhin du sa chu bsreg za rlung gi khor yug rnams dang / rdo rje phreng ba rnams la ste zlum skor gnyis la sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi ra ba'i tshad kyis so zhes pa ni khams kyi yon tan gyi dbye bas rdul tshon gyi dpangs nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa chu bsreg za rlung gi khor yug rnams dang / rdo rje phreng ba rnams la ste zlum skor gnyis la sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi ra ba'i tshad kyis so zhes pa ni khams kyi yon tan gyi dbye bas rdul tshon gyi dpangs nges pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the spheres of earth, water, fire, and wind, and the vajra garlands are two circles with the measure of the enclosure of the body maṇḍala.

original: dgye ba gzhan ni thams cad du yon tan gsum gyi dbye bas sa thams cad la tshad mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: dgye ba gzhan ni thams cad du yon tan gsum gyi dbye bas sa thams cad la tshad mtshungs pa ste /
translated: The other measurements are equal on all the levels, because of the division of the three qualities.🔽The enclosures are three times the size of the three maṇḍalas.

original: ra ba rnams ni dkyil 'khor gsum gyi tshad las sum 'gyur ro zhes pa ste rdul tshon rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: ra ba rnams ni dkyil 'khor gsum gyi tshad las sum 'gyur ro zhes pa ste rdul tshon rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purity of the colored powders.

original: da ni snying po zhes pa la sogs pas 'jig rten gyi khams dag pas rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi dag pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni snying po zhes pa la sogs pas 'jig rten gyi khams dag pas rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi dag pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “the essence,” he explains the purity of the maṇḍala of colored powder by way of the purity of the world systems.

original: 'dir ji ltar phyi rol du de bzhin lus //
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar phyi rol du de bzhin lus //
translated: Here, just as externally, so in the body.

original: ji ltar lus la de bzhin gzhan //
analyzed: ji ltar lus la de bzhin gzhan //
translated: Just as in the body, so in the other.

original: rdul tshon gyi ni dkyil 'khor @126a * //
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi ni dkyil 'khor @126a * //
translated: In the maṇḍala of colored powder.

original: la'o ; / des na 'jig rten gyi khams la tshad dpag tshad 'bum phrag bzhi gang yin pa de ni lus la khru bzhi ste /
analyzed: la'o ; / des na 'jig rten gyi khams la tshad dpag tshad 'bum phrag bzhi gang yin pa de ni lus la khru bzhi ste /
translated: Thus, that which is one hundred thousand leagues in the world systems is four cubits in the body.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
translated: And likewise, in the maṇḍala.

original: khru gcig nas brtsams te ji srid khru stong gi bar thams cad du rang gi khru yis khru bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: khru gcig nas brtsams te ji srid khru stong gi bar thams cad du rang gi khru yis khru bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Beginning with one cubit up to one thousand cubits, in all cases, it is a four-cubit maṇḍala by one’s own cubit,

original: sor phyed pa dgu bcu rtsa drug nyis 'gyur gyi bdag nyid kyi cha yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sor phyed pa dgu bcu rtsa drug nyis 'gyur gyi bdag nyid kyi cha yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a part that is the nature of ninety-six and a half finger breadths.

original: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor thams cad khru bzhi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor thams cad khru bzhi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all maṇḍalas are of the nature of four cubits.

original: des na snying po nas ni sgo'i dang po'i mtshams kyis nor ldan mar 'gyur zhes pa tshangs pa'i thig nas phyogs thams cad du sgo'i mthar thug pa sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis nor ldan mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na snying po nas ni sgo'i dang po'i mtshams kyis nor ldan mar 'gyur zhes pa tshangs pa'i thig nas phyogs thams cad du sgo'i mthar thug pa sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis nor ldan mar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, from the center to the first gate, it is called the “wealthy one.” From the Brahma line, in all directions, up to the end of the gate, it is twenty-four fingerbreadths, which is called the “wealthy one.”

original: de la snying po'i padma sor phyed pa bcu gnyis pa ni dpag tshad stong phrag lnga bcu'i phyed kyi tshad kyis so //
analyzed: de la snying po'i padma sor phyed pa bcu gnyis pa ni dpag tshad stong phrag lnga bcu'i phyed kyi tshad kyis so //
translated: The lotus of the center is twelve fingerbreadths, with a size of twenty-five thousand yojanas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phar ma ni phyogs thams cad du gling drug dang / rgya mtsho drug dang / ri drug gi mthar 'og dang steng du lhun po'i tshad kyis te dpag tshad stong phrag lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phar ma ni phyogs thams cad du gling drug dang / rgya mtsho drug dang / ri drug gi mthar 'og dang steng du lhun po'i tshad kyis te dpag tshad stong phrag lnga bcu'o //
translated: The excess of the tathagata is in all directions, with six continents, six oceans, and six mountains, up to the end, with the size of Meru above and below, twenty-five thousand yojanas.

original: de nas sa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga ste dkyil 'khor la rdul tshon gyis sgo'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga ste dkyil 'khor la rdul tshon gyis sgo'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Then, in all the maṇḍalas of the earth, it is twenty-five thousand yojanas, up to the end of the gate of the maṇḍala with colored powders.

original: de ltar snying po'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag ni dpag tshad 'bum ste /
analyzed: de ltar snying po'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag ni dpag tshad 'bum ste /
translated: Thus, the entire maṇḍala of the essence is one hundred thousand yojanas.

original: sor phyed pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyi cha dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: sor phyed pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyi cha dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with a portion of forty-eight finger lengths.

original: de ltar na snying po nas ni sgo'i dang po'i mtshams ni nor ldan mar 'gyur 'jig rten khams kyi dkyil 'khor la zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na snying po nas ni sgo'i dang po'i mtshams ni nor ldan mar 'gyur 'jig rten khams kyi dkyil 'khor la zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, from the essence, the distance to the first gate is called “wealthy,” the maṇḍala of the world system.

original: de bzhin du sgo bzhi nas phyogs bzhi rnams su ca rtsi k'a mthar sum 'gyur gdengs can re mig rnams kyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgo bzhi nas phyogs bzhi rnams su ca rtsi k'a mthar sum 'gyur gdengs can re mig rnams kyis te /
translated: In the same way, from the four gates, in the four directions, there are four finger lengths, and the distance to the end of caurī is three times that.

original: phyogs bzhi rnams su sor phyed nyi shu rtsa bzhis lan tshva'i rin chen gnas zhes pa lan tshva'i chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi rnams su sor phyed nyi shu rtsa bzhis lan tshva'i rin chen gnas zhes pa lan tshva'i chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In the four directions, there are twenty-four finger lengths.

original: de ltar na gsung gi dkyil 'khor ni 'bum phrag gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na gsung gi dkyil 'khor ni 'bum phrag gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the maṇḍala of speech is two hundred thousand yojanas.

original: shar nas nub kyi phyed kyi bar du'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: shar nas nub kyi phyed kyi bar du'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: From the east to the west, it is said to be the distance.

original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo de nas rgyal ba'i dbang po'i re mig gis @126b zhes pa phyogs thams cad du sor phyed nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis kyang gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi kra ma sh'irsha'i mthar thug pa ni me'i dkyil 'khor te gnas de nas shar
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo de nas rgyal ba'i dbang po'i re mig gis @126b zhes pa phyogs thams cad du sor phyed nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis kyang gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi kra ma sh'irsha'i mthar thug pa ni me'i dkyil 'khor te gnas de nas shar
translated: The end of the Kramaśaila of the maṇḍala of speech is the maṇḍala of fire.

original: dang nub tu 'jig rten gyi khams la dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum mo zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: dang nub tu 'jig rten gyi khams la dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum mo zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: From that place, the east and west are three hundred thousand yojanas in the world system.

original: de nas de bzhin rlung du 'gyur zhes pa kra ma sh'irsha de nas rgyal ba'i dbang po'i re mig gis te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin rlung du 'gyur zhes pa kra ma sh'irsha de nas rgyal ba'i dbang po'i re mig gis te /
translated: “Then, likewise, in the wind” means that from that Kramaśaila, the “squares of the lord of the victors” are twenty-four finger lengths in all directions.

original: sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis phyogs thams cad du sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i mthar thug pa ni 'jig rten khams kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis phyogs thams cad du sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i mthar thug pa ni 'jig rten khams kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The end of the door of the maṇḍala of the body is the maṇḍala of wind of the world system.

original: de ltar phyi rol du 'jig rten khams kyi dkyil 'khor 'bum phrag bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol du 'jig rten khams kyi dkyil 'khor 'bum phrag bzhi ste /
translated: Thus, externally, the maṇḍala of the world system is four hundred thousand.

original: dgu bcu rtsa drug nyis 'gyur gyi cha dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni sku'i dkyil 'khor nges pa'o //
analyzed: dgu bcu rtsa drug nyis 'gyur gyi cha dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni sku'i dkyil 'khor nges pa'o //
translated: The sixteen parts are the measure of the mandala of the body.

original: slar yang de'i phyi rol du sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi rta babs kyi gnas la de dag rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang de'i phyi rol du sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi rta babs kyi gnas la de dag rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Again, outside of that, in the place of the archways of the mandala of the body, there are the purities of those.

original: sa la sogs pa'i khor yug rnam par dag pa ni lhun po spangs nas sa'i khor yug sor phyed pa bcu gnyis dang / lhag ma rnams so sor sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khor yug rnam par dag pa ni lhun po spangs nas sa'i khor yug sor phyed pa bcu gnyis dang / lhag ma rnams so sor sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis blta bar bya'o //
translated: The purities of the outer rings of earth and so forth are to be seen as twelve fingerbreadths outside of Meru, and the rest are each twenty-four fingerbreadths.

original: de nas phyi rol du sor phyed pa bcu gnyis kyis rdo rje phreng ba ste g-yas dang g-yon du cha gsum byas nas dbus su cha drug gis rdo rje'i phreng ba bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol du sor phyed pa bcu gnyis kyis rdo rje phreng ba ste g-yas dang g-yon du cha gsum byas nas dbus su cha drug gis rdo rje'i phreng ba bya'o //
translated: Then, outside of that, the vajra garland is twelve fingerbreadths. Having divided the right and left sides into three parts, in the middle, the vajra garland is six parts.

original: de'i phyi rol du nyi shu rtsa bzhis rdo rje'i me lce ste 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dag pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du nyi shu rtsa bzhis rdo rje'i me lce ste 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dag pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Outside of that, the vajra flame is twenty-four fingerbreadths. This is the definition of the purity of the world systems.

original: da ni gtsug tor zhes pa la sogs par steng 'og rnam par dag pa gsungs pa 'dir phyi rol du lhun po'i gtsug tor stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga ste sor phyed pa bcu gnyis kyi cha dang ldan pa ni dbus su snying po'i padma de'i cha dang
analyzed: da ni gtsug tor zhes pa la sogs par steng 'og rnam par dag pa gsungs pa 'dir phyi rol du lhun po'i gtsug tor stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga ste sor phyed pa bcu gnyis kyi cha dang ldan pa ni dbus su snying po'i padma de'i cha dang
translated: Here, externally, the crown protrusion of Meru is twenty-five thousand [leagues], endowed with a half-breadth of twelve [leagues], in the center, the lotus of the essence is endowed with that [breadth].

original: ldan pa'o // de nas gdong 'bum phrag phyed dang mgrin pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'o // de nas gdong 'bum phrag phyed dang mgrin pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
