translated: Then, the face is one hundred and fifty thousand [leagues], and the throat is twenty-five thousand [leagues].

original: de rnams las gdong gi phyed stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'i cha dang po la sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: de rnams las gdong gi phyed stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'i cha dang po la sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: Of those, the first half of the face, twenty-five thousand [leagues], is the wheel of the buddhas.

original: gnyis pa la 'khor lo gzhan no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la 'khor lo gzhan no //
translated: The second is another wheel.

original: lhag ma cha gnyis la rdul tshon gyis te sgo'i mthar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma cha gnyis la rdul tshon gyis te sgo'i mthar ro //
translated: The remaining two parts are with colored powder, at the end of the door.

original: de ltar steng 'og tu mgrin pa'i mthar 'jig rten gyi khams @127a * //
analyzed: de ltar steng 'og tu mgrin pa'i mthar 'jig rten gyi khams @127a * //
translated: Thus, above and below, at the end of the throat, the world system is

original: dpag tshad 'bum ste dkyil 'khor la kun nas khru gcig go //
analyzed: dpag tshad 'bum ste dkyil 'khor la kun nas khru gcig go //
translated: one hundred thousand leagues, and all around the mandala is one cubit.

original: snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa ste /
analyzed: snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa ste /
translated: This is the definition of the mandala of the essence.

original: de ltar na gtsug tor gdong dang mgrin pa sum 'gyur gdengs can re mig rnams kyis dkyil 'khor la ni g-yas dang g-yon du sbyang bar bya zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gtsug tor gdong dang mgrin pa sum 'gyur gdengs can re mig rnams kyis dkyil 'khor la ni g-yas dang g-yon du sbyang bar bya zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the crown, face, and throat, each three times the nāgas and checkerboards, are to be applied to the right and left of the maṇḍala, respectively.

original: de nas te mgrin pa nas lhun po mtha' dag dpyi'i mthar steng 'og tu dpag tshad 'bum ni sum 'gyur gdengs can re mig rnams kyis zhes pa sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis gsung gi mtshan nyid kyi dkyil 'khor la g-yas dang g-yon du sbyar bar bya🔽ste / 'og tu sa ni ji srid nyid du'o //
analyzed: de nas te mgrin pa nas lhun po mtha' dag dpyi'i mthar steng 'og tu dpag tshad 'bum ni sum 'gyur gdengs can re mig rnams kyis zhes pa sor phyed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis gsung gi mtshan nyid kyi dkyil 'khor la g-yas dang g-yon du sbyar bar bya ste / 'og tu sa ni ji srid nyid du'o //
translated: Then, from the throat to the end of Meru, at the end of spring, one hundred thousand yojanas, three times the nāgas and checkerboards, with twenty-four finger lengths, is to be applied to the right and left of the maṇḍala of the characteristic of speech.

original: de nas re mig drug drug dag gis rim pa ste dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid can cha drug dang ldan pa dag gis 'bum phrag gnyis cha brgyad du byas nas /
analyzed: de nas re mig drug drug dag gis rim pa ste dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid can cha drug dang ldan pa dag gis 'bum phrag gnyis cha brgyad du byas nas /
translated: Then, with six squares each, the levels, which are twenty-five thousand yojanas in size, with six parts, are divided into eight parts, two hundred thousand.

original: gsal bar klu'i srid pa dang ni sa 'og bdun po ste dmyal ba'i srid pa rnams so sor sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsal bar klu'i srid pa dang ni sa 'og bdun po ste dmyal ba'i srid pa rnams so sor sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: One should purify the nāga existence and the seven underworlds, that is, the hells, individually.

original: lus la dpyi nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthil gyi mthar cha brgyad du byas nas /
analyzed: lus la dpyi nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthil gyi mthar cha brgyad du byas nas /
translated: In the body, beginning from the hips and ending at the soles of the feet, one should divide into eight parts.

original: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la sbyang bar bya ste tshangs pa'i gnas nas phyogs thams cad du sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar te /
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la sbyang bar bya ste tshangs pa'i gnas nas phyogs thams cad du sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar te /
translated: One should purify in the maṇḍala of colored powder, from the abode of Brahmā to all directions, to the end of the body maṇḍala,

original: sgo bzhi'i mthar thug pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhi'i mthar thug pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: to the end of the four doors. This is the determination.

original: de bzhin sa la sogs pa thams cad slar yang de bzhin du mi la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi rang gi lus la sbyang bar bya zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sa la sogs pa thams cad slar yang de bzhin du mi la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi rang gi lus la sbyang bar bya zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, all the earth, etc., again in the same way, one should purify in the body of all sentient beings, humans, etc. This is the determination of the form of the maṇḍala.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rnam par dag pa gzhan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rnam par dag pa gzhan brjod par bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should state the other purities taught in the Root Tantra.

original: 'dir sems can thams cad kyi snying gi nang na gnas pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: 'dir sems can thams cad kyi snying gi nang na gnas pa ni ye shes so //
translated: Here, the wisdom that abides in the heart of all sentient beings

original: de yang gzhom du med pa'i sgra ste rtag tu n'a da'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de yang gzhom du med pa'i sgra ste rtag tu n'a da'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is the sound that cannot be overcome, always having the characteristic of nāda.

original: de'i phyir snying ga'i 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor de dbus su byas te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir snying ga'i 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor de dbus su byas te ;
translated: Therefore, having made that maṇḍala of the heart cakra in the center,

original: de la mgrin pa dang lte ba dag gi dbus su tshad phyed bzung nas tshad phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kyi dkyil 'khor du bya'o //🔽mgrin pa nas lte ba'i mthar thug pa tshad nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid ni gsung @127b gi dkyil 'khor du bya'o //
analyzed: de la mgrin pa dang lte ba dag gi dbus su tshad phyed bzung nas tshad phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kyi dkyil 'khor du bya'o // mgrin pa nas lte ba'i mthar thug pa tshad nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid ni gsung @127b gi dkyil 'khor du bya'o //
translated: there, having taken half a measure from the center of the throat and navel, the one with half a measure and twelve is the maṇḍala of the Bhagavān’s mind.🔽From the throat to the end of the navel, the one with twenty-five measures is the maṇḍala of speech.

original: mdzod spu'i gnas nas chu so'i mthar tshad lnga bcu'i bdag nyid ni sku'i dkyil 'khor du bya'o //
analyzed: mdzod spu'i gnas nas chu so'i mthar tshad lnga bcu'i bdag nyid ni sku'i dkyil 'khor du bya'o //
translated: From the place of the ūrṇā to the end of the anus, the one with fifty measures is the maṇḍala of the body.

original: de la sku'i sgo bzhi ni bshang ba dang gci ba dang khu ba dang gtsug tor gyi bug pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la sku'i sgo bzhi ni bshang ba dang gci ba dang khu ba dang gtsug tor gyi bug pa rnams so //
translated: There, the four doors of the body are the anus, the urethra, the penis, and the fontanelle.

original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo ni la la n'a dang ras n'a dang aa ba dh'u t'i dang dung can ma rnams te mgrin pa nas lte ba'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo ni la la n'a dang ras n'a dang aa ba dh'u t'i dang dung can ma rnams te mgrin pa nas lte ba'i mtshams su'o //
translated: The doors of the mandala of speech are Lalana, Rasana, Avadhuuti, and Suṣumnā, from the throat to the navel.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo rnams ni sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo rnams ni sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: The doors of the mandala of mind are the characteristics of waking, dreaming, deep sleep, and the fourth.

original: de ltar sgo bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid can sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas zla ba'i cha bcu drug gi cha dang ldan pa ni phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du lus dang de bzhin du gzhan la ste
analyzed: de ltar sgo bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid can sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas zla ba'i cha bcu drug gi cha dang ldan pa ni phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du lus dang de bzhin du gzhan la ste
translated: Thus, the supreme mandala of body, speech, and mind, which has the nature of twelve doors, and the primordial buddha who possesses the sixteen phases of the moon, is just as it is externally, so it is in the body and in others.

original: dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum shes nas slob dpon gyis dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum shes nas slob dpon gyis dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
translated: Having understood the three mandalas, the master should draw the mandala. This is the certainty in all cases.

original: gnyis dang chu gter gcig la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni sngar thig gdab pa dang lhan cig brjod zin to //
analyzed: gnyis dang chu gter gcig la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni sngar thig gdab pa dang lhan cig brjod zin to //
translated: The two verses beginning with “two and one ocean” and so on were previously stated together with the layout of the maṇḍala.

original: da ni aom yig ces pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi sngags dang phyag rgya'i mtshan ma gsungs te 'dir rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la aom yig sku rdo rje dang des dkyil 'khor rdzogs par byas pa ni
analyzed: da ni aom yig ces pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi sngags dang phyag rgya'i mtshan ma gsungs te 'dir rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la aom yig sku rdo rje dang des dkyil 'khor rdzogs par byas pa ni
translated: Now, beginning with “the syllable oṃ,” the mantra and the sign of the maṇḍala deities are stated. Here, in all the kings of tantras, the maṇḍala of colored powder is the syllable oṃ, the vajra of body, and the one who perfects the maṇḍala is

original: aom yig ye shes las skyes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: aom yig ye shes las skyes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: the syllable oṃ, born from gnosis.

original: de'i phyir aom yig las skyes pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal ba mchog gi padma zhes pa padma nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams su zla ba dang nyi ma dag gi gdan rnams ni lo'i dbye bas te nya bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas zla ba'i gdan rnams dang gnam stong
analyzed: de'i phyir aom yig las skyes pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal ba mchog gi padma zhes pa padma nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams su zla ba dang nyi ma dag gi gdan rnams ni lo'i dbye bas te nya bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas zla ba'i gdan rnams dang gnam stong
translated: Therefore, the maṇḍala born from the syllable oṃ is the supreme king of maṇḍalas. The “lotus” is the twenty-four lotuses. The seats of the moon and sun are the divisions of the year, the seats of the moon by the division of the twelve full moons, and the seats of the sun by the division of the six

original: bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas nyi ma'i gdan rnams ni thabs dang shes rab rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas nyi ma'i gdan rnams ni thabs dang shes rab rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The seats of the suns are divided into twelve, because of the purity of method and wisdom.

original: steng du ste lte ba'i steng na gnas pa zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan de rnams la aa sogs zhes pa aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs rnams dang ka sogs zhes pa ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed rnams so //
analyzed: steng du ste lte ba'i steng na gnas pa zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan de rnams la aa sogs zhes pa aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs rnams dang ka sogs zhes pa ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed rnams so //
translated: Above, that is, above the navel, on the seats of the moon and sun, are the vowels, that is, the vowels beginning with a, and the consonants, that is, the consonants beginning with ka.

original: stong par bcas pa rnams dang zhes pa thig le dang rnam par bcad pa dang bcas pa dag dang lhan cig tu srid gsum skyed par mdzad ma stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad pa n'a da'i rang bzhin can ni thig le'i steng du ste yum khams gsum
analyzed: stong par bcas pa rnams dang zhes pa thig le dang rnam par bcad pa dang bcas pa dag dang lhan cig tu srid gsum skyed par mdzad ma stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad pa n'a da'i rang bzhin can ni thig le'i steng du ste yum khams gsum
translated: Together with the empty, that is, together with the bindu and the exclusion, the mother who generates the three worlds, emptiness in all aspects, the nature of the nāda, is on the bindu.

original: skyed par mdzad ma gzhom du med pa'i sgra zhes @128a * //
analyzed: skyed par mdzad ma gzhom du med pa'i sgra zhes @128a * //
translated: The mother who generates the three worlds, the invincible sound,

original: pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma sangs rgyas skyed par mdzad ma ni don dam pa'i bden ba la brten nas /
analyzed: pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma sangs rgyas skyed par mdzad ma ni don dam pa'i bden ba la brten nas /
translated: is on the bindu. The mother who generates the buddhas, the perfection of wisdom, the mother who generates the buddhas, is based on ultimate truth.

original: aa yig la sogs pa dang ka yig la sogs pa stong ba dang bcas pa'i sngags thams cad kyi mgor gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: aa yig la sogs pa dang ka yig la sogs pa stong ba dang bcas pa'i sngags thams cad kyi mgor gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The letter A and so forth, and the letter Ka and so forth, together with the void, should be placed at the beginning of all mantras.

original: des na de ni de rnams dang lhan cig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: des na de ni de rnams dang lhan cig brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is to be uttered together with them.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyang bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin can de'i nang du gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyang bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin can de'i nang du gnas so //
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One, who is of the nature of great bliss, abides within it.

original: da ni stong pa zhes pa la sogs pas stong pa lnga las sku la sogs pa'i sngags rab tu brjod pa'i chos can rnams 'byung ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni stong pa zhes pa la sogs pas stong pa lnga las sku la sogs pa'i sngags rab tu brjod pa'i chos can rnams 'byung ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “the void,” he declares the arising of the mantras of the body and so forth, which are the subjects of the teaching of the five voids:

original: stong pa ni le'u dang por brjod pa'i sngags kyi g-yon gyi yan lag tu rjes su nga ro dang / shar dang nub tu aa yig gnyis dang / lho'i yan lag tu rnam par bcad pa thig le gnyis dang / dbyangs dang bral ba mchog ces pa gzhom du med pa'i ha yig dbyangs med pa las sku dang gsung dang thugs dang /
analyzed: stong pa ni le'u dang por brjod pa'i sngags kyi g-yon gyi yan lag tu rjes su nga ro dang / shar dang nub tu aa yig gnyis dang / lho'i yan lag tu rnam par bcad pa thig le gnyis dang / dbyangs dang bral ba mchog ces pa gzhom du med pa'i ha yig dbyangs med pa las sku dang gsung dang thugs dang /
translated: The void is the mantra uttered in the first chapter, the left limb, the two A letters in the east and west, the two anusvāras in the south limb, and the supreme devoid of vowels, the invincible letter Ha devoid of vowels.

original: ye shes rdo rje rnams yang dag par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje rnams yang dag par 'byung ngo //
translated: The vajra of wisdom arises perfectly.

original: de rnams las dang por re zhig sku 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams las dang por re zhig sku 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Among them, first of all, the body should be described.

original: 'dir dang por rjes su nga ro dang / de nas aa yig dang / gnyi ga'i dbus su rnam par bcad pa dang rjes su nga ro'i mthar a'a yig ring po'o //
analyzed: 'dir dang por rjes su nga ro dang / de nas aa yig dang / gnyi ga'i dbus su rnam par bcad pa dang rjes su nga ro'i mthar a'a yig ring po'o //
translated: Here, first of all, the anusvāra, then the letter A, and in the middle of both, the visarga, and at the end of the anusvāra, the long ā.

original: de ltar dbyangs ring por pha rol tu phyung bas sngon ma'i rjes su nga ro ma nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dbyangs ring por pha rol tu phyung bas sngon ma'i rjes su nga ro ma nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the extension of the long vowel, the anusvāra itself is obtained.

original: ma yig pha rol tu byung bas kyang /
analyzed: ma yig pha rol tu byung bas kyang /
translated: By the extension of the letter ma,

original: aa yig las pha rol gyi rnam par bcad pa ni /
analyzed: aa yig las pha rol gyi rnam par bcad pa ni /
translated: the visarga beyond the letter A

original: au yig tu 'gyur te phyin nas aa yig gis yon tan du gyur pa ni ao yig go //
analyzed: au yig tu 'gyur te phyin nas aa yig gis yon tan du gyur pa ni ao yig go //
translated: becomes the letter u. Having gone to the letter A, the quality becomes the letter o.

original: de nas nges pa'i tshig gis mtshan nyid las /
analyzed: de nas nges pa'i tshig gis mtshan nyid las /
translated: Then, by the definition of the characteristics,

original: yi ge nyams pa yod ces pas ma yig rnam par phral nas a'a yig dbyi bar bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge nyams pa yod ces pas ma yig rnam par phral nas a'a yig dbyi bar bya'o //
translated: the letter ma is separated by the statement “the letter is defective,” and the letter ā is removed.

original: de ltar na yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid aom yig sku rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid aom yig sku rdo rje ste /
translated: Thus, the letter oṃ, which is the nature of the three qualities, is the vajra of body.

original: aa aum zhes rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' las brjod do //
analyzed: aa aum zhes rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' las brjod do //
translated: The a and o are spoken of in one's own and others' philosophical systems.

original: da ni gsung rdo rje brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gsung rdo rje brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the vajra of speech is to be spoken of.

original: 'dir sngon dang phyi ma'i aa yig gnyis ring por byas nas mthar rnam par bcad pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngon dang phyi ma'i aa yig gnyis ring por byas nas mthar rnam par bcad pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Here, the two a syllables of the beginning and end are made long, and at the end a visarga is given.

original: de nas a'a:yig yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas a'a:yig yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Then, the syllable aḥ becomes the nature of the three qualities.

original: aa a'a:zhes brjod do //
analyzed: aa a'a:zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said, aḥ.

original: da ni thugs rdo rje brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni thugs rdo rje brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the vajra of mind is to be spoken of.

original: 'dir sngon du ha yig dbyangs med pa dang / de nas aa yig @128b thung du dang de nas rnam par bcad pa dang / de nas thig le dang de nas a'a: yig ring po'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngon du ha yig dbyangs med pa dang / de nas aa yig @128b thung du dang de nas rnam par bcad pa dang / de nas thig le dang de nas a'a: yig ring po'o //
translated: Here, the syllable ha is without vowel, then the short a syllable, then the visarga, then the bindu, and then the long aḥ syllable.

original: de ltar snga ma bzhin du rnam par bcad pa au yig ste /
analyzed: de ltar snga ma bzhin du rnam par bcad pa au yig ste /
translated: Thus, as before, the visarga is the syllable u.

original: thog ma dang tha ma'i a'a yig dag dbyi'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma'i a'a yig dag dbyi'o //
translated: The first and last a syllables are elided.

original: de las h'um yig yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid de ha yum zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de las h'um yig yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid de ha yum zhes brjod do //
translated: From that, the syllable hūṃ is the nature of the three qualities, and it is said, ha yūṃ.

original: de ltar sku gsung thugs kyi sngags yang dag par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar sku gsung thugs kyi sngags yang dag par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Thus, the mantra of body, speech, and mind is perfectly produced.

original: sngags rnams kyi skye gnas ni skyed par byed pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sngags rnams kyi skye gnas ni skyed par byed pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The source of the mantras is the producer.

original: da ni ye shes rdo rje brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni ye shes rdo rje brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the vajra of wisdom should be stated.

original: 'dir sngon du ha yig dbyangs med pa dang / de nas aa yig thung du dang / de nas rnam par bcad pa dang / de nas rjes su nga ro dang / de nas a'a: yig ring po'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngon du ha yig dbyangs med pa dang / de nas aa yig thung du dang / de nas rnam par bcad pa dang / de nas rjes su nga ro dang / de nas a'a: yig ring po'o //
translated: Here, first the letter ha without vowel, then the short vowel a, then the visarga, then the anusvāra, and then the long vowel āḥ.

original: de ltar snga ma bzhin du rnam par bcad pa las /
analyzed: de ltar snga ma bzhin du rnam par bcad pa las /
translated: Thus, as before, from the visarga

original: au yig dang snga ma'i dbyangs kyi yon tan te /
analyzed: au yig dang snga ma'i dbyangs kyi yon tan te /
translated: the letter u and the vowel of the previous [letter] are the quality.

original: ha yig dang yang dag par sbyar zhing phyi ma'i aa yig dang ma yig dag dbyi'o //
analyzed: ha yig dang yang dag par sbyar zhing phyi ma'i aa yig dang ma yig dag dbyi'o //
translated: It is joined with the letter ha and the following a and ma are dropped.

original: de ltar na yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid ho yig ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid ho yig ste /
translated: Thus, the essence of the three qualities is the letter ho.

original: ha aa au zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ha aa au zhes brjod do //
translated: It is stated as ha a u.

original: de ltar ye shes rdo rje la yon tan gsum ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ye shes rdo rje la yon tan gsum ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the vajra of wisdom the three qualities are ignorance, formation, and consciousness.

original: sku rdo rje la ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang reg pa'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang reg pa'o //
translated: In the vajra of body, name and form, the six sense bases, and contact.

original: gsung rdo rje la tshor ba dang / sred pa dang len pa'o //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje la tshor ba dang / sred pa dang len pa'o //
translated: The vajra of speech has feeling, craving, and grasping.

original: thugs rdo rje la srid pa dang / skye ba dang rga shi ste /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje la srid pa dang / skye ba dang rga shi ste /
translated: The vajra of mind has becoming, birth, and old age and death.

original: thig le'i gzugs kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: thig le'i gzugs kyi dbang gis so //
translated: This is by the power of the form of the drop.

original: de ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa skyed par byed pa mchog gi bde byed ye shes rdo rje dag ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa skyed par byed pa mchog gi bde byed ye shes rdo rje dag ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Thus, the four are the vajras of gnosis, which are the producers of ignorance and so forth, and which are the supreme bliss.

original: zhes pa ni sngags rnams kyi skye gnas te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags rnams kyi skye gnas te /
translated: This is the source of the mantras.

original: thams cad du rnam pa bcu gnyis pa sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes rdo rje'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad du rnam pa bcu gnyis pa sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes rdo rje'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Everywhere, the twelve aspects are the vajras of body, speech, mind, and gnosis.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //🔽da ni sngags kyi mtshan ma dgod pa gsungs pa 'dir thams cad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o // da ni sngags kyi mtshan ma dgod pa gsungs pa 'dir thams cad du /
translated: This is the rule of the Bhagavān.

original: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi nyi ma dang / zla ba'i gdan rnams la rags pa dang phra ba dang / gzhan gyi dbye bas dgod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi nyi ma dang / zla ba'i gdan rnams la rags pa dang phra ba dang / gzhan gyi dbye bas dgod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Now, the placement of the signs of the mantras is stated. Here, everywhere, on the seats of the sun and moon of the maṇḍala of colored particles, there are three types of placement by the divisions of coarse, subtle, and other.

original: de la gzhan gyi dbye ba ni sngags kyi sa bon dgod pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dbye ba ni sngags kyi sa bon dgod pa'o //
translated: There, the other division is the placement of the seed syllables of the mantras.

original: phra ba'i dbye ba ni sngags kyi sa bon yongs su gyur pa rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dgod pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba'i dbye ba ni sngags kyi sa bon yongs su gyur pa rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dgod pa'o //
translated: The subtle division is the placement of the insignia of the vajra, etc., which is the transformation of the mantra seed.

original: rags pa'i dbye ba ni rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa'i lha'i gzugs dgod pa'o //🔽@129a * // de ltar go rims ji lta bas sngags kyi sa bon dgod par byas pas /
analyzed: rags pa'i dbye ba ni rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa'i lha'i gzugs dgod pa'o // @129a * // de ltar go rims ji lta bas sngags kyi sa bon dgod par byas pas /
translated: The gross division is the placement of the form of the deity, which is the transformation of the insignia of the vajra, etc.

original: mtshan ma dgod pa la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dgod pa la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in accordance with the sequence, the mantra seed is placed, and the placement of the insignia, etc. should be understood.

original: zhes pa ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni nges pa ste /
translated: This is the rule.

original: des na 'dir gtso bo nyid kyis sngags kyis bon dgod pa gsungs so //
analyzed: des na 'dir gtso bo nyid kyis sngags kyis bon dgod pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, here the mantra seed is taught to be the principal one.

original: rgyal ba'i bdag po'i padma sna tshogs mdog la zhes pa ljang khu'i mdog la zla ba nyi ma me yi steng du h'um yig ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bdag po'i padma sna tshogs mdog la zhes pa ljang khu'i mdog la zla ba nyi ma me yi steng du h'um yig ste zhes pa ni /
translated: On the lotus of the Lord of Conquerors, of various colors, that is, on the green one, on the sun and moon and fire, the syllable hum.

original: 'dir gnam stong gi mthar 'dzin pa'i dus su zla ba dang nyi ma dang / sgra gcan rnams sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir gnam stong gi mthar 'dzin pa'i dus su zla ba dang nyi ma dang / sgra gcan rnams sbyor ba ste /
translated: Here, at the end of the full moon, the sun, moon, and Rahu are joined.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dang me yang dag par ldan pa de nyid dkyil 'khor gyi gdan no //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dang me yang dag par ldan pa de nyid dkyil 'khor gyi gdan no //
translated: The seat of the mandala is the union of the moon, sun, and fire.

original: nang du ni la la n'a dang ra sa na dang aa ba dh'u t'i dang / yang dag par ldan pa snying kha'i padma ste /
analyzed: nang du ni la la n'a dang ra sa na dang aa ba dh'u t'i dang / yang dag par ldan pa snying kha'i padma ste /
translated: Inside, the union of lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūtī is the heart lotus.

original: de'i lte bar zla ba nyi ma sgra gcan gyi steng du /
analyzed: de'i lte bar zla ba nyi ma sgra gcan gyi steng du /
translated: On top of the moon, sun, and Rāhu in its center,

original: h'um yig gis bon rdul tshon sngon pos bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: h'um yig gis bon rdul tshon sngon pos bri bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw the seed syllable hūṃ with blue dust.

original: yang na de yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje sngon po rtse gsum pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na de yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje sngon po rtse gsum pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should draw a blue three-pronged vajra that has transformed from that.

original: gsang ba'i rgyud kyi rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la 'jig rten gyi smod pa yongs su spang pa'i slang du lha'i gzugs ni bri bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i rgyud kyi rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la 'jig rten gyi smod pa yongs su spang pa'i slang du lha'i gzugs ni bri bar mi bya'o //
translated: In the secret-tantra-colored-powder mandala, one should not draw the form of the deity in order to completely abandon worldly contempt.

original: bdag po'i sa bon dgod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i sa bon dgod pa'o //
translated: One should place the seed syllable of the lord.

original: de nas padma'i 'dab ma la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas padma'i 'dab ma la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dgod par bya ste /
translated: Then, on the lotus petals, one should place the perfections such as generosity.

original: phyogs 'dab rnams la aa sogs stong pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs 'dab rnams la aa sogs stong pa zhes pa ni /
translated: On the petals in the directions, the emptinesses beginning with a.

original: shar gyi 'dab ma la aa lho'i 'dab ma la aa: byang du a'am /
analyzed: shar gyi 'dab ma la aa lho'i 'dab ma la aa: byang du a'am /
translated: On the petal in the east, A; on the petal in the south, AḤ; in the north, Aṃ;

original: nub tu a'a zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nub tu a'a zhes pa'o //
translated: in the west, Aḥ.

original: yang na mtshan ma rnams te /
analyzed: yang na mtshan ma rnams te /
translated: Or else, the symbols:

original: shar gyi 'dab ma la sbos kyi snod dang lhor mar me dang byang du lta bshos dang nub tu dung ngo //
analyzed: shar gyi 'dab ma la sbos kyi snod dang lhor mar me dang byang du lta bshos dang nub tu dung ngo //
translated: on the petal in the east, a vessel of incense; in the south, a lamp; in the north, a sacrificial cake; in the west, a conch.

original: 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa las mtshan ma gang zhig gang gi g-yas pa'i phyag mthil du 'gyur phyag rgya de ni chu skyes dag gis dman zhes gsungs pa'i phyir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i das pas phyag rgya rgod do //
analyzed: 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa las mtshan ma gang zhig gang gi g-yas pa'i phyag mthil du 'gyur phyag rgya de ni chu skyes dag gis dman zhes gsungs pa'i phyir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i das pas phyag rgya rgod do //
translated: Here, since it will be said in the explanation that “the symbol which is on the right palm of a given deity is the mudrā of that deity, inferior by one lotus,” the mudrā is inferior by one lotus.

original: de bzhin du phyogs bral 'dab ma la yang ha sogs stong pa rnam pa bzhi zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bral 'dab ma la yang ha sogs stong pa rnam pa bzhi zhes pa ni /
translated: Similarly, on the petals in the intermediate directions, the four voids beginning with H.

original: 'dir me ru ha bden bral du ha:dbang ldan du ham rlung du h'a'o //
analyzed: 'dir me ru ha bden bral du ha:dbang ldan du ham rlung du h'a'o //
translated: Here, in the southeast, HŪṀ; in the southwest, HḤ; in the northwest, HŪṀ; in the northeast, HĀ.

original: yang na nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po dang ser po'i rnga yab rnams bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po dang ser po'i rnga yab rnams bri bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should draw the yak-tails black, red, white, and yellow.

original: de nas phyogs bral 'di la phyi rol gyi zur bzhi rnams su grangs bzhin du dbang ldan du sku rdo rje aom yig gam chos kyi dung ngo //
analyzed: de nas phyogs bral 'di la phyi rol gyi zur bzhi rnams su grangs bzhin du dbang ldan du sku rdo rje aom yig gam chos kyi dung ngo //
translated: Then, in this [mandala] without divisions, in the four outer corners, one should draw, in order, in the northeast, the Body-vajra, the syllable OṂ, or the Dharma conch;

original: bden bral gyi zur du gsung rdo rje @129b a'a: 'am chos kyi gandi'o //
analyzed: bden bral gyi zur du gsung rdo rje @129b a'a: 'am chos kyi gandi'o //
translated: in the southeast, the Speech-vajra, the syllable ĀḤ, or the Dharma bell;

original: rtse mo can du thugs rdo rje hum ngam yid bzhin gyi nor bu'o //
analyzed: rtse mo can du thugs rdo rje hum ngam yid bzhin gyi nor bu'o //
translated: in the southwest, the Mind-vajra, the syllable HŪṂ, or the wish-fulfilling gem;

original: rlung du chags pa ste ye shes rdo rje ho'am dpag bsam gyi shing bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rlung du chags pa ste ye shes rdo rje ho'am dpag bsam gyi shing bri bar bya'o //
translated: and in the northwest, the Gnosis-vajra, the syllable HO, or the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: snying po'i padma la dgod pa'o //
analyzed: snying po'i padma la dgod pa'o //
translated: They are placed on the lotus of the center.

original: da ni 'phang ma gnyis pa la dgod pa gsungs pa 'dir 'phar ma gnyis pa la shar la sogs pa'i le tshe'i gnas brgyad po rnams su ste /🔽shar gyi lha'i padma'i gnas kyi byang dang lho ru hi h'i 'am bum pa gnyis so //
analyzed: da ni 'phang ma gnyis pa la dgod pa gsungs pa 'dir 'phar ma gnyis pa la shar la sogs pa'i le tshe'i gnas brgyad po rnams su ste / shar gyi lha'i padma'i gnas kyi byang dang lho ru hi h'i 'am bum pa gnyis so //
translated: Now, the placement on the second floor is stated: Here, on the second floor, in the eight places of the squares beginning with the east,🔽in the north and south of the place of the eastern deity's lotus, two HĪ HĪs or vases;

original: lho'i lha'i shar dang nub tu hri hr'i 'am bum pa dag go //
analyzed: lho'i lha'i shar dang nub tu hri hr'i 'am bum pa dag go //
translated: in the east and west of the place of the southern deity, two HRĪH HRĪHs or vases.

original: nub kyi lha'i lho dang byang du hli hl'i 'am bum pa dag go //🔽byang gi lha'i nub dang shar du hu h'u'am bum pa dag go //
analyzed: nub kyi lha'i lho dang byang du hli hl'i 'am bum pa dag go // byang gi lha'i nub dang shar du hu h'u'am bum pa dag go //
translated: In the south and north of the western deity are the two H and L, or vases.🔽In the west and east of the northern deity are the two H and U, or vases.

original: ham ha: ni shar dang nub kyi sgor 'byung ba la ste /
analyzed: ham ha: ni shar dang nub kyi sgor 'byung ba la ste /
translated: The H and H are in the east and west doors,

original: khro bo'i steng du steng 'og dag pas so //
analyzed: khro bo'i steng du steng 'og dag pas so //
translated: because they are above and below the wrathful ones.

original: hi yig la sogs bcu ru 'gyur te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: hi yig la sogs bcu ru 'gyur te zhes pa ni /
translated: The ten are the H and so forth.

original: bum pa'i sa bon dgod pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa'i sa bon dgod pa'o //
translated: This is the placement of the seed syllables of the vases.

original: de nas lha'i sa bon dgod pa ste /
analyzed: de nas lha'i sa bon dgod pa ste /
translated: Then, the placement of the seed syllables of the deities is as follows.

original: 'dir shar gyi chu skyes steng du nyi ma'i gdan la 'du byed kyi ai yig gam ral gri'o //🔽rtse mo can du padma la gnas te /
analyzed: 'dir shar gyi chu skyes steng du nyi ma'i gdan la 'du byed kyi ai yig gam ral gri'o // rtse mo can du padma la gnas te /
translated: Here, on the eastern lotus is the sun seat, upon which is the I of formation, or a sword.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa rlung gi khams kyi a'i yig ring po'am ral gri'am /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa rlung gi khams kyi a'i yig ring po'am ral gri'am /
translated: On the southern lotus is a moon seat, upon which is the long A of the wind element, or a sword,🔽or a blue lotus.

original: autpala'o // de bzhin du gshin rjer tshor ba'i ri yig gam rin po che'o //
analyzed: autpala'o // de bzhin du gshin rjer tshor ba'i ri yig gam rin po che'o //
translated: Similarly, in the south is the R of feeling, or a jewel.

original: bden bral du zla ba la me'i khams kyi r'i'am padma dmar po'o //
analyzed: bden bral du zla ba la me'i khams kyi r'i'am padma dmar po'o //
translated: In the west is the long I of the fire element, or a red lotus.

original: de bzhin du nor sbyin du 'du shes kyi au yig gam padma dkar po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nor sbyin du 'du shes kyi au yig gam padma dkar po'o //
translated: Likewise, in the northeast, the seed of the water element is the syllable ū or a white lotus.

original: dbang ldan du chu'i khams kyi a'u 'am autpala dkar po'o //🔽de bzhin du chu ru yang gzugs kyi li yig gam 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du chu'i khams kyi a'u 'am autpala dkar po'o // de bzhin du chu ru yang gzugs kyi li yig gam 'khor lo'o //
translated: In the northeast, the seed of the water element is the syllable ū or a white lotus.🔽In the southeast, the seed of the earth element is the syllable la or a wheel.🔽In the southwest, the seed of the fire element is the syllable ra or a red lotus.

original: rlung gi zur du sa'i khams kyi l'i 'am 'khor lo'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rlung gi zur du sa'i khams kyi l'i 'am 'khor lo'o zhes pa ni /
translated: In the northwest, the seed of the wind element is the syllable ya or a green sword.🔽In the northeast, the seed of the space element is the syllable ha or a white double-vajra.🔽In the center, the seed of the consciousness element is the syllable a or a five-pronged vajra.

original: phung po dang khams dgod pa ste /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dgod pa ste /
translated: This is the arrangement of the aggregates and elements.

original: nam mkha'i khams dang rnam par shes pa dag gcig pa nyid kyis mtshan ma ni lte ba la rdo rje'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams dang rnam par shes pa dag gcig pa nyid kyis mtshan ma ni lte ba la rdo rje'o //
translated: Since the space element and consciousness are the same, the sign is a vajra at the navel.

original: shar dang mer nag po dang lho dang lha min du dmar po dang byang dang dbang ldan du dkar po dang / nub dang rlung du ser po ste /
analyzed: shar dang mer nag po dang lho dang lha min du dmar po dang byang dang dbang ldan du dkar po dang / nub dang rlung du ser po ste /
translated: In the east and south, black; in the south and southwest, red; in the west and northwest, white; and in the north and northeast, yellow.

original: rgyal ba'i zhal gyi dbye ba dag gis dgod par bya zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i zhal gyi dbye ba dag gis dgod par bya zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definite order of the faces of the Victor.

original: da ni 'phar ma gsum pa la dbang po drug dang / yul drug rnam par dag pa lha dang lha mo rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni 'phar ma gsum pa la dbang po drug dang / yul drug rnam par dag pa lha dang lha mo rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te /
translated: Now, in the third platform, the seed syllables of the gods and goddesses, which are the purities of the six sense faculties and the six sense objects, are stated.

original: 'dir shar gyi sgo'i lhor padma'i steng @130a * //🔽du gnas pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la sna'i ae yig go //
analyzed: 'dir shar gyi sgo'i lhor padma'i steng @130a * // du gnas pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la sna'i ae yig go //
translated: Here, in the south of the eastern door, on a lotus and sun disk seat, is the letter E of smell.🔽In the southeast, on a lotus and sun disk seat, is the letter AI of touch.

original: me yi padma la gnas te me'i zur du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la reg bya rdo rje ma'i aee yig go //
analyzed: me yi padma la gnas te me'i zur du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la reg bya rdo rje ma'i aee yig go //
translated: In the southwest, on a lotus and moon disk seat, is the letter AI of touch-vajra.

original: de bzhin du lho'i sgo'i nub tu mig gi aar yig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho'i sgo'i nub tu mig gi aar yig go //
translated: In the same way, in the west of the southern door, is the letter AR of the eye.

original: de bzhin du bden bral du ro rdo rje ma'i aar yig go zhes pa ste zung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du bden bral du ro rdo rje ma'i aar yig go zhes pa ste zung ngo //
translated: In the same way, in the southwest, is the letter AR of taste-vajra.

original: de bzhin du nub tu lus kyi dbang po'i aa la yig dang / rlung du dri rdo rje ma'i a'a la yig dang gnod sbyin du lce'i ao dang drag por gzugs rdo rje ma'i aoo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nub tu lus kyi dbang po'i aa la yig dang / rlung du dri rdo rje ma'i a'a la yig dang gnod sbyin du lce'i ao dang drag por gzugs rdo rje ma'i aoo'o //
translated: In the same way, in the west, is the letter AL of the body sense faculty; in the northwest, is the letter AL of smell-vajra; in the northeast, is the letter O of the tongue; and in the north, is the letter AU of form-vajra.

original: lha chu gshin rje'i gnod sbyin dang bcas sgo yi g-yon du ni zhes pa la /
analyzed: lha chu gshin rje'i gnod sbyin dang bcas sgo yi g-yon du ni zhes pa la /
translated: In the left corner of the door of the yakshas, together with the lord of death,

original: 'dir shar gyi sgo'i byang du nyi ma'i steng du yid kyi dbang po'i aam ngo //
analyzed: 'dir shar gyi sgo'i byang du nyi ma'i steng du yid kyi dbang po'i aam ngo //
translated: Here, in the north of the eastern door, on a sun disk seat, is the letter AM of the mind sense faculty.

original: chu'i sgo'i lhor zla ba la chos kyi khams kyi a'a yig go //
analyzed: chu'i sgo'i lhor zla ba la chos kyi khams kyi a'a yig go //
translated: In the south of the water door, on a moon disk seat, is the letter A of the phenomena element.

original: gshin rje zhes pa lho'i sgo'i shar du nyi ma la rna ba'i dbang po'i aa yig go //
analyzed: gshin rje zhes pa lho'i sgo'i shar du nyi ma la rna ba'i dbang po'i aa yig go //
translated: Yama is the a of the organ of hearing on the sun in the east of the southern gate.

original: thams cad du bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal bzhi'i dbye bas g-yon du'o //
analyzed: thams cad du bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal bzhi'i dbye bas g-yon du'o //
translated: In all cases, to the left is in terms of the division of the four faces of the Bhagavat.

original: gnod sbyin du byang gi sgo'i nub tu sgra rdo rje ma'i a'a: yig go //
analyzed: gnod sbyin du byang gi sgo'i nub tu sgra rdo rje ma'i a'a: yig go //
translated: Yaksa is the a of the sound-vajra woman on the sun in the west of the northern gate.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis kyis bon dgod pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis kyis bon dgod pa'o //
translated: This is the arrangement of the seed syllables of the twelve sense bases.

original: da ni sgo skyong gi sa bon dgod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni sgo skyong gi sa bon dgod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the arrangement of the seed syllables of the gate protectors is stated:

original: rim pa yis ni slar yang ya wa la lha sogs sgo yi padma la ste /
analyzed: rim pa yis ni slar yang ya wa la lha sogs sgo yi padma la ste /
translated: Again, ya va la, etc., on the lotus of the gates, in order.

original: 'dir shar gyi sgor nyi ma'am zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ngag gi dbang po'i ya yig dang lhor nyi ma la lag pa'i dbang po'i ra yig dang byang du rkang pa'i dbang po'i wa yig dang / nub tu bshang lam gyi dbang po'i la yig go zhes pa ste dgod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir shar gyi sgor nyi ma'am zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ngag gi dbang po'i ya yig dang lhor nyi ma la lag pa'i dbang po'i ra yig dang byang du rkang pa'i dbang po'i wa yig dang / nub tu bshang lam gyi dbang po'i la yig go zhes pa ste dgod pa'o //
translated: Here, the a of the organ of speech is on the sun or moon mandala in the east, the ra of the organ of the hand is on the sun in the south, the va of the organ of the foot is in the north, and the la of the organ of the anus is in the west. This is the arrangement.

original: da ni zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan gyi nges pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan gyi nges pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, the determination of the moon and sun seats is stated:

original: 'dir shar gyi sgo dang byang gi sgor ni ri bong 'dzin pa dag kyang khro bo dag gi gdan du 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir shar gyi sgo dang byang gi sgor ni ri bong 'dzin pa dag kyang khro bo dag gi gdan du 'gyur pa ste /
translated: Here, in the eastern and northern doors, the moon is also the seat of the wrathful ones.

original: zhes pa ni kyang yig gis yang na nyi ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kyang yig gis yang na nyi ma'o //
translated: The word “also” indicates that the sun is also [their seat].

original: lho dang nub tu yang nyi mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lho dang nub tu yang nyi mar 'gyur te /
translated: In the south and west, the sun is also [their seat].

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi yan lag gi dbye bas so //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi yan lag gi dbye bas so //
translated: This is because of the division of the branches of wisdom and means.

original: yang na rang rang gi padma rnams la thabs kyi gdan nyi ma dang shes rab kyi gdan zla ba'o /
analyzed: yang na rang rang gi padma rnams la thabs kyi gdan nyi ma dang shes rab kyi gdan zla ba'o /
translated: Or else, on their respective lotuses, the seat of means is the sun and the seat of wisdom is the moon.

original: de nas shar dang me'i lha rnams kyi ral gri dang / lho dang bden bral gyi rnams kyi rin po che dang byang dang dbang ldan gyi rnams kyi padma dang nub dang rlung gi rnams kyi 'khor lo dang / steng dang 'og gi lha rnams kyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nas shar dang me'i lha rnams kyi ral gri dang / lho dang bden bral gyi rnams kyi rin po che dang byang dang dbang ldan gyi rnams kyi padma dang nub dang rlung gi rnams kyi 'khor lo dang / steng dang 'og gi lha rnams kyi rdo rje'o //
translated: Then, the swords of the deities of the east and southeast, the jewels of the deities of the south and southwest, the lotuses of the deities of the west and northwest, the wheels of the deities of the north and northeast, and the vajras of the upper and lower deities.

original: yang na yul gyi dbye bas te /
analyzed: yang na yul gyi dbye bas te /
translated: Or else, it is by the division of the directions.

original: sgra'i rgyud mangs dang reg @130b bya'i gos dang gzugs kyi me long dang ro'i snod dang / ri'i dung dang chos kyi khams kyi chos 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgra'i rgyud mangs dang reg @130b bya'i gos dang gzugs kyi me long dang ro'i snod dang / ri'i dung dang chos kyi khams kyi chos 'byung ngo //
translated: The sound of the lute, the cloth to be touched, the mirror of form, the vessel of taste, the conch of smell, and the phenomena element of phenomena.

original: de bzhin du ngag gi dbang po'i ral gri dang lag pa'i dbang po'i dbyug pa dang / rkang pa'i dbang po'i padma dang bshang lam gyi dbang po'i thob ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag gi dbang po'i ral gri dang lag pa'i dbang po'i dbyug pa dang / rkang pa'i dbang po'i padma dang bshang lam gyi dbang po'i thob ste /
translated: Likewise, the sword of the speech faculty, the club of the hand faculty, the lotus of the foot faculty, and the threshold of the anus faculty.

original: snying po'i dkyil 'khor la mtshan ma dgod pa'o //
analyzed: snying po'i dkyil 'khor la mtshan ma dgod pa'o //
translated: The signs are placed in the mandala of the heart.

original: da ni thig le'i rnam pa dag gis zhes pa la sogs pas padma'i sa bon rnams gsungs pa 'dir padma nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyi rtsa ba la sogs pa rnams la ka la sogs pa'i sde pa'i yi ge rnams thig le la sogs pas phye ba
analyzed: da ni thig le'i rnam pa dag gis zhes pa la sogs pas padma'i sa bon rnams gsungs pa 'dir padma nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyi rtsa ba la sogs pa rnams la ka la sogs pa'i sde pa'i yi ge rnams thig le la sogs pas phye ba
translated: Now, beginning with “the pure aspects of the bindu,” the seed syllables of the lotus are explained. Here, the syllables of the ka group are divided by the bindu and so on in the roots and so on of the twenty-four lotuses.

original: ni aam aa:aa a'a zhes pa 'di dag gis phye ba lha'i rigs kyi dbang gis sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: ni aam aa:aa a'a zhes pa 'di dag gis phye ba lha'i rigs kyi dbang gis sbyin par bya ste /
translated: The divisions are Am, Ah, A, and A. These are to be applied according to the family of the deity.

original: rna ba'i padma'i rtsa ba la kam sdong bu la kham 'dab ma la gam ge sar la gham lte ba la ngam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i padma'i rtsa ba la kam sdong bu la kham 'dab ma la gam ge sar la gham lte ba la ngam zhes pa'o //
translated: On the root of the ear lotus is kam, on the stalk is kham, on the petals is gam, on the anthers is gham, and on the center is ngam.

original: chos kyi khams kyi k'a kh'a g'a gh'a d'a zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi k'a kh'a g'a gh'a d'a zhes pa'o //
translated: In the phenomena element are ka, kha, ga, gha, and da.

original: yid kyi dbang po'i sam nytham sham thgam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po'i sam nytham sham thgam zhes pa'o //
translated: In the mental faculty are sam, nyam, sham, tham, and nam.

original: sgra'i sa: wam:sha:thka:zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sgra'i sa: wam:sha:thka:zhes pa ste /
translated: In sound are sa, va, sha, tha, and ka.

original: yi ge lnga po 'di rnams yongs su gyur pa las padma'o //
analyzed: yi ge lnga po 'di rnams yongs su gyur pa las padma'o //
translated: These five syllables transform into a lotus.

original: 'du byed kyi padma la tsa tsha dza dzha nya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi padma la tsa tsha dza dzha nya zhes pa'o //
translated: In the lotus of mental formations are ca, cha, ja, jha, and nya.

original: de bzhin du sna'i tsam tsham dzam dznyam nyam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sna'i tsam tsham dzam dznyam nyam zhes pa'o //
translated: Similarly, in the nose are cam, cham, jam, jham, and nam.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi khams kyi ts'a tsh'a dz'a dzh'a ny'a zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi khams kyi ts'a tsh'a dz'a dzh'a ny'a zhes pa'o //
translated: Similarly, in the wind element are ca, cha, ja, jha, and nya.

original: reg bya'i tsa:tsha:dza:dzha: zhes pa'o //
analyzed: reg bya'i tsa:tsha:dza:dzha: zhes pa'o //
translated: In the tactile sense are ca, cha, ja, jha, and nya.

original: tshor ba'i ta tha da dha na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i ta tha da dha na zhes pa'o //
translated: In feeling are ta, tha, da, dha, and na.

original: mig gi tam tham dam dham nam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi tam tham dam dham nam zhes pa'o //
translated: In the eye are tam, tham, dam, dham, and nam.

original: me'i khams kyi t'a th'a d'a dh'a n'a zhes pa'o //
analyzed: me'i khams kyi t'a th'a d'a dh'a n'a zhes pa'o //
translated: In the fire element are ta, tha, da, dha, and na.

original: ro rdo rje ma'i ta:tha:da:na:zhes pa'o //🔽'du shes kyi pa pha ba bha ma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ro rdo rje ma'i ta:tha:da:na:zhes pa'o // 'du shes kyi pa pha ba bha ma zhes pa'o //
translated: The syllable of the Vajra of Taste is ta, tha, da, dha, na.🔽The syllable of the perception aggregate is bha, bha, ma, bha, ma.

original: lce'i pam pham bam bham mam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lce'i pam pham bam bham mam zhes pa'o //
translated: The syllable of the tongue sense base is pa, pha, ba, bha, ma.

original: chu'i khams kyi p'a ph'a b'a bh'a m'a zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi p'a ph'a b'a bh'a m'a zhes pa'o //
translated: The syllable of the water element is ā, ā, ō, ō, au.

original: gzugs rdo rje ma'i pa:pha:ba:bha:ma:zhes pa'o //🔽gzugs kyi ta tha da dha na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma'i pa:pha:ba:bha:ma:zhes pa'o // gzugs kyi ta tha da dha na zhes pa'o //
translated: The syllable of the Vajra of Form is pa, pha, ba, bha, ma.🔽The syllable of the form aggregate is ta, tha, da, dha, na.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i tam tham dam dham nam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i tam tham dam dham nam zhes pa'o //
translated: The syllable of the body sense base is ta, tha, da, dha, na.

original: sa'i khams kyi t'a th'a d'a dh'a n'a zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i khams kyi t'a th'a d'a dh'a n'a zhes pa'o //
translated: The syllable of the earth element is ā, ā, ō, ō, au.

original: dri'i ta:tha:da:dha:na:zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dri'i ta:tha:da:dha:na:zhes pa'o //
translated: The syllable of the smell sense base is ta, tha, da, dha, na.

original: de bzhin du tsa tsha dza dzha nya ngag gi dbang po dang / ta tha da dha na lag pa'i dbang po dang / pa pha ba bha ma rkang pa'i dbang po dang / ta tha da dha na bshang lam gyi dbang po'i padma la rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tsa tsha dza dzha nya ngag gi dbang po dang / ta tha da dha na lag pa'i dbang po dang / pa pha ba bha ma rkang pa'i dbang po dang / ta tha da dha na bshang lam gyi dbang po'i padma la rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the syllable of the speech sense base is ca, cha, ja, jha, ña; the syllable of the hand sense base is ta, tha, da, dha, na; the syllable of the foot sense base is pa, pha, ba, bha, ma; and the syllable of the anus sense base is ta, tha, da, dha, na.

original: padma'i sa bon dgod pa ste /
analyzed: padma'i sa bon dgod pa ste /
translated: This is the placement of the lotus seed syllables.

original: thung du ring po rang gi sa la'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: thung du ring po rang gi sa la'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment.

original: de bzhin du thig le'am aa yig gam /
analyzed: de bzhin du thig le'am aa yig gam /
translated: Similarly, with the drop, the letter A,

original: ha yig gis zla ba'i @131a * //
analyzed: ha yig gis zla ba'i @131a * //
translated: or the letter Ha, the moon seats,

original: gdan rnams dang / rnam par bcad pa'am ra yig gam ksha yig gis nyi ma'i gdan rnams te lte ba'i steng du'o //🔽bdag po'i padma la s'om nyp'om sh'om sh'om thk'om zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gdan rnams dang / rnam par bcad pa'am ra yig gam ksha yig gis nyi ma'i gdan rnams te lte ba'i steng du'o // bdag po'i padma la s'om nyp'om sh'om sh'om thk'om zhes pa'o //
translated: and with the exclusion, the letter Ra, or the letter KṢa, the sun seats, above the navel.🔽On the lord’s lotus, the earth, water, fire, air, space, and wisdom seats.

original: lte ba'i steng du aom a'a:aa ste zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan gyi gdan rnams so //
analyzed: lte ba'i steng du aom a'a:aa ste zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan gyi gdan rnams so //
translated: Above the navel, Oṃ, Aḥ, A, are the moon, sun, and Rāhu seats.

original: zhes pa ni dgod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dgod pa'o //
translated: This is the arrangement.

original: da ni sde drug ces pa la sogs pas mchod pa'i lha mo rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sde drug ces pa la sogs pas mchod pa'i lha mo rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te /
translated: Now, with “The six clans,” he states the seed syllables of the offering goddesses.

original: 'dir thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi shar gyi stegs bu la rta babs kyi ka ba'i byang du dri ma'i tstshdzdzhnya dang lhor phreng ba ma'i tstshdzdzhny'a'o //
analyzed: 'dir thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi shar gyi stegs bu la rta babs kyi ka ba'i byang du dri ma'i tstshdzdzhnya dang lhor phreng ba ma'i tstshdzdzhny'a'o //
translated: Here, on the eastern platform of the mind mandala, to the north of the gate’s pillar is the scent-goddess’s TṢa Ṭa Ḍa Dha Na, and to the south is the garland-goddess’s TṢa Ṭa Ḍa Dha Na.

original: de bzhin du lhor spos ma'i tthddhna dang mar me ma'i tthddhn'a'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhor spos ma'i tthddhna dang mar me ma'i tthddhn'a'o //
translated: Similarly, to the south are the incense-goddess’s TṬha Ḍ̣ḍha Ṇ̣ha Na and the lamp-goddess’s TṬha Ḍ̣ḍha Ṇ̣ha Na.

original: nub tu sgeg mo'i tthddhna dang bzhad ma'i tthddhn'a'o //
analyzed: nub tu sgeg mo'i tthddhna dang bzhad ma'i tthddhn'a'o //
translated: In the west, the seal of the goddess Lāsya is THTADHN, and the seal of the goddess Hāsyā is THTADHN.

original: byang du bdud rtsi ma'i pphbbhma dang 'bras bu ma nyams ma'i pphbbhm'a'o //
analyzed: byang du bdud rtsi ma'i pphbbhma dang 'bras bu ma nyams ma'i pphbbhm'a'o //
translated: In the north, the seal of the goddess Amṛtā is PPHABH, and the seal of the goddess Phala is PPHABH.

original: shar gyi sgo'i rta babs kyi steng du gar ma'i kkhgghnga dang nub kyi sgo'i rta babs kyi steng du sil snyan ma'i kkhgghng'a'o //
analyzed: shar gyi sgo'i rta babs kyi steng du gar ma'i kkhgghnga dang nub kyi sgo'i rta babs kyi steng du sil snyan ma'i kkhgghng'a'o //
translated: On the pediments of the eastern gate, the seal of the goddess Nṛtya is KKHAGHGHAṄ, and on the pediments of the western gate, the seal of the goddess Gītā is KKHAGHGHAṄ.

original: byang gi sgo'i rta babs kyi steng du glu ma'i swpshshthka dang lho'i sgo'i rta babs kyi steng du 'dod ma'i snypshshthk'a'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgo'i rta babs kyi steng du glu ma'i swpshshthka dang lho'i sgo'i rta babs kyi steng du 'dod ma'i snypshshthk'a'o //
translated: On the pediments of the northern gate, the seal of the goddess Vādya is SVAPŚAŚAṬHA, and on the pediments of the southern gate, the seal of the goddess Dhūpā is SNYAPŚAŚAṬHA.

original: yang na mtshan ma rnams te /
analyzed: yang na mtshan ma rnams te /
translated: Alternatively, the signs are

original: dung dang phreng ba dang / spos snod dang mar me dang dbu rgyan dang do shal dang 'bras bu dang snod dang gos dang rda dang rdo rje dang padma rnams shar gyi cha la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: dung dang phreng ba dang / spos snod dang mar me dang dbu rgyan dang do shal dang 'bras bu dang snod dang gos dang rda dang rdo rje dang padma rnams shar gyi cha la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: the conch, garland, incense holder, lamp, crown, necklace, fruit, vessel, cloth, sword, vajra, and lotus, which should be applied in the eastern direction and so forth. This is the rule.

original: da ni phyi rol du zhes pa la sogs pas 'dod ma sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyi sa bon gsungs pa 'dir phyi rol du gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi stegs bu la ste shar gyi sgo'i lho'i stegs bu la tsa:tsha:dza:dzha:nya:/
analyzed: da ni phyi rol du zhes pa la sogs pas 'dod ma sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyi sa bon gsungs pa 'dir phyi rol du gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi stegs bu la ste shar gyi sgo'i lho'i stegs bu la tsa:tsha:dza:dzha:nya:/
translated: Now, “outside” and so forth teaches the seed syllables of the thirty-six desire goddesses. Here, on the platform of the maṇḍala of speech, that is, on the platform of the southern door of the east, is ca, cha, ja, jha, ña,🔽ta, tha, da, dha, na in the south,

original: lho ru ta:tha:da:dha:na:/ nub tu ta:tha: da:dha:na:/
analyzed: lho ru ta:tha:da:dha:na:/ nub tu ta:tha: da:dha:na:/
translated: ta, tha, da, dha, na in the west,🔽pa, pha, ba, bha, ma in the north,

original: byang du pa:pha:ba:bha:ma:/ shar gyi sgo'i byang du sa: wa: sha: sha: thka:/
analyzed: byang du pa:pha:ba:bha:ma:/ shar gyi sgo'i byang du sa: wa: sha: sha: thka:/
translated: sa, śa, ṣa, sa, ha, and saka in the north of the eastern door,

original: byang gi sgo'i nub tu la:wa:ra:ya:ha:/
analyzed: byang gi sgo'i nub tu la:wa:ra:ya:ha:/
translated: la, va, ra, ya, and ha in the west of the northern door,

original: lho'i sgo'i shar gyi stegs bu la ka:kha:ga: gha:nga:/
analyzed: lho'i sgo'i shar gyi stegs bu la ka:kha:ga: gha:nga:/
translated: ka, kha, ga, gha, ṅa on the platform of the east of the southern door,

original: nub kyi sgo'i lhor ksha:zhes pa ste gsung gi dkyil 'khor la'o //
analyzed: nub kyi sgo'i lhor ksha:zhes pa ste gsung gi dkyil 'khor la'o //
translated: and kṣa in the south of the western door.

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge 'di rnams thig le dang bcas pa ste tsa yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyis phyir 'dod ma rnams kyi sa bon nam mtshan ma'am gzugs bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge 'di rnams thig le dang bcas pa ste tsa yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyis phyir 'dod ma rnams kyi sa bon nam mtshan ma'am gzugs bri bar bya'o //
translated: On the maṇḍala of the body, these syllables are endowed with bindus. The seed syllables, or signs, or forms of the external desire goddesses are drawn with the syllables ca and so on.

original: snying @131b po'i stegs bu la mchod pa'i lha mo du ma ste gzungs ma mtha' dag bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: snying @131b po'i stegs bu la mchod pa'i lha mo du ma ste gzungs ma mtha' dag bri bar bya'o //
translated: On the platform of the center, one should draw many offering goddesses, all the consorts.

original: gzungs ma dang 'dod ma'i sa bon dgod pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs ma dang 'dod ma'i sa bon dgod pa'o //
translated: The seed syllables of the consorts and the desire goddesses are placed.

original: de ltar 'dod ma thams cad kun nas rang rig phyogs su gnas te rgyal ba rnams kyi kha dog dbye bas kha dog rig par bya ste kha dog lnga'i rdul tshon gyis zhes pa ni thams cad du des pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod ma thams cad kun nas rang rig phyogs su gnas te rgyal ba rnams kyi kha dog dbye bas kha dog rig par bya ste kha dog lnga'i rdul tshon gyis zhes pa ni thams cad du des pa'o //
translated: Thus, all the desire goddesses are situated in the direction of one's own awareness. The colors should be known by the colors of the victors. The phrase with five-colored powders is to be applied everywhere.

original: da ni thung zhes pa la sogs pas gsung gi dkyil 'khor la tsartsi k'a la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni thung zhes pa la sogs pas gsung gi dkyil 'khor la tsartsi k'a la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te /
translated: Now, the seed syllables of Cācīkā and so forth in the speech maṇḍala are stated beginning with short i and so forth.

original: 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sgrub thabs kyi le'u las tsartsi k'a'i gdan yi dags ni padma de'i steng du'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sgrub thabs kyi le'u las tsartsi k'a'i gdan yi dags ni padma de'i steng du'o //
translated: Here, the seat of Cācīkā in the chapter on the sādhana that will be explained is a ghost on a lotus, above that.

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa de nyid rdul tshon gyis bri bar bya ste padma yang kha dog dmar po'o //
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa de nyid rdul tshon gyis bri bar bya ste padma yang kha dog dmar po'o //
translated: That eight-petaled lotus should be drawn with colored powders, and the lotus is also red.

original: de nas thung ring ha yig dag ni zhes pa ni lhar padma'i lte ba la tsartsi k'a'i ha'o //🔽nor sbyin du padma'i lte ba la khyu mchog gi steng du drag mo'i ham ngo //
analyzed: de nas thung ring ha yig dag ni zhes pa ni lhar padma'i lte ba la tsartsi k'a'i ha'o // nor sbyin du padma'i lte ba la khyu mchog gi steng du drag mo'i ham ngo //
translated: Then, the short and long ha syllables are in the directions, in the center of the lotuses.🔽In the east, in the center of the lotus, is the ha of Cārśī.

original: lhor ma he'i steng du phag mo'i ha:'o //
analyzed: lhor ma he'i steng du phag mo'i ha:'o //
translated: In the south, in the center of the lotus, on top of a bull, is the hā of Raudrı̄.🔽In the west, on top of an elephant, is the ha of Vāsinı̄.

original: nub tu glang po che'i steng du dbang mo'i h'a'o zhes pa ste phyogs su tsartsi k'a sogs rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nub tu glang po che'i steng du dbang mo'i h'a'o zhes pa ste phyogs su tsartsi k'a sogs rnams kyi'o //
translated: In the north, on top of a water buffalo, is the ha of Varāhi.🔽The kṣa syllables of Viṣṇu and so forth are in the intermediate directions, in the center of the lotuses.

original: khyab 'jug ma sogs rnams kyi ksha yig ni de bzhin du me'i zur du padma'i lte ba la mkha' lding gi steng du ksha'o //
analyzed: khyab 'jug ma sogs rnams kyi ksha yig ni de bzhin du me'i zur du padma'i lte ba la mkha' lding gi steng du ksha'o //
translated: In the southeast, on top of a garuḍa, is the kṣa.

original: de bzhin du 'phrog byed du seng ge'i steng du dpal chen mo'i kshom ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phrog byed du seng ge'i steng du dpal chen mo'i kshom ngo //
translated: In the southwest, on top of a lion, is the kṣa of Śrīmahādevī.

original: rlung du dang pa'i steng du tshangs ma'i ksha'o //
analyzed: rlung du dang pa'i steng du tshangs ma'i ksha'o //
translated: In the northwest, on top of a swan, is the kṣa of Brahmāṇī.

original: bden bral du padma'i lte ba la rma bya'i steng du gzhon nu ma'i ksha:'o //
analyzed: bden bral du padma'i lte ba la rma bya'i steng du gzhon nu ma'i ksha:'o //
translated: In the northeast, in the center of the lotus, on top of a peacock, is the kṣa of Kumārī.

original: 'di rnams la zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan med pa ste tsartsi k'a la sogs pa'i dbye bas lha min du'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan med pa ste tsartsi k'a la sogs pa'i dbye bas lha min du'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: These are without seats of moon and sun.

original: da ni hi la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pas padma'i 'dab ma rnams la 'jigs ma la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te 'dir hi la sogs pas grangs brgyad do //
analyzed: da ni hi la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pas padma'i 'dab ma rnams la 'jigs ma la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te 'dir hi la sogs pas grangs brgyad do //
translated: Now, beginning with “hi,” he states the seed syllables of the sixty-four yoginīs, beginning with Bhaya, on the lotus petals. Here, “hi” and so on are the eight.

original: de la tsartsi k'a'i mdun gyi padma'i 'dab ma la 'jigs ma'i hi'o //
analyzed: de la tsartsi k'a'i mdun gyi padma'i 'dab ma la 'jigs ma'i hi'o //
translated: There, on the lotus petal in front of Caṇḍālī is Bhaya’s hi.

original: rgyab tu rlung shugs ma'i h'i'o //
analyzed: rgyab tu rlung shugs ma'i h'i'o //
translated: In the rear is Pūraṇā’s hi.

original: rang phyogs de rnams su ste shar gyi phyogs su ya sogs thung ba drug rnams so //
analyzed: rang phyogs de rnams su ste shar gyi phyogs su ya sogs thung ba drug rnams so //
translated: In those directions, in the east are the six short vowels beginning with ya.🔽Bhaya and so on are clockwise.

original: 'jigs ma la sogs pa g-yas skor gyis te de bzhin du 'jigs ma'i 'dab ma gnyis pa la drag mo'i ya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs ma la sogs pa g-yas skor gyis te de bzhin du 'jigs ma'i 'dab ma gnyis pa la drag mo'i ya'o //
translated: Thus, on the second petal of Bhaya is Raudrī’s ya.

original: gsum pa la dus kyi mche ba ma'i yi'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la dus kyi mche ba ma'i yi'o //
translated: On the third is Kālarātri’s i.

original: bzhi pa lam 'bar gdong ma'i yri'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa lam 'bar gdong ma'i yri'o //
translated: On the fourth is Jvālāvaktrā’s ṛ.

original: de nas @132a * //
analyzed: de nas @132a * //
translated: Then,

original: 'dab ma lnga pa la rlung gi shugs ma'i brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'dab ma lnga pa la rlung gi shugs ma'i brjod zin to //
translated: On the five-petaled one, the wind-speeding one, as already mentioned.

original: drug ba la rab gtum ma'i yu'o //
analyzed: drug ba la rab gtum ma'i yu'o //
translated: On the six-petaled one, the very fierce one, the ya.

original: bdun pa la drag mig ma'i yli'o //
analyzed: bdun pa la drag mig ma'i yli'o //
translated: On the seven-petaled one, the fierce-eyed one, the li.

original: brgyad pa la sna chen ma'i yam ngo //
analyzed: brgyad pa la sna chen ma'i yam ngo //
translated: On the eight-petaled one, the great-nosed one, the yam.

original: yang na lte ba la sogs pa la thams cad du tsartsi k'a la sogs pa rnams kyi gri gug gi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: yang na lte ba la sogs pa la thams cad du tsartsi k'a la sogs pa rnams kyi gri gug gi mtshan ma'o //
translated: Or else, at the navel and so forth, everywhere, the signs of the flaying knives of Cācī and so forth.

original: lha yi padma la ste shar gyi padma la dgod pa'o //
analyzed: lha yi padma la ste shar gyi padma la dgod pa'o //
translated: On the god's lotus, that is, on the eastern lotus, one should place.

original: 'dir me'i padma la sogs pa rnams la kshi la sogs ba grangs brgyad po ste de la khyab 'jug ma'i mdun du dbal mo'i kshi'o //
analyzed: 'dir me'i padma la sogs pa rnams la kshi la sogs ba grangs brgyad po ste de la khyab 'jug ma'i mdun du dbal mo'i kshi'o //
translated: Here, on the fire lotus and so forth, the eight of the kṣa and so forth. There, in front of Viṣṇu, the kṣa of Śrī.

original: rgyab tu mchog tu rnam par rgyal ma'i ksh'i'o //
analyzed: rgyab tu mchog tu rnam par rgyal ma'i ksh'i'o //
translated: In back, the kṣa of Supreme Victory.

original: de bzhin du y'a la sogs pa ste sgyu 'phrul ma'i y'a'o //🔽grags ma'i y'i'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du y'a la sogs pa ste sgyu 'phrul ma'i y'a'o // grags ma'i y'i'o //
translated: Likewise, the ya and so forth. There, the ya of Māyā.🔽The yi of Yaśodharā.

original: dpal mo'i yr'i'o //
analyzed: dpal mo'i yr'i'o //
translated: The ṛ of Śrī.

original: 'dab ma drug pa la rgyal ma'i y'u'o //

analyzed: ro yi gdong pa dag gi zhes pa gdong drug gi ni ring po ste chu stod kyi zla ba'i tshes rnams la tsa sde ring po bzhin no //
translated: In the face of the dead, that is, in the face of the six, the long ones of the class of c, like the long ones of the class of c in the month of Śravaṇa.

original: lte ba la dr'i na:zhes pa ste thung du ring po'i rab dbye yis so //
analyzed: lte ba la dr'i na:zhes pa ste thung du ring po'i rab dbye yis so //
translated: At the navel, the short ones of the class of d, n, etc.

original: de bzhin du g-yon du zhes pa byang du rgya mtsho'i ba sde thung du ste gro bzhin @133b gyi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi bri bom mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon du zhes pa byang du rgya mtsho'i ba sde thung du ste gro bzhin @133b gyi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi bri bom mo //
translated: In the same way, to the left, that is, in the north, the short ones of the class of p, b, etc., of the ocean, on the days of the moon of the month of Aśvayuja.

original: dbang ldan du ring po'i dbye bas tshogs kyi zhes pa log 'dren gyi ste lte ba la khrums kyi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi br'i ma:'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du ring po'i dbye bas tshogs kyi zhes pa log 'dren gyi ste lte ba la khrums kyi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi br'i ma:'o //
translated: In the northeast, the long ones of the class of s, etc., of the host, that is, of the evil spirits, at the navel, on the days of the moon of the month of Kārttika.

original: de bzhin du chur brgya byin gyi ta sde thung dun la sogs pa ste lte ba la tha skar gyi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi dri tom mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du chur brgya byin gyi ta sde thung dun la sogs pa ste lte ba la tha skar gyi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi dri tom mo //
translated: Likewise, in the water, Indra's ta, short du, and so on. The center is the gri of the new moon and full moon of the month of Ashadha.

original: de bzhin du rlung du tshangs pa'i t'a la sogs pa ste lte ba la smin drug gi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi dr'i na:'o //🔽de bzhin du shar gyi sgo'i g-yon du padma'i 'dab ma la lha min dgra yi zhes pa khyab 'jug gi ka ste thung du nga la sogs pa ste lte ba la mchu yi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi gri kom mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung du tshangs pa'i t'a la sogs pa ste lte ba la smin drug gi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi dr'i na:'o // de bzhin du shar gyi sgo'i g-yon du padma'i 'dab ma la lha min dgra yi zhes pa khyab 'jug gi ka ste thung du nga la sogs pa ste lte ba la mchu yi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi gri kom mo //
translated: Likewise, in the wind, Brahma's ta, and so on. The center is the na of the new moon and full moon of the month of Bhadrapada.🔽Likewise, to the left of the eastern door, on the lotus petal, is the asura enemy's, that is, Vishnu's, short ka, nga, and so on. The center is the ko of the new moon and full moon of the month of Asvayuja.

original: lho ru zhes pa lho'i sgo'i shar du gshin rje dag gi ring po k'a la sogs pa ste lte ba la dbo'i zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi gr'i nga:'o //
analyzed: lho ru zhes pa lho'i sgo'i shar du gshin rje dag gi ring po k'a la sogs pa ste lte ba la dbo'i zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi gr'i nga:'o //
translated: In the south, that is, to the east of the southern door, is Yama's long ka, and so on. The center is the ga of the new moon and full moon of the month of Kartika.

original: de nas byang du zhes pa byang gi sgo'i nub tu phyugs bdag gis sde thung du thka la sogs pa ste lte ba la mgo'i zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi shri sam mo //
analyzed: de nas byang du zhes pa byang gi sgo'i nub tu phyugs bdag gis sde thung du thka la sogs pa ste lte ba la mgo'i zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi shri sam mo //
translated: Then in the north means in the west of the northern gate, the lord of cattle, Takshaka, and so on. In the center, on the full moon and new moon of the head month, it is Shri Sam.

original: de bzhin du nub kyi sgo'i lhor padma'i 'dab ma rnams la gnod sbyin gyi ring po s'a la sogs pa ste lte ba la rgyal gyi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi shr'i thka:zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nub kyi sgo'i lhor padma'i 'dab ma rnams la gnod sbyin gyi ring po s'a la sogs pa ste lte ba la rgyal gyi zla ba'i nya dang gnam stong dag gi shr'i thka:zhes pa'o //
translated: Similarly, in the south of the western gate, on the lotus petals, the yaksha, Sala, and so on. In the center, on the full moon and new moon of the victorious month, it is Shri Tak.

original: de ltar dpyid dang sog dang dbyar dang ston dang dgun smad dang dgun stod kyi dus kyi dbye bas rlung dang me dang chu dang sa dang nam mkha' dang ye shes kyi khams rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar dpyid dang sog dang dbyar dang ston dang dgun smad dang dgun stod kyi dus kyi dbye bas rlung dang me dang chu dang sa dang nam mkha' dang ye shes kyi khams rnams so //
translated: Thus, by the divisions of spring, summer, rainy season, autumn, late winter, and early winter, there are the elements of wind, fire, water, earth, space, and wisdom.

original: chos kyi dbye bas dkyil 'khor lnga la drug drug gi dbye bas sku'i dkyil 'khor la sa bon dgod pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbye bas dkyil 'khor lnga la drug drug gi dbye bas sku'i dkyil 'khor la sa bon dgod pa'o //
translated: By the division of phenomena, in the five mandalas, by the division of six by six, the seed syllables are placed in the mandala of the body.

original: yang na gtso bo'i mtshan ma'i rab tu dbye bas 'dab ma thams cad la mtshan ma rnams te 'dir lte ba la bden bral la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma ni rim pas ral gri dang ljon shing dang shag ti dang / mdung dang zhags pa dang dgra sta dang rdo rje dang khab dang 'khor lo dang dbyug pa dang /
analyzed: yang na gtso bo'i mtshan ma'i rab tu dbye bas 'dab ma thams cad la mtshan ma rnams te 'dir lte ba la bden bral la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma ni rim pas ral gri dang ljon shing dang shag ti dang / mdung dang zhags pa dang dgra sta dang rdo rje dang khab dang 'khor lo dang dbyug pa dang /
translated: Alternatively, the signs are on all the petals by the classification of the signs of the principal ones. Here, the signs of Nairṛtī and so on on the navel cakra are, respectively, a sword, a tree, a śakti, a spear, a noose, an axe, a vajra, a needle, a wheel, a club, a trident, and a mace.

original: rtse gsum dang be con no zhes pa mtshan ma dgod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rtse gsum dang be con no zhes pa mtshan ma dgod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for arranging the signs.

original: 'di lta ste lha min sogs kyi rang gi sa bon du 'gyur 'dab ma la min rang rang sde ba'i mtha' dang dbus //
analyzed: 'di lta ste lha min sogs kyi rang gi sa bon du 'gyur 'dab ma la min rang rang sde ba'i mtha' dang dbus //
translated: The individual seed syllables of the asuras and so on are not on the petals but on the outer and inner edges of their respective sections.

original: 'dab bzang nyi shu rtsa brgyad la yang nyen zhag dbang gis rang rang sde ba dag gi yi ge rnams zhes pa ste sku'i dkyil @134a * //
analyzed: 'dab bzang nyi shu rtsa brgyad la yang nyen zhag dbang gis rang rang sde ba dag gi yi ge rnams zhes pa ste sku'i dkyil @134a * //
translated: On the excellent twenty-eight petals, the syllables of the individual sections are arranged by the power of the lunar day.

original: 'khor la rdo rje'i tshes sum brgya drug cu dgod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor la rdo rje'i tshes sum brgya drug cu dgod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for arranging the three hundred and sixty vajra days on the body maṇḍala.

original: da ni y'a r'a zhes pa la sogs pas sgo skyong shing rta la gnas pa'i lha mo rnams dang / khro bo'i rgyal po rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te /🔽'dir shar gyi sgor 'od zer can gyi l'a:'o //
analyzed: da ni y'a r'a zhes pa la sogs pas sgo skyong shing rta la gnas pa'i lha mo rnams dang / khro bo'i rgyal po rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te / 'dir shar gyi sgor 'od zer can gyi l'a:'o //
translated: Now, beginning with Ya Ra, he teaches the seed syllables of the goddesses who stand in the chariots guarding the doors, and of the kings of wrath.🔽Here, at the eastern door, is the La of Marici,

original: dbyug pa sngon po'i yom ngo //
analyzed: dbyug pa sngon po'i yom ngo //
translated: and the Om of Niladanda.🔽At the southern door, the Va of Cundā,

original: lho'i sgor tsun d'a'i w'a:dang / 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i rom mo //
analyzed: lho'i sgor tsun d'a'i w'a:dang / 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i rom mo //
translated: and the Rom of Kāmarāja.🔽At the northern door, the Ra of Bhrikuti,

original: byang gi sgor khro gnyer can gyi r'a:dang / mi g-yo ba'i wom ngo //
analyzed: byang gi sgor khro gnyer can gyi r'a:dang / mi g-yo ba'i wom ngo //
translated: and the Vom of Acala.🔽At the western door, the Ya of Vajraśṛṅkhalā,

original: nub tu rdo rje lcags sgrog ma'i y'a:dang / stobs po che'i lom ngo //
analyzed: nub tu rdo rje lcags sgrog ma'i y'a:dang / stobs po che'i lom ngo //
translated: and the Lom of Mahābala.🔽In the pure sky, in front of the eastern door, the Ha of Nīlamā,

original: nam mkha' dag pas shar gyi sgo'i mdun du sngon mo'i h'a:dang / gtsug tor gyi ham ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' dag pas shar gyi sgo'i mdun du sngon mo'i h'a:dang / gtsug tor gyi ham ngo //
translated: and the Hum of Uṣṇīṣa.🔽In the pure earth, in front of the western door, the Ha of Caṇḍākṣī,

original: sa 'og dag pas nub kyi sgo'i mdun du drag spyan ma'i h'a dang / gnod mdzes rgyal po'i ha'o //
analyzed: sa 'og dag pas nub kyi sgo'i mdun du drag spyan ma'i h'a dang / gnod mdzes rgyal po'i ha'o //
translated: and the Ha of Sumbha-rāja.

original: yang na mtshan ma rnams te dbyug pa dang / mda' dang / gtun shing dang / be con dang / rdo rje dang rtse gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mtshan ma rnams te dbyug pa dang / mda' dang / gtun shing dang / be con dang / rdo rje dang rtse gsum pa'o //
translated: Or else, the signs are the club, the arrow, the pestle, the mace, the vajra, and the trident.

original: phag pa dang / rta dang / seng ge dang / glang po che dang / aa ni la dang rkang pa brgyad pa'i shing rta'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
