analyzed: phag pa dang / rta dang / seng ge dang / glang po che dang / aa ni la dang rkang pa brgyad pa'i shing rta'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The pig, the horse, the lion, the elephant, the antelope, and the chariot with eight wheels.

original: da ni klu'i sa bon rnams gsungs pa 'dir shar la sogs pa'i sgo las g-yas dang g-yon du stegs bu la gdengs can padma la sogs pa rnams kyi rim pa bzhin du //
analyzed: da ni klu'i sa bon rnams gsungs pa 'dir shar la sogs pa'i sgo las g-yas dang g-yon du stegs bu la gdengs can padma la sogs pa rnams kyi rim pa bzhin du //
translated: Now, the seed syllables of the nāgas are taught. Here, from the eastern gate, etc., on the right and left sides, on the platform, the syllables of the nāgas, Padma, etc., in order,

original: ya sogs la gnas ha yig ste /
analyzed: ya sogs la gnas ha yig ste /
translated: are located on ya, etc., and the syllable ha.

original: 'dir shar gyi sgo'i byang du rlung gi dkyil 'khor la stobs kyi rgyu'i hya dang / lho ru padma'i hy'a'o //
analyzed: 'dir shar gyi sgo'i byang du rlung gi dkyil 'khor la stobs kyi rgyu'i hya dang / lho ru padma'i hy'a'o //
translated: Here, to the north of the eastern gate, on the wind maṇḍala, is the syllable hyā of Vāsuki, and to the south, on the lotus, is the syllable hyā of Padma.

original: yang na rgyal mtshan gyi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyal mtshan gyi mtshan ma'o //
translated: Or else, it is the sign of the banner.

original: de bzhin du lho sgo'i shar dang nub tu me'i dkyil 'khor la nor rgyas dang / dung skyong dag gi hra hr'a'am bkra shis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho sgo'i shar dang nub tu me'i dkyil 'khor la nor rgyas dang / dung skyong dag gi hra hr'a'am bkra shis so //
translated: Similarly, to the east and west of the southern gate, on the fire maṇḍala, are the syllables hrīṃ and hrīṃ of Vāsuki and Śaṅkhapāla, respectively, or the syllables hrīṃ and hrīṃ.

original: byang gi sgo'i nub dang / shar du chu'i dkyil 'khor la rigs ldan dang / mtha' yas dag gihw'a hw'a'am padma'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgo'i nub dang / shar du chu'i dkyil 'khor la rigs ldan dang / mtha' yas dag gihw'a hw'a'am padma'o //
translated: At the western and eastern doors of the north, on the water maṇḍala, are the seed syllables of Kulika and Ananta, namely, VĀ and HĀ, or lotus.

original: nub kyi sgo'i lho dang byang du sa'i dkyil 'khor la 'jog po dang padma chen po dag gi hla hl'a'am rdo rje'o zhes pa ni mtshan ma dgod pa'o //
analyzed: nub kyi sgo'i lho dang byang du sa'i dkyil 'khor la 'jog po dang padma chen po dag gi hla hl'a'am rdo rje'o zhes pa ni mtshan ma dgod pa'o //
translated: At the southern and northern doors of the west, on the earth maṇḍala, are the seed syllables of Takṣaka and Mahāpadma, namely, HA and HA, or vajra. This is the placement of the signs.

original: da ni sde drug la ces pa la sogs pas dur khrod kyi lha mo rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te /🔽'dir shar la sogs pa'i dur khrod chen po brgyad po rnams su grangs bzhin du phyogs kyi 'khor lor @134b ka sogs sde rnams zhes pa ni shar gyi 'khor lo'i steng du kkhgghnga zhes pa 'am gri gug go //
analyzed: da ni sde drug la ces pa la sogs pas dur khrod kyi lha mo rnams kyi sa bon gsungs te / 'dir shar la sogs pa'i dur khrod chen po brgyad po rnams su grangs bzhin du phyogs kyi 'khor lor @134b ka sogs sde rnams zhes pa ni shar gyi 'khor lo'i steng du kkhgghnga zhes pa 'am gri gug go //
translated: Now, in order to teach the seed syllables of the charnel ground goddesses, he says “the six groups” and so on.🔽Here, in the eight great charnel grounds of the east and so on, the “six groups” are the seed syllables of the goddesses of the charnel grounds, which are placed in the wheels of the directions, beginning with the east.🔽In the east, on the wheel, are the syllables KA, KHA, GA, GHA, ṄA, and ḌHA, or flaying knives.🔽In the south, on the wheel, are the syllables CA, CHĀ, JA, JHA, ÑA, and ṬHA, or ḍamarus.

original: nub tu snypshshthka zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nub tu snypshshthka zhes pa'o //
translated: In the west, on the wheel, are the syllables ṬA, ṬHA, ḌA, ḌHA, ṆA, and TA, or a flaying knife.🔽In the north, on the wheel, are the syllables THA, DA, DHA, NA, PA, and PHA, or a skull.

original: byang du lwryha zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang du lwryha zhes pa'o //
translated: In the northeast, on the wheel, are the syllables BA, BHA, MA, YA, RA, and LA, or a vajra.🔽In the southeast, on the wheel, are the syllables VA, BHĀ, ŚA, ṢA, SA, and HA, or a lotus.

original: lho ru ksha sogs ldan pa lwryksha zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lho ru ksha sogs ldan pa lwryksha zhes pa'o //
translated: In the southwest, on the wheel, are the syllables KṢA and so on, or a flaying knife.🔽In the northwest, on the wheel, are the syllables A, Ā, I, Ī, U, and Ū, or a skull.

original: 'di rnams ni g-yo ba dang me'i khor yug gi dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa byas nas de'i steng du'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni g-yo ba dang me'i khor yug gi dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa byas nas de'i steng du'o //
translated: These are in the middle of the moving fire maṇḍala.🔽The others beginning with ca are in the intermediate directions, in the southeast, etc.

original: tsa sogs gzhan ni rim pas phyogs bral rnams su ste mer tstshddzhnya'o //🔽bden bral du tthddhna'o //
analyzed: tsa sogs gzhan ni rim pas phyogs bral rnams su ste mer tstshddzhnya'o // bden bral du tthddhna'o //
translated: In the southwest, ṭha, ḍha, and ṇa.

original: rlung du tthddhna'o //
analyzed: rlung du tthddhna'o //
translated: In the northwest, ṭha, ḍha, and ṇa.

original: dbang ldan du pphbbhma'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du pphbbhma'o //
translated: In the northeast, pa, pha, ba, and bha.

original: yang na thams cad du gri gug gi mtshan ma ni nges pa ste shar dang gshin rje byang dang chu dang me dang lha min dang ni dbang ldan rlung gi zur du'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na thams cad du gri gug gi mtshan ma ni nges pa ste shar dang gshin rje byang dang chu dang me dang lha min dang ni dbang ldan rlung gi zur du'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Or else, the sign of the flaying knife is certain in all places, in the east, south, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, and in the corner of Vāyu.

original: 'dir sa'i dkyil 'khor la zla ba'i aom dang nyi ma'i aa:ni sa bon no //
analyzed: 'dir sa'i dkyil 'khor la zla ba'i aom dang nyi ma'i aa:ni sa bon no //
translated: Here, the seed of the earth maṇḍala is the moon’s oṃ and the sun’s āḥ.

original: dur khrod sa gzhi la gnas 'byung po'i tshogs kyi zhes pa phyed dang bcas pa'i bye ba phrag gsum gyi tshogs kyi 'byung po'i tshogs mtha' yas pa'i sngags rnams te de'i grangs rnams so //
analyzed: dur khrod sa gzhi la gnas 'byung po'i tshogs kyi zhes pa phyed dang bcas pa'i bye ba phrag gsum gyi tshogs kyi 'byung po'i tshogs mtha' yas pa'i sngags rnams te de'i grangs rnams so //
translated: The mantra of the assembly of the hosts of spirits dwelling in the charnel ground is the assembly of three hundred and fifty million spirits, the infinite hosts of spirits, and their number.

original: yang na rlung gi khor yug la mtshan ma sna tshogs pa bya ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rlung gi khor yug la mtshan ma sna tshogs pa bya ste nges pa'o //
translated: Or else, one should ascertain the various signs in the wind-mandala.

original: da ni chos kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i sa bon ni shar gyi rta babs la chos kyi 'khor lo'i h'um ngo //
analyzed: da ni chos kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i sa bon ni shar gyi rta babs la chos kyi 'khor lo'i h'um ngo //
translated: Now, the seed of the Dharma-wheel, etc. is the HŪṀ of the Dharma-wheel on the eastern portico.

original: lhor bum pa bzang po'i a'a:'o //
analyzed: lhor bum pa bzang po'i a'a:'o //
translated: The AḤ of the excellent vase is in the south.

original: byang du rda bo che'i aom mo //
analyzed: byang du rda bo che'i aom mo //
translated: The OṀ of the great drum is in the north.

original: nub tu byang chub shing gi ho'o //
analyzed: nub tu byang chub shing gi ho'o //
translated: The HOḤ of the enlightenment tree is in the west.

original: zhes pa de ltar dbyangs ldan rnams ni rigs kyi dbang gis dkyil 'khor dag la sngags kyi dbye par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes pa de ltar dbyangs ldan rnams ni rigs kyi dbang gis dkyil 'khor dag la sngags kyi dbye par 'gyur //
translated: Thus, the seed-syllables, endowed with vowels, are the divisions of the mantras in the maṇḍalas, according to the families.

original: phyag rgya mtshan ma rnams kyi kha dog mtha' dag rdo rje can gyi zhal gyi dbye ba dag gis 'gyur //
analyzed: phyag rgya mtshan ma rnams kyi kha dog mtha' dag rdo rje can gyi zhal gyi dbye ba dag gis 'gyur //
translated: All the colors of the insignia of the seals are due to the divisions of the faces of the Vajrī.

original: thab tu sbyin sreg dag kyang de bzhin nyid du 'gyur te slar yang 'jug dogs pa rnams spyan drangs dang / dpal ldan sa la bsang ba dang ni mchod yon cho ga de bzhin bdud ni gzhom pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: thab tu sbyin sreg dag kyang de bzhin nyid du 'gyur te slar yang 'jug dogs pa rnams spyan drangs dang / dpal ldan sa la bsang ba dang ni mchod yon cho ga de bzhin bdud ni gzhom pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: The fire offering in the hearth is likewise, and also the invocation of the invited deities, the sprinkling of the ground with water, the ritual of the welcome offering, and likewise the subjugation of the demons.

original: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dir yang dag par bsdus pa thams cad 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas rig par bya'o zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dir yang dag par bsdus pa thams cad 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas rig par bya'o zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
translated: This verse is to be understood in the same way as the previous one, with the same order of topics, and all the correct summaries.

original: da ni sgo zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi sgo bsrung ba'i slad du slob ma rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sgo zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi sgo bsrung ba'i slad du slob ma rnams gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to protect the doors of the maṇḍala, the disciples are taught beginning with “door” and so forth.

original: 'dir shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams bsrung ba'i don du brtul zhugs nges pa dang ldan zhes pa @135a * //
analyzed: 'dir shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams bsrung ba'i don du brtul zhugs nges pa dang ldan zhes pa @135a * //
translated: Here, in order to protect the doors of the east and so forth, “one should draw the door guardians, who are endowed with the certainty of conduct.”

original: la brtul zhugs ni 'chad par 'gyur pa nyi shu rtsa lnga po rnams so //
analyzed: la brtul zhugs ni 'chad par 'gyur pa nyi shu rtsa lnga po rnams so //
translated: Here, “conduct” refers to the twenty-five explained below.

original: de rnams la nges pa ni sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba ste de dang ldan pa ni brtul zhugs nges pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la nges pa ni sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba ste de dang ldan pa ni brtul zhugs nges pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Certainty” is the permission of the buddhas. Endowed with that, they are “endowed with the certainty of conduct.”

original: dag pa'i slob ma ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu pa bzhi dang bral ba ste lag na rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu thogs pa mngon par dbang bskur zhing rjes su gnang ba de rnams sgo rnams su rab tu dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i slob ma ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu pa bzhi dang bral ba ste lag na rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu thogs pa mngon par dbang bskur zhing rjes su gnang ba de rnams sgo rnams su rab tu dgod par bya'o //
translated: The pure disciples are free from the four root downfalls, holding the vajra and bell, fully initiated, and authorized. They should be placed at the doors.

original: dpal ldan bum pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams me dang lha min rlung dang dbang ldan zur du rim pas so //
analyzed: dpal ldan bum pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams me dang lha min rlung dang dbang ldan zur du rim pas so //
translated: The glorious yoginīs of the vase are in the directions of fire, demigod, wind, and Indra, respectively.

original: zhes pa ni sngar gyi brtul zhugs la sogs pa yongs su dag pa dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar gyi brtul zhugs la sogs pa yongs su dag pa dgod par bya'o //
translated: This is the placement of the previously mentioned pure observances and so on.🔽Then the vajra master becomes the glorious lord of the gaṇas, having been made the king of actions, the lord of men.

original: de nas rdo rje slob dpon dpal ldan tshogs kyi dbang por 'gyur te mi bdag las kyi rdo rje can ni rab byas nas zhes pa ni 'dir lnga pa slob ma bzang po las thams cad la mkhas shing de nyid bcu yongs su shes pa de sbyin sreg
analyzed: de nas rdo rje slob dpon dpal ldan tshogs kyi dbang por 'gyur te mi bdag las kyi rdo rje can ni rab byas nas zhes pa ni 'dir lnga pa slob ma bzang po las thams cad la mkhas shing de nyid bcu yongs su shes pa de sbyin sreg
translated: Here, the fifth is the good disciple, skilled in all actions, who fully understands the ten topics. He should perform the burnt offerings,

original: la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs la las kyi rdo rje can du byas nas bla mas dkyil 'khor la rab tu gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs la las kyi rdo rje can du byas nas bla mas dkyil 'khor la rab tu gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having made the vajra karma master do the collection of rites such as the bali offering, the guru should perform the consecration of the mandala.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i slob ma med na tshogs kyi dbang po rang gis kyang ni sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i las bya ste kyang yig gis 'chad par 'gyur pa gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i slob ma med na tshogs kyi dbang po rang gis kyang ni sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i las bya ste kyang yig gis 'chad par 'gyur pa gzhan yang ngo //
translated: If there is no disciple who has become like that, then the master of the ganacakra should also perform the rites such as the burnt offering. The word “also” indicates that there are other rites to be performed, which will be explained below.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las dkyil 'khor bri ba zhes bya ba'i mdor bsdus chen po ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las dkyil 'khor bri ba zhes bya ba'i mdor bsdus chen po ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the third great summary called “The Mandala Drawing” from the Stainless Light, a commentary on the Condensed Kālacakra Tantra that follows the Root Tantra’s twelve-thousand-verse root manual.

original: // / phung po sogs kyi yam shing sogs //
analyzed: // / phung po sogs kyi yam shing sogs //
translated: The firewood of the aggregates and so forth

original: bsregs pa thams cad gsol ba gang //
analyzed: bsregs pa thams cad gsol ba gang //
translated: are all burned and offered🔽to that wisdom fire.

original: ye shes me de la btud nas //
analyzed: ye shes me de la btud nas //
translated: Having bowed to that,

original: de yi thab kyi mtshan nyid bshad //
analyzed: de yi thab kyi mtshan nyid bshad //
translated: I will explain the characteristics of its hearth.

original: zhi ba la sogs rab dbye las //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs rab dbye las //
translated: From the divisions of the rites of pacification and so forth,

original: so so'i phyogs kyi cha yis ni //
analyzed: so so'i phyogs kyi cha yis ni //
translated: the individual directions and parts

original: thab khung rnam brgyad rab gsungs dang // dgu pa las ni thams cad pa //
analyzed: thab khung rnam brgyad rab gsungs dang // dgu pa las ni thams cad pa //
translated: The eight hearth-fires are well-known, and the ninth is the all-purpose one.

original: 'dzam  pa'i rdo rjes rtsa rgyud las //
analyzed: 'dzam  pa'i rdo rjes rtsa rgyud las //
translated: From the Root Tantra of the Earth-vajra,

original: phyung ste mdor bsdus bstan pa gang //🔽de rnams rtsa rgyud rjes su ni //
analyzed: phyung ste mdor bsdus bstan pa gang // de rnams rtsa rgyud rjes su ni //
translated: the concise teaching extracted🔽is the one for all activities.🔽Those should be expanded upon

original: 'jug pas rnam par rgyas par bya //
analyzed: 'jug pas rnam par rgyas par bya //
translated: by following the Root Tantra.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa la sogs pas gsungs pa las thams cad pa la sogs pa'i thab rnams kyi mtshan nyid @135b zlum po 'am zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs te 'dir thams cad du khru bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor la las thams cad
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa la sogs pas gsungs pa las thams cad pa la sogs pa'i thab rnams kyi mtshan nyid @135b zlum po 'am zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs te 'dir thams cad du khru bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor la las thams cad
translated: Here, in the seventy-first verse and so forth, the characteristics of the hearths for all activities and so forth are taught, beginning with round or square. Here, in all cases, the hearth for all activities is four cubits in size.

original: pa'i thab ni zhi ba la zlum po dkyil 'khor gyi phyed do //
analyzed: pa'i thab ni zhi ba la zlum po dkyil 'khor gyi phyed do //
translated: For pacifying, it is round, half the size of the maṇḍala.

original: rgyas pa la gru bzhi dkyil 'khor dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la gru bzhi dkyil 'khor dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: For increasing, it is square, the same size as the maṇḍala.

original: de la re zhig rigs kyi dbang gis ye shes kyi 'khor lo ni thams cad du snying por te rdo rje phreng ba dang ka ba'i mthar dkyil 'khor las phyed kyi char 'gyur te phyi rol 'khor lo'i phyed kyi tshad kyis zhes pa'i nges pa las so //
analyzed: de la re zhig rigs kyi dbang gis ye shes kyi 'khor lo ni thams cad du snying por te rdo rje phreng ba dang ka ba'i mthar dkyil 'khor las phyed kyi char 'gyur te phyi rol 'khor lo'i phyed kyi tshad kyis zhes pa'i nges pa las so //
translated: In this regard, the wheel of gnosis, by the power of the clan, is in the center everywhere, half the measure of the mandala, at the end of the vajra garland, by the rule that it is half the measure of the outer wheel.

original: de'i phyed kyis rtsa ba'i padma ste de'i phyir snying po'i padma'i nyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyed kyis rtsa ba'i padma ste de'i phyir snying po'i padma'i nyis 'gyur ro //
translated: Half of that is the basic lotus, and twice that is the lotus in the center.

original: rgyas pa la khru gnyis pa gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la khru gnyis pa gru bzhi'o //
translated: The expanded one is two cubits square.

original: zlum po dang snying po'i padma'i tshad ni khru gcig go //
analyzed: zlum po dang snying po'i padma'i tshad ni khru gcig go //
translated: The round one and the lotus in the center are one cubit.

original: thams cad du grong la sogs pa'i dbus su bsod nams kyi don du'o //
analyzed: thams cad du grong la sogs pa'i dbus su bsod nams kyi don du'o //
translated: Everywhere, in the middle of a town, etc., for the sake of merit.

original: yang na las kyi rjes su mthun pas byang dang drag po'i zur 'am gzhan yang dkar po'i sa la rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor rdo rje 'bar ba'i phyi rol khru gnyis kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: yang na las kyi rjes su mthun pas byang dang drag po'i zur 'am gzhan yang dkar po'i sa la rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor rdo rje 'bar ba'i phyi rol khru gnyis kyi bar du'o //
translated: Or else, in accordance with the rite, in the north or northeast corner, or else on a white piece of ground, the colored-powder mandala is two cubits outside the blazing vajra.

original: de la thab gru bzhi ni khru gnyis pa ste rgyar phyi rol gyi 'khor lo'i phyed kyi tshad kyis so //
analyzed: de la thab gru bzhi ni khru gnyis pa ste rgyar phyi rol gyi 'khor lo'i phyed kyi tshad kyis so //
translated: The hearth is square, two cubits, with a width of half the outer wheel.

original: zabs ni padma'i tshad ces pa ni 'dir rgyas pa'i thab la zabs ni padma'i tshad de mtho gnyis su 'gyur zhing zlum po la mtho'i tshad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zabs ni padma'i tshad ces pa ni 'dir rgyas pa'i thab la zabs ni padma'i tshad de mtho gnyis su 'gyur zhing zlum po la mtho'i tshad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The depth is the measure of the lotus. Here, the depth of the hearth for prosperity is the measure of the lotus, which becomes two cubits. For the round hearth, it becomes the measure of the height.

original: de'i nang du snying por padma ste khru bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor la ji lta ba de bzhin du thab gru bzhi dang khru gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor la ji lta ba de bzhin du thab zlum po'i snying po la mtshan ma dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i nang du snying por padma ste khru bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor la ji lta ba de bzhin du thab gru bzhi dang khru gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor la ji lta ba de bzhin du thab zlum po'i snying po la mtshan ma dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In its center, the lotus. Just as in the four-cubit maṇḍala, so in the square hearth, and just as in the two-cubit maṇḍala, so in the round hearth, the center has the signs.

original: de ltar na dkyil 'khor la padma phyed dang padma'i phyi ru phyogs dang phyogs bral rnams su bum pa dang bcas ral gri la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ji lta ba de bzhin du thab khung gi snying por rtsa ba'i padma la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dkyil 'khor la padma phyed dang padma'i phyi ru phyogs dang phyogs bral rnams su bum pa dang bcas ral gri la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ji lta ba de bzhin du thab khung gi snying por rtsa ba'i padma la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Thus, in the maṇḍala, half a lotus and outside the lotus, in the directions and intermediate directions, along with the vases, the signs of the sword and so forth, just so, in the center of the hearth, the root lotus and so forth should be made.

original: rdul tshon dkar po la sogs pa'am 'jim pas te thab khung thams cad la phyi nas las kyi rjes su mthun pas kha dog bya ba ni rgyas pa'i dkyil 'khor la 'bras btags pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rdul tshon dkar po la sogs pa'am 'jim pas te thab khung thams cad la phyi nas las kyi rjes su mthun pas kha dog bya ba ni rgyas pa'i dkyil 'khor la 'bras btags pa la sogs pas so //
translated: The colors of the hearth should be made externally in accordance with the rite, with white sand, etc., or with clay.

original: mtshan ma rnams ni dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams ni dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The signs are the signs of the maṇḍala, just as they are.

original: de ltar thab khung gi gzhi la tshangs ba'i gnas nas thad ka'i cha khru gcig ste gru bzhi'i phyed kyi cha'o //🔽de @136a * //
analyzed: de ltar thab khung gi gzhi la tshangs ba'i gnas nas thad ka'i cha khru gcig ste gru bzhi'i phyed kyi cha'o // de @136a * //
translated: Thus, from the place of Brahmā, the straight line is one cubit, half the measure of the square.

original: bzhin du thab kyi rtsig pa la'o //
analyzed: bzhin du thab kyi rtsig pa la'o //
translated: In that way, on the wall of the hearth.

original: de ltar cha gnyis dang gnyis ni shar dang nub dag dang de bzhin du lho dang byang la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar cha gnyis dang gnyis ni shar dang nub dag dang de bzhin du lho dang byang la yang ngo //
translated: In that way, two parts each are in the east and west, and likewise in the south and north.

original: de ltar na thab khru bzhi ni ra ba'i mtshams su ste mig la sogs pa'i gnas kyi mthar thug par ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na thab khru bzhi ni ra ba'i mtshams su ste mig la sogs pa'i gnas kyi mthar thug par ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the hearth is four cubits, up to the end of the place of the eyes, etc., at the border of the enclosure. This is the rule.

original: khru bzhi pa ni gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: khru bzhi pa ni gru bzhi'o //
translated: The four cubits are the square.

original: de'i phyed ni zlum po ste khru gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i phyed ni zlum po ste khru gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Half of that is the circle, the mandala of two cubits.

original: de yi phyed kyis kyang ni mchu ste zhes pa ni padma'i phyed de de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas de'i phyed kyis thad ka dang dpangs su ster ba'i tshad kyi thad ka'i cha yis nges pa'o //
analyzed: de yi phyed kyis kyang ni mchu ste zhes pa ni padma'i phyed de de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas de'i phyed kyis thad ka dang dpangs su ster ba'i tshad kyi thad ka'i cha yis nges pa'o //
translated: And also by half of that is the lip, that is, half of the lotus. The extent of the space of the Tathagata is determined by the horizontal measure of half of that, and by the vertical measure of half of that.

original: tshad de nyid kyis dkyil 'khor gyi stegs bu'i phyed ji srid pa'o //
analyzed: tshad de nyid kyis dkyil 'khor gyi stegs bu'i phyed ji srid pa'o //
translated: By that very measure, the half of the mandala platform is as far as.

original: de'i steng du de'i phyed kyis 'byung ba dang dpangs te mchu'i phyi rol gyi steng du re kh'a'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i steng du de'i phyed kyis 'byung ba dang dpangs te mchu'i phyi rol gyi steng du re kh'a'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Above that, by half of that, is the emergence and the height, the horizontal part of the upper surface outside of the lip, the mandala of lines.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi stegs bu'i mthar yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi stegs bu'i mthar yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the platform of the mandala is completely pure.

original: de las nyis 'gyur dag kyang kha khyer dag gi rgya yi cha zhes pa ni snying po'i mchu'i tshad de las nyis 'gyur thad ka'i char bkyed pa ni kha khyer te de bzhin du rin po che'i snam bu dang do shal dang do shal phyed pa'i sa dang
analyzed: de las nyis 'gyur dag kyang kha khyer dag gi rgya yi cha zhes pa ni snying po'i mchu'i tshad de las nyis 'gyur thad ka'i char bkyed pa ni kha khyer te de bzhin du rin po che'i snam bu dang do shal dang do shal phyed pa'i sa dang
translated: Twice that is the width of the rim. The width of the lip of the hearth is twice that. The rim is extended straight out from that. In the same way, the rim should be all around up to the jeweled ledge, the garland, the half-garland,

original: ba ku l'i'i mthar thug par thams cad du kha khyer bya'o //
analyzed: ba ku l'i'i mthar thug par thams cad du kha khyer bya'o //
translated: and the bakula.

original: de nas bku l'i dang kra ma sh'irsha'i cha tshad phyed thang ka'i char bkyed pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bku l'i dang kra ma sh'irsha'i cha tshad phyed thang ka'i char bkyed pa'o //
translated: Then, the bakula and kramaśira are extended in the width of the painting.

original: kha khyer gyi steng gi dbus kyi cha de la kha khyer cha lngar byas nas dbus kyi cha gsum gyi kha khyer gyi steng du rdo rje phreng ba ste las thams cad pa'i thab la'o //
analyzed: kha khyer gyi steng gi dbus kyi cha de la kha khyer cha lngar byas nas dbus kyi cha gsum gyi kha khyer gyi steng du rdo rje phreng ba ste las thams cad pa'i thab la'o //
translated: On top of the rim, in the middle part, having divided the rim into five parts, on top of the rim of the middle three parts, there is a vajra garland. This is for the hearth of all activities.

original: mchu'i tshad phyed kyis dpangs te gang gi tshe 'jim pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe dbus ma'i rva ni mchu'i phyed kyis dpangs so //
analyzed: mchu'i tshad phyed kyis dpangs te gang gi tshe 'jim pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe dbus ma'i rva ni mchu'i phyed kyis dpangs so //
translated: Half the width is the height. When it is made of clay, then the middle horn is half the width in height.

original: gang gi tshe rdul tshon gyis yin pa de'i tshe dpangs nges pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdul tshon gyis yin pa de'i tshe dpangs nges pa med do //
translated: When it is made of colored powders, then its height is not fixed.

original: phyi rol 'og tu ste 'og tu rtse mo yod pa'i 'dab ma rnams sa'i mthar thug par kha khyer gyi phyed kyi tshad kyis bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol 'og tu ste 'og tu rtse mo yod pa'i 'dab ma rnams sa'i mthar thug par kha khyer gyi phyed kyi tshad kyis bya'o //
translated: Outside, below, with the tips below, the petals are to be made with a measure of half the width, reaching the end of the ground.

original: de nas phyi rol gyi phyogs rnams kun dus la ku sha dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi phyogs rnams kun dus la ku sha dgod par bya'o //
translated: Then, in all the external directions, one should lay out the kuśa grass.🔽Outside that spread of kuśa grass, in the western direction, there will definitely be three lines and one door.

original: ku sha bkram pa de yi phyi rol du ri mo gsum dang nub kyi phyogs kyi char nges par sgo gcig tu ni rab tu 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir thab kyi phyi rol du khru gnyis dor nas phyi rol tu dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po'i
analyzed: ku sha bkram pa de yi phyi rol du ri mo gsum dang nub kyi phyogs kyi char nges par sgo gcig tu ni rab tu 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir thab kyi phyi rol du khru gnyis dor nas phyi rol tu dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po'i
translated: Here, two cubits outside the hearth, outside, with colored powders of white, red, and black,

original: rdul tshon gyis rab gsum bya ste de nas nub tu @136b rab ring ba'i tshad kyi brgyad cha'i sgo ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgo bzhin du rta babs dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rdul tshon gyis rab gsum bya ste de nas nub tu @136b rab ring ba'i tshad kyi brgyad cha'i sgo ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgo bzhin du rta babs dang bcas pa'o //
translated: one should make three lines. Then, in the west, the door, with a measure of one-eighth of the length of the long side, has a pediment like the door of the maṇḍala.

original: de ltar thab che ba dang chung ba thams cad la khru gnyis dor nas rab gsum ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar thab che ba dang chung ba thams cad la khru gnyis dor nas rab gsum ni nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, having measured two cubits from all the great and small hearths, three are certain.🔽The seat of the master is certainly even and square, twice the size of the lotus of the hearth's essence.

original: slob dpon dag gi gdan ni nges par mnyam pa gru bzhir 'gyur te thab kyi snying po'i padma dag las nyis 'gyur ro zhes pa ni khru gnyis pa grub zhi'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dag gi gdan ni nges par mnyam pa gru bzhir 'gyur te thab kyi snying po'i padma dag las nyis 'gyur ro zhes pa ni khru gnyis pa grub zhi'o //
translated: Thus, it is two cubits.

original: de bzhin du thab thams cad la khru gang gi khyon no //🔽de bzhin du g-yon du mchod yon gyi gdan khru gang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thab thams cad la khru gang gi khyon no // de bzhin du g-yon du mchod yon gyi gdan khru gang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in all hearths, the measure is one cubit.🔽Thus, to the left, the seat of the libation becomes one cubit.

original: de bzhin du g-yas su sbyin sreg snod dag gi gdan yang khru gang ste rgyas pa la khru gnyis so ;
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas su sbyin sreg snod dag gi gdan yang khru gang ste rgyas pa la khru gnyis so ;
translated: Thus, to the right, the seats of the sacrificial vessels are also one cubit, two cubits for the extensive.

original: ; gdan rnams kun la dbus su padma'i 'dab ma rnams bkod pa'o //
analyzed: ; gdan rnams kun la dbus su padma'i 'dab ma rnams bkod pa'o //
translated: On all the seats, lotus petals are arranged in the center.

original: gdan gyi dbus su sna tshogs rdo rje'i mtshan ma dgod par bya ste rgyal ba'i bdag po rdo rje sems dpa'i'o //
analyzed: gdan gyi dbus su sna tshogs rdo rje'i mtshan ma dgod par bya ste rgyal ba'i bdag po rdo rje sems dpa'i'o //
translated: In the center of the seat, one should place the sign of a variegated vajra, that of the lord of victors, Vajrasattva.

original: yang na mkha' yi padma yum gyi'o zhes pa chos 'byung dgod par bya ste las thams cad pa la'o //
analyzed: yang na mkha' yi padma yum gyi'o zhes pa chos 'byung dgod par bya ste las thams cad pa la'o //
translated: Or else, the womb of space is the mother, and so the source of phenomena is to be drawn, for all activities.

original: 'bru la sogs pa rnams bsreg pa'i don du zhal thab khung ngo //
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa rnams bsreg pa'i don du zhal thab khung ngo //
translated: The mouth is the hearth for the burning of grains and so forth.

original: mar la sogs pa bdud rtsi'i sreg blugs sbyin pa'i slad du gsang ba thab khung ngo //
analyzed: mar la sogs pa bdud rtsi'i sreg blugs sbyin pa'i slad du gsang ba thab khung ngo //
translated: The secret hearth is for the offering of the oblation of nectar such as clarified butter.

original: de ltar phyi dang lus la thab khung rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te rgyal po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyi dang lus la thab khung rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te rgyal po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are two kinds of hearths, the outer and the body, and the king is the burner.

original: de ltar na las thams cad pa'i thab kyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na las thams cad pa'i thab kyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the definition of the hearth for all activities is complete.

original: da ni sngar mdor bstan pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid rgyas par bshad par bya ste 'dir zlum po'i thab khru'i tshad la snying po'i padma dkar po khru'i tshad de lte ba la padma dang 'dab ma rnams la rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan
analyzed: da ni sngar mdor bstan pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid rgyas par bshad par bya ste 'dir zlum po'i thab khru'i tshad la snying po'i padma dkar po khru'i tshad de lte ba la padma dang 'dab ma rnams la rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan
translated: Now, the definition of the pacification and so forth previously mentioned in brief is to be explained in detail. Here, the hearth for pacification is round, one cubit in size, with a white lotus in the center one cubit in size, with a lotus in the center and vajras and so forth on the petals.

original: ma'o // padma'i phyed kyis zabs so //
analyzed: ma'o // padma'i phyed kyis zabs so //
translated: It is one half of a lotus in depth.

original: padma'i bcu gnyis cha ni mchu'i thad kar zhal bkyed pa ste steng du de'i phyed kyis so //
analyzed: padma'i bcu gnyis cha ni mchu'i thad kar zhal bkyed pa ste steng du de'i phyed kyis so //
translated: The face of the lotus is twelve parts of the lotus, and the mouth is at the level of the face, and above that is half of that.

original: thad kar 'byung ba'i kha khyer gyi dpangs la yang ste padma'i drug cha ni kha khyer ro //
analyzed: thad kar 'byung ba'i kha khyer gyi dpangs la yang ste padma'i drug cha ni kha khyer ro //
translated: The height of the rim is also twelve parts of the lotus, and the rim is six parts of the lotus.

original: kha khyer cha lnga rnams las mdun dang rgyab kyi cha gnyis dor nas cha gsum gyis padma'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: kha khyer cha lnga rnams las mdun dang rgyab kyi cha gnyis dor nas cha gsum gyis padma'i phreng ba'o //
translated: Having abandoned two parts of the rim in front and behind, the garland of lotuses is three parts.

original: kha khyer gyi 'og gi phyi rol du padma'i 'dab ma rnams dang d'u ra ba dgram par bya ste ra ba gsum dang sgo dang rta babs ni byang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha khyer gyi 'og gi phyi rol du padma'i 'dab ma rnams dang d'u ra ba dgram par bya ste ra ba gsum dang sgo dang rta babs ni byang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Outside below the rim, one should arrange the lotus petals and the enclosure. The three enclosures, the door, and the archway are in the north.

original: slob dpon gyi gdan te mchod yon gyi gdan dang sbyin sreg gi gdan ni slob dpon gyi gdan gyi @137a * //🔽g-yon dang g-yas su bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi gdan te mchod yon gyi gdan dang sbyin sreg gi gdan ni slob dpon gyi gdan gyi @137a * // g-yon dang g-yas su bya'o //
translated: The master's seat, the seat for the water offering, and the seat for the fire offering are to the left and right of the master's seat.

original: rgyas pa la padma khru gnyis pa ste thams cad du mchu la sogs pa ni bcu gnyis la sogs pa'i cha'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la padma khru gnyis pa ste thams cad du mchu la sogs pa ni bcu gnyis la sogs pa'i cha'o //
translated: For the extensive [mandala], the lotus is two cubits, and everywhere the mouth and so forth are twelve parts and so on.

original: lte ba la 'khor lo dang 'dab ma la rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: lte ba la 'khor lo dang 'dab ma la rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The navel has the sign of a wheel, and the petals have the signs of a vajra, and so on.

original: zur du spyan ma la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: zur du spyan ma la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: In the corners are the signs of Locanā and so on.

original: kha khyer la 'khor lo'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: kha khyer la 'khor lo'i phreng ba'o //
translated: The rim has a garland of wheels.

original: lhag ma ni sngar gyi las bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sngar gyi las bzhin no //
translated: The rest is like the previous one.

original: de bzhin du gzhu'i rnam pa ni zhi ba'i thab dbus nas bcad pa ste dbus su padma sor bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhu'i rnam pa ni zhi ba'i thab dbus nas bcad pa ste dbus su padma sor bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the shape of the bow is cut from the middle of the pacifying hearth, with a twelve-finger space in the middle for a lotus.

original: de'i phyed kyis zabs so //
analyzed: de'i phyed kyis zabs so //
translated: Half of that is the depth.

original: mchu la sogs pa thams cad sngar bzhin du bcu gnyis la sogs pa'i cha'o //
analyzed: mchu la sogs pa thams cad sngar bzhin du bcu gnyis la sogs pa'i cha'o //
translated: All the lips and so on are twelve fingers and so on, as before.

original: padma'i 'dab ma'i gnas su mtshan ma ni lag mthil gyi sor mo'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma'i gnas su mtshan ma ni lag mthil gyi sor mo'i phreng ba'o //
translated: The signs in the places of the lotus petals are the rows of fingers on the palms of the hands.

original: 'og gi phyi rol du ro'i skras spras pa'o //
analyzed: 'og gi phyi rol du ro'i skras spras pa'o //
translated: Outside below, it is adorned with the hair of corpses.

original: lte ba la gri gug dang kha khyer gyi steng du gri gug gi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: lte ba la gri gug dang kha khyer gyi steng du gri gug gi phreng ba'o //
translated: In the center, there is a flaying knife, and above the rim, there is a garland of flaying knives.

original: slob dpon gyi gdan ni gzhu'i rnam pa gri gug gis mtshan pa ste zhi ba la padmas mtshan pa dang rgyas pa la 'khor los mtshan pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi gdan ni gzhu'i rnam pa gri gug gis mtshan pa ste zhi ba la padmas mtshan pa dang rgyas pa la 'khor los mtshan pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The master's seat is in the form of a bow marked with a flaying knife, just as in the case of the peaceful [fire] it is marked with a lotus, and in the case of the enriching [fire] it is marked with a wheel.

original: zur lnga pa ni zhi ba'i thab kyi tshad de zur lnga'i steng du kha khyer la ral gri'i phreng ba dang snying po'i mtshan ma yang ral gri'o //
analyzed: zur lnga pa ni zhi ba'i thab kyi tshad de zur lnga'i steng du kha khyer la ral gri'i phreng ba dang snying po'i mtshan ma yang ral gri'o //
translated: The five-sided [fire] is the size of the peaceful hearth. On the five sides there is a garland of swords, and the sign in the center is also a sword.

original: phyi rol gyi 'og tu bya rog gi mjug ma'i phreng ba sa'i rang bzhin kha dog nag po bya ste phyi rol du 'byung po'i shing gi 'dab ma dgod do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'og tu bya rog gi mjug ma'i phreng ba sa'i rang bzhin kha dog nag po bya ste phyi rol du 'byung po'i shing gi 'dab ma dgod do //
translated: Outside, below, there is a garland of crow tails, the nature of earth, black in color. Outside, one should place the leaves of a tree of spirits.

original: zur gsum pa ni rna ba nas rna bar khru gang dang rna ba nas dbus ma'i char sor mo nyi shu ni snying po'i padma'o //
analyzed: zur gsum pa ni rna ba nas rna bar khru gang dang rna ba nas dbus ma'i char sor mo nyi shu ni snying po'i padma'o //
translated: The triangular [fire] is one cubit from ear to ear, and from ear to the center it is twenty finger-widths, which is the lotus in the center.

original: tshad de nyid kyis padma'i phyed sor mo bcu ni zabs so //
analyzed: tshad de nyid kyis padma'i phyed sor mo bcu ni zabs so //
translated: With that same measurement, half of the lotus, ten finger-widths, is the depth.

original: lhag ma mchu la sogs pa ni bcu gnyis kyi cha la sogs pas snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma mchu la sogs pa ni bcu gnyis kyi cha la sogs pas snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The remaining lips and so forth are as before, with twelve parts and so forth.

original: kha khyer la mda'i phreng ba dang 'og tu padma dmar po rnams so //
analyzed: kha khyer la mda'i phreng ba dang 'og tu padma dmar po rnams so //
translated: On the rim are garlands of arrows and below are red lotuses.

original: phyi rol du me tog dmar pos spras pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du me tog dmar pos spras pa'o //
translated: Outside it is adorned with red flowers.

original: zur bdun pa ni 'di'i nyis 'gyur te kha khyer la rdo rje lcags khyu'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: zur bdun pa ni 'di'i nyis 'gyur te kha khyer la rdo rje lcags khyu'i phreng ba'o //
translated: The seven-sided one is twice that. On the rim is a garland of vajra hooks.

original: lhag ma ni zur gsum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni zur gsum pa bzhin no //
translated: The rest is like the three-sided one.

original: snying po'i mtshan ma ni zur gsum pa la mda' ste dgug pa la rdo rje lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: snying po'i mtshan ma ni zur gsum pa la mda' ste dgug pa la rdo rje lcags kyu'o //
translated: The sign in the center of the three-sided one is an arrow. For summoning, it is a vajra hook.

original: zur drug pa ni sor sum cu ste zur drug pa'i steng du kha khyer la spral gyi zhags pa'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: zur drug pa ni sor sum cu ste zur drug pa'i steng du kha khyer la spral gyi zhags pa'i phreng ba'o //
translated: The six-sided one is thirty finger-widths. On the rim above the six sides is a garland of snake nooses.

original: snying po'i mtshan ma ni sbrul gyi zhags pa'o //
analyzed: snying po'i mtshan ma ni sbrul gyi zhags pa'o //
translated: The sign in the center is a snake noose.

original: aarka ser po'i 'dab ma rnams dang phyi rol du me tog ser pos spras @137b pa'o ;
analyzed: aarka ser po'i 'dab ma rnams dang phyi rol du me tog ser pos spras @137b pa'o ;
translated: It has petals of yellow arka flowers and is adorned with yellow flowers outside.

original: / zur brgyad pa ni snga ma nyis 'gyur te snying po'i mtshan ma ni rdo rje lcags sgrog go //
analyzed: / zur brgyad pa ni snga ma nyis 'gyur te snying po'i mtshan ma ni rdo rje lcags sgrog go //
translated: The eight-sided one is twice the previous. The sign in the center is a vajra chain.

original: kha khyer la rdo rje lcags sgrog gi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: kha khyer la rdo rje lcags sgrog gi phreng ba'o //
translated: On the rim is a garland of vajra chains.

original: 'og tu zur drug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'og tu zur drug pa bzhin no //
translated: As in the sixth chapter below.

original: rab gsum ni thams cad du khru gnyis dor nas so //
analyzed: rab gsum ni thams cad du khru gnyis dor nas so //
translated: The three best are two cubits less in all directions.

original: slob dpon gyi gdan dang mchod yon gyi gdan dang spyin sreg gi gdan ni thams cad du thab kyi rnam pas so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi gdan dang mchod yon gyi gdan dang spyin sreg gi gdan ni thams cad du thab kyi rnam pas so //
translated: The master's seat, the seat for the libation, and the seat for the fire offering are all in the shape of the hearth.

original: thab rnams kyi rna ba nas rna ba'i tshad kyis thad ka'i cha nges pa'o //
analyzed: thab rnams kyi rna ba nas rna ba'i tshad kyis thad ka'i cha nges pa'o //
translated: The width of the hearth is measured from ear to ear.

original: da ni thab rnams kyi rang bzhin brjod par bya ste 'dir zhi ba'i thab ni zla ba'i rang bzhin nyi ma'i mtshan mas mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: da ni thab rnams kyi rang bzhin brjod par bya ste 'dir zhi ba'i thab ni zla ba'i rang bzhin nyi ma'i mtshan mas mtshan pa'o //
translated: Now the nature of the hearths will be described. Here, the pacifying hearth has the nature of the moon, marked by the sign of the sun.

original: rgyas pa'i thab ni nyi ma'i chos can nyis 'gyur nyid kyi phyir zla ba nyis 'gyur te zla bas mchan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i thab ni nyi ma'i chos can nyis 'gyur nyid kyi phyir zla ba nyis 'gyur te zla bas mchan pa'o //
translated: The prosperity hearth has the nature of the sun, twice the size of the moon, marked by the sign of the moon.

original: gsad pa'i thab ni sgra gcan gyi mtshan nyid de dus me'i mtshan mas mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: gsad pa'i thab ni sgra gcan gyi mtshan nyid de dus me'i mtshan mas mtshan pa'o //
translated: The killing hearth has the nature of Rāhu, marked by the sign of Kālāgni.

original: bskrad pa'i thab ni rlung gi mtshan nyid me'i rang bzhin dang 'dres pa ste rang gi mtshan mas mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: bskrad pa'i thab ni rlung gi mtshan nyid me'i rang bzhin dang 'dres pa ste rang gi mtshan mas mtshan pa'o //
translated: The expelling hearth has the nature of wind, mixed with the nature of fire, marked by its own sign.

original: zur gsum pa'i thab ni dus me'i mtshan nyid de rang gi mtshan mas mtshan pa'o //🔽dgug pa'i thab ni sa dang me'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid de lcags kyu'i mtshan mas mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: zur gsum pa'i thab ni dus me'i mtshan nyid de rang gi mtshan mas mtshan pa'o // dgug pa'i thab ni sa dang me'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid de lcags kyu'i mtshan mas mtshan pa'o //
translated: The triangular hearth is characterized by the fire of time, and is marked by its own sign.🔽The hearth for summoning is the nature of earth and fire, and is marked by the sign of the iron hook.

original: zur drug pa ni sgra gcan dang sa'i bdag nyid de sprul gyi mtshan mas mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: zur drug pa ni sgra gcan dang sa'i bdag nyid de sprul gyi mtshan mas mtshan pa'o //
translated: The six-cornered one is the nature of Rāhu and earth, and is marked by the sign of the snake.

original: rmongs pa la sgra gcan gyi'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa la sgra gcan gyi'o //
translated: For stupefying, it is Rāhu's.

original: rengs pa'i thab ni lhun po dang sa gnyi ga kha sbyar ba gnyi ga'i mtshan mas mtshan pa'o zhes pa ni thab kyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: rengs pa'i thab ni lhun po dang sa gnyi ga kha sbyar ba gnyi ga'i mtshan mas mtshan pa'o zhes pa ni thab kyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: The hearth for paralyzing is the union of both Meru and earth, and is marked by the sign of both.🔽The mantrin should know the postures, the substances for the fire sacrifice, and so forth, as previously stated.

original: sngar gsungs pa'i 'dug stangs dang sbyin sreg gi rdzas la sogs pa'i nges pa sngags pas rig par bya'o zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud la sogs pa thams cad la bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i 'dug stangs dang sbyin sreg gi rdzas la sogs pa'i nges pa sngags pas rig par bya'o zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud la sogs pa thams cad la bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule of the Blessed One for all the tantras of yoga and yoginī and so forth.

original: da ni thab ces pa la sogs pas sbyin sreg gi chog gsungs pa 'dir dang por thab kyi phyogs bcu rnams su khro bo'i rgyal po lha mor bcas pas zhes pa khro bo rnams kyi lha mo rnams dang thabs cig tu bsrung ba byas nas sngar brjod pa'i🔽sngags kyi tshig rnams kyis phur pa btab ste de nas dpal ldan rdo rje rnams kyis bsang ba sogs dang aom a'a:hum hri:phat ces pa 'dis thab kyi phyogs bcu rnams su ku shas mchod yon gyi snod nas dri'i chu blangs te dang por bsang bar bya'o //
analyzed: da ni thab ces pa la sogs pas sbyin sreg gi chog gsungs pa 'dir dang por thab kyi phyogs bcu rnams su khro bo'i rgyal po lha mor bcas pas zhes pa khro bo rnams kyi lha mo rnams dang thabs cig tu bsrung ba byas nas sngar brjod pa'i sngags kyi tshig rnams kyis phur pa btab ste de nas dpal ldan rdo rje rnams kyis bsang ba sogs dang aom a'a:hum hri:phat ces pa 'dis thab kyi phyogs bcu rnams su ku shas mchod yon gyi snod nas dri'i chu blangs te dang por bsang bar bya'o //
translated: Now, beginning with “the hearth,” he teaches the rite of the fire sacrifice. Here, first, in the ten directions of the hearth, having performed the protection with the king of wrathful ones together with the goddesses, that is, together with the goddesses of the wrathful ones, one should plant the dagger with the mantra syllables previously mentioned.🔽Then, with the glorious vajra syllables, one should purify the hearth, and so on, and with “oṃ āḥ hūṃ hriḥ phaṭ,” one should take the water for sprinkling from the vessel of offering in the ten directions of the hearth with kuśa grass and first purify it.

original: @138a * // de nas de'i rnal 'byor dmigs par bya ste rang gi snying kha dang thab tu me lta rab tu bzhag cing de nas chur bcas me tog rnams kyis me la mchod yon nyid /
analyzed: @138a * // de nas de'i rnal 'byor dmigs par bya ste rang gi snying kha dang thab tu me lta rab tu bzhag cing de nas chur bcas me tog rnams kyis me la mchod yon nyid /
translated: Then, one should visualize one’s yoga, and having placed the fire in one’s heart and in the hearth, one should offer the water and flowers to the fire as an offering.

original: de yi rnal 'byor ldan pas sbyin par bya ste rang snying padmar zla ba'i steng du bsgoms nas so //
analyzed: de yi rnal 'byor ldan pas sbyin par bya ste rang snying padmar zla ba'i steng du bsgoms nas so //
translated: One who is endowed with this yoga should give, having meditated on the mantra in one's heart lotus on a moon.

original: las thams cad pa la zhal gcig pa kha dog ljang gu phyag bzhi pa zhabs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: las thams cad pa la zhal gcig pa kha dog ljang gu phyag bzhi pa zhabs gnyis pa'o //
translated: For all activities, one should visualize the deity as having one face, green in color, four arms, and two legs.

original: 'dir las thams cad ba la g-yas pa'i phyag dang po na rdo rje dang gnyis pa na bgrang phreng ngo //
analyzed: 'dir las thams cad ba la g-yas pa'i phyag dang po na rdo rje dang gnyis pa na bgrang phreng ngo //
translated: Here, for all activities, the first right hand holds a vajra and the second a rosary.

original: g-yon na dril bu dang padma'o //
analyzed: g-yon na dril bu dang padma'o //
translated: The left hands hold a bell and a lotus.

original: ral pa shin tu ser skya dang mig dmar ser dang gos dmar ser te las thams cad pa la mi bskyod pa spyi bor 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ral pa shin tu ser skya dang mig dmar ser dang gos dmar ser te las thams cad pa la mi bskyod pa spyi bor 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The hair is very light brown, and the eyes and garments are light red. For all activities, one should hold Akṣobhya on the crown.

original: dam tshig sems dpa' rdzogs par byas te de nas de'i snying khar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' rdzogs par byas te de nas de'i snying khar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Having completed the pledge-being, then in its heart one should meditate on a moon disk.

original: de'i steng du dza:yig gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje lcags kyu dri med 'phro byed bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du dza:yig gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje lcags kyu dri med 'phro byed bsgom par bya'o //
translated: On top of that, from the seed syllable jraṃ, one should meditate on a vajra hook radiating light.

original: de yis kun 'gro ye shes sems dpa' bkug nas dam tshig sems dpa' dang lhan cig ro mnyam par mdzod cig / de ltar thab la yang ni yang dag 'gyur te rang gi snying kha las phyir 'byung ba'i dbugs dang 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rdo rje lcags khyu'i
analyzed: de yis kun 'gro ye shes sems dpa' bkug nas dam tshig sems dpa' dang lhan cig ro mnyam par mdzod cig / de ltar thab la yang ni yang dag 'gyur te rang gi snying kha las phyir 'byung ba'i dbugs dang 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rdo rje lcags khyu'i
translated: In this way, the fire is truly generated, and the breath that comes out from one's heart is the vajra hook that is about to be explained.

original: phyag rgyas spyan drang pa byas nas rdo rje khu tshur steng du mthe bos padma'i lte ba la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgyas spyan drang pa byas nas rdo rje khu tshur steng du mthe bos padma'i lte ba la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having invited with the gesture of the vajra hook, one should place the vajra fist above, with the thumb on the lotus center.

original: zhi ba la kha dog dkar po gos dang bcas pa snang ba mtha' yas kyis dbu brgyan pa te g-yas pa na padma dang shel gyi bgrang phreng 'dzin zhing g-yon pa na ril ba dang dung 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la kha dog dkar po gos dang bcas pa snang ba mtha' yas kyis dbu brgyan pa te g-yas pa na padma dang shel gyi bgrang phreng 'dzin zhing g-yon pa na ril ba dang dung 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the case of pacification, one should visualize oneself as Amitābha, white in color, wearing white garments, with a crown on the head, holding a lotus and a crystal rosary in the right hand, and a water pot and a conch in the left hand.

original: rgyas pa la g-yas na 'khor lo dang mu tig gi bgrang 'phreng 'dzin zhing g-yon na padma dang spyi blugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la g-yas na 'khor lo dang mu tig gi bgrang 'phreng 'dzin zhing g-yon na padma dang spyi blugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the case of enrichment, one should hold a wheel and a pearl rosary in the right hand, and a lotus and a sacrificial ladle in the left hand.

original: gsad pa la kha dog nag po gos dang bcas pa don yod grub pas dbu brgyan pa ste phyag g-yas pa na gri gug dang rtse gsum pa phyag g-yon pa na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga'o //
analyzed: gsad pa la kha dog nag po gos dang bcas pa don yod grub pas dbu brgyan pa ste phyag g-yas pa na gri gug dang rtse gsum pa phyag g-yon pa na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga'o //
translated: For killing, he is black, with clothes, and Amoghasiddhi as a head ornament. He has a flaying knife and a trident in his right hands and a skull cup and khaṭvāṅga in his left hands.

original: bskrad pa dang dbye ba la yang phyag g-yas pa na ral gri dang rtse gsum pa dang phyag g-yon pa na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga'o //
analyzed: bskrad pa dang dbye ba la yang phyag g-yas pa na ral gri dang rtse gsum pa dang phyag g-yon pa na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga'o //
translated: For banishing and separating, he has a sword and a trident in his right hands and a skull cup and khaṭvāṅga in his left hands.

original: dbang la gur gum gyi mdog can gos dang bcas pa phyag g-yas pa na mda' dang rin po che dang phyag g-yon pa na gzhu dang me long ste rin chen dbang phyug gis dbu @138b brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang la gur gum gyi mdog can gos dang bcas pa phyag g-yas pa na mda' dang rin po che dang phyag g-yon pa na gzhu dang me long ste rin chen dbang phyug gis dbu @138b brgyan pa'o //
translated: For enthralling, he is the color of saffron, with clothes, holding an arrow and a jewel in his right hands and a bow and a mirror in his left hands, and Ratnasambhava as a head ornament.

original: dgug pa la g-yas na rdo rje lcags kyu dang rin po che 'dzin zhing g-yon na rdo rje zhags pa dang me long 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dgug pa la g-yas na rdo rje lcags kyu dang rin po che 'dzin zhing g-yon na rdo rje zhags pa dang me long 'dzin pa'o //
translated: For summoning, he holds a vajra hook and a jewel in his right hands and a vajra noose and a mirror in his left hands.

original: rmongs pa la g-yas na sprul dang dbyug pa 'dzin zhing phyag g-yon pa na 'khor lo dang tho ba'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa la g-yas na sprul dang dbyug pa 'dzin zhing phyag g-yon pa na 'khor lo dang tho ba'o //
translated: For confusing, he holds a snake and a club in his right hands and a chakram and a hammer in his left hands.

original: rengs pa dang phur bus gdab pa la g-yas na lcags sgrog dang thob 'dzin zhing phyag g-yon na 'khor lo dang rdo rje phur bu ste kha dog ser po gos dang bcas pa rnam par snang mdzad kyis dbu brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: rengs pa dang phur bus gdab pa la g-yas na lcags sgrog dang thob 'dzin zhing phyag g-yon na 'khor lo dang rdo rje phur bu ste kha dog ser po gos dang bcas pa rnam par snang mdzad kyis dbu brgyan pa'o //
translated: For paralyzing and stabbing, he is yellow, with garments, and has a chain and a goad in his right hands and a wheel and a vajra dagger in his left hands. He is crowned with Vairocana.

original: 'dir dang por las thams cad pa la lha khang nas me blangs nas tsandan gyi shing gis rab tu sbar bar bya'o ;
analyzed: 'dir dang por las thams cad pa la lha khang nas me blangs nas tsandan gyi shing gis rab tu sbar bar bya'o ;
translated: Here, first, for all activities, one should take fire from a temple and ignite with sandalwood sticks.

original: / zhi ba dang rgyas pa la bram ze'i khyim nas so //
analyzed: / zhi ba dang rgyas pa la bram ze'i khyim nas so //
translated: For pacifying and enriching, [one should take fire] from a brahmin's house.

original: gsad pa la sogs pa la dmangs rigs kyi khyim nas so //🔽dbang la sogs pa la rgyal rigs kyi khyim nas so //
analyzed: gsad pa la sogs pa la dmangs rigs kyi khyim nas so // dbang la sogs pa la rgyal rigs kyi khyim nas so //
translated: For killing and so forth, [one should take fire] from a śūdra's house.🔽For controlling and so forth, [one should take fire] from a kṣatriya's house.

original: rengs pa la sogs pa la rje'u rigs kyi khyim nas so //
analyzed: rengs pa la sogs pa la rje'u rigs kyi khyim nas so //
translated: For paralyzing and so forth, [one should take fire] from a vaiśya's house.

original: gsad pa la ni gdol pa'i khyim nas blangs te tsher ma can gyi shing gis rab tu sbar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsad pa la ni gdol pa'i khyim nas blangs te tsher ma can gyi shing gis rab tu sbar bar bya'o //
translated: For killing, one should take [fire] from an untouchable's house and ignite with thorny sticks.

original: rengs pa la bska ba'i shing gis so //
analyzed: rengs pa la bska ba'i shing gis so //
translated: For paralyzing, [one should ignite] with bitter sticks.

original: dbang la seng ldeng la sogs pa dmar po'i shing gis so //
analyzed: dbang la seng ldeng la sogs pa dmar po'i shing gis so //
translated: For power, with red wood such as teak.

original: zhi ba la'o ma can gyi shing gis so //
analyzed: zhi ba la'o ma can gyi shing gis so //
translated: For pacification, with milky trees.

original: las thams cad pa la tsandan dang aa ga ru dang thad shing la sogs pa dri bzang po'i shing rnams sam shing 'o ma can rnams kyis so //
analyzed: las thams cad pa la tsandan dang aa ga ru dang thad shing la sogs pa dri bzang po'i shing rnams sam shing 'o ma can rnams kyis so //
translated: For all activities, with fragrant trees such as sandalwood, agarwood, and deodar, or with milky trees.

original: de nas sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis me lha spyan drang bar bya ste aom ae hi ae hi ma h'a bh'u ta de ba ri shi dvi dza sa ta ta ma gri h'i tv'a yu dham ma h'a ra smi aa smin sam ni hi to bha pa
analyzed: de nas sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis me lha spyan drang bar bya ste aom ae hi ae hi ma h'a bh'u ta de ba ri shi dvi dza sa ta ta ma gri h'i tv'a yu dham ma h'a ra smi aa smin sam ni hi to bha pa
translated: Then, with these mantra words, one should invite the fire god: Oṃ ehi ehi mahābhūta deva ṛṣi dvija satatamagṛhītayu-🔽dhamaharasmiṃ asmin sannihite bhagavan vajradhara ajñāpayati svāhā.

original: badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya yi sv'a h'a zhes pa brjod cing lcags kyu'i phyag rgyas dgug par bya ste rdo rje'i phyag rgyas gzhug par bya zhing zhags pa'i phyag rgyas bcing bar bya ste dril bu'i phyag rgya 'chad par 'gyur pas mnyes par bya'o /
analyzed: badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya yi sv'a h'a zhes pa brjod cing lcags kyu'i phyag rgyas dgug par bya ste rdo rje'i phyag rgyas gzhug par bya zhing zhags pa'i phyag rgyas bcing bar bya ste dril bu'i phyag rgya 'chad par 'gyur pas mnyes par bya'o /
translated: Reciting this, one should summon with the hook mudrā, cause to enter with the vajra mudrā, bind with the noose mudrā, and please with the bell mudrā as will be explained.

original: 'di rnams la so sor sa bon gyi yi ge dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la so sor sa bon gyi yi ge dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: For each of these, one should recite the seed syllables: jraṃ, hūṃ, vaṃ, hoḥ.

original: de nas rdo rje dril bu dkrol nas dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje dril bu dkrol nas dbang du bya'o //
translated: Then, shaking the vajra and ringing the bell, one should bring them under control.

original: 'dir mchod yon dbul bar bya ste aom pra wa ra sa ta k'a ram ma h'a ra smin pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a zhes pa ni mchod yon dbul ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: 'dir mchod yon dbul bar bya ste aom pra wa ra sa ta k'a ram ma h'a ra smin pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a zhes pa ni mchod yon dbul ba'i sngags so //
translated: Here, one should offer water for the feet: oṃ pṛva(pravara)sa(sa)t(ta)ka(ka)raṃ mahārasa(rasa)prati(prati)c(c)cha(cha) svāhā. This is the mantra for offering water for the feet.

original: de nas mchod pa ni de bzhin du badzra gan dham pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /🔽badzra pushpam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de nas mchod pa ni de bzhin du badzra gan dham pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a / badzra pushpam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: Then, the offerings: likewise, vajra gandhaṃ pratīccha svāhā,🔽vajra puṣpaṃ pratīccha svāhā,

original: badzra dh'a pam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra dh'a pam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra dhūpaṃ pratīccha svāhā,

original: @139a * // badzra pra d'i pam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /🔽badzra aa ksha tam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: @139a * // badzra pra d'i pam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a / badzra aa ksha tam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra dīpaṃ pratīccha svāhā,🔽vajra akṣataṃ pratīccha svāhā,

original: badzra nee be tyam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /🔽badzra l'a syam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /🔽badzra h'a syam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra nee be tyam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a / badzra l'a syam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a / badzra h'a syam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra naivedyaṃ pratīccha svāhā,🔽vajra lāsyāṃ pratīccha svāhā,🔽vajra hāsyāṃ pratīccha svāhā,

original: badzra p'a dyam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra p'a dyam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra gītāṃ pratīccha svāhā,🔽vajra pādyāṃ pratīccha svāhā.

original: badzra nri dyam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /🔽badzra g'i tam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra nri dyam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a / badzra g'i tam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra niryātaya svāhā🔽vajra gītam pratyālaya svāhā

original: badzra k'a mam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra k'a mam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: vajra kāya pratyālaya svāhā

original: de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i rdzas las kyi rjes su mthun pas me mchod pa'i yul la sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams sv'a h'a'i mtha' can gyis mchod par bya ste dkyil 'khor mchod pa la na ma:'i mtha' can gyis so zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i rdzas las kyi rjes su mthun pas me mchod pa'i yul la sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams sv'a h'a'i mtha' can gyis mchod par bya ste dkyil 'khor mchod pa la na ma:'i mtha' can gyis so zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o
translated: In the same way, with the substances previously mentioned, in accordance with the rite, one should make offerings to the fire with these mantra words ending in svāhā, and in the mandala offering with the ending namah. This is the rule in all cases.

original: // de bzhin du zhabs bsil thams cad rab tu phul te sil snyan thams cad rab tu dkrol te /
analyzed: // de bzhin du zhabs bsil thams cad rab tu phul te sil snyan thams cad rab tu dkrol te /
translated: In the same way, having offered all the foot-baths, having played all the musical instruments,

original: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i yam shing la sogs pa dang sngar gsungs pa'i 'dug stangs kyi cho ga dang sngar gsungs pa'i sbyin sreg gi rdzas rnams kyis las kyi rjes su mthun pas ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i yam shing la sogs pa dang sngar gsungs pa'i 'dug stangs kyi cho ga dang sngar gsungs pa'i sbyin sreg gi rdzas rnams kyis las kyi rjes su mthun pas ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: then the vajra master abiding in samādhi should perform the homa with the previously mentioned kindling woods and so forth, with the previously mentioned ritual postures, and with the previously mentioned homa substances, in accordance with the rite.

original: lag pas yam shing bsregs te de nas blugs gzar gyis sbyin sreg gi rdzas thams cad dang dgang gzar gyis sreg blugs dbul bar bya zhing de med na rang gi lag pa mchog sbyin gyi mthe bong gis me'i zhal du thams cad sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: lag pas yam shing bsregs te de nas blugs gzar gyis sbyin sreg gi rdzas thams cad dang dgang gzar gyis sreg blugs dbul bar bya zhing de med na rang gi lag pa mchog sbyin gyi mthe bong gis me'i zhal du thams cad sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should burn the kindling wood with the hand, and then with the ladle one should offer all the materials for the sacrifice, and with the funnel one should offer the oblations. If one does not have these, one should offer everything into the mouth of the fire with one's own hand, with the thumb of the boon-granting hand.

original: 'dir me lha'i rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste 'dir me rnam pa gsum ni lho'i me dang khyim bdag gi me dang mchod sbyin gyi me'o //
analyzed: 'dir me lha'i rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste 'dir me rnam pa gsum ni lho'i me dang khyim bdag gi me dang mchod sbyin gyi me'o //
translated: Here one should state the purification of the fire god. Here the three kinds of fire are the southern fire, the householder's fire, and the sacrificial fire.

original: lho'i me ni 'dir glog go /
analyzed: lho'i me ni 'dir glog go /
translated: The southern fire is here lightning.

original: khyim bdag gi me ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi me ni nyi ma'o //
translated: The householder's fire is the sun.

original: mchod sbyin gyi me ni mi bzad pa'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi me ni mi bzad pa'o //
translated: The sacrificial fire is the unbearable one.

original: bzhi pa'i ye shes kyi me ni bden pa ste kun du dga' ba'i chos so //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i ye shes kyi me ni bden pa ste kun du dga' ba'i chos so //
translated: The fire of the gnosis of the fourth stage is truth, the Dharma of universal joy.

original: de'i phyir de'i don du thams cad nyid sbyin sreg byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i don du thams cad nyid sbyin sreg byed do //
translated: Therefore, for that purpose, one should make all the offerings.

original: de bzhin du rig byed kyi mtha' las smras pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du rig byed kyi mtha' las smras pa /
translated: Similarly, it is said in the Vedanta:

original: mi bzad me ni ring du bdag spong ste //
analyzed: mi bzad me ni ring du bdag spong ste //
translated: I abandon the unbearable fire far away,

original: ri ka rab 'dzin gshin rje'i rgyal srid 'gro //
analyzed: ri ka rab 'dzin gshin rje'i rgyal srid 'gro //
translated: The king of Yama, the lord of the dead, is the mountain of the sun.

original: 'di nyid du ni gzhan skyes rigs byed 'di //
analyzed: 'di nyid du ni gzhan skyes rigs byed 'di //
translated: Here, the other one born is the creator.

original: lha dang skye dgu sogs las bsreg bya 'dzin //🔽zhes pa rig byed kyi don de 'dir yang don de nyid mi bzad pa'i me'o ;
analyzed: lha dang skye dgu sogs las bsreg bya 'dzin // zhes pa rig byed kyi don de 'dir yang don de nyid mi bzad pa'i me'o ;
translated: The oblation is held from the gods, the people, and so forth.🔽The meaning of the Veda is that the oblation is held from the gods, the people, and so forth. Here, the oblation is held from the fire of desire.

original: / sngags kyi tshig 'dis 'dod pa'i me spyan drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: / sngags kyi tshig 'dis 'dod pa'i me spyan drang bar bya ste /
translated: By this mantra, the fire of desire is invoked.

original: aom sarba p'a pa dang ha na badzr'a ga ni badzra satva sarba p'a pa dang ha da ha sv'a h'a zhes pa'i nges pa las so //
analyzed: aom sarba p'a pa dang ha na badzr'a ga ni badzra satva sarba p'a pa dang ha da ha sv'a h'a zhes pa'i nges pa las so //
translated: The certainty is: Oṃ, all evil, burn, O vajra, the being, all evil, burn, burn, svāhā.

original: de bzhin du nyi ma'i yang 'dri bsreg bya 'dzin pa'i sngags kyi dam tshig ni aom badzra na la sarba bh'u t'a na dzv'a la ya sarba na bha sm'i ku ru sarba dz'a na @139b dushta na hum phat sv'a h'a zhes pa'i nges pa la nyi ma de
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi ma'i yang 'dri bsreg bya 'dzin pa'i sngags kyi dam tshig ni aom badzra na la sarba bh'u t'a na dzv'a la ya sarba na bha sm'i ku ru sarba dz'a na @139b dushta na hum phat sv'a h'a zhes pa'i nges pa la nyi ma de
translated: In the same way, the certainty of the mantra of the sun, which holds the oblation, is: Oṃ, vajra, burn all beings, blaze, make all the people happy, destroy all the wicked people, hūṃ phaṭ svāhā. The sun

original: nyid gza' bdun gyi bdag po rta bdun pa'i shing rta can gza'i dbye bas lce bdun pa ste zhi ba la zla ba'i lce'o //
analyzed: nyid gza' bdun gyi bdag po rta bdun pa'i shing rta can gza'i dbye bas lce bdun pa ste zhi ba la zla ba'i lce'o //
translated: He is the lord of the seven planets, the seven-horsed chariot of the sun, and the seven-tongued one by the division of the planets. For pacification, he has the tongue of the moon.

original: rgyas pa la nyi ma'i lce'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la nyi ma'i lce'o //
translated: For increase, he has the tongue of the sun.

original: gsad pa dang bskrad pa dang dbye ba la spen pa'i lce'o //🔽dbang la ba sangs kyi le'o //
analyzed: gsad pa dang bskrad pa dang dbye ba la spen pa'i lce'o // dbang la ba sangs kyi le'o //
translated: For killing, expelling, and separating, he has the tongue of Saturn.🔽For controlling, he has the tongue of Venus.

original: dgug pa la phur bu'i lce'o //🔽rmongs pa la gza' lag gi lce'o //
analyzed: dgug pa la phur bu'i lce'o // rmongs pa la gza' lag gi lce'o //
translated: For summoning, he has the tongue of Mercury.🔽For confusing, he has the tongue of Mars.

original: rengs pa la bkra shis kyi lce'o //
analyzed: rengs pa la bkra shis kyi lce'o //
translated: For paralyzing, he has the tongue of Jupiter.

original: de bzhin du res gza' so so rnam par dag pas las so so re re la zhal gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du res gza' so so rnam par dag pas las so so re re la zhal gcig pa'o //
translated: Similarly, by the purity of each individual planet, he has one face for each individual action.

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo rnam par dag pas zhabs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo rnam par dag pas zhabs gnyis pa'o //
translated: By the purity of day and night, he has two feet.

original: thun mtshams bzhi rnam par dag pas phyag bzhi pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa ste zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la'o //
analyzed: thun mtshams bzhi rnam par dag pas phyag bzhi pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa ste zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la'o //
translated: By the purity of the four periods, he has four arms. This is the certainty for pacifying and other actions.

original: gsad pa la 'jug rings rnam par dag pas phyag gnyis pa ste phyag na gri gug dang thod pa'o //
analyzed: gsad pa la 'jug rings rnam par dag pas phyag gnyis pa ste phyag na gri gug dang thod pa'o //
translated: For killing, by the purity of Rahu, he has two arms, holding a flaying knife and skull-cup.

original: dbye ba la spen pa rnam par dag pas phyag na ral gri dang thod pa zhes pa phyogs gzhan gyi nges pa ste gza' spen pa la snga ma phyed dang phyi ma phyed kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: dbye ba la spen pa rnam par dag pas phyag na ral gri dang thod pa zhes pa phyogs gzhan gyi nges pa ste gza' spen pa la snga ma phyed dang phyi ma phyed kyi dbye bas so //
translated: In the case of Saturn, the sword and the skull-bowl in his hands are the purities of the first and second half of Saturday, which is another division.

original: las thams cad pa la sgra gcan rnam par dag pa dang dus me rnam par dag pa ste skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: las thams cad pa la sgra gcan rnam par dag pa dang dus me rnam par dag pa ste skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In the case of all actions, Rāhu and Kālāgni are the purities of origination and destruction.

original: 'dod pa'i me dang mchod sbyin gyi me ni rang gi lha'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i me dang mchod sbyin gyi me ni rang gi lha'o //
translated: The fire of desire and the fire of sacrifice are one's own deity.

original: ye shes kyi me ni gza' thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje slob dpon gyis sngar gyi cho gas mchod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi me ni gza' thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje slob dpon gyis sngar gyi cho gas mchod par bya ba'o //
translated: The fire of wisdom is the vajra master, who should be worshipped by the previously mentioned rite, because it pervades all the planets.

original: me lha spyan drang pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: me lha spyan drang pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for inviting the fire god.

original: da ni mchog sbyin zhes pa la sogs pas sbyin sreg gi phyag rgyal sogs pa gsungs te 'dir gang gi tshe blugs gzar med pa na de'i tshe rdo rje slob dpon sngar brjod pa'i 'dug stangs kyis gnas pas lag pa g-yon pa gan rkyal du byas nas g-yas
analyzed: da ni mchog sbyin zhes pa la sogs pas sbyin sreg gi phyag rgyal sogs pa gsungs te 'dir gang gi tshe blugs gzar med pa na de'i tshe rdo rje slob dpon sngar brjod pa'i 'dug stangs kyis gnas pas lag pa g-yon pa gan rkyal du byas nas g-yas
translated: Now, beginning with “the boon-granting hand,” he teaches the mudrā of the fire offering, and so on. Here, when there is no ladle, the vajra master, abiding in the previously mentioned posture, with the left hand lying flat,

original: pa mchog sbyin gyi phyag gi mthe bos sbyin sreg gi rdzas bskyod cing zhal phye ba'i me yi zhal du sbyin sreg bya ste de yang gsol bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: pa mchog sbyin gyi phyag gi mthe bos sbyin sreg gi rdzas bskyod cing zhal phye ba'i me yi zhal du sbyin sreg bya ste de yang gsol bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: with the thumb of the right boon-granting hand, he should stir the fire-offering substances and offer them into the mouth of the open fire. He should imagine that they are consumed.

original: rdo rje yis zhes pa ni aom a'a:hum ho:ham ksha:sv'a h'a 'di rnams kyis yam shing lnga brgya po de rnams las brgya rtsa brgyad bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje yis zhes pa ni aom a'a:hum ho:ham ksha:sv'a h'a 'di rnams kyis yam shing lnga brgya po de rnams las brgya rtsa brgyad bsreg par bya'o //
translated: “With the vajra” means that with these, Oṃ āḥ huṃ hoḥ haṃ kṣaḥ svāhā, one should burn one hundred and eight of those five hundred fire-sticks.

original: de nas yan lag gis zhes pa ni hr'ii h'um hr'im hr'im hr'im hra:sv'a h'a zhes pa'i yan lag gis brgya rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: de nas yan lag gis zhes pa ni hr'ii h'um hr'im hr'im hr'im hra:sv'a h'a zhes pa'i yan lag gis brgya rtsa brgyad do //
translated: Then, “with the limbs” means that with the limbs, hrīḥ huṃ hriṃ hriṃ hriṃ hraḥ svāhā, one should burn one hundred and eight.

original: kyang yig gis phung po drug dang khams rnams kyis te aa a'a ai a'i ri r'i au a'u li l'i aam aa:sv'a h'a 'di rnams kyis brgya rtsa brgyad do //🔽de bzhin du skye mched rnams kyis kyang ste aa a'a ae aee aa ra a'a ra ao aoo aa la a'a la @140a * //
analyzed: kyang yig gis phung po drug dang khams rnams kyis te aa a'a ai a'i ri r'i au a'u li l'i aam aa:sv'a h'a 'di rnams kyis brgya rtsa brgyad do // de bzhin du skye mched rnams kyis kyang ste aa a'a ae aee aa ra a'a ra ao aoo aa la a'a la @140a * //
translated: The also indicates the six constituents and the elements. That is, a ā i ī u ū e ai o au l lī lū aṃ aḥ svāhā. These are the one hundred and eight.

original: aam aa:sv'a h'a zhes pa skye mched bcu gnyis kyis brgya rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: aam aa:sv'a h'a zhes pa skye mched bcu gnyis kyis brgya rtsa brgyad do //
translated: Similarly, the sense bases are also. That is, a ā ai au aṃ aḥ svāhā. These are the one hundred and eight of the twelve sense bases.

original: de nas las kyi dbang po yul dang bcas pa rnams kyis kyang ste ha h'a ya y'a ra r'a wa w'a la l'a ham ha:'di rnams kyi brgya rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: de nas las kyi dbang po yul dang bcas pa rnams kyis kyang ste ha h'a ya y'a ra r'a wa w'a la l'a ham ha:'di rnams kyi brgya rtsa brgyad do //
translated: Then, the action faculties and their objects are also. That is, ha hā ya rā vā lā haṃ haḥ svāhā. These are the one hundred and eight.

original: de ltar bzhi bcu lhag pa'i lnga brgya rnams kyis lnga brgya'i grangs su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzhi bcu lhag pa'i lnga brgya rnams kyis lnga brgya'i grangs su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the one hundred and fifty are to be taken as the number five hundred.

original: so sor sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par ba ste mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cu ni brgya rtsa gcu gnyis so //
analyzed: so sor sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par ba ste mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cu ni brgya rtsa gcu gnyis so //
translated: Each is recited one hundred and eight times. The thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks are one hundred and twelve.

original: de rnams la sku dang gsungs dang thugs dang ye shes kyi gnas rnams spangs nas lhag ma brgya rtsa brgyad po rnams ni bgrang phreng la ste lhun po la zhal bzhi'o ;
analyzed: de rnams la sku dang gsungs dang thugs dang ye shes kyi gnas rnams spangs nas lhag ma brgya rtsa brgyad po rnams ni bgrang phreng la ste lhun po la zhal bzhi'o ;
translated: Having abandoned the abodes of body, speech, mind, and gnosis, the remaining one hundred and eight are on the rosary, and on Meru, the four faces.

original: / des na thams cad du las thams cad pa'i sbyin sreg la bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du brgya rtsa brgyad kyi tshad do //
analyzed: / des na thams cad du las thams cad pa'i sbyin sreg la bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du brgya rtsa brgyad kyi tshad do //
translated: Thus, everywhere, the measure of one hundred and eight is for the purpose of the accumulation of merit in the fire sacrifice of all activities.🔽Then, the substances of the fire sacrifice of grains, etc., are also by this very rite.

original: de nas 'bru la sogs pa'i sbyin sreg gi rdzas kyang cho ga 'di nyid kyis te 'bru dang d'u ra ba mar dang 'o ma yis zhes pa rdo rje la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis brgya rtsa brgyad kyi dbye bas sbyin sreg bya zhing yam shing dang 'bru
analyzed: de nas 'bru la sogs pa'i sbyin sreg gi rdzas kyang cho ga 'di nyid kyis te 'bru dang d'u ra ba mar dang 'o ma yis zhes pa rdo rje la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis brgya rtsa brgyad kyi dbye bas sbyin sreg bya zhing yam shing dang 'bru
translated: The grains, barley, ghee, and milk, by these vajra, etc., one should perform the fire sacrifice by the division of one hundred and eight.
