original: rnams mar gyis sbrags pa dang d'u ra ba 'o mas spangs pa rnams bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: rnams mar gyis sbrags pa dang d'u ra ba 'o mas spangs pa rnams bsreg par bya'o //
translated: The firewood and grains smeared with ghee and barley smeared with milk should be burned.

original: de nas snying po'i sngags kyis gang ba'i sreg blugs te gang gzar mar gyis bkang nas skyil krung du gnas rab tu zhi zhing g-yo ba med pa'i sems ldan gsang sngags rig pa sngags kyi sku /
analyzed: de nas snying po'i sngags kyis gang ba'i sreg blugs te gang gzar mar gyis bkang nas skyil krung du gnas rab tu zhi zhing g-yo ba med pa'i sems ldan gsang sngags rig pa sngags kyi sku /
translated: Then, having filled the ladle with oblations filled with the essence mantra, filled with ghee, seated cross-legged, with a mind of complete peace and non-movement, the mantra-holder,

original: slob dpon las kyi rdo rje can gyis slar yang me la sreg blugs dag ni nges par dbul bar bya ste aom hkshmllbarya zhes pa'i sngags 'dis mar gyi sreg blugs dbul lo //
analyzed: slob dpon las kyi rdo rje can gyis slar yang me la sreg blugs dag ni nges par dbul bar bya ste aom hkshmllbarya zhes pa'i sngags 'dis mar gyi sreg blugs dbul lo //
translated: the vajra-holder of the master, should again definitely offer oblations into the fire with the mantra Oṃ ha kṣamallavarya, offering ghee oblations with this mantra.

original: de nas zan dang chu bzung nas bkra shis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas zan dang chu bzung nas bkra shis brjod par bya ste /
translated: Then, having taken food and water, one should recite the benediction:

original: aom bh'u ra bhu ba: sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom bh'u ra bhu ba: sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ bhūrbhūḥ svāhā.🔽Namo devāya svāhā, namaste prajābhyāya svāhā, namaste rājābhyāya svāhā, namaste ādhipatya-vidyā-ālambhutaye svāhā.

original: na mo de be bhya:sva ste pra dz'a bhya:sv'a h'a r'a dza bhya:sv'a dh'a bi tri bhya:aa lam bh'u te bhya:ba sha ti na dr'a ya zhes brjod cing thab kyi phyi rol du rnam par phyin te chu dang zan de phyi rol du rab tu gtor nas der bsang
analyzed: na mo de be bhya:sva ste pra dz'a bhya:sv'a h'a r'a dza bhya:sv'a dh'a bi tri bhya:aa lam bh'u te bhya:ba sha ti na dr'a ya zhes brjod cing thab kyi phyi rol du rnam par phyin te chu dang zan de phyi rol du rab tu gtor nas der bsang
translated: Having recited this, having gone outside the hearth, having scattered that food and water outside, one should purify there with the mantra Oṃ nīrī hūṃ.

original: gtor byas la slar yang dkyil 'khor gyi khang par rab tu zhugs nas me la yang ku  sha'i chus bsang gtor bya ste aom a'a: h'um k'a ya b'a ka tsi tta sba bh'a ba shud dta sb'a h'a sngags 'dis so //
analyzed: gtor byas la slar yang dkyil 'khor gyi khang par rab tu zhugs nas me la yang ku  sha'i chus bsang gtor bya ste aom a'a: h'um k'a ya b'a ka tsi tta sba bh'a ba shud dta sb'a h'a sngags 'dis so //
translated: Having scattered [the ashes], one should again enter the temple of the maṇḍala, and having sprinkled the fire with water from the kuśa, one should recite the mantra OṂ ĀḤ HŪṂ kāya-vāk-citta-svabhāva-śuddhāḥ svāhā.

original: 'dir thab rab tu 'bar bar byed pa'i dus su me rya yang dag par 'bar ba'i don du kha'i rlung mi bya ste rlung yab kyi rlung la sogs pas by'ao //
analyzed: 'dir thab rab tu 'bar bar byed pa'i dus su me rya yang dag par 'bar ba'i don du kha'i rlung mi bya ste rlung yab kyi rlung la sogs pas by'ao //
translated: Here, at the time of kindling the fire, one should not fan the fire with the wind of one's mouth for the sake of properly igniting the fire, but rather with a fan or other [means].

original: de ltar rim pa yis ni sbyin sreg byas @140b nas bsad  gtor dag kyang de bzhin me dang bdag nyid dag la yang /
analyzed: de ltar rim pa yis ni sbyin sreg byas @140b nas bsad  gtor dag kyang de bzhin me dang bdag nyid dag la yang /
translated: Having thus performed the homa in stages, one should also offer the bali in the same way to the fire and oneself.

original: a'a hv'a na y'a mi sv'a h'a zhes pas ye shes kyi me gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: a'a hv'a na y'a mi sv'a h'a zhes pas ye shes kyi me gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: With Āhavaniyāmi svāhā, one invites the wisdom fire.

original: phyi nas slob ma la ni dbang bskur bla ma mtha' dag yon tan gter gyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas sbyin no //
analyzed: phyi nas slob ma la ni dbang bskur bla ma mtha' dag yon tan gter gyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas sbyin no //
translated: Then, for the sake of the disciple, the consecration is given by the entire teacher, with the treasure of good qualities, in the manner that will be explained.

original: dbang gi don du dang por bdud rtsi lnga ni rgyal ba mchog gi rdo rjes bying yis brlabs pa zhes pa ni aom a'a:hum ho:ham ksha:zhes pas bdud rtsi lnga lan bdun mngon par bsngags pa byas nas nya phyis kyi snod dam dung chos kyi snod du gzhag go
analyzed: dbang gi don du dang por bdud rtsi lnga ni rgyal ba mchog gi rdo rjes bying yis brlabs pa zhes pa ni aom a'a:hum ho:ham ksha:zhes pas bdud rtsi lnga lan bdun mngon par bsngags pa byas nas nya phyis kyi snod dam dung chos kyi snod du gzhag go
translated: For the sake of consecration, first, the five nectars are blessed by the supreme victor Vajra, with Om āḥ hūṃ hoḥ haṃ kṣaḥ, which is the seven-fold recitation of the five nectars, placed in a shell vessel or conch vessel.

original: // de bzhin du sgron ma lnga'i ril bu rnams snod de nyid du'o //
analyzed: // de bzhin du sgron ma lnga'i ril bu rnams snod de nyid du'o //
translated: Similarly, the pills of the five lamps are in that very vessel.

original: dag pa'i slad du'i zhes pa ni sngar bsgrub par bya ba ste dbang bdun gyi don du'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i slad du'i zhes pa ni sngar bsgrub par bya ba ste dbang bdun gyi don du'o //
translated: For the sake of purification means that which is to be accomplished first, for the sake of the seven empowerments.

original: sbyin sreg gi cho ga rgyud thams cad las bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi cho ga rgyud thams cad las bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The ritual of fire offering is the Bhagavān's certainty in all tantras.

original: da ni rang gi zhes pa la sogs pas rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu gnas pa'i slad du ting nge 'dzin gsungs te 'dir rang gi sngags kyis sbyin sreg grub par gyur cing zhes pa ni bya ba dang rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa
analyzed: da ni rang gi zhes pa la sogs pas rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu gnas pa'i slad du ting nge 'dzin gsungs te 'dir rang gi sngags kyis sbyin sreg grub par gyur cing zhes pa ni bya ba dang rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa
translated: Now, “now for oneself” and so on teaches the samādhi for the sake of the consecration of the maṇḍala of colored powder.🔽Here, “one’s mantra is accomplished through the burnt offering” means that the mantras taught in the tantras of Kriyā, Caryā, Yoga, Yoginī, and Anuyoga are one’s own mantra.

original: dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud du ma las gsungs pa rnams ni rang gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i sngags te rang gi sngags de rnams kyis rang gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas sbyin sreg grub par gyur cing sbyin sreg gi dang por rang gi dkyil 'khor de la
analyzed: dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud du ma las gsungs pa rnams ni rang gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i sngags te rang gi sngags de rnams kyis rang gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas sbyin sreg grub par gyur cing sbyin sreg gi dang por rang gi dkyil 'khor de la
translated: Those mantras are accomplished through the burnt offering according to the rite taught in one’s tantra.

original: rdul tshon btab pa'i rjes la lha'i tshogs kyi snying po'i mtshan ma rang rang gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas bkod par gyur pa na zur du shel gyi bum pa dkar po skud pa lnga yis dkris pa rnams ni yang dag gzhag par bya zhes pa ste
analyzed: rdul tshon btab pa'i rjes la lha'i tshogs kyi snying po'i mtshan ma rang rang gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas bkod par gyur pa na zur du shel gyi bum pa dkar po skud pa lnga yis dkris pa rnams ni yang dag gzhag par bya zhes pa ste
translated: Then, the crystal vases, white, wrapped with five-colored strings, are set up separately.

original: zhi ba la'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la'o //
translated: This is for the pacifying [rites].

original: lhag ma rnams la gsungs pa'i cho gas skud pa lngas dkris shing mgrin pa gos kyis bcings pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la gsungs pa'i cho gas skud pa lngas dkris shing mgrin pa gos kyis bcings pa rnams so //
translated: For the remaining [rites], the vases are wrapped with five-colored strings and their necks bound with cloth, according to the rite taught.

original: bum pa lnga'i bya ba la dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du shar gyis la rgyal ba'i bum pa ste de'i steng du drug pa rnam par rgyal ba dung ngo //
analyzed: bum pa lnga'i bya ba la dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du shar gyis la rgyal ba'i bum pa ste de'i steng du drug pa rnam par rgyal ba dung ngo //
translated: For the rite of five vases, outside the mandala, in the east, is the Victorious Vase, and above it, the sixth, the Vase of Victory, which is white.

original: bum pa bcu'i bya ba la yang phyogs brgyad po rnams su bum pa @141a * //
analyzed: bum pa bcu'i bya ba la yang phyogs brgyad po rnams su bum pa @141a * //
translated: For the rite of ten vases, in the eight directions, there are the eight vases of the eight classes, and in the four intermediate directions, there are the four vases of the four activities.

original: brgyad do // rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa ni shar dang nub kyi bum pa'i phyi rol du sor gnyis kyis ma reg bar te de la shar gyi rgyal ba'i bum pa'i steng du bcu gcig pa rnam par rgyal pa chen po'i bum pa ni dung ngo zhes
analyzed: brgyad do // rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa ni shar dang nub kyi bum pa'i phyi rol du sor gnyis kyis ma reg bar te de la shar gyi rgyal ba'i bum pa'i steng du bcu gcig pa rnam par rgyal pa chen po'i bum pa ni dung ngo zhes
translated: The eleventh vase, the great victorious-victorious vase, is a conch.

original: pa bum pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: pa bum pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the vases.

original: de ltar bum pa brgya stong la yang rnam par rgyal ba chen po'i bum pa ni dung ste zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang las thams cad pa la'o //
analyzed: de ltar bum pa brgya stong la yang rnam par rgyal ba chen po'i bum pa ni dung ste zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang las thams cad pa la'o //
translated: Thus, in the case of a hundred or a thousand vases, the great victorious-victorious vase is a conch, for pacifying, increasing, and all activities.

original: drag po'i las la ni thod pa'o //
analyzed: drag po'i las la ni thod pa'o //
translated: For wrathful activities, it is a skull cup.

original: dbang la sogs pa la zangs dang gser gyi snod do //
analyzed: dbang la sogs pa la zangs dang gser gyi snod do //
translated: For subjugation and so forth, it is a copper or gold vessel.

original: rengs pa dang rmongs pa la sogs pa la yang kham phor ro //
analyzed: rengs pa dang rmongs pa la sogs pa la yang kham phor ro //
translated: For paralyzing, confusing, and so forth, it is an earthenware pot.

original: der gzhag cing las kyi rjes su mthun pa'i skud pas bcings te gos mgrin par byas nas kha yal 'dab dang bcas pa rnams slob dpon gyis gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: der gzhag cing las kyi rjes su mthun pa'i skud pas bcings te gos mgrin par byas nas kha yal 'dab dang bcas pa rnams slob dpon gyis gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The master should place them there, bound with a cord that corresponds to the activity, covered with cloth, and with their mouths covered with leaves.

original: de nas slob dpon shar gyi zhal du 'dug ste 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sgrub thabs kyi cho gas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas nas dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang las rgyal mchog dang thig le'i rnal 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon shar gyi zhal du 'dug ste 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sgrub thabs kyi cho gas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas nas dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang las rgyal mchog dang thig le'i rnal 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor bya'o //
translated: Then, the master, having entered the eastern door, having confessed sins and so on by the rite of the means of achievement which will be explained, should perform the supreme royal mandala, the supreme royal action, the yoga of the drop, and the subtle yoga.

original: de nas shes rab dang thabs las byung ba rdo rje padma las skyes rab bgrod khro bo'i rgyal po rnams dag gis zhes pa sgrub thabs kyi thabs dang ldan pa'i tshogs dza: h'um bom ho: sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis te dza:yig gis dgug pa dad h'um yig
analyzed: de nas shes rab dang thabs las byung ba rdo rje padma las skyes rab bgrod khro bo'i rgyal po rnams dag gis zhes pa sgrub thabs kyi thabs dang ldan pa'i tshogs dza: h'um bom ho: sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams kyis te dza:yig gis dgug pa dad h'um yig
translated: Then, by the king of wrathful ones born from the wisdom-being and the art-being, born from the vajra and lotus, having gone through the stages, by these words of mantra, “jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ,” endowed with the means of the means of achievement, having summoned with the syllable jaḥ,

original: gis gzhug pa dang bam yig gis bcing ba dang ho:yig gi mnyes par byas nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo ni rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor du bsgoms shing de la ro mnyam du bya ste dbang gi don du'o //
analyzed: gis gzhug pa dang bam yig gis bcing ba dang ho:yig gi mnyes par byas nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo ni rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor du bsgoms shing de la ro mnyam du bya ste dbang gi don du'o //
translated: having caused to enter with the syllable hūṃ, having bound with the syllable vaṃ, and having pleased with the syllable hoḥ, the wheel of wisdom, having meditated on the pledge mandala in the mandala of colored powder, one should make it of the same taste, for the purpose of empowerment.

original: de nas rab tu gnas pa byas te sngar brjod pa'i cho gas mchod yon phul nas aom a'a: hum ho: tree dh'a tu ke shva ra k'a la tsakra aa rgham pra t'i tstsha sa pa ri w'a ra tv'am bha ga w'a na me bar do bha wa shishy'a🔽tsa zhes pas gsol ba 'debs pa'i mchod yon ni rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du mandala byas nas dbul bar bya'o //🔽de nas rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa'i mdun du gzhan khru gang ba'i mandala byas te der sngar gsungs pa'i dri la sogs pa dang zhabs bsil rab tu dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rab tu gnas pa byas te sngar brjod pa'i cho gas mchod yon phul nas aom a'a: hum ho: tree dh'a tu ke shva ra k'a la tsakra aa rgham pra t'i tstsha sa pa ri w'a ra tv'am bha ga w'a na me bar do bha wa shishy'a tsa zhes pas gsol ba 'debs pa'i mchod yon ni rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du mandala byas nas dbul bar bya'o // de nas rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa'i mdun du gzhan khru gang ba'i mandala byas te der sngar gsungs pa'i dri la sogs pa dang zhabs bsil rab tu dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having performed the consecration, one should offer the previously mentioned libation with the procedure, saying Oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ, and the supplication for the libation:

original: de bzhin du phyogs dang phyogs bral thams cad @141b du lha so so rnams la yang lha bshos la sogs pa dbul bar bya ste phyogs thams cad du rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs dang phyogs bral thams cad @141b du lha so so rnams la yang lha bshos la sogs pa dbul bar bya ste phyogs thams cad du rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du'o //
translated: “Oṃ, O Lord, I offer this water for the feet to the Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three-dhātu, Three-vajra, Three-kāya, Three

original: rdul tshon gyi sa la ni me tog la sogs pa dbul bar mi bya ste phul na rdul tshon bsubs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi sa la ni me tog la sogs pa dbul bar mi bya ste phul na rdul tshon bsubs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But one should not offer flowers, etc. on the ground of the colored powders, for if one does offer them, the colored powders will be destroyed.

original: rab tu gnas pa byas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rdul tshon bsubs pa las mchod rten 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa byas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rdul tshon bsubs pa las mchod rten 'jig pa'o //
translated: And the destruction of the colored powders of a mandala which has been consecrated is the destruction of a stupa.

original: des na rigs yongs su brtag pa'i don du dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol shar gyi sgor rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa'i steng du me tog dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na rigs yongs su brtag pa'i don du dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol shar gyi sgor rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa'i steng du me tog dor bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to determine the clan, one should cast the flower outside the mandala, in front of the eastern door, on top of the victorious vase.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na khru stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la slob mas dor ba'i me tog shar gyi rdo rje 'bar ba spangs nas gang du ltung bar 'gyur de la rdo rje 'bar ba yang rkang pa dang bcas pa'i khru brgyar 'gyur te lhas byin gyis brlabs pa
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na khru stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la slob mas dor ba'i me tog shar gyi rdo rje 'bar ba spangs nas gang du ltung bar 'gyur de la rdo rje 'bar ba yang rkang pa dang bcas pa'i khru brgyar 'gyur te lhas byin gyis brlabs pa
translated: Otherwise, if the disciple casts the flower on a mandala one thousand cubits in size, avoiding the eastern blazing vajra, wherever it falls, that blazing vajra will be one hundred cubits together with the foot.

original: ma gtogs pa de rgal nas rigs kyi phyogs rnams su ji ltar me tog ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ma gtogs pa de rgal nas rigs kyi phyogs rnams su ji ltar me tog ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: Except for the consecration by the deity, how could the flower fall in the directions of the clans, having passed over that?

original: de'i phyir rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pha la mtshan ma lnga byas nas de la 'chad par 'gyur pa'i me tog dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pha la mtshan ma lnga byas nas de la 'chad par 'gyur pa'i me tog dor bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, having made the five signs on the victorious vase, one should cast the flower which will be explained.

original: des na dril sogs pa rnams rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du ste rdul tshon gyi sa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dril sogs pa rnams rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du ste rdul tshon gyi sa la ni ma yin no //
translated: Then, the bell and so forth are outside the colored-powder mandala, not on the colored-powder ground.

original: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor ni bcom ldan 'das kyi skur rig par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor ni bcom ldan 'das kyi skur rig par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The colored-powder mandala should be known as the Bhagavat's body. This is the rule.

original: da ni lha dang zhes pa la sogs pas sngags kyi nges pa gsungs pa 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo dang gtso bo'i rjes su mthun pa rnams thams cad kyi ming gi sngags kyi sngon du aom du 'gyur te aom yig go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: da ni lha dang zhes pa la sogs pas sngags kyi nges pa gsungs pa 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo dang gtso bo'i rjes su mthun pa rnams thams cad kyi ming gi sngags kyi sngon du aom du 'gyur te aom yig go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Now, he says the mantra of the gods and so forth. Here, the mantra of the name of all the deities who are in accord with the principal deity of the mandala has the syllable Om at the beginning, meaning the syllable Om.

original: ma gsungs pa'i sngags rnams la yad thams cad du aom yig dang por ro zhes rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ma gsungs pa'i sngags rnams la yad thams cad du aom yig dang por ro zhes rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the case of mantras not mentioned, one should understand that the syllable Om is at the beginning in all cases.

original: sbyin sreg la ni sv'a h'a'i mtha' can gyi sngags te thams cad kyi ming gi sngags ni snying por brjod do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg la ni sv'a h'a'i mtha' can gyi sngags te thams cad kyi ming gi sngags ni snying por brjod do //
translated: In the case of homa, the mantra ends with svaha. The mantra of the name of all is said to be the essence.

original: de nyid sbyin sreg gi bya ba la sv'a h'a'i mtha' can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid sbyin sreg gi bya ba la sv'a h'a'i mtha' can du 'gyur ro //
translated: That itself ends with svaha in the performance of homa.

original: las thams cad pa'i mchod pa dag la na ma:'i mtha' can du 'gyur te de nyid do zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i mchod pa dag la na ma:'i mtha' can du 'gyur te de nyid do zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: In the case of the worship of all activities, it ends with namaḥ. That itself is the rule.

original: dza:h'um pam ho:lcags kyu la sogs zhes pa ni 'dir lha rnams spyan drang ba la dza:yig gis lcags kyu bya'o //
analyzed: dza:h'um pam ho:lcags kyu la sogs zhes pa ni 'dir lha rnams spyan drang ba la dza:yig gis lcags kyu bya'o //
translated: Jaḥ, hūṃ, vaṃ, hoḥ, the hook, etc. Here, in the case of the invocation of the deities, one should use the hook with the syllable jaḥ.

original: gzhug pa la h'um yig gi rdo rje'o //🔽bcing ba la bam yig gis zhags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhug pa la h'um yig gi rdo rje'o // bcing ba la bam yig gis zhags pa'o //
translated: In the case of the entry, one should use the vajra with the syllable hūṃ.

original: mnyes pa la @142a * //
analyzed: mnyes pa la @142a * //
translated: In the case of binding, one should use the noose with the syllable vaṃ.🔽In the case of pleasing, one should use the vajra and bell with the syllable hoḥ.

original: ho: yig gis rdo rje dril bu ste rim pa ji lta bar yongs su bkod pa rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ho: yig gis rdo rje dril bu ste rim pa ji lta bar yongs su bkod pa rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: In order, these are the vajra hook, etc., which are arranged.

original: de nas mchod yon sbyin pa la yang ming gi sngags kyi mthar 'gyur te che ge mo ai dam grihna grihna aargham kam me pu na: zhes pa ni nges pa'o //🔽da ni rgyas pa la zhes pa la sogs pas rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las kyi dbye bas sngags kyi cho ga gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas mchod yon sbyin pa la yang ming gi sngags kyi mthar 'gyur te che ge mo ai dam grihna grihna aargham kam me pu na: zhes pa ni nges pa'o // da ni rgyas pa la zhes pa la sogs pas rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las kyi dbye bas sngags kyi cho ga gsungs te /
translated: Then, in the case of the offering of water for the feet, the mantra ends with the name, and is definitely: “So-and-so, accept, accept the water for the feet.”

original: 'dir rgyas pa la thams cad du sngags bzlas pa'am sbyin sreg la aom yig dang po dang sv'a h'a'i mtha' can sngags su 'gyur ro //🔽mi bdag ces pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgyas pa la thams cad du sngags bzlas pa'am sbyin sreg la aom yig dang po dang sv'a h'a'i mtha' can sngags su 'gyur ro // mi bdag ces pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: Now, in the case of the rites of augmentation and so forth, he states the mantra procedure by means of the division of the rites of augmentation and so forth, beginning with “Here, for augmentation, the mantra is everywhere repeated, or in the case of a homa, it has the syllable Oṃ at the beginning and the syllable SVĀHĀ at the end.”🔽Here, “everywhere” means in all the rites of augmentation.

original: zhi ba la sngags 'di na ma:'i mtha' can no //🔽dgug pa la de nyid boo shata mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba la sngags 'di na ma:'i mtha' can no // dgug pa la de nyid boo shata mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of pacification, the mantra has the syllable NAMAH at the end.🔽In the case of summoning, that very [mantra] has the syllable VAUȘAṬ at the end.

original: de nyid ba shata mtha' ni dbang la'o //
analyzed: de nyid ba shata mtha' ni dbang la'o //
translated: That very [mantra] with the syllable VAȘAT at the end is for enthralling.

original: de bzhin nyid du h'um yig mtha' can mngon spyod la ste dbye ba dang bskrad pa dang gsad pa la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du h'um yig mtha' can mngon spyod la ste dbye ba dang bskrad pa dang gsad pa la'o //
translated: In the case of assault, it has the syllable HŪṂ at the end, for the divisions of banishing, expelling, and killing.

original: rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis phur bus gdab pa dang rmongs pa dang rengs pa la phat yig gi mtha' can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis phur bus gdab pa dang rmongs pa dang rengs pa la phat yig gi mtha' can du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of the natural qualities, the nail is driven in, and for delusion and paralysis, it is concluded with the syllable PHAṬ.🔽

original: 'dir rang bzhin ni rgyas pa la rlan dang bcas pa'i sa'i rang bzhin te des na sv'a h'a'o //
analyzed: 'dir rang bzhin ni rgyas pa la rlan dang bcas pa'i sa'i rang bzhin te des na sv'a h'a'o //
translated: By the power of the nature of the qualities, the nature of the qualities is the nature of the earth with moisture for increasing, and therefore it has svaha.

original: zhi ba la chu'i rang bzhin na ma:'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la chu'i rang bzhin na ma:'o //
translated: For pacifying, the nature of water is nam.

original: dgug pa la me dang sa'i rang bzhin booshata'o //
analyzed: dgug pa la me dang sa'i rang bzhin booshata'o //
translated: For summoning, the nature of fire and earth is bosat.

original: dbang la me'i rang bzhin bashta'o //
analyzed: dbang la me'i rang bzhin bashta'o //
translated: For controlling, the nature of fire is bhasht.

original: gsad pa dang bskrad pa dang dbye ba la rlung dang me'i rang bzhin h'um yig go //
analyzed: gsad pa dang bskrad pa dang dbye ba la rlung dang me'i rang bzhin h'um yig go //
translated: For killing, banishing, and separating, the nature of wind and fire is the syllable hum.

original: phur bus gdab pa dang rengs pa la lhun po dang sa'i rang bzhin phat yig go //
analyzed: phur bus gdab pa dang rengs pa la lhun po dang sa'i rang bzhin phat yig go //
translated: For striking with a kila and paralyzing, the nature of Meru and earth is the syllable phat.

original: rmongs pa la yang rlung dang sa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rmongs pa la yang rlung dang sa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: For confusing, the nature of wind and earth is also [the syllable hum].

original: yang na thams cad du gsang pa la sogs pa dang rmongs pa la sogs pa'i las gsum po rnams la yi ge h'um phat kyi mtha' ste sngags bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg dang mchod pa la sogs pa yang sngags pas bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: yang na thams cad du gsang pa la sogs pa dang rmongs pa la sogs pa'i las gsum po rnams la yi ge h'um phat kyi mtha' ste sngags bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg dang mchod pa la sogs pa yang sngags pas bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Or, in all cases, the mantra practitioner should perform the three actions of bewilderment, etc., with the end of the syllables HŪṀ and PHAṬ, as well as the recitation of the mantra, the burnt offerings, the worship, etc.

original: lha'i kha dog ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la dkar po dang / dbang la sogs pa la dmar po dang / gsad pa la sogs pa la nag po dang / rmongs pa la sogs pa la ser po ste las kyi dbye ba rnams kyis sngags su 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i kha dog ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la dkar po dang / dbang la sogs pa la dmar po dang / gsad pa la sogs pa la nag po dang / rmongs pa la sogs pa la ser po ste las kyi dbye ba rnams kyis sngags su 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges ba'o //
translated: The color of the deity is white for pacification and increase, red for subjugation, etc., black for killing, etc., and yellow for bewilderment, etc. The mantra is to be applied according to the division of the actions.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor gyis rnam par dag pa'i sa bon rnams gsungs te 'dir shar du rlung rnam par dag @142b pas thugs rdo rje kha dog nag po sa'i chal khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor gyis rnam par dag pa'i sa bon rnams gsungs te 'dir shar du rlung rnam par dag @142b pas thugs rdo rje kha dog nag po sa'i chal khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: Now he states the seed syllables that are purified by the maṇḍala. Here, in the east, the wind is purified by the seed syllable YAṀ, which is the color of the wind, and is the nature of the wind.

original: byang du chu dag pas sku rdo rje dkar po dang lho ru me dag pas gsungs rdo rje dmar po dang nub tu rang gi rigs sa'i phyogs su gnas pa ye shes rdo rje ser po'o //
analyzed: byang du chu dag pas sku rdo rje dkar po dang lho ru me dag pas gsungs rdo rje dmar po dang nub tu rang gi rigs sa'i phyogs su gnas pa ye shes rdo rje ser po'o //
translated: In the north, by the purification of water, the white Body-vajra; in the south, by the purification of fire, the red Speech-vajra; and in the west, by the purification of one's own family, the yellow Mind-vajra.

original: de bzhin du sgra can dang zla ba dang nyi ma dang dus me dag pas zhal bzhi'i dbye bas sa'i cha'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra can dang zla ba dang nyi ma dang dus me dag pas zhal bzhi'i dbye bas sa'i cha'o //
translated: Similarly, by the purification of Rahu, the moon, the sun, and the fire of time, the division of the four faces is the earth element.

original: de'i phyir grangs bzhin du rlung gi skye gnas ai dang me'i skye gnas ri dang chu'i skye gnas au dang sa'i skye gnas ni li'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir grangs bzhin du rlung gi skye gnas ai dang me'i skye gnas ri dang chu'i skye gnas au dang sa'i skye gnas ni li'o //
translated: Therefore, in order, the wind-birth is i, the fire-birth is ri, the water-birth is u, and the earth-birth is li.

original: de bzhin du rlung la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi skye gnas ni ai yig la sogs pa rang rang gis bon te 'du byed dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang gzugs kyi rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi skye gnas ni ai yig la sogs pa rang rang gis bon te 'du byed dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang gzugs kyi rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the births of the gods of wind, etc., are the individual seed syllables such as i, etc., which are the natures of compositional factors, feelings, discriminations, and forms.

original: aa yig ni ma brjod kyang nam mkha'i skye gnas te rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa thams cad du nges pa ste aa ai ri yu li ka zhes pa so sor bsdu ba'i tshig las spro ba'i rim pas te skyed pa'i rim pas
analyzed: aa yig ni ma brjod kyang nam mkha'i skye gnas te rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa thams cad du nges pa ste aa ai ri yu li ka zhes pa so sor bsdu ba'i tshig las spro ba'i rim pas te skyed pa'i rim pas
translated: The word each is a collective particle. The sequence of emanation, the sequence of generation, is from A, I, R, U, L, and K.

original: so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The word each is a particle of determination.

original: da ni phyag rgyas gdab pa'i don du phyag rgya'i sa bon rnams gsungs te 'dir dpral bar sku'i phyag rgya aom yig dkar po dang mgrin par gsung gi phyag rgya a'a: yig dmar po dang snying khar thugs kyi phyag rgya h'um yig nag bo'o zhes pa ni thabs
analyzed: da ni phyag rgyas gdab pa'i don du phyag rgya'i sa bon rnams gsungs te 'dir dpral bar sku'i phyag rgya aom yig dkar po dang mgrin par gsung gi phyag rgya a'a: yig dmar po dang snying khar thugs kyi phyag rgya h'um yig nag bo'o zhes pa ni thabs
translated: Now, for the purpose of sealing, the seed syllables of the seals are stated. Here, on the forehead is the body seal, the white syllable Om, on the throat is the speech seal, the red syllable Aḥ, and on the heart is the mind seal, the black syllable Hūṃ.

original: kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the method seal.🔽The wisdom seal is the syllable Sva on the navel and the syllable Ha on the secret place.

original: shes rab kyi lte bar sv'a dang gsang bar h'a'o 'di dag dang bcas pa lnga ste gang gi phyir zla ba'i rkang pa la bcu gsum zla ba'i rkang par nga gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi lte bar sv'a dang gsang bar h'a'o 'di dag dang bcas pa lnga ste gang gi phyir zla ba'i rkang pa la bcu gsum zla ba'i rkang par nga gsungs pa'o //
translated: These five are stated in the line of the moon, the thirteenth of the moon's digits.

original: nyi mar dus zhes gsungs pa'i phyir nyi ma'i rkang pa gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: nyi mar dus zhes gsungs pa'i phyir nyi ma'i rkang pa gsum gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the three lines of the sun are stated.

original: ring po'i dbye ba las zhes pa ni sdeb sbyor gyi ngor rtsa bar sva ha thung du'o //
analyzed: ring po'i dbye ba las zhes pa ni sdeb sbyor gyi ngor rtsa bar sva ha thung du'o //
translated: From the division of the long, in the context of prosody, the svaha is short.

original: de bzhin du aom sku'i zhal dang a'a: gsung gi zhal dang h'um thugs kyi zhal dang ho ye shes kyi zhal lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du aom sku'i zhal dang a'a: gsung gi zhal dang h'um thugs kyi zhal dang ho ye shes kyi zhal lo //
translated: Similarly, the om is the face of the body, the ah is the face of speech, the hum is the face of the mind, and the ho is the face of wisdom.

original: gzhan pa dag kyang de bzhin gzhom du med pa lnga pa ste gang gis gtso bo rgyas btab pa de nyid ni stod pa chen po 'gyur med lnga'o zhes pa ste des pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag kyang de bzhin gzhom du med pa lnga pa ste gang gis gtso bo rgyas btab pa de nyid ni stod pa chen po 'gyur med lnga'o zhes pa ste des pa'o //
translated: The others are also like that. The five that are invincible are the five immutable great seals, which are the seal of the main one. By that, the five immutable great seals are formed.

original: de bzhin du a'a sogs dang bcas zhes pa ni a'a la sogs pa dbyangs drug dang lhan cig tu hram yig drug ni ro rkang drug dang lhan cig na ma:sogs kyis yan lag drug tu 'gyur te aom hril'am na ma:/ aom hr'um sv'a h'a /🔽aom hri'u sv'a h'a/ aom hrir'am booshata /
analyzed: de bzhin du a'a sogs dang bcas zhes pa ni a'a la sogs pa dbyangs drug dang lhan cig tu hram yig drug ni ro rkang drug dang lhan cig na ma:sogs kyis yan lag drug tu 'gyur te aom hril'am na ma:/ aom hr'um sv'a h'a / aom hri'u sv'a h'a/ aom hrir'am booshata /
translated: Similarly, with the vowels means that the six hums together with the six vowels, the a and so on, are the six body parts together with the six body parts, the na and so on.🔽 Om hrīṃ laṃ namah🔽Om hrūṃ svāhā

original: aom hri'a h'um /
analyzed: aom hri'a h'um /
translated: Om hrīṃ svāhā🔽Om hrīṃ vauṣaṭ🔽Om hrīṃ hūṃ

original: aom hr'am bshata /🔽aom hra:phat ces pa grangs bzhin du snying kha dang mgo po dang @143a * //
analyzed: aom hr'am bshata / aom hra:phat ces pa grangs bzhin du snying kha dang mgo po dang @143a * //
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ phaṭ.🔽The mantra of the syllable hrīḥ itself, along with the sounds of earth, water, fire, wind, space, and wisdom, is for the heart, head,

original: gtsug tor dang go cha dang mig dang mtshon cha ste sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang stong pa dang ye shes kyi dbyangs dang bcas pa hram yig gi sngags nyid de de ltar yan lag drug go //
analyzed: gtsug tor dang go cha dang mig dang mtshon cha ste sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang stong pa dang ye shes kyi dbyangs dang bcas pa hram yig gi sngags nyid de de ltar yan lag drug go //
translated: crown protuberance, armor, eyes, and weapon, respectively. Thus, there are six branches.

original: de bzhin du phrem gi yi ge ni sna tshogs yum gyi sa bon no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phrem gi yi ge ni sna tshogs yum gyi sa bon no //
translated: Similarly, the syllable hrīḥ is the seed of Viśvamātā.

original: rgyal ba dus kyi 'khor lo shes rab dang bcas pa dag gi sngags ni hkshamlwam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba dus kyi 'khor lo shes rab dang bcas pa dag gi sngags ni hkshamlwam zhes pa'o //
translated: The mantra of the Victorious One, Kālacakra, along with his wisdom consort, is ha kṣa ma ḷaṃ.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid tha dad par bskyed pa'i slad du hum yig ye shes kyi sa bon te shes rab dang thabs so sor bskyed pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid tha dad par bskyed pa'i slad du hum yig ye shes kyi sa bon te shes rab dang thabs so sor bskyed pa'i slad du'o //
translated: The syllable hūṃ is the seed of wisdom for the generation of that very Bhagavān separately, for the generation of wisdom and method separately.

original: snying po dag kyang de bzhin du rgyal ba'i brtsegs pa'i sngags sngar gsungs pa aom a'a: hum ho zhes pa zhal bzhi dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: snying po dag kyang de bzhin du rgyal ba'i brtsegs pa'i sngags sngar gsungs pa aom a'a: hum ho zhes pa zhal bzhi dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The essence mantras are also like that. The previously stated mantra of the Victorious One’s Peak is oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ, along with the four faces.

original: hr'am yig la sogs yan lag drug po aom yig dang por gyur pa dang ldan pa ni bzlas pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyi nye ba'i snying po ste /
analyzed: hr'am yig la sogs yan lag drug po aom yig dang por gyur pa dang ldan pa ni bzlas pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyi nye ba'i snying po ste /
translated: The Bhagavān’s essence mantra for the purpose of recitation is the six-limbed mantra beginning with the syllable Oṃ, namely, HRAUM, HRAUM, HRIH, HRIH, HRIH, and HRAḤ.

original: aom hra'am hri'am hrir'am hri'uam hrila'm hra:zhes pa skyes pa'i rim pas las thams cad sgrub pa la ste drug po la sdud pa'i rim pas hril'am nas bzlas so //
analyzed: aom hra'am hri'am hrir'am hri'uam hrila'm hra:zhes pa skyes pa'i rim pas las thams cad sgrub pa la ste drug po la sdud pa'i rim pas hril'am nas bzlas so //
translated: By the process of generation, it accomplishes all activities. By the process of withdrawal, it is recited from HRAḤ.

original: lha dang lha mo rnams kyi phreng ba'i sngags ni de bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang lha mo rnams kyi phreng ba'i sngags ni de bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: The mantra garland of the deities and goddesses is otherwise.

original: de yang las kyi dbye ba du ma yis rnam pa mang bo tshig du ma dang ldan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang las kyi dbye ba du ma yis rnam pa mang bo tshig du ma dang ldan par shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be known to have many forms and many words by the many divisions of activity.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor 'dir ni sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te de'i yon tan dbang gis so zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor 'dir ni sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te de'i yon tan dbang gis so zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
translated: In this Cakrasaṃvara maṇḍala, it is of the nature of earth, etc., by the power of its qualities. This will be explained in the commentary.

original: de ltar rgyud gzhan thams cad la des pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyud gzhan thams cad la des pa'o //
translated: Thus it is in all other tantras.

original: da ni rin chen zhes pa la sogs pas lha rnams mchod pa gsungs pa 'dir sngar brjod pa'i cho gas lha rnams dmigs pa byas te de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dam tshig gi 'khor lo dang lhan cig gcig tu byas nas sngar gyi sngags kyi tshig
analyzed: da ni rin chen zhes pa la sogs pas lha rnams mchod pa gsungs pa 'dir sngar brjod pa'i cho gas lha rnams dmigs pa byas te de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dam tshig gi 'khor lo dang lhan cig gcig tu byas nas sngar gyi sngags kyi tshig
translated: Now, the worship of the deities is stated by “Now, jewels, etc.” Here, having visualized the deities by the rite stated previously, then the wisdom wheel together with the commitment wheel are made one, and the previously stated mantra words

original: rnams kyis mchod yon la sogs pa 'bul lo //
analyzed: rnams kyis mchod yon la sogs pa 'bul lo //

original: de nas mchod pa'i don du dang por tsandan la sogs pa'i dri bzung nas mthe bo dang ming med dag gis phyi rol du mandala byas la gtso bo la sogs pa rnams mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mchod pa'i don du dang por tsandan la sogs pa'i dri bzung nas mthe bo dang ming med dag gis phyi rol du mandala byas la gtso bo la sogs pa rnams mchod par bya'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of worship, first taking up the scent of sandalwood, etc., one should worship the principal one, etc., having made an external maṇḍala with the thumb and the ring finger.

original: thams cad kyi ming gi dang bor aom yig sbyin par bya ste las thams cad kyi mchod pa la ming gi mthar nam: zhes par 'gyur zhing las so so la ni rgyas pa la sogs pa la sv'a h'a mthar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi ming gi dang bor aom yig sbyin par bya ste las thams cad kyi mchod pa la ming gi mthar nam: zhes par 'gyur zhing las so so la ni rgyas pa la sogs pa la sv'a h'a mthar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should give the syllable Oṃ at the beginning of the name of all, and at the end of the name in the worship of all rites it becomes NAMAH. But in the individual rites, one should know that in the case of prosperity, etc., it ends with SVĀHĀ.

original: 'dir las thams cad la mchod @143b pa'i slad du lha rnams kyi sngags kyi tshig rnams ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las 'di sta ste /🔽aom bud dh'a ya na ma:/

original: dag pa gsum gyis zhes pa lus dang ngag dang sems dag pas rdzas dang bdag nyid bu dang bu mo dang bcas te gal te rang la med na rigs las skyes pa'i gzhon nu ma dbul bar bya'o //

translated: “With the three purities” means with the purity of body, speech, and mind. The substances and oneself, together with one’s son and daughter, should be offered. If one does not have them, a young maiden born into a good family should be offered.

translated: “I will give gifts to those who are poor” means that one who abides in the jewel lineage will give the ten types of gifts for the sake of the accumulation of merit.🔽The ten types of gifts are:🔽a wish-granting jewel,

original: ces pa ste /

translated: The aspiration is: By abiding in the wheel family, I will keep the five nectars and so forth, the cow, the bull, and the assembly of aggregates and faculties.🔽 The vow is: I will make offerings to the sword.

analyzed: gsal bar chu skyes rigs la ste padma'i rigs la gnas par gyur pas rigs dang rigs ma yin pa la mngon par 'gro bas gsal bar padma la reg pa las tshul khrims kyi sngom pa'i slad du tshangs par spyod pa'i sdom pa rnams ni bskyang bar bgyi zhes
translated: The aspiration is: By abiding in the lotus family, I will keep the vows of pure conduct for the sake of the discipline of touching the lotus with clarity, through going to the suitable and unsuitable.🔽 The vow is: I will keep the vows of pure conduct for the sake of the discipline of touching the lotus with clarity.🔽 The aspiration is: By abiding in the lotus family, I will keep the vows of pure conduct for the sake of the discipline of touching the lotus with clarity, through going to the suitable and unsuitable.

analyzed: pa'i smod lam gdab par bya'o //
translated: Make the aspiration prayer.🔽For the sake of the liberation of sentient beings, I will generate the great seal, which is the nature of emptiness and compassion, the attainment of enlightenment, in the family that produces the victors, in the family of the single-pronged vajra.

original: sems can rnams ni thar pa'i slad du rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la ste rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i rigs la gnas par gyur pas stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub byang chub bdag gis bskyed par bgyi'o zhes smon lam gdab

translated: Thus, make the aspiration prayer.

original: par bgyi'o // de ltar smon lam gdab pa byas pa'i tshe dbang bskur ba'i slad du gsol ba btab pa'i bla ma dgyes shing ma nyes par gyur pas slob ma dam pa khrus byas dri yis rjes byugs brtul zhugs nges pa dang ldan shar gyi ra ni /

translated: When one has made the aspiration prayer in that way, in order to confer the empowerment, the guru, who has been requested to confer the empowerment, is pleased and is not offended. The excellent disciple bathes, is anointed with perfume, and is endowed with the certainty of the vow.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du gzhag par bya zhing dngos grub don du so shing sngar brjod pa'i cho gas rgyal ba mchog gi rdo rje dag gis zhes pa aom a'a:hum 'di dag gis lam bdun mngon par bsngags pa byas te /

translated: One should place it outside the maṇḍala. For the sake of siddhi, one should chew the tooth stick with the previously described rite, and with the three syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ, which are the supreme victors’ vajras.

original: de nas @145b gsor nas mandala du dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas @145b gsor nas mandala du dor bar bya'o //

analyzed: phyogs brgyad rnams su zhi ba la sogs pa'i las sngar gsungs so //

translated: Then, having given the disciple three handfuls of water to drink and purified him, one should arrange a curtain around the maṇḍala, lead the disciple to the eastern side, and then place the five nectars on his tongue.

original: rgyal ba mchog gi dam tshig dag gis te bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga bo dag gis sngar spos bsgrub nas spos de nyid lha dbab pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba mchog gi dam tshig dag gis te bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga bo dag gis sngar spos bsgrub nas spos de nyid lha dbab pa'i don du'o //
translated: By the commitments of the supreme Victor, that is, by the five nectars and the five lamps, one should previously accomplish the incense, and that incense itself is for the purpose of the descent of the deity.

original: de la sngags ni h'um gi yi ge gcig ste aa ra la dad bcas pa zhes pa aom aa ra ra ra ra la la la la badzr'a pe sha ya h'um zhes pa'i sngags 'dis khro bo'i gtso bo bskul ba byas nas khro bo dbab bo zhes pa'i

translated: The mantra is the single syllable hūṃ, along with a ra la la, that is, the mantra oṃ ra ra ra ra la la la la vajra-peśa ya hūṃ. Having urged the chief of the wrathful ones with this mantra, one should cause the wrathful one to descend.

original: don to // 'di la bzlas pa bye ba dang sbyin sreg 'bum phrag bcus sngon du bsnyen pa bya'o //
analyzed: don to // 'di la bzlas pa bye ba dang sbyin sreg 'bum phrag bcus sngon du bsnyen pa bya'o //
translated: This means that one should perform the prior approximation with ten million repetitions and one hundred thousand fire sacrifices.
