analyzed: des 'grub par 'gyur te dran pa tsam gyis khro bo 'bebs bar byed do //
translated: By that, one will be successful, and by merely remembering it, one causes the descent of the wrathful one.

original: de la mtshan nyid ni tshigs su bcad pa brgyad cu rtsa brkyang pas gsungs pa 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ni tshigs su bcad pa brgyad cu rtsa brkyang pas gsungs pa 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the characteristics are stated in the eighty-verse hymn. It goes:

original: khro bo'i rgyal po phebs na mtshon chas mdzes pa'i lag pa dag gis bdud kyi tshogs la sdigs byed cing zhes pa ni 'dir slob dpon ma la khro bo'i rgyal po babs par gyur na mtshon chas mdzes par byas pa'i lag pa dag gis brtan pa dang g-yo
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po phebs na mtshon chas mdzes pa'i lag pa dag gis bdud kyi tshogs la sdigs byed cing zhes pa ni 'dir slob dpon ma la khro bo'i rgyal po babs par gyur na mtshon chas mdzes par byas pa'i lag pa dag gis brtan pa dang g-yo
translated: When the King of Wrath arrives, with hands beautiful with weapons he threatens the hosts of demons.

original: ba gang la bsnun pa de phye ma brgyar byed do //
analyzed: ba gang la bsnun pa de phye ma brgyar byed do //
translated: Here, when the King of Wrath arrives, with hands made beautiful with weapons he splits into a hundred pieces whatever is struck, whether🔽firm or moving.

original: bdud kyi tshogs chos la 'tshe bar byed pa gang la sdigs mdzub kyis bsdigs pa des la 'gyel bar byed cing sems med par byed do //
analyzed: bdud kyi tshogs chos la 'tshe bar byed pa gang la sdigs mdzub kyis bsdigs pa des la 'gyel bar byed cing sems med par byed do //
translated: With the threatening forefinger he threatens the hosts of demons who do harm to the Dharma, and they fall down and become senseless.

original: de bzhin du g-yon brkyang la sogs stabs rnams dang ni rnam mang byed pa rnams kyis rdo rje'i gar gyis gar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon brkyang la sogs stabs rnams dang ni rnam mang byed pa rnams kyis rdo rje'i gar gyis gar byed de /
translated: Thus, with the many actions of the left-extended and so forth, he dances with the dance of the vajra.

original: 'dir slob ma gang zhig sngar gar gyi mtshan nyid cung zad kyang mi shes pa de nyid khro bo phebs par gyur pa na rdo rje'i gar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir slob ma gang zhig sngar gar gyi mtshan nyid cung zad kyang mi shes pa de nyid khro bo phebs par gyur pa na rdo rje'i gar byed do //
translated: Here, whatever disciple does not know even a little of the characteristics of dance, when he is possessed by the King of Wrath, he dances with the dance of the vajra.

original: bar snang la yang rnam mang byed pa rnams kyis zhes pa gar byed do //
analyzed: bar snang la yang rnam mang byed pa rnams kyis zhes pa gar byed do //
translated: And in space, with many actions, he dances.🔽If he laughs, then at that time, with the syllable hum mixed in, he gives fear to the host of enemies, that is, of demons.

original: ci ste bzhad par byed na de'i tshe h'um gi yi ge 'dres pas dgra ste bdud kyi tshogs la 'jigs pa ster ba dang ni de bzhin du slob ma gang zhig sngar mi shes pha de khro bo phabs pa na mi la sogs pa rnams kyis rtogs par
analyzed: ci ste bzhad par byed na de'i tshe h'um gi yi ge 'dres pas dgra ste bdud kyi tshogs la 'jigs pa ster ba dang ni de bzhin du slob ma gang zhig sngar mi shes pha de khro bo phabs pa na mi la sogs pa rnams kyis rtogs par
translated: And likewise, whatever disciple, previously unknown, he causes to tremble, he should be understood by men and so forth.

original: bya ba mi yin pa'i sgras rgyud gzhan du ma las gang gsungs pa'i glu byed do //
analyzed: bya ba mi yin pa'i sgras rgyud gzhan du ma las gang gsungs pa'i glu byed do //
translated: By the word man, he sings the song that is taught in other tantras.

original: @146a * // de'i phyir khro bo'i rgyal po phebs pa ni ngo tsha med cing dogs pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @146a * // de'i phyir khro bo'i rgyal po phebs pa ni ngo tsha med cing dogs pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the descent of the King of Wrath is without shame and without fear.

original: yon tan dbang gis zhes pa khro bo'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: yon tan dbang gis zhes pa khro bo'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: By the power of his qualities, that is, by the nature of the wrathful one.

original: lha gzhan rnams kyang zhi ba'o zhes pa ni ci ste spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha yin na zhi ba'o zhes pa ste khro bo dbab pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: lha gzhan rnams kyang zhi ba'o zhes pa ni ci ste spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha yin na zhi ba'o zhes pa ste khro bo dbab pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: And the other gods are peaceful, that is, if they are the gods Locana and so forth, they are peaceful. This is the rule for the descent of the wrathful one.

original: 'dir yang rgya cher gzhan khro bo bcu po rnams kyi rang bzhin bcu po rnams ni phyag rgya bcing bas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang rgya cher gzhan khro bo bcu po rnams kyi rang bzhin bcu po rnams ni phyag rgya bcing bas rig par bya'o //
translated: Here also, the nature of the ten wrathful ones is to be known by the binding of the seals.

original: mtshan ma gang gis gang bskyed pa de yang de'i phyag gi phyag rgyar 'gyur te de ni des shes par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma gang gis gang bskyed pa de yang de'i phyag gi phyag rgyar 'gyur te de ni des shes par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: And the sign by which one is generated is also the seal of his hand; that is to be known by him. This is the definition.

original: da ni sku zhes pa la sogs pas khro bo'i rgyal po'am byang chub sems dpa'i sku la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlab pa gsungs pa 'dir sku phebs pa ni rnal 'byor ldan pa zhes pa lha'i sku rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs par gyur na rang bzhin yon tan
analyzed: da ni sku zhes pa la sogs pas khro bo'i rgyal po'am byang chub sems dpa'i sku la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlab pa gsungs pa 'dir sku phebs pa ni rnal 'byor ldan pa zhes pa lha'i sku rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs par gyur na rang bzhin yon tan
translated: Now, beginning with “body,” he teaches the consecration of the body, etc., of the king of wrathful ones or the bodhisattva. Here, the consecration of the body is that when the practitioner is consecrated by the body vajra of the deity, he becomes the nature of the body vajra.

original: dbang gis drag po dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyis slob ma sku'i bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: dbang gis drag po dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyis slob ma sku'i bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: By the power of the nature of the qualities, he performs the deeds of the body for the disciple by the nature of the fierce and the peaceful.

original: ji ltar khro bo dang byang chub sems dpa'i ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang sa 'og tu 'gro bar mdzad pa de bzhin du slob mas byed cing dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ma mthong pa bskyed par byed de mchog gi lha'i sku rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs
analyzed: ji ltar khro bo dang byang chub sems dpa'i ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang sa 'og tu 'gro bar mdzad pa de bzhin du slob mas byed cing dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ma mthong pa bskyed par byed de mchog gi lha'i sku rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs
translated: Just as the wrathful and bodhisattvas fly in the sky and travel under the earth, so too the disciples do, and they generate what is not seen, such as maṇḍalas, and so on.

original: par gyur pas ri bo 'byin pa la sogs pa sku'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: par gyur pas ri bo 'byin pa la sogs pa sku'i bya ba byed do //
translated: Since they are empowered by the supreme deity’s vajra body, they perform bodily actions, such as creating mountains.🔽Similarly, since they are empowered by the vajra speech, the disciples are empowered by the speech of the three existences, gods, nāgas, and demigods.

original: de bzhin du gsung phebs pas ni srid gsum lha dang klu dang lha min rnams las rnam par gyis brlabs pa'i slob ma rmongs pa yang 'jam dpal ji lta ba de gyis brlabs pa'i slob ma rmongs pa yang 'jam dpal ji lta ba de bzhin du 'gyur ro
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung phebs pas ni srid gsum lha dang klu dang lha min rnams las rnam par gyis brlabs pa'i slob ma rmongs pa yang 'jam dpal ji lta ba de gyis brlabs pa'i slob ma rmongs pa yang 'jam dpal ji lta ba de bzhin du 'gyur ro
translated: The disciples are empowered by the speech of Mañjuśrī, and they become just like Mañjuśrī.

original: zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: That is the definitive meaning.

original: de bzhin du mchog gi lha'i thugs phebs pas ni gzhan gyi snying la gnas pa thams cad dang 'das ba dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba ma mthong ba thams cad slob mas shes par 'gyur zhes pa thugs phebs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mchog gi lha'i thugs phebs pas ni gzhan gyi snying la gnas pa thams cad dang 'das ba dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba ma mthong ba thams cad slob mas shes par 'gyur zhes pa thugs phebs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Likewise, by the descent of the supreme deity's mind, the disciple will know all that is in the hearts of others, and all that has been unseen in the past, future, and present. This is the certainty of the descent of the mind.

original: ci ste skye ba snga ma'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis kha cig la ye shes phebs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste skye ba snga ma'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis kha cig la ye shes phebs par 'gyur te /
translated: If, by the power of the latent tendencies of past lives, the wisdom descends into some [disciples],

original: de'i tshe dkyil 'khor la 'grub par 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dkyil 'khor la 'grub par 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: at that time they will accomplish the maṇḍala and become buddhas.

original: bla ma yi yang bla ma zhes pa mngon par shes pa lnga thob pa dang sa bcu'i dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla ma yi yang bla ma zhes pa mngon par shes pa lnga thob pa dang sa bcu'i dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The guru of the guru is one who has attained the five higher perceptions and is a lord of the ten stages.

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni nye bar btags pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni nye bar btags pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The term buddha is a metaphorical designation.

original: rdzu 'phrul ldan pa'i ston pa gcig pu zhes pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ldan pa'i ston pa gcig pu zhes pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The sole teacher endowed with miraculous powers is also like that.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang @146b ye shes kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang @146b ye shes kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the consecration of body, speech, mind, and wisdom.

original: da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi byin gyis brlabs pa gsungs pa 'dir gang gi tshes phebs pas ni rnal 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi byin gyis brlabs pa gsungs pa 'dir gang gi tshes phebs pas ni rnal 'byor pa ste /
translated: Now, beginning with “Earth,” he explains the consecration of Locanā, etc. Here, if the yogī,

original: slob ma byin gyis brlabs par gyur na /
analyzed: slob ma byin gyis brlabs par gyur na /
translated: the disciple, is consecrated by the earth,

original: ri dang mtshungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ri dang mtshungs par 'gyur te /
translated: he becomes like a mountain,

original: mi brgya phrag du mas kyang bskyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: mi brgya phrag du mas kyang bskyod par mi nus so //
translated: incapable of being shaken by hundreds of men.

original: chus kyang bsil bar rab tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: chus kyang bsil bar rab tu 'gyur te /
translated: He also becomes cooled by water.

original: 'dir m'a ma k'i sa byin gyis brlabs pa'i rnal 'byor pas gang zhig sreg pa'i rims kyis bzung ba la 'khyud na yang de rims dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir m'a ma k'i sa byin gyis brlabs pa'i rnal 'byor pas gang zhig sreg pa'i rims kyis bzung ba la 'khyud na yang de rims dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, if the yogī is consecrated by Māmakī, and he embraces someone seized by the fever of passion, that person becomes free from fever.

original: me phebs bas ni sreg par 'gyur te 'dir gang gi tshe gos dkar mos byin gyis brlabs par gyur na /
analyzed: me phebs bas ni sreg par 'gyur te 'dir gang gi tshe gos dkar mos byin gyis brlabs par gyur na /
translated: He also becomes burning by fire. Here, if he is consecrated by Pāṇḍaravāsinī,

original: de'i tshe gang la reg pa de sreg par byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang la reg pa de sreg par byed do //
translated: then whatever he touches is burned.

original: ci ste rlung phebs pas byin gyis brlabs na de bzhin skam pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste rlung phebs pas byin gyis brlabs na de bzhin skam pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur te /
translated: If he is consecrated by Vāyu, he becomes dry.

original: gang la 'khyud pa de dpag tshad du ma rnams su skrod par byed do //
analyzed: gang la 'khyud pa de dpag tshad du ma rnams su skrod par byed do //
translated: Whoever is embraced by her is expelled for many yojanas.

original: de bzhin du stong pa phebs pas mi snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa phebs pas mi snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, by the descent of emptiness, one becomes invisible.

original: gang la reg pa de nyid mi snang bar 'gyur zhing sa steng du ni mkha' la spyod pa nyid du rab tu 'gyur zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: gang la reg pa de nyid mi snang bar 'gyur zhing sa steng du ni mkha' la spyod pa nyid du rab tu 'gyur zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Whoever touches her becomes invisible and becomes one who moves in the sky on the surface of the earth.🔽Thus, everything should be understood by the power of the nature of the qualities.

original: de bzhin thams cad rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis rig par bya ste 'dir gang gi tshe lha'i mig phebs par gyur na de'i tshe lha'i mchog gi gzugs dang mi mthong ba'i rdzas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin thams cad rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis rig par bya ste 'dir gang gi tshe lha'i mig phebs par gyur na de'i tshe lha'i mchog gi gzugs dang mi mthong ba'i rdzas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, when the divine eye descends, then one sees the form of the supreme deity and also substances that are invisible.

original: gang gi tshe lha'i rna ba phebs par gyur na de'i tshe sems can rnams kyi sgra gang mi thos pa de thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe lha'i rna ba phebs par gyur na de'i tshe sems can rnams kyi sgra gang mi thos pa de thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the divine ear descends, then one hears the sounds of sentient beings that were not heard before.

original: gang gi tshe lha'i yid phebs par gyur na de'i tshe gzhan gyi sems shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe lha'i yid phebs par gyur na de'i tshe gzhan gyi sems shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the divine mind descends, then one knows the minds of others.

original: gang gi tshe lha'i lus kyi dbang po phebs par gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lha'i lus kyi dbang po phebs par gyur na /
translated: When the divine body sense faculty descends,

original: de'i tshe lha'i reg bya 'dzin par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i tshe lha'i reg bya 'dzin par 'gyur zhing /
translated: At that time, one will apprehend the touch of the deity.

original: sngon gyi gnas shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will know one's former lives.

original: gang gi tshe lha'i lce phebs par gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lha'i lce phebs par gyur na /
translated: When the divine tongue enters,

original: de'i tshe lha'i ro myong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i tshe lha'i ro myong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: at that time one will experience the taste of the deity.

original: des nam mkha'i rdzu 'phrul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nam mkha'i rdzu 'phrul du 'gyur ro //
translated: One will have the magic power of space.

original: gang gi tshe lha'i sna phebs par gyur na de'i tshe lha'i dri 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lha'i sna phebs par gyur na de'i tshe lha'i dri 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: When the divine nose enters, at that time one will apprehend the smell of the deity.

original: des sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: des sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: One will be blessed by all the buddhas.

original: da ni dbab pa zhes pa la sogs pas lha dbab pa bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa 'dir lha dbab pa gang yin pa de ni nges par zhes pa mtha' @147a * //
analyzed: da ni dbab pa zhes pa la sogs pas lha dbab pa bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa 'dir lha dbab pa gang yin pa de ni nges par zhes pa mtha' @147a * //
translated: Now, beginning with “descent,” he teaches the characteristics of the generation of the descent of the deity.

original: gcig tu 'gyur te sngags pa slob dpon rnams kyi sgom pa'i stobs dang sngon du bsnyen pa'i dbye ba dang ni zhes pa chog sna tshogs pa dang / rnam mang dam tshig ste byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le la sogs pa bsrungs ba dang /
analyzed: gcig tu 'gyur te sngags pa slob dpon rnams kyi sgom pa'i stobs dang sngon du bsnyen pa'i dbye ba dang ni zhes pa chog sna tshogs pa dang / rnam mang dam tshig ste byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le la sogs pa bsrungs ba dang /
translated: They become one, by the power of the mantra master's meditation, and by the divisions of prior approximation, that is, by the various rites, and by the many kinds of pledges, that is, by guarding the bodhicitta drop and so forth.

original: de bzhin du sngags kyi bzlas ba la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang phebs par 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du na mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags kyi bzlas ba la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang phebs par 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du na mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And likewise, by the mantra repetitions and so forth, they enter the mandala, but not otherwise.

original: 'ga' zhig dag gi tshe bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas rnam par dag pa'i slob ma la ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dag gi tshe bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas rnam par dag pa'i slob ma la ste /
translated: Some, by the stages of the guru lineage, are pure disciples,

original: sangs rgyas ro myong byed pas bdud rtsi'i dbang las dkyil 'khor 'ga' zhig tu ni mchog gi bu la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ro myong byed pas bdud rtsi'i dbang las dkyil 'khor 'ga' zhig tu ni mchog gi bu la 'gyur ro //
translated: and by tasting the buddhahood, they become supreme sons from the nectar empowerment in some mandalas.

original: mi'i bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The lord of men is the Tibetan word for king.

original: rang byin brlab pas dman pa rnam mang srid pa rnams kyis sngags pa rnams la dngos grub yod ma yin ji srid 'og min gyi srid pa'i mthar thug pa'i par du de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang byin brlab pas dman pa rnam mang srid pa rnams kyis sngags pa rnams la dngos grub yod ma yin ji srid 'og min gyi srid pa'i mthar thug pa'i par du de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The inferior ones, who are many, do not have power in the world, up to the end of the world of Akaniṣṭha, as long as they do not have the consecration of self-consecration.

original: 'dir mchog rnams kyi dbab pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mchog rnams kyi dbab pa'o //
translated: Here, it is the descent of the supreme ones.

original: gzhan du 'byung bo dang srin po'i 'khor la sogs pa rnams kyi dbab pa ni mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du 'byung bo dang srin po'i 'khor la sogs pa rnams kyi dbab pa ni mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: Elsewhere, the descent of the retinue of bhūtas, rākṣasas, and so forth is infinite.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang bla ma'i bka'i mtshan nyid kyang le'u lnga pa'i ye shes grub pa las brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang bla ma'i bka'i mtshan nyid kyang le'u lnga pa'i ye shes grub pa las brjod par bya ste /
translated: Their characteristics and the characteristics of the guru's command should be stated in the chapter on the accomplishment of wisdom.

original: des na 'dir dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la de rnams ma gsungs so zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'dir dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la de rnams ma gsungs so zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, here, in the entry into the maṇḍala, they are not mentioned. This is the determination of the Bhagavān.

original: da ni phebs pa nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni phebs pa nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, the pacification of descent and so forth is stated.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe slob ma khro bo'i lha la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa de'i tshe slob dpon gyis cung zad mngon par 'dod pa'i bya ba dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe slob ma khro bo'i lha la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa de'i tshe slob dpon gyis cung zad mngon par 'dod pa'i bya ba dri bar bya'o //
translated: Here, when the disciple is empowered by the wrathful deities, etc., then the master should ask about the rite that is slightly desired.

original: de nas aom a'a:hum yi ge gsum gyis me tog mngon par bsngags te mgo bor sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas aom a'a:hum yi ge gsum gyis me tog mngon par bsngags te mgo bor sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, with the three syllables Om Ah Hum, one should consecrate the flower and give it to the disciple.

original: des phebs pa gtong zhing rang gi gnas su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des phebs pa gtong zhing rang gi gnas su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He should let the flower fall and go to his own place.

original: de ltar phebs pa gtong bar 'gyur te de nas phebs pa btang ba'i phyi nas mgo bor rgyal bas bsrung ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir mgo bor aom yig gis so //
analyzed: de ltar phebs pa gtong bar 'gyur te de nas phebs pa btang ba'i phyi nas mgo bor rgyal bas bsrung ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir mgo bor aom yig gis so //
translated: Thus, having let the flower fall, after that, on the head, with the syllable Om, as it is said, “protected by the Victor.”

original: snying khar hum yig gis so //
analyzed: snying khar hum yig gis so //
translated: On the heart, with the syllable Hum.

original: spyi gtsug ste gtsug tor du ham yig gis so zhes pa ni thabs kyi ste /
analyzed: spyi gtsug ste gtsug tor du ham yig gis so zhes pa ni thabs kyi ste /
translated: On the crown, that is, on the uṣṇīṣa, with the syllable Kṣa. This is the method.

original: rang gi rdo rje gsum gyis zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyis so //
analyzed: rang gi rdo rje gsum gyis zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyis so //
translated: With one’s three vajras, that is, with body, speech, and mind.

original: de bzhin du lte bar ho:yig gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lte bar ho:yig gis so //
translated: Likewise, on the navel, with the syllable Ho.

original: mgrin par a'a:yig gis so //
analyzed: mgrin par a'a:yig gis so //
translated: On the throat, with the syllable Āḥ.

original: gsang bar ksha: @147b yig gis so zhes pa ni shes rab kyi ste rang gi rdo rje gsum gyis zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyis so //
analyzed: gsang bar ksha: @147b yig gis so zhes pa ni shes rab kyi ste rang gi rdo rje gsum gyis zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyis so //
translated: The kṣa in the secret place is the wisdom [seal], and one's own three vajras are the body, speech, and mind.

original: 'dir ni gnyi ga'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i yul la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni gnyi ga'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i yul la'o //
translated: Here, [the three vajras] are the objects of both the body, speech, and mind vajras.

original: gzhan du ni h'um yig ring po gsung rdo rje dang thung du thugs rdo rje ste gang na yod pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni h'um yig ring po gsung rdo rje dang thung du thugs rdo rje ste gang na yod pa la'o //
translated: Elsewhere, the long hūṃ is the speech vajra, and the short [hūṃ] is the mind vajra, and one should understand [the three vajras] in terms of where [the hūṃ] is located.

original: de nas bsrung ba bya zhing lus la ser po'i gos dag byin te /
analyzed: de nas bsrung ba bya zhing lus la ser po'i gos dag byin te /
translated: Then, having performed the protection, one should give the disciple yellow garments,

original: mig ni bsgribs par gyur ba'i slob ma dkyil 'khor 'dir ni gzhug pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: mig ni bsgribs par gyur ba'i slob ma dkyil 'khor 'dir ni gzhug pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and having covered his eyes, he should be brought into this maṇḍala.

original: dang por kun rdzob don du brtul zhugs byang chub kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: dang por kun rdzob don du brtul zhugs byang chub kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du ste /
translated: First, for the sake of the relative [truth], [one should practice] the observances until the end of enlightenment.

original: kun rdzob ni bsod nams la sogs pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni bsod nams la sogs pa'i tshogs so //
translated: The relative [truth] is the accumulation of merit and so forth.

original: de'i don ni de'i don no //
analyzed: de'i don ni de'i don no //
translated: The meaning of that is the meaning of that.

original: rab mchog bgrod pa rnams la bgrod pa de rnams zhes pa la rab mchog ni rnam par gzigs la sogs pa dang skal ba bzang po la sh'akya thub pa'i mthar thug pa de bzhin gshegs pa bdun po rnams so //
analyzed: rab mchog bgrod pa rnams la bgrod pa de rnams zhes pa la rab mchog ni rnam par gzigs la sogs pa dang skal ba bzang po la sh'akya thub pa'i mthar thug pa de bzhin gshegs pa bdun po rnams so //
translated: The paths of those who are the best of the best are the paths of Vipaśyin and so on, and of Śākyamuni, the seventh Tathāgata, who is the last of the Fortunate Aeon.

original: de rnams kyi bgrod pa ni bsod nams dang tshul khrims dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bgrod pa ni bsod nams dang tshul khrims dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The paths of those are the accumulations of merit, morality, and wisdom.

original: de la bgrod pa ni rab mchog bgrod pa rnams la bgrod pa ste /
analyzed: de la bgrod pa ni rab mchog bgrod pa rnams la bgrod pa ste /
translated: The paths of those are the paths of the best of the best.

original: de nyid slob dpon gyis slob ma la sbyin par bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid slob dpon gyis slob ma la sbyin par bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The Master should give that to the disciple, this is the Tathāgata's determination.

original: de la brtul zhugs rnams ni byang chub kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'tshe dang mi bden gzhan gyi bud med spang bya gzhan gyi nor dang chang gi btung ba de bzhin nyid ces pa ste /
analyzed: de la brtul zhugs rnams ni byang chub kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'tshe dang mi bden gzhan gyi bud med spang bya gzhan gyi nor dang chang gi btung ba de bzhin nyid ces pa ste /
translated: The observances are the five observances taught by the Blessed One up to the end of enlightenment: Abandon killing, untruth, the wives of others, the wealth of others, and the intoxicants, just as they are.

original: brtul zhugs lnga'i nges pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: brtul zhugs lnga'i nges pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this is the determination of the five observances.

original: gang las ci'i phyir zhe na 'khor bar rdo rje'i zhags pa dag ste rang gi dge ba 'joms byed sdig pa'i las lnga po 'di rnams so de'i phyir mi bya'o zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: gang las ci'i phyir zhe na 'khor bar rdo rje'i zhags pa dag ste rang gi dge ba 'joms byed sdig pa'i las lnga po 'di rnams so de'i phyir mi bya'o zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: From what? For what reason? These five actions of sin, which destroy one's virtue, are the vajra fetters in cyclic existence. Therefore, one should not do them. This is the determination.

original: sna tshogs gtso bo su zhig gi zhe na gang zhig gang gi dus su byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa lha dang mi yi bla ma de yi mtshan gyis rab sbyin bya /
analyzed: sna tshogs gtso bo su zhig gi zhe na gang zhig gang gi dus su byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa lha dang mi yi bla ma de yi mtshan gyis rab sbyin bya /
translated: What is the name of the various chief ones? The name of the Tathagata who appears at that time, the teacher of gods and men, should be given.

original: sna tshogs gtso bo'i bka' 'di srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa dag ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs gtso bo'i bka' 'di srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa dag ste /
translated: This is the command of the various chief ones, which conquers the fears of existence.

original: khyod kyis kyang ni bskyang bar bya zhes pa ni rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo rnams kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi slad du bskyangs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang ni bskyang bar bya zhes pa ni rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo rnams kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi slad du bskyangs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du'o zhes pa ste /
translated: You also should protect. This is like the protection of sons and daughters of good family for the sake of the accumulation of merit.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pas bslab pa'i gnas lnga dang ldan pa'o //🔽de nas gal te 'dod na de'i tshe gzhan @148a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pas bslab pa'i gnas lnga dang ldan pa'o // de nas gal te 'dod na de'i tshe gzhan @148a * //
translated: Thus, by the determination of the Tathagata, one should possess the five points of training.

original: rnams sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rnams sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, if one wishes, at that time one should give to others.

original: de la che lo dang kha na ma tho bcas pa'i zas sngar brjod pa dang tshig ngan klog pa dang 'byung po'i chos pha mes kyi bya ba dang mchod sbyin gyi bya ba rig byed las brjod ba dang lha min gyi chos ni kla klo'i chos te mi
analyzed: de la che lo dang kha na ma tho bcas pa'i zas sngar brjod pa dang tshig ngan klog pa dang 'byung po'i chos pha mes kyi bya ba dang mchod sbyin gyi bya ba rig byed las brjod ba dang lha min gyi chos ni kla klo'i chos te mi
translated: the dharma of asuras, which is the dharma of barbarians.🔽The first five of the ten nonvirtues of the past and future are not to be done at all times:🔽killing cows,🔽killing children,🔽killing women,

original: bya'o zhes pa nye ba'i sdig pa lnga dang de bzhin du snga ma dang phyi ma bcu po rnams kyi dang po gsod pa lnga dus thams cad du mi bya ste ba lang gsod pa dang byis pa gsod pa dang bud med gsod pa dang skyes pa gsod
analyzed: bya'o zhes pa nye ba'i sdig pa lnga dang de bzhin du snga ma dang phyi ma bcu po rnams kyi dang po gsod pa lnga dus thams cad du mi bya ste ba lang gsod pa dang byis pa gsod pa dang bud med gsod pa dang skyes pa gsod
translated: killing men,

original: pa dang / lha mi'i bla ma zhes pa ni sku gzugs dang mchod rten la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pa dang / lha mi'i bla ma zhes pa ni sku gzugs dang mchod rten la sogs pa ste /
translated: and killing the gurus of gods and humans, which refers to destroying images, stupas and so forth.

original: rnam par bshig pa ni gsod pa gzhan no //
analyzed: rnam par bshig pa ni gsod pa gzhan no //
translated: Destroying is another type of killing.

original: de bzhin du grogs po la 'khu ba dang rje bo la 'khu ba dang sangs rgyas la 'khu ba dang dge 'dun la 'khu ba dang / yid brtan la 'khu ba zhes pa lnga mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du grogs po la 'khu ba dang rje bo la 'khu ba dang sangs rgyas la 'khu ba dang dge 'dun la 'khu ba dang / yid brtan la 'khu ba zhes pa lnga mi bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should not betray a friend, a master, a Buddha, a Saṅgha, or a confidant.

original: de bzhin du dbang po rnams ni kun nas chags pa dag ste zhes pa ni gzugs la kun nas chags pa dang sgra la kun nas chags pa dang dri la kun nas chags pa dang / ro la kun nas chags pa dang reg la kun nas chags pa dang lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po rnams ni kun nas chags pa dag ste zhes pa ni gzugs la kun nas chags pa dang sgra la kun nas chags pa dang dri la kun nas chags pa dang / ro la kun nas chags pa dang reg la kun nas chags pa dang lnga'o //
translated: Likewise, the senses are completely attached, that is, attached to form, attached to sound, attached to smell, attached to taste, and attached to touch.

original: srid pa'i bdag po rdo rje sems dpa'i nges pa'i brtul zhugs nyi shu lnga ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i bdag po rdo rje sems dpa'i nges pa'i brtul zhugs nyi shu lnga ste /
translated: The lord of existence is Vajrasattva, whose definite observances are twenty-five.

original: slob ma rnams kyis bskyang bar bya zhing rdo rje slob dpon gyis dbang gi dus su slob ma la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma rnams kyis bskyang bar bya zhing rdo rje slob dpon gyis dbang gi dus su slob ma la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: They are to be observed by the disciples and given to the disciples by the vajra master at the time of initiation.

original: brtul zhugs sbyin pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs sbyin pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of giving the observances.

original: da ni dpal ldan sngags zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa gsungs te 'dir dang por brtul zhugs byin pa'i de ma thag tu las thams cad pa la gos ser po'am gos dmar pos gdong bcing bar bya zhing zhi ba la sogs pa la lha'i
analyzed: da ni dpal ldan sngags zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa gsungs te 'dir dang por brtul zhugs byin pa'i de ma thag tu las thams cad pa la gos ser po'am gos dmar pos gdong bcing bar bya zhing zhi ba la sogs pa la lha'i
translated: Now, beginning with “the glorious mantra,” he explains the entry into the maṇḍala. Here, immediately after the bestowal of the observances, one should bind the face of the one who is to be initiated with a yellow or red cloth for all activities, and for pacifying, etc., with a thin cloth the color of the deity.

original: kha dog gi mdog can gyi gos srab mos te aom dv'a da sh'am ga ni ro dha k'a ri ne hum phat ces 'dis bsngags nas so //
analyzed: kha dog gi mdog can gyi gos srab mos te aom dv'a da sh'am ga ni ro dha k'a ri ne hum phat ces 'dis bsngags nas so //
translated: With the mantra “Oṃ dvāṣaṣaṇirodhakāriṇi huṃ phaṭ,”

original: de nas dang por mig bkab nas dge ba'i grogs la sogs pas dkyil 'khor la lan gsum bskor te /
analyzed: de nas dang por mig bkab nas dge ba'i grogs la sogs pas dkyil 'khor la lan gsum bskor te /
translated: then, first, having covered the eyes, one should circumambulate the maṇḍala three times with the spiritual friend, etc.

original: de nas shar gyi sgor slob dpon gtso bo'i gzugs su gnas pas te gal te dkyil 'khor la lha g-yon brkyang la sogs pa'i stabs kyis bzhengs pa yin na de'i tshe slob dpon bzhengs pas slob ma la dbang bskur sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas shar gyi sgor slob dpon gtso bo'i gzugs su gnas pas te gal te dkyil 'khor la lha g-yon brkyang la sogs pa'i stabs kyis bzhengs pa yin na de'i tshe slob dpon bzhengs pas slob ma la dbang bskur sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, at the eastern door, the master, abiding in the form of the principal deity, if the deities in the maṇḍala are standing in the posture of the left leg extended, then the master, standing, should bestow the initiation on the disciple.

original: ci ste bzhugs pa yin na de'i tshe bzhugs pas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste bzhugs pa yin na de'i tshe bzhugs pas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If he is present, then he should be given while he is present.

original: de nas dge @148b pa'i grogs kyis gtad pa'i slob ma'i mgo bo la dung gi chus bsang gtor byas te aom a'a:hum zhes pa yi ge gsum gyis lan bdun mngon par bsngags pa'i me tog gcig de'i lag pa'i padma sbyar bar kun du sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas dge @148b pa'i grogs kyis gtad pa'i slob ma'i mgo bo la dung gi chus bsang gtor byas te aom a'a:hum zhes pa yi ge gsum gyis lan bdun mngon par bsngags pa'i me tog gcig de'i lag pa'i padma sbyar bar kun du sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Then, having sprinkled the disciple's head with water from the conch, one should give him a flower anointed with the three syllables, OṂ, AḤ, and HŪṂ, seven times, in the joined palms of his lotus hand.

original: me tog gi snyim pa rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: me tog gi snyim pa rnam par dag pas so //
translated: With the pure cupped hands of the flower.

original: de nas lag pa'i padma sbyar ba dag las dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du rgyal ba'i bum pa'i steng du sngar brjod pa'i nges pas me tog dor ba dang dus gcig tu mig gi dar dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lag pa'i padma sbyar ba dag las dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du rgyal ba'i bum pa'i steng du sngar brjod pa'i nges pas me tog dor ba dang dus gcig tu mig gi dar dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Then, from the joined palms of the lotus hand, outside the maṇḍala, on the top of the victorious vase, at the same time as the flower is cast, the blindfold should be removed, according to the previously stated rule.

original: yang na sngar me tog dor ba byas la phyi nas dgrol bar bya ste aom di byin tri y'a nu ta gh'a ta ya sv'a h'a zhes pa'i sngags 'dis so //
analyzed: yang na sngar me tog dor ba byas la phyi nas dgrol bar bya ste aom di byin tri y'a nu ta gh'a ta ya sv'a h'a zhes pa'i sngags 'dis so //
translated: Or else, having previously cast the flower, later it should be removed, with this mantra: OṂ Dīpyajvālanūtathāgata SVĀHĀ.

original: mig dbye ba byas nas gang gi gnas su me tog bzang po yi ge gsum gyis mngon par bsngags pa lhung ba der gnas pa'i lha ni de'i rigs kyi lhar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig dbye ba byas nas gang gi gnas su me tog bzang po yi ge gsum gyis mngon par bsngags pa lhung ba der gnas pa'i lha ni de'i rigs kyi lhar 'gyur te /
translated: Having opened the eyes, the deity who is in the place where the good flower falls, consecrated with the three syllables, is the deity of that family.

original: de'i las kyi phyag rgyas 'grub bo zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i las kyi phyag rgyas 'grub bo zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: That is accomplished by the action seal of that, is the determination.

original: de nas de'i rigs kyi lha bstan te phyi nas chu la sogs pa dbang bdun po rnams dang rnam gsum 'dir ni ji bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa ste der las kyi phyag rgya mchod nas so //
analyzed: de nas de'i rigs kyi lha bstan te phyi nas chu la sogs pa dbang bdun po rnams dang rnam gsum 'dir ni ji bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa ste der las kyi phyag rgya mchod nas so //
translated: Then, having shown the deity of that family, afterwards the seven empowerments beginning with the water empowerment, and the three, here just as they are, the vase empowerment, etc., having worshipped with the action seal there.

original: bla med 'chad par 'gyur pa yang dag rab sbyin bya zhes pa slob dpon gyis te de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: bla med 'chad par 'gyur pa yang dag rab sbyin bya zhes pa slob dpon gyis te de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The unsurpassed, which will be explained, is to be given perfectly, by the master. That is the determination of the Tathagata.

original: da ni klu zhes pa la sogs pas dbang bdun gyi cho ga gsungs te 'dir klu zhes pa brgyad dang bzhi'i rgyal dang rnam rgyal bum pa dag gis zhes pa ni bum pa brgyad kyi phyogs la rgyal ba'i bum pa lnga dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa
analyzed: da ni klu zhes pa la sogs pas dbang bdun gyi cho ga gsungs te 'dir klu zhes pa brgyad dang bzhi'i rgyal dang rnam rgyal bum pa dag gis zhes pa ni bum pa brgyad kyi phyogs la rgyal ba'i bum pa lnga dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa
translated: Now, the seven initiations are stated beginning with “nāga,” and so on. Here, “with the eight and four victory vases and the victory vases and the completely victorious vases” means that in the case of eight vases, there are five victory vases and five completely victorious vases.

original: lngas so // bum pa bzhi'i phyogs la rgyal ba'i bum pa gsum dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa gsum gyis te ;
analyzed: lngas so // bum pa bzhi'i phyogs la rgyal ba'i bum pa gsum dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa gsum gyis te ;
translated: In the case of four vases, there are three victory vases and three completely victorious vases.

original: nor bu gser gyi rang bzhin nam de med nas yi rang bzhin rin chen dang bcas pa sman dang dri dang ldan pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu gser gyi rang bzhin nam de med nas yi rang bzhin rin chen dang bcas pa sman dang dri dang ldan pa zhes pa'o //
translated: They are “filled with jewels and gold or, if they are not available, with silver, filled with jewels, with medicine and scent.”

original: de la sman ni sngar gsungs pa'i dri'i le tshe sbyar ba las mig ces pa la sogs pa'i cha shas kyis gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la sman ni sngar gsungs pa'i dri'i le tshe sbyar ba las mig ces pa la sogs pa'i cha shas kyis gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The medicine is the previously mentioned scent drop, which is to be taken with the parts of the verse beginning with “eye,” and so on.

original: slob dpon gyis rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas nyi shu rtsa lnga po rnams kyi nang nas ji ltar rnyed pa lnga gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas nyi shu rtsa lnga po rnams kyi nang nas ji ltar rnyed pa lnga gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The master should take five of the twenty-five [types of women] that are mentioned in the root tantra, whichever are available.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: dri yi le tshe sbyar ba la //
analyzed: dri yi le tshe sbyar ba la //
translated: In the square of scents,

original: rgyal po tshangs ma la sogs sman //
analyzed: rgyal po tshangs ma la sogs sman //
translated: the medicines of Brahmaṇī and so forth,🔽the parts of Candra, Agni, and so forth,

original: mig zla me sogs cha shas dang // lnga lnga yis ni rim pas dgod //🔽tshangs @149a * //
analyzed: mig zla me sogs cha shas dang // lnga lnga yis ni rim pas dgod // tshangs @149a * //
translated: are arranged in order by fives.🔽Brahmaṇī, Nārāyaṇī, Caṇḍī,🔽Īśvarī, Īśvarīvara,

original: ma sred med drag mo dang // dbang phyug mchog gi dbang phyug ma //
analyzed: ma sred med drag mo dang // dbang phyug mchog gi dbang phyug ma //
translated: Indrāṇī, Śrī, Vārāhī,

original: dbang mo dpal mo phag mo dang // gzhon nu tsartsi k'a de bzhin //
analyzed: dbang mo dpal mo phag mo dang // gzhon nu tsartsi k'a de bzhin //
translated: and likewise the maiden Cārucārucāruṇḍā.🔽Earth, water, fire,

original: sa mo chu mo me mo dang // rlung mo mkha' spyod ma de bzhin //
analyzed: sa mo chu mo me mo dang // rlung mo mkha' spyod ma de bzhin //
translated: wind, and likewise the sky-goer,🔽mother, sister, daughter,

original: ma dang sring mo bu mo dang // tsha mo rang skyes ma de bzhin //
analyzed: ma dang sring mo bu mo dang // tsha mo rang skyes ma de bzhin //
translated: niece, and likewise the naturally arisen,

original: bram ze rgyal rigs rje rigs mo //
analyzed: bram ze rgyal rigs rje rigs mo //
translated: the brahmin woman, the kṣatriya woman, the vaiśya woman,

original: dmangs mo g-yung mo de bzhin bshad //
analyzed: dmangs mo g-yung mo de bzhin bshad //
translated: the śūdra woman, and likewise the prostitute.

original: ces pa'i sman ni dngos grub che //
analyzed: ces pa'i sman ni dngos grub che //
translated: These medicines are for great powers.

original: zos pas rtag tu rdzu 'phrul ster //
analyzed: zos pas rtag tu rdzu 'phrul ster //
translated: By eating it, one always obtains magical power.

original: zhes pa'o // da ni 'di rnams kyi rab tu gsal ba'i ming brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // da ni 'di rnams kyi rab tu gsal ba'i ming brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the names of these [consorts] should be stated clearly.

original: 'dir tshangs ma zhes pa ni brahma dandi ste cha gnyis dang sred med ma ni bishnu k'ant'a ste cha gcig dang drag mo zhes pa ru ta dza t'a ste cha gsum dang dbang phyug ma ni rab tu grags pa ste cha bzhi dang mchog gi dbang phyug ma
analyzed: 'dir tshangs ma zhes pa ni brahma dandi ste cha gnyis dang sred med ma ni bishnu k'ant'a ste cha gcig dang drag mo zhes pa ru ta dza t'a ste cha gsum dang dbang phyug ma ni rab tu grags pa ste cha bzhi dang mchog gi dbang phyug ma
translated: Here, Brahmi is Brahmadandi, with two parts. Narayani is Vishnukanta, with one part. Rudra is Rudrajata, with three parts. Ishvari is well-known, with four parts. Parama-Ishvari

original: ni de ba d'a li ste cha lnga'o zhes pa dang po'i dgod pa'o //
analyzed: ni de ba d'a li ste cha lnga'o zhes pa dang po'i dgod pa'o //
translated: is Devadali, with five parts. This is the first arrangement.🔽Then, the second should be stated. Indra is Indravayu, with three parts. Shri is Lakshana, with four parts. Varahi is Varahakarna, with five parts. Kumari is Kumari,

original: de nas gnyis pa brjod par bya ste dbang mo zhes pa ni aintra b'a ru ni ste cha gsum dang dpal mo ni la ksha na ste cha bzhi dang phag mo zhes ba ni ba r'a ha karnna ste cha lnga dang gzhon nu ma zhes pa ni ka
analyzed: de nas gnyis pa brjod par bya ste dbang mo zhes pa ni aintra b'a ru ni ste cha gsum dang dpal mo ni la ksha na ste cha bzhi dang phag mo zhes ba ni ba r'a ha karnna ste cha lnga dang gzhon nu ma zhes pa ni ka
translated: with six parts. This is the second arrangement.

original: ra ni ka ste cha gnyis dang tsartsi k'a zhes pa ni aa dho pushpi ka ste cha gcig go zhes pa ni gnyis pa lnga dgod pa'o //
analyzed: ra ni ka ste cha gnyis dang tsartsi k'a zhes pa ni aa dho pushpi ka ste cha gcig go zhes pa ni gnyis pa lnga dgod pa'o //
translated: Ra means two parts, and Cārikā means one part, Aḍhopuṣpikā. This is the second placement of five.

original: de nas gsum pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas gsum pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Then the third should be stated.

original: sa mo zhes pa ni mu sha l'i ste /
analyzed: sa mo zhes pa ni mu sha l'i ste /
translated: Earth means Muśalā,

original: cha lnga dang chu mo zhes pa ni ru dant'i ste /
analyzed: cha lnga dang chu mo zhes pa ni ru dant'i ste /
translated: five parts. Water means Rudantā,

original: cha gnyis dang me mo zhes pa ni dzyo tishma t'i ste /
analyzed: cha gnyis dang me mo zhes pa ni dzyo tishma t'i ste /
translated: two parts. Fire means Jyotiṣmatī,

original: cha gcig dang rlung mo ni ladzdz'a lu ste /
analyzed: cha gcig dang rlung mo ni ladzdz'a lu ste /
translated: one part. Wind means Lajaṭī,

original: cha gsum dang mkha' spyod ma ni aarka ste cha bzhi'o zhes pa ni gsum pa lnga'o //
analyzed: cha gsum dang mkha' spyod ma ni aarka ste cha bzhi'o zhes pa ni gsum pa lnga'o //
translated: three parts. Sky-goer means Arka, four parts. This is the third placement of five.

original: de nas bzhi pa dgod pa brjod par bya ste ma zhes pa ni pu tram dz'a ri ste /
analyzed: de nas bzhi pa dgod pa brjod par bya ste ma zhes pa ni pu tram dz'a ri ste /
translated: Then the fourth placement should be stated. Mother means Putrajāri,

original: cha gcig dang sring mo zhes pa ni sa ha de ba ste cha gsum dang bu mo ni kri t'anydza li ste cha bzhi dang tsha mo ni aa dza karnna ste cha lnga dang rangs skyes ma ni mo ha n'i ba ta ba tri k'a ste cha gnyis
analyzed: cha gcig dang sring mo zhes pa ni sa ha de ba ste cha gsum dang bu mo ni kri t'anydza li ste cha bzhi dang tsha mo ni aa dza karnna ste cha lnga dang rangs skyes ma ni mo ha n'i ba ta ba tri k'a ste cha gnyis
translated: one part. Sister means Sahādevī, three parts. Daughter means Kṛtāñjalī, four parts. Niece means Ajākarṇā, five parts. Cousin means Mohanī, two parts.

original: so zhes pa ni bzhi pa lnga'o //
analyzed: so zhes pa ni bzhi pa lnga'o //
translated: The sa is the fourth and fifth.

original: de nas lnga pa dgod pa brjod par bya ste bram ze mo zhes pa ni bri ha t'i ste cha bzhi dang rgyal rigs mo zhes pa ni bhri ga r'a dz'a ste cha lnga dang rje rigs mo ni shing da ngar te cha gnyis dang /
analyzed: de nas lnga pa dgod pa brjod par bya ste bram ze mo zhes pa ni bri ha t'i ste cha bzhi dang rgyal rigs mo zhes pa ni bhri ga r'a dz'a ste cha lnga dang rje rigs mo ni shing da ngar te cha gnyis dang /
translated: Then the fifth arrangement should be stated: Brahmin woman is brihatī, four parts; kṣatriya woman is bṛigirā, five parts; vaiśya woman is śiṅgāṇī, two parts;

original: dmangs rigs mo ni kanda k'a ri ste cha gcig dang g-yung mo ni me yu ri shi kh'a ste /
analyzed: dmangs rigs mo ni kanda k'a ri ste cha gcig dang g-yung mo ni me yu ri shi kh'a ste /
translated: śūdra woman is kaṇḍalī, one part; outcaste woman is meṣi,

original: cha gsum mo zhes pa lnga pa dgod pa'o //
analyzed: cha gsum mo zhes pa lnga pa dgod pa'o //
translated: three parts.

original: de bzhin du grangs ji lta bas so pa la sogs pa 'bru'i tshogs rnams te so ba dang so ba chen po dang / mon sran dang @149b tsa na ka dkar po dang til nag po ni dang po lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du grangs ji lta bas so pa la sogs pa 'bru'i tshogs rnams te so ba dang so ba chen po dang / mon sran dang @149b tsa na ka dkar po dang til nag po ni dang po lnga'o //
translated: Thus, according to the number, the groups of grains such as soba and so on are the first five: soba, great soba, beans, white chanaka, and black sesame.

original: gnyis pa ni kota b'a dang mud ga dang sran ma dang til dkar po dang gro'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni kota b'a dang mud ga dang sran ma dang til dkar po dang gro'o //
translated: The second is koṭavā, mudga, beans, white sesame, and wheat.

original: gsum pa ni mooshtha dang tri pu ta dang yungs nag dang nas dang mon sran no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mooshtha dang tri pu ta dang yungs nag dang nas dang mon sran no //
translated: The third is mośṭha, tripuṭa, black mustard, barley, and lentils.

original: bzhi pa ni sran chung dang nyungs kar dang kam gu dang tu ba ri ka dang bar ba ti k'a'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sran chung dang nyungs kar dang kam gu dang tu ba ri ka dang bar ba ti k'a'o //
translated: The fourth is mung beans, mustard seeds, kamangu, turmerika, and vartikaka.

original: lnga pa ni zar ma dang ba ra t'i dang barnn'a dang ku lan tha dang tsa na ka nag po ste le tshe sbyar ba'i chas 'bru lnga ji ltar rnyed pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni zar ma dang ba ra t'i dang barnn'a dang ku lan tha dang tsa na ka nag po ste le tshe sbyar ba'i chas 'bru lnga ji ltar rnyed pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The fifth is hemp, barati, barna, kulattha, and black chana. One should obtain the five grains, which are the parts of the combination of the squares, as much as one can get.

original: 'dir cha rnams ni ril bu'i grangs so //
analyzed: 'dir cha rnams ni ril bu'i grangs so //
translated: Here, the parts are the number of pills.

original: de nas rin po che rnams ni bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang mthar skyes kyi rigs las skyes pa'i rdo rje rnams dang de bzhin du aindra n'i la dang padma r'a ga dang zla ba chu shel dang / ka ra ke ta ka dang ma ra ka ta ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de nas rin po che rnams ni bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang mthar skyes kyi rigs las skyes pa'i rdo rje rnams dang de bzhin du aindra n'i la dang padma r'a ga dang zla ba chu shel dang / ka ra ke ta ka dang ma ra ka ta ni gtso bo'o //
translated: Then, the jewels are the vajras born from the brahmin caste, the kṣatriya caste, the vaiśya caste, the śūdra caste, and the lowest caste, and similarly, the chief ones are sapphire, ruby, moonstone, cat’s eye, and emerald.

original: de bzhin du lcags rnams ni gser dang dngul dang zangs dang lcags rnon po dang / khab len gyi lcags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lcags rnams ni gser dang dngul dang zangs dang lcags rnon po dang / khab len gyi lcags so //
translated: Likewise, the metals are gold, silver, copper, sharp iron, and lodestone.

original: de bzhin du rin po che 'bring po ni mu tig dang byi ru dang mu men dang / sh'u la ma ni dang thig le drug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rin po che 'bring po ni mu tig dang byi ru dang mu men dang / sh'u la ma ni dang thig le drug pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the medium jewels are pearl, coral, sapphire, śālmali, and tilaka.

original: de bzhin du tha ma rnams ni shel dang rdz'i ba dz'a ti dang doo ha ri dang mching bu dang nor bu ljang khu rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tha ma rnams ni shel dang rdz'i ba dz'a ti dang doo ha ri dang mching bu dang nor bu ljang khu rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the inferior ones are crystal, vaidurya, dohari, cat’s eye, and green gem.

original: 'di rnams las ji ltar 'byor pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams las ji ltar 'byor pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should take whichever of these is available.

original: ci ste bka'i 'khor los sgyur pa rin po che chen po'i dbang bskur ba la ni lha dang klu rnams kyi rin po che kha dog lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste bka'i 'khor los sgyur pa rin po che chen po'i dbang bskur ba la ni lha dang klu rnams kyi rin po che kha dog lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is the consecration of the great jewel cakravartin, the jewels of the gods and nāgas will be five-colored.

original: de med na kha dog lnga'i me tog dri bzang bo rnams so zhes pa nges pa ste dbul po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de med na kha dog lnga'i me tog dri bzang bo rnams so zhes pa nges pa ste dbul po rnams kyi'o //
translated: If that is not available, then flowers of five colors with a good smell. This is the rule for the poor.

original: de bzhin du sa'i rang bzhin rin chen bcas zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa'i rang bzhin rin chen bcas zhes so //
translated: Similarly, “the earth nature with jewels” and so on.

original: 'dir rin po che ljang khu ni rnam par rgyal ba'i dung la'o //
analyzed: 'dir rin po che ljang khu ni rnam par rgyal ba'i dung la'o //
translated: Here, the green gem is for the victorious conch.

original: rin po che sngon po ni shar dang nub kyi rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la'o //
analyzed: rin po che sngon po ni shar dang nub kyi rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la'o //
translated: The blue jewel is in the eastern and western vases of Jina and Vijaya.

original: nag po ni shar dang me'i bum pa la'o //
analyzed: nag po ni shar dang me'i bum pa la'o //
translated: The black one is in the eastern and southern vases of Indra and Agni.

original: dmar po ni lho dang bden bral gyi bum pa la'o //
analyzed: dmar po ni lho dang bden bral gyi bum pa la'o //
translated: The red one is in the southern and southwestern vases of Yama and Rakshasa.

original: dkar po ni byang dang dbang ldan gyi bum pa la'o //
analyzed: dkar po ni byang dang dbang ldan gyi bum pa la'o //
translated: The white one is in the northern and northeastern vases of Kubera and Ishana.

original: ser po ni nub dang rlung gi bum pa la'o //
analyzed: ser po ni nub dang rlung gi bum pa la'o //
translated: The yellow one is in the western and northwestern vases of Varuna and Vayu.

original: de bzhin du khab len gyi lcags dang / lcags rnon po dang / zangs dang dngul dang gser ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du khab len gyi lcags dang / lcags rnon po dang / zangs dang dngul dang gser ro //
translated: Similarly, the iron filings are iron, sharp iron, copper, silver, and gold.

original: de bzhin du sman rnams te cha gcig pa ni rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sman rnams te cha gcig pa ni rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la'o //
translated: Similarly, the herbs are in the vases of Jina and Vijaya.

original: cha gnyis pa ni shar dang mer ro //
analyzed: cha gnyis pa ni shar dang mer ro //
translated: The two-part one is in the eastern and southern vases of Indra and Agni.

original: cha gsum pa ni gshin rje dang lha min du'o //
analyzed: cha gsum pa ni gshin rje dang lha min du'o //
translated: The three-part one is in the southern and southwestern vases of Yama and Rakshasa.

original: cha bzhi pa ni byang dang 'phrog @150a * //
analyzed: cha bzhi pa ni byang dang 'phrog @150a * //
translated: The four-part one is in the northern and northeastern vases of Kubera and Ishana.

original: byed du'o // cha lnga pa ni nub dang rlung du'o //
analyzed: byed du'o // cha lnga pa ni nub dang rlung du'o //
translated: The five-part one is in the western and northwestern vases of Varuna and Vayu.

original: de bzhin du ril bu'i dbye bas 'bru rnams dang de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i sman gyi le tshe sbyar ba'i dri lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ril bu'i dbye bas 'bru rnams dang de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i sman gyi le tshe sbyar ba'i dri lnga ste /
translated: Likewise, the five scents are the five seeds of the grains, and likewise the five scents of the herbs previously mentioned.

original: de ltar lcags dang rin po che dang nags kyi sman dang 'bru dang dri'i rdzas rnams bum pa rnams su blugs nas slar yang nyi shu rtsa lnga bo de dag thum por bcings te rnam par rgyal ba'i dung chus gang bar gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lcags dang rin po che dang nags kyi sman dang 'bru dang dri'i rdzas rnams bum pa rnams su blugs nas slar yang nyi shu rtsa lnga bo de dag thum por bcings te rnam par rgyal ba'i dung chus gang bar gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having placed the substances of the metals, jewels, forest herbs, grains, and scents in the vases, again those twenty-five should be wrapped in a bundle and placed in a victorious vase filled with water.

original: des skye ba'i gnas lngar dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: des skye ba'i gnas lngar dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: With that, one should confer initiation in the five places.

original: gtsug tor dang phrag pa dang dpung pa'i tshigs g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dang de bzhin du dpyi dang brla'i mtshams dag la'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor dang phrag pa dang dpung pa'i tshigs g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dang de bzhin du dpyi dang brla'i mtshams dag la'o //
translated: [The five places are] the uṣṇīṣa, the shoulders, the right and left elbow, and likewise the hips and the knees.

original: de nas rigs kyi lha rnam par sbyang ba'i don du me tog 'dor ba'i sngags ni aom sarba ta th'a ga ta ku la bi sho dha ni sv'a h'a sngags 'dis slob dpon gyis slob ma me tog 'dor du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rigs kyi lha rnam par sbyang ba'i don du me tog 'dor ba'i sngags ni aom sarba ta th'a ga ta ku la bi sho dha ni sv'a h'a sngags 'dis slob dpon gyis slob ma me tog 'dor du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of purifying the deity of the family, the mantra for casting the flower is Oṃ sarva tathāgata kula viśodhani svāhā. With this mantra, the master should cause the disciple to cast the flower.

original: sngags 'dis mig dbye bar bya ste aom di bya na ya na mu da gh'a ta y'a mi sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sngags 'dis mig dbye bar bya ste aom di bya na ya na mu da gh'a ta y'a mi sv'a h'a /
translated: With this mantra, one should open the eyes: Oṃ divya nayana vīṣṭha tāyāmī svāhā.

original: de nas rigs kyi lha dang dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo dang por byas pa'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rigs kyi lha dang dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo dang por byas pa'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag bstan par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should show the entire maṇḍala, beginning with the deity of the family and the principal deity of the maṇḍala.

original: shar gyi sgor rigs dag par byas te /
analyzed: shar gyi sgor rigs dag par byas te /
translated: Having purified the family at the eastern door,
